text: I came here with expectations after reading some reviews here. I have to say the service was not as bad as I thought it would be. It is your average Asian resto service. Distant and quick. I got the pho with just the noodles and it was better than Pho Kim Long's! They do not give you a lot of mint and sprouts like Pho Kim Long but I am sure if you ask for more they will give you more. The large was not that big but it was enough for me. They have bigger bowls at Pho Kim Long. Over all I say its not bad. I will come back here just because the Pho was great. Service could be better but hey no one said you have to be happy at work. As long as they do their job right, you do not have to be my BFF.

This place is super clean (major bonus points!) and they have great vegetarian pho.  I am mostly restaurant vegetarian and it's hard to find pho that is not either a beef or chicken broth.  Their's (I think called tofu/vegetable) is very flavorful, salty, and comes with a platter of very fresh veggies to arrange in your soup as you like.  My husband and I each get a large bowl- it is huge and takes forever to eat!  Their fresh spring rolls (the cold ones) are good, but not the best i've had.  The sweet sauce that comes with them is great.  Major bonus points for a place that offers a veg pho on par with the traditional beef one!

We stopped by for Pho since we were soo done with the Vegas mass grazing from last night.  The Pho here is decent as far as Vegas goes and the broth doesn't taste artificially sweet like some places when they load the MSG in there. Their bean sprouts are super clean and white which is a good indication they do it right. We may come back again if we have a Pho craving while in Vegas. Oh don't order the Che Ba Mau dessert it is a rip off!

There are a lot of pho restaurants in this town. This one is my favorite for 3 reasons. 

Reason #1 - It's got the word "pho" in the name, so you know it's good.

Reason #2 - They are from "Saigon", where pho was invented, so you know they know what they are doing here.

Reason #3 - The number "8" is a very humbling number to give ones self. It's better then 5 and not as douchey as 10.  So you know they've got class.

Yup, the humblest, most authenticest, phoiest restaurant on Eastern. Much better than Pho Saigon 7 and less pretentious then Pho Saigon 9.  

Till next Tuesday Pho Saigon 8, when my parents will pay for my dinner again!!

Best pho on this side of town.  Not as good as the Spring Mountain location, but a really good substitute when you can't make it across town.  Egg rolls are the bomb, chicken bun is one of my faves, and the #31 is my go to dish!

Biggest drawback is the service is kind of slow.  Food comes out pretty quick but sometimes it can be a wait to get drinks and/or the check.

Excellent Pho!
Great service, very attentive on busy Holiday weekend
All ingredients fresh and tasty.
What more is there to say.

The service is mediocre and the pho is not bad . The meat in the pho was tough and hard to chew . My lil one ordered the BBQ chicken and it was delivered to us In a matter of minutes after ordering . After cutting into the chicken I realized that the chicken had been cooked earlier in the day or yesterday perhaps ( def not fresh) and reheated once we ordered . I asked the Waiter bout this and he informed me that " we cook the chicken half way and finish the cooking when ordered, otherwise it would take 30 min or so to cook". Now I know it doesn't take more then 5-7 min to cook a thin slice of chicken . The chicken is a direct reflection of how they run their kitchen . I've been eating vietnamese for a long time and I will never return to this place . The prices are a lil above the avg. for this food.

Absolutely love this place. We always come here to get our pho fix & the staff here is great. They see that we have a toddler and automatically come out w/ our waters & of course a styrofoam cup w/ a lid on it w/o even having to ask them for it. 

Typically we like to share our pho w/ my son rather than ordering him his own bowl. So we'll ask for an extra bowl and along w/ the extra bowl we asked for, they bring out scissors (to cut the noodles and the meat) and plastic silverware. I love the fact that they knew and we didn't have to ask for every single thing. Never disappointed and their food is delicious!!

Our usual order is,
#1 crispy fried egg roll
#20, noodle with rare eye round, flank & beef ball

We had the noodle soup and rice dish.  The food quality is just OK.  Another "run of the mill" Vietnamese noodle food.  Nothing special - just OK.  Not sure why others rate them high.

It is on the expensive side for Vietnamese noodle soup.  The extra large bowl was $8.25 but the size is just a regular size bowl when compare with other restaurant.  A good thing - they do wash and clean their bean sprouts.  The rice and pork chop just come with 1 piece of very THIN AND DRIED CHOP with plenty of rice - again not much food for the amount that they charge for the dish.  NOT GOOD.

I have to agree with a couple of other reivews.  NOT MUCH SERVICE.  They just drop the food.  NOT VERY HELPFUL asking about the menu.   COMMUNICATION IS LIMITED. 

WATCH OUT FOR THE MANDATORY 15% TIPs FOR PARTY OF 6 OR MORE -  EVEN THEY ARE NOT VERY HELPFUL WITH THE SERVICE.  IT IS BURIED IN THE BILL.  I ENDED UP PAYING THE TIPs TWICE FOR NO SERVICE.  WATCH OUT!

The bill was a little over $100 for a party of 6.  I think there are better choices to go for the amount that we spent.

if i could give 0 stars i would ! caterpillars in my soup?? so gross ! even when we told them they said bugs are in the vegetables, no discount, still payed full price for soup that had bugs ?? never coming back

Every time I'm in Vegas, I always try to make my way here. Both their Henderson and Spring Mountain locations are great (I haven't tried their newest location on Eastern yet). The broth here is what makes it so good. I always get the pho tai gan (comes with the steak and soft tendons). Honestly, it's the only one I've tried. It's such a long time between trips out to Vegas, that I'm always craving the same thing. If you haven't had pho before, there is hoisin sauce and siracha or another chili sauce (siracha is the more spicy kind with the green top, the other kind is in the cup with the spoon. I'm a weak asian so I go for the less spicy kind :X) that I usually mix together in a small sauce dish and dip my noodles into it.

To drink, they have amazing coconut water. It's so sweet and refreshing. If you want to be healthy, order the kind from the fresh young coconut (not as sweet, but still very good). For any of you asian readers, the che 3 mau (three bean dessert with coconut milk) is so reminiscent of our childhood. I'm not really sure how it tastes to westerners, but the dessert is definitely top 5 on my dessert list.

www.anitaeat.com

Since this is a restaurant, I'm going to review on my bowl of Bun Bo Hue first.  It's just a bowl of noodle soup, doesn't have the Bun Bo Hue flavor.

Cleanliness, there was a fly in the bowl of my noodle soup... need me to say more???

Service, worst than their food.  Waitress turned her back on us when we tried to order, didn't apologize when I told her about the fly and just took the bowl away.   The manager DEMANDED that we have to leave tips because we had 10 people when we don't want to.  We paid for our food without gratuities, the manager ran after us and said that we eat and run, and he's going to call the police to report us.  All these time I thought gratuity = reward for good services

Pho Saigon 8, this was my first and last.  Before you tell anyone that we're cheap, please tell them the real reason why we didn't want to leave tips.  Just for your information, this is the very first time I left a restaurant without leaving tips regardless I have been to many bad restaurants but your service trump them all.
Great Pho and grilled pork is excellent. They gave us a very generous amount of soft tendon and fatty brisket in the pho.

Very few noodles in the big bowl of broth... 2 small shrimp and non-existent crab.

Good BBQ pork roll, but the peanut sauce was way too thick and tasted like they mixed bean puree in it.

We didn't have the pho, so take this review with a grain of salt.  We both had the vermicelli noodle bowls, one with grilled chicken and eggrolls, and one with grilled pork and shrimp with eggrolls.  The amount of meat and vegetables in the bowls was a little lacking, and the meat itself was a bit fatty.  The service was really quick and friendly though.  Others looked like they were enjoying the pho, so we'll have to try that next time!

I am giving a one star for bad experience with the staff and not the food. Happened to be there during lunch from work and decided to experiment with seafood and shrimp pho(#43). The food when it came to the table smelled completely off and rotten that even turned a few heads from neighboring tables. On complaining to the server about the foul taste and requesting to change the dish, they blatantly refused. I told them that I had not tried the dish, and the smell told the entire story. They refused a refund or change to a different dish, and had me reorder a second dish and pay for both.

This is one of the worst experiences I have ever had at a restaurant considering I eat out at least once a day. They have probably lost more than one customer today as the friends who were with me were baffled at this as well and have decided not to go back to the place.

wow, whoever thought in the desert wasteland known as las vegas, amongst the gambling, strip clubs, and dirty dirties, lies the gem of a pho place known as pho saigon 8. 

this place is pretty darn tasty. as per ritual, i always sip the soup before i massacre it with mints, lime, chilis, sriracha, and bean sprouts. excellent broth. a weeee bit too salty, but theres no complaints there. u can defintely taste the thirst coming an hour later.

wow they sure give a whole lot of meat. and it tastes good meat too. tender, juicy meat. yum.

noodles were just right. just chewy, and even after awhile, didn't sog up. good good noodles. 

i also got the three color drink. it was a bit small. and the tapioca things didn't have the cruncy chestnuts inside like i like them. but it was pretty good. 

service was even decent. and my friends all loved the hot chicks rollin in.  but i din't think they were so hot. 

all in all, a good pho place.

Horrible horrible place the service was the absolute worst. They're were plenty of staff but not sure what their problem with.  I had to ask for refills napkins. I asked for children chopsticks,  a staff member literally took rubber bands and dropped in the table. Didn't even attempt to make them for me. The service was slow and rude. Never again will I be back. They're are better pho places in this town with betrer service and food. I was extremely disappointed

Absolutely love their food here. I try to stop here each time I come into town. I Have tried many different options on the menu but, I keep going back to their beef pho. Service isn't the greatest, they take your order bring your drink and most times you don't get a refill unless you wave someone down. But the food makes up for it.

Been going here for years and the food has been consistently good and service adequate with a few exceptions but I am moved to report today my pitiful experience. Fried egg rolls and beef pho the former came out small and burnt the latter didn't come at all. I ate the egg rolls and thought oh well but I was basically ignored while the wait staff entertained themselves. Decided to leave after 25 min. And I was one of only a handful of customers, not like they were busy you know.honestly the place has been in decline for some time now. Come on guys straighten up.

it was very disappointed with the pho soup here compared to the location in Henderson. the pho soup was super sweet, either too much sugar or msg. The tea cup were a bit greasy. I don't think we'll be coming back to this location, Henderson was far much better, cleaner, food taste better, friendly service, much much better.
The food and service were great. I liked the soup's flavor and the food arrived quickly. The charbroiled chicken vermicelli was flavorful as well. This place fills up pretty quickly.

They have your typical variety of Vietnamese food here. The food tastes very mediocre and bland. Although the portions are a bit on the larger size which is good. This would be a decent place to go eat at if the other Vietnamese restaurants in the area are extremely busy and you're extremely hungry. Other than that, it's just not too bad.
Order so rice and waited for over half an hour.  We end up cancelling the orders and left.   Didn't even get a sorry.  Horrible service.   Don't ever come here.

It was better when they opened, but now I'd rather drive the half hour to get service.   The food quality varies on time of day or time that you show up.  As the day draws to a close, the broth resembles water and salt thrown in a bowl with oil.

But as the others said, service is in the pits.  Once we were seated and they completely forgot to take our order for like 15 minutes-then we left.  Be sure to order two drinks and water for yourself, because once they throw you food  on your table they'll never check up on you.   

Also the tables are cramped so close together so if you and the person scoot your seats together, you'd practically be siamese twins.
Hands down the best place to get Pho soup!

Went here on a hot hot hot day and wasn't very excited to eat any soup never mind a tripe soup.

I was forced to go and thought it was very good.  My friends told me that this is the best place since its such a clean soup and not oily.  

It was good but I cant say its the best until I try more Pho places.  

The tripe in this soup is so pleasant in comparison to the menudo stuff Mexicans swear by.  Its really hard to explain the texture but its more noodle like vs the chewy raw squid stuff in the menudo.

The shrimp rolls were big winners on the hot day too.

Driving from Red Rock to Paris Hotel, I was looking for a Pho resturant
like I always do when I am in town. My buddy in the car pointed out at Pho Saigon 8 as we were driving down spring mountain. What the hell, I said as always. Already tried 5 different spots and all came up short of being good Pho. Got seated and was brought these huge, color, and pictured menu. Right off the back I knew this place was a real authentic Vietnamese joint. 

Went here 3 times in 2 day.enough said.
Pho tai large : soup was very, very flavorful but the large there is our 
                          medium here.. And the bowl was $7. Wtf.. I know
                          prices have gone up, but how does sink water increase
                          prices?? And the onion oil helps inchance the flavor of
                          Pho. Try it.
#19 Beef Stew/ French bread : Soup was flavorful with nice size beef 
                                                        chunks. Make sure to make a side 
                                                        order for a extra bread. 1 bread is not 
                                                        enough.HA!

That pretty much sums up my past experience there and WOULD highly recommend this spot.

DO NOT GO TO THESE LOCATIONS!!!
Kim Long II- to bland
Little saigon - large is nothing but water and soup was decent
Pho Huong - Brutal , No flavor
Pho Hung - Attention, your pho taste like crap. No flavor
Best pho in Vegas. Wait time was about 20-30  minutes. However, saw a few local viets who were able to "jump" the line because they speak vietnamese and were regulars there. Food was amazing

This is my favorite Vietnamese place in Vegas.  The food is fresh and good.  The service is very fast, though not always the friendliest.  The prices are reasonable.  I'd recommend a noddle bowl or pho.
If you are not eating here and live on the south end of town then you are cheating yourself out of one of life's best pleasures.

Joseph and I live in PS8's area and forever opted to make the drive to Chinatown instead.  I suggested we try our neighborhood pho joint so we could make a quick trip for dinner or takeaway.  Broth, he says, was pleasingly flavorful and almost as good as Pho Vietnam's {on it's good day}.

We are regulars and never disappointed. My favorite is bun xeo. The crepe is always perfect and the vegetables fresh and plentiful. Not available on busy weekends, i.e. holidays. My partner likes pho.
The phò is so good! The decor and feel of the restaurant was nice too. Servers were friendly. It was a nice experience for my first time here :)

Disappointing indeed. We eat a lot of phos
all over. Here, the pho was blend, no flavor and pretty mucH MSG-ed out. Herbs were fresh, service fast, clean interior, thumbs up! Would not recommend the pho here.

Rude ass mother fuckers here, if you like being treated like shit then you'll want to come here. Tried asking waitress questions about menu because it had been my first time & she acted like I was wasting her time. As well I ordered an ice tea, & never got it. Then they tried to bill me for that! The food isn't all that great either. I'm very upset with the way I was treated. They all need attitude checks. Litterarly felt like just because I was white they were rude as hell

I have ALWAYS patronized this establishment, on a regular basis, since I moved to Las Vegas approximately two years ago due to the service and quality of the food.

HOWEVER, my last trip , on June 8th was an EPIC disappointment.  

They had a new server, male, he was totally unattentive.  He NEVER once came by our table to ask if we wanted refills for our drinks, desert or if everything was  OK/

Moreover, he NEVER gave us the BILL!  We had to obtain it from the wonderful female server who has been a staple of the restaurant.

As a result, we just could NOT leave him a tip!  That is something that we hated to do but his attitude was appauling.

In short, they NEED to TRAIN this guy on how to service customers.

Everytime I go to Vegas, this is where I eat. The food is delicious. I've gone here about 20-30 times and I've always had a good experience. Service is fast, sometimes you have to flag the waiter down for more napkins or water but hey, they don't mind and I don't expect much from them anyways. I've had almost everything on the menu, I can't say I didn't like anything, except for maybe the banh xeo, it was a little greasy.  They do have the best Vietnamese coffee! This place is packed no matter what time of day it is. Overall, a good place to eat at, it's clean, cute decor, nice sized restaurant.

I was first introduced to Pho Saigon 8 from a friend who took me to the one in Chinatown, so I was really excited when this place opened on my side of town. 

I usually get the grilled sliced pork & fried egg rolls over vermicelli and vegetables, and my husband usually gets the grilled lemongrass sliced beef over vermicelli and vegetables or the chicken pho, and we get spring rolls to share. 

Service is good when we dine in, although we usually do take-out more often. The staff is very friendly and accommodating, and the place is very clean.

The pho is just ok, expensive, and the service is very bad.  They are rude, literally throw your food on the table.  Make you pass food from one side of the table to the other side.  Too lazy to walk around.  would not come back here again.

Wow Pho Saigon 8,  I am so disappointed in you guys.  How much cheaper can you get?  You raised your prices from 5.75 for a bowl of pho to now almost 9 dollars... and you still don't have enough to buy noodles and veggies?  This is the cheapest spring roll I have ever eaten!  There are maybe 5 strings of rice noodles in it, and nothing except chopped lettuce.... no other meat except shrimp that has been half cut.  I'm sorry but I have been a regular customer for several years and have seen it get worse and worse...  you have lost a customer.  Everyone,  don't expect quality anymore from this place.  Smh.... I am disappointed... and sad at the same time that quality of food has gone down the drain.....

Pho Saigon 8 was my choice of restaurant every time I visited Las Vegas. However, I was very disappointed with the quality of food and the services at my recent visit. All 4 dishes that each person in our party of four ordered did not meet our expectation. Pho bo was just ok. Banh tam bi and com ga quay were bland. Hu tieu tom cua had very strong smell of seafood.

The service was so ass. Idk how this place keeps loyal customers. We were eating the mediocre pho, nothing special, when the busy boy came and began to take our bowls away. Cleaning the table when we were not done. We sat there and allowed but definitely would not recommend this. Being a pho store owner in LA, I know this is unacceptable. It gave customers, including us, the sense of them kicking us out. Keep in mind that the store was not packed at all. Wouldn't come back, I recommend pho so 1 down the street for excellent pho and family like service.

I love pho and all sorts of soups in general. I usually order the hot soy milk, #14 pho, spring rolls or regular fried egg rolls. It all taste yummy as just like the first original location on Spring mountain in China town. Unfortunately, I'm a shame to same I still constantly come here bcos it is the closest pho restaurant near me (I live in Henderson). They have the worst service. Every time I come here, they either give me water after my food, or they never refill my water. When my family and I order other drinks or smoothies, it takes so long to come out. Like, it comes out after we are done eating and we just take the drinks to go. Also, I always ask for extra lime and sauté. 19 out of 20 times, they forget. Not to mention, these mistakes happen whether it is slow or busy. 

If u want good service, don't come here.
Great service and great food. The quality of pho is outstanding here!
Good Pho and generous portions for the right price. Expect it to be crowded sometimes. It may also be hard to find parking outside.

My wife and I were craving bun and our normal place Pho Mai Lan was closed for the evening. So we decided to go for it and give this place a shot.. Well.... It sure was a mistake! We walked in and they asked us how many. We told them two, and they walked us over to a table set down two glasses of water and walked away. Came back a minute later and set down two menus with our napkins on top, then walked away again. After about 5 minutes they come back over and ask us what we wanted. We hadn't decided just yet and we asked for another minute and the reply was, "Okay, just yell for me when your ready." And then she walked away. 
Okay?! By now they've lost any chance at a tip.
So after we decided to get #'s 69 and 70 we looked around and they came over took our order and about 10 minutes later our food came out! It looked good! Well!.... It wasn't. It was a HUGE disappointment! The shrimp on both plates were dry like last weeks left overs that they nuked for a minute and tossed in our dish. Our pork was a little on the burn side and had a funk nasty after taste, but it wasn't terrible enough to not eat... And my roll was fairly uncomfortable to eat. We'd have to say the worst part was the fish sauce. That wasn't to great. 
So while we ate the atmosphere wasn't very inviting. The wait staff was talking on their phones while they were on speaker so we could hear all of their conversation. It was also not very welcoming when they would look at us hoping we would leave. 
All in all everything was terrible except their pricing was pretty fair.

Great customer service. Very attentive my and the food was really good. The Thai tea was an awesome desert! Thanks guys! Keep up the good work on making us have a good experience!

Mr.Paul

This place is going downhill fast!  I used to come here regularly and get the pho or vermicelli and it was pretty good. Today I took my dad and it was horrible!  
The service has never been good and I didn't think it could get worse, but it has! The table next to me ordered after I did, we ordered the same thing but they got their food before my dad. My dad finally got his food 15 minutes after the table next to us. 

Then I ordered the vermicelli, which came out quick, but I had to sit for 20 minutes until my dad got his food. Then when I actually started eating I noticed most of my lettuce was spoiled! It was turning brown and gray! So disgusting. The only thing I was asked when I brought this to someone's attention was if I wanted new lettuce! Was I really supposed to pick out all of the bad lettuce an eat everything else around it? An then I was still charged for my meal! 

Avoid this place! Go to Pho So 1 down the street. Much better!

Pho Saigon 8 is a pretty typical Vietnamese restaurant. I'm from the 626 area and this place tastes like home. Prices are typical. Pho tastes typical. The servers are nice and helpful.

I asked if they could put my rare beef on a separate plate (bc I like it very rare), but they wouldn't do it bc they said there's "too little meat to separate." 

My family loves the durian smoothie here because they use real, fresh durian. They have filtered water.

Spring rolls are expensive; they're like $5.35 for two rolls. When they came, the rice paper was still a bit wet, which was a great way of telling me that they're fresh, but premade. It's pricy, but I love these spring rolls and the stuff they put in it. The shrimp are a decent size as well!
Everything was on point!!! Customer service was okay. It hit the spot on this cold Vegas day

Worst pho place to go to. They don't clean up the tables at all. They leave the dirty dishes on the table until someone comes in. The waiters' attitudes are really bad and talk a lot behind people's back in Vietnamese. The waiters always argue and cuss at each other. Never coming back with the crappy food and service

I used to love this place but two years ago they started consistently majorly skimping out on the meat for the pho. The eggrolls are delicious, crispy, and one of the best in Vegas though. I saw a waitress in the bathroom and she didn't wash her hands when she left! Service is typical for a pho place.

this place is like part of my house, me and my friend go there almost everyday. it's open early so we go there for breakfast too. 
fast and tasty. Boba is too soft and kinda boiled too much though but Thai tea is good too. we like number 13. what we like about this place is we can choose large or small.
I love here. I love a guy who work at this place he always smiling, nice customer service. he is like a girl, he is so cute. we always put extra tips when he serve us because he makes us happy!

Recently craving some Pho, I happen to catch Pho Saigon 8 out of the corner of my eye and am I glad I did! 

I first noticed that the business was full, even as people were leaving, it seemed as though all the tables were occupied. The lady who greeted and seated my friend and me was very friendly and welcoming. She had us seated immediately. 

The second thing I noticed was the cleanliness. The tables were quickly wiped clean as people left.  

The menu was extensive and had a good explanation of the various menu items. I chose the beef strip Pho and my friend had the chicken breast Pho. We also had an order of shrimp veggie rolls. All was very tasty and the Pho was plentiful. The beef and the chicken were very tasty, fresh, and juicy. They definitely did not skimp on the amount placed in the bowls. 

I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to my friends and it is definitely going to be my go to when craving Pho!

Me and my friend coming from California when in this restaurant. We liked the food but horrible service!!!! The owner may put attention in the service .i ll not to invite friends anymore to go there was so embarrassed.

Good authentic Vietnamese food. They get busy so order ahead for pick up. I get the pho dac biet and the pork chop with rice. So yummy! Egg rolls are good too. I come back often and would recommend this place to anyone.

The most elaborate menu I've ever seen at a Vietnamese joint. 

I opted for the rare beef pho and was not disappointed. The noodle to beef portions was just about right and the broth was delishus. 

The bowl of noodles was a little pricier than I'm use to but not by much.

My boyfriend and I went there today.   This is our second time there... the first experience is good but today, we ordered a large bowl of seafood pho and it came with only 2 tiny shrimps, two pieces of squids and some frozen seafood meatballs that tasted really stale.  I do not recommend this place.

Worst costumer service I've ever had. So rude. I can't believe people come here. I was afraid to ask for anything and when I finally did they walked away like they didn't hear me. Never coming back. The food was good but not worth the experience of being treated like that.

I was visiting from California with the wife and kids. Being half thai thought of getting some good food. What a big disappointment this place was. The waitress was rude. The food was mediocre. What a waste of time and money. Will never come here again.
Favorite Pho ever!  I love this place!  The iced tea is amazing!  The service was great too!  I highly recommend it!

Order this Bun Bo Hue, soup wasn't as hot! When I added the veggies, the soup got cold!! It was flavorless, all it is SALTY!!!! It didn't come with veggies on the side, we had to ask for it! $9.45 for a small not worth it!

My husband walked in and was seated immediately, which was pretty fast on a friday during lunch hour and it didn't take them long to take our order. 

My husband usually gets the pho with rare streak only and I like to get the Hu Tieu - dry with the cellophane noodles. So far so good but once we got our food it was a different story. 

Hubby's order was fine but mines came with soup. Not dry BUT with soup! 

So I made a complaint to our waiter (the only older man with glasses) and he said that I DID NOT order dry noodles. And I told him I did, my husband even heard my order. The waiter also said he can not change my order because I "didn't order it right". And basically blaming me because I didn't order it right. Ok fine, whatever I'll just eat it so he'll be quiet. I' m not the type to start any confict. I took the first bite and wasn't happy it wasn't the dry version. It tastes totally different and I didn't bother eating it again. 

Just when were about to leave to pay our bill, the waiter comes back and noticed i did not eat it and he offered to change my food. Seriously ? What happen to "I can't change your order?" 

Anyways, I wanted to see the manager after this but they supposedly don't have a manager. So I just told the lady who managed our bill what happened and she apologized for his service. She knew who I was complaining about and I didn't even have to point out who it was. She also offered to take my order off the bill and all we had to pay was for my husband's pho. So thank you for that. 

That is why today I gave it 3 stars if it wasn't for the lady upfront who helped us. It'll definitely be awhile before my husband and I come back here.
My girl and I love their Pho. The service can be a little slow at times, but the food is awesome. We're regulars.
I'm not a big fan of pho, but this place really impressed me. Usually, I order the #55, and my boyfriend gets one of the soups. We eat here often.

Perhaps, one of the best Pho places that I have been to. The menu is very big so you have a lot of choices. Whatever Pho you order, they include a lot of meat. The waiters are polite and courteous - they didn't get offended or gave me a blank stare when I asked for a fork.

The place is nicely decorated and crowded., but we didn't have to wait to get a table.  Awesome place to go to if you are in Vegas. It was only about 10min drive from the strip. I'd recommend this place if you really want a quality bowl of Pho in Vegas.
Food is good, wouldn't say bad service except nobody seemed to speak English so come knowing what you want.

This place makes some really really good food, but at time the service can be bad. The first time I got here they seated people who came in after us and made us wait for awhile. Drinks aren't so great either, but everything on the menu seems to be really good. 

DO try this place!
The serving of food is amazing and the customer devices is great, always a great place for lunch or dinner- always leave with a doggie bag

Went there last night for dinner, and it was a good, filling meal.  Walked in, got immediately seated ("Do you have a lonely table for one?  Thank you."), and got the menu.  After getting my beverages with a few minutes looking at the menu, I gave my order and started to read the local Filipino (English language) newspaper.  I swear, my hot steaming bowl of pho came out in less than five minutes.  Granted, I know that the ingredients for pho are probably ready ("mise en place") to get it out to the customer but it was quick.  Twenty minutes from walking in to walking out?  I know where I need to go if I need to eat with no time on the clock.  And it was good food (item #18, and the broth was a bit saltier than I like).

I didn't get a chance to case the joint, as I was given literally the first table as you walk in.  But, I saw Viet families and some other non-Asian folks enjoying their meals.  Since it is farther away from the Strip, I would assume the clientele is more civilized and respectful (re: not drunk, no loutish behavior).  Will try out the other pho joints, but Pho Saigon 8 is a good Mom and Pop to seriously consider.

This was my first time trying pho or Vietnamese food but it was delicious. I got pork broth pho with rice noodles and grilled pork and chicken. I think it was #47. I also had their spring rolls, which were amazing. 

The only problem, one which makes me hesitant to return, was that I ended up sick the next day. Now, admittedly this could be a coincidence; but I can't recommend 5 stars when I ended up sick for 2 days.

5 stars for the food. But -2 stars for service and -1 star for their weird prices. 

Food is good. I mean, typical pho and viet food with nothing nasty in it. So 5 stars for that. 

Service...haha get ready. Ordered drinks and food. Our food comes out first so I'm waiting for our drinks. 5 mins go by..nothing. So I asked the waiter (the really fat one) and he gives this irritates look on his face and says "IT'S COMING!" well alright jeez. People normally get their drinks before their foods, fatso. ESP with pho...all that MSG, you need a drink with it! The others weren't really any better. We went around 9pm and I guess they were closing soon. Felt like they were trying to rush everyone out. Well hello! You're in Vegas! You expect people to have early dinner times? Whatever. The only reason we tipped is because we had a kid with us and she made a mess with her rice -__-

Their prices are so weird! 6.05 7.05 8.05 dude seriously? You are so stingy you have to do .05. I guess that .05 really helps the owner out but seriously? I've never seen more ridiculous prices. This place is already way more expensive than many other pho places. And having that .05 on the menu just makes em look more stingy.
I ordered PHO #31 with extra meat. Well I got 1 ounze of chicken the same that comes with a standard order. This happened on 2 seperate occassions. Will not be back!!

The entire menu is numbered. I ordered #43 which was a pork broth bowl with fresh streamed lump crab meat and shrimp which was DELISH. Everything comes out with fresh mint, basil, bean sprouts, limes carrots and jalapeños.  I went a step further and ordered shrimp spring rolls and lettuce wrapped egg rolls to complete my feast. The overall experience was absolutely amazing. I would highly recommend checking this place out.

My favorite Pho place in Vegas.

The Pho is always fresh and flavorful and the meat is tender. They give generous portions and will load you up with extra veggies if you ask. 
Sometimes the servers don't speak the best English but everything is described in the menu.
My favorite pho place. Egg rolls are amazing and my soup is always on point. My favorite place to go out to eat hands down.

The first time I went to Pho 8 I was just getting over a cold (no, I wasn't contagious) and felt the need for a soup. After sampling the wonton bowl, I thought it was the best place on the planet. It was so good that I ended up back a week later, only to discover that while it was still pretty good, their plastic drinking glasses and plastic soup spoons reek of bleach or some other cleansing agent. Nice to know they are sanitized, but I could live without the chemical infusion with my lunch. 

Good soup, clean place, but a little too heavy on the cleansers. I'd still go back, but I think I'll bring my own spoon next time.

I had pho here, I had bun thit nuong cha gio, spring rolls and nem rolls.  The food is edible and didn't make me sick so I'm thankful.  I say, it's just not that special.  If I can make it better, why pay for it?
All I can say is DELICIOUS! From their Pho, to the fried rice, to their rice plates.  Everything is just delicious.  If you don't believe me, see for yourself.
Best pho in vegas served by the grumpiest and most unfriendly staff you will encounter...if it truely was not great i would have stopped coming here years ago

All the Pho restaurant here in Vegas is about the same...but the service at the place just makes it bad. The staff is rude...don't greet you...they just seem like they don't want to be there...so why would you? The place is dim/ depressing and dirty. If your a Pho connoisseur and see sauces and gack splatter on the wall you know this place is dirty. It's just un-appetizing.  If they don't care what the dinning area looks like ...just wonder what happens in the kitchen. Not worth giving it a second try.

First off I think the food is good. This is my go-to place when I want to have some pho around the area. My only concern is that the guy named Tran gave a really bad customer service. I mean that guy is not fit to be a server with the kind of attitude that he has. He's just flat out rude. He even rolled his eyes when we asked for straws and to go container. Who does that? With that being said, it just drives the customers away and think not to come back.. Not good for your business.
Food is great. Always come here with the wife. Service is quick and they are always nice.
I've only been once, it was good pho, pretty cheap, and reasonably fast. I wouldn't say it was anything spectacular but worth it if you're in the mood.

Judged by my Vietnamese taste buds, food definitely meets authentic standard.  Service is typical of Vietnamese - civilized but not super friendly...which is fine b/c I'm there for the foods, not to socialize with the waiter/waitress.  Being new to Las Vegas, I had to suffer some very bad Vietnamese restaurants to find this place.  One example is Viet Bistro - their pho broth tasted like artificial pho seasoning diluted in water served in a bowl.  Big mistake serving that to Vietnameses b/c they'd never pay to eat your crappy food twice.  You'd, of course, find many Vietnameses eating at Pho 8...that's a very good sign!

After wanting a hot bowl of pho, I came across to this place. I got the pho tai, and it honestly was like any other bowl of pho I've had. There wasn't anything special about it, but it was edible. There's a possibility that I would come back.

I am not normally big on Pho, but there are times when one could use a good hot broth. I am staying in Vegas for the winter, and tried the Pho at Pho Huong Saigon on Decatur as it is closest to me. The experience there had me thinking there MUST be better Pho around, particularly as this is Las Vegas's asian strip with many Viet Pho places. 

So I  yelped and found the highly rated Pho Sai Gon 8.

I went there and found it to be crowded for the lunch rush - a good sign I thought. I order the chicken Pho, with both white and dark meat. 

5 minutes later the Pho arrived, packed with meat and noodles. I dug in.

The good:

- Excellent quantity of food. 
- Lotsa flavor.


The not so good

- The broth was oily and the saltiness reeked of MSG. For the first time ever eating Pho, I didnt drink most of the broth.
- The meat was tough and remained so as it sat in the broth.
- The service was perfunctory, with the crowds of people. I left a dollar because someone did come along and refilled my water, otherwise I was left alone.
- The Pho was pricey at 7.50 for a large bowl.

For the first time ever leaving a Pho place, I left unfulfilled and wanting food. I considered going to the cheap and cheerful BBQ King chinese joint behind Pho Saigon 8, but settled for a sardine Bahn Mi at the little bakery in the mall.

With all the choices around on Spring Mountain, I wont be back at Pho Saigon 8.

My friends and I had broth that was sooooo salty. And this was our second time coming here.  The waiter brought out an order wrong and blamed it on my entire group. We were completely baffled as to why this waiter was blaming us.  We just wanted to get the what we ordered. 

Extremely rude service. I rather go down the street to lemon grass.  The waiters are nice and the soup taste cleaner and not pumped up with MSG.

Friend and I were in the mood for pho, and this was close by and the place seemed to have decent reviews, so we gave it a shot. Started off okay, as we promptly got our drink orders taken and had a chance to look over the menu. Looked like a nice extensive menu! The woman taking our food order was different from the man who took our drink order. I was slightly worried because she did not write anything down, and she later had to come back to clarify a part of our order. I also had to repeat my order to her 3x - but perhaps I wasn't speaking clearly enough.

Anyway, food arrived and I added in some jalapenos, basil, and chili sauce which enhanced the soup. However, the well done beef brisket pieces were extremely fatty. So much that I couldn't even eat them. The soup was okay, but not as good as what I get at Lemongrass Cafe. 

Unfortunately after we received our food, no one came by to check on us and it was difficult to flag down someone to get a water refill. Granted, I don't usually have high expectations for service in Asian restaurants, but it sucks when you feel like you're being purposely ignored.

Not planning on ever coming back here. Not much positives to warrant it.

Went here because Lemongrass Cafe was closed for remodeling... that place is our go-to, but my partner and I were really craving pho, so we reluctantly had to settle for another nearby place.

Been here once before, but wasn't much memorable back then. Felt the same way the second time around. We were immediately given menus and water, which was cool. Took a little while for someone to take our order though, but no biggie.

Lots of different meat options for the pho. But felt that the broth itself was almost flavorless. Perhaps because it was a freshly cooked batch and didn't have enough time to steep? Who knows. But the side of herbs of basil, sprouts, lime, and jalapenos were very fresh though.  Spring rolls were also big and plump and a filling appetizer for two people. Just wish it had been cut in half to make it easier to eat.

Service wasn't exactly warm, but adequate. Waters were refilled without having to ask. No one checked in on us at the end though or dropped off a check, so we just paid at the counter. (Not sure what the normal protocol was). 

Fills the craving, but just made us miss our usual Lemongrass Cafe.

Noodle soup gets 5 stars...can't find a better place, good meat portion, fresh sprouts.
Appetizer gets 4 stars...#6 is fantastic, especially the dipping sauce.
Customer service gets 2 star only because they bring the food out...
 
Customer service can use a lot of improvement, especially when the owner's son (the chubby one) is working. The rest of the staff reflects his attitude.

Used to be my favorite pho in the area

But recently,  the chicken pho is more like been sprout pho with the essence of chicken

They reduced the amount of noodles and meet SUBSTANTIALLY

Will have to try some other places

The spring rolls are good, though
Best Pho place in Henderson but they raised their price.  Their bbq meat is very well marinated and delicious.  3 stars for being too expensive and we had to keep asking for water.
The broth wasn't so good. This place isn't what I was expecting. I had better. Never again. For some reason it is hard to find a good pho restaurant in Las Vegas.

We have been going here for years and the amount of meat and food we get, gets smaller and smaller. Not sure what's going on here but the last 3 visits we had were poor. I used to love going here but for the price it is not worth it. I even called to ask them why so much as changed and they didn't understand what I was saying.

**CREDIT CARD FRAUD!***        CREDIT CARD FRAUD!

I am warning you to avoid this place completely.  I.D theft and credit card fraud is on the rise.  Don't let this happen to you.  

Here's what happened.  My good friend paid for the lunch with his credit card.  This was the only transaction for the day on that specific card.  That evening he went to use it for dinner and the card was already shut down.  Come to find out, there were 4 transactions totaling about $800 originating from North Las Vegas while this restaurant is in Henderson (can't be at two places at the same time).  Praise the Lord that the credit card company caught the red flag and canceled his card and the investigation is pending.

I'm so bummed that this happened.  The food is great, the price is not bad and my wife and I were beginning to love  this place!  But in all seriousness and gravity, the good food is not worth the risk of having your identity and credit card stolen.  Be warned and be wise.  I care about all of you, who are reading this, and wouldn't want you to experience such a crime against you.  I implore you to stay away!

Have fun on your quest for good eats!
Sincerely,
Eric F.


p.s the Sunrise Cafe is great... it's on the north side of the same plaza a couple doors down from starbucks.

First time trying this place out. Our server rushed us, didn't say anything when he dropped off our food, or check up on us. It's the guy with the hair shaved on the sides of his head and drags his feet everywhere he walks. The only guy who was friendly was the only one not in uniform with a white tshirt, and he's the one who refilled our drinks and asked how we were doing. 
Spring rolls were okay, pho was good. I'll still probably be trying out other pho places until I'm satisfied.

Pho Saigon 8 is my favorite Vietnamese place in Vegas. Although I prefer the West side one on Spring Mountain because it allows a bit easier access with my wheelchair, I am glad that they are now present on the Eastside. A previous Yelper commented that the Lemongrass Cafe across the street is much better, but I have to disagree. Furthmore, the danky carpet in the other place ruins my appetite. Saigon 8 creates the best both for the phos everytime. According to a lot of my Vietnamese friends, it is created fresh every day. The summer rolls are always delicious and their peanut sauce is superb. When I need comfort food this is the place to be. I even feel guilty if I do not order my usual dishes.

Pho never fails at this location. Service is quick and prompt, although not very personable (but I don't set high expectations for that). Once ordered that pork chop with rice dish...it was really good although the portion was a bit small for the price. It was cut pretty thin and they only give you one slice. But other than that, the pho is better than most and it's usually our go to pho spot.

Pho Saigon 8:
Eastern and 215 Location (Eastern and Pebble)

Let's start with the constructive criticism.  It's smaller places, parking is a little tight otherwise you are parking in the LVAC parking lot.

And most of the servers might have a little trouble speaking English but not all and the owner is usually on-site and very fluent.

Now for the more important stuff, good food, and great price.  I've noticed you seem to get a little more for your buck here than I've seen at other viet restaurants and the food always comes out quick.

Spring mountain location:
Same as above for food, good food for the price, parking is worse though if you go when it's busy but seating is much better and it's larger to accomodate groups. 

Extra info:
I guess the things I'm not crazy about but they aren't unique to either location is if you want to substitute something it's a huge no no, at best you can just have things removed.  And I think the soup only comes in a mainstream size, maybe not quite large but you can't order a small but some dishes come with a small size of Pho minus the meat.

oooh, so far my most favorite vietnamese restaurant in las vegas.  a friend of mine, who just moved here and is vietnamese, also feels that it's one of the better places here in vegas.  the big steaming hot bowls of pho are all good here.  remember when you eat pho, ask for the plate of vinegered onions.  then you smother them with hoisen sauce and the hot chili sriracha sauce.  so, take in some pho to the mouth and then take a fork full of onions.  ooooh yeahhhh.  also, i have to admit i love the wonton soup here.  you gotta order it with egg noodles.  so hearty with lots of wontons.  deelish!!!  it goes so good with those damn onions on the side too.   they do have a wide selection of sinh to (milkshakes)!  they have my favorite durian shake...it does stink, but it taste like vanilla when you drink it down...so when i'm looking for good vietnamese food, i am usually here if i'm not lazy.  i also always refer people to eat here.  so i do really think it's that good.

Overpriced pho!!! 

I mean .. it is in Vegas so I understand but I feel cheated when people have to pay cloce to $10 for pho :(

Food.... "meh. I've experienced better" pretty much says it.

Props for being open 24 hours though.

Verdict: 
Never again, I will wait until I get back to LA.

Came here for a quick Pho fix. It was a decent place easy location to find. The inside is clean looking , the tables are too close together. The staff was not the friendliest either.
The food: was okay. The pho was decent but it was missing something the flavor was not there. They had a piece of tendon in there literally bigger then my debit card. We also had the vietnames rice noodles with shrimp and pork. For some reason they gave us that to go. So I believe this took away from the experience of how its to be eaten. The egg roll was not cut instead whole which is not how I've seen this plate served. The flavor was a bit bland the shrimp were over cooked.
I have been here twice.  The service is quick, the food is cheap and tasty, but both times I ate here it made me sick.  Too bad :(
Great broth taste. Service not awesome but the the Pho soup is great. Good portions on the bowel with lots of meat

We stopped here on our drive out of Vegas, and it was a great surprise. I ordered the pork and egg roll with noodles, and loved it. The price was great, too. Family of four ate for less than $30 - a steal in Vegas.
This is an ok place if you need a pho fix. Bill came to $26 for 2 bowls of pho and spring rolls. Not too bad.
Restaurant is clean and service is great. Been coming here for years for pho.  I recommend the combo large pho. Packed with a lot of meat and noodle makes it tough to finish.

I am an absolute fan of vietnamese food and have eaten at many restaurants.  This one definitely stands out from the others and I know there are a lot of vietnamese restaurants to choose from in that area.  When my family traveled to Las Vegas, we actually dined here twice because we were pleased to find such a great restaurant the first time.

The broth is what I consider the most important part of a good bowl of noddle soup.  The beef AND seafood broth were both spectacular and delicious.  I like the atmosphere and the quality of the pieces of meat. Only bad thing is the price.  I do not like how there are other restaurants just down the street for a more affordable price for a little less  in expectations.  That knocks it down one star.  The restroom is a bit dirty but its nothing extreme.  You should go try it out!
Love this location! I don't have to go far to get the best pho in town.  The decor was contemporary, also there are 4 televisions.  The staffs and services were amazing!

This place is on Rainbow just south of 215. If that brings up visions of terrible traffic, you're not alone. If you're coming from the 215 exit, you can sit there several minutes waiting to make the left into the parking lot.

The defining feature of this place, really, is that it's open till 11pm some nights, midnight other nights. So, if it's after about 9:30, this is a great option for some really decent pho. And you don't have to worry about traffic at that hour.

Most of what they make here, while very good, isn't quite as good as some of the other nearby places--but not enough to matter when you're craving some lovely pho. One standout is the chicken pho, which is excellent, and they even let you choose white or dark meat (dark, of course). If you're one of those weird people for whom the normal bowl of pho is too much, they offer a small size.

Service can be spotty. Order by number, as some of the servers don't speak English very well. Don't bother waiting for your check when you're done, just go up to the register and if it's crowded, take note of your table number.

Great option for 11pm takeout.

The pho here is pretty good, i gave this restaurant only 2 stars because i was really disappointed with the service. We weren't greeted when we came in which i didnt think it was a big deal but once we were seated, the server rushed us in ordering and took off before we even finished ordering. No one came to check up on us if we were doing ok until the very end when we were already pretty unsatisfied with the service. Again the food was pretty good but i would like to see the service improve.

I am constantly trying to find something that is closer to Henderson thank Pho Kim Long to satisfy my craving for Pho. This place did it for me. Thank god. Pho was great! Fresh, satisfying, and service was good. Even when we order to go, everything is packaged properly and ready fast. Happy Customer and will be back often!
Amazing and crave-worthy... wanna blow their minds? Be caucasian and order #8... you're welcome.

It's super fast, friendly, and yummy! I had a large pho with rare meat and it was great. Lots of meat compared to other places. I also really enjoyed the soda chan, a lime and club soda mix. Really refreshing in the Vegas heat.

Not the best Pho place at all! I definitely would choose one in China town before this. But the food is decent, so if you don't want to deal with long lines or traffic it's okay. But personally I would rather deal with that and get great Pho at Pho Kim Long. This place also is not clean or nice at all! Pho Kim Longs IS the BEST Pho in town. Trust me, your mind will be blown if you think this place is & then go to Pho Kim Long.

I guess I made a wrong choice today. 

If you can't make the food right, then shouldnt you only focus on what you are good at? Dont make a menu with 100 of choices and none of them taste good. (We ordered 5 differents food on the menu and all of them have weird taste)
The service are amazingly awful. No greeting, no smiling, no customer interaction, Nothing. 
I paid not only for the food but also the service. If your foods aren't good enough. Make it up by the service.

I've been coming here for a few years now but it's my first time reviewing it. If you're on a time crunch this place is great. I often come here for lunch. The price is unbelievably affordable and you get great tasting food. The service is average, they're very quick. You're able to order and get your food very quickly. We ordered spring rolls for appetizer, that's a must. Healthy, refreshing and yummy. I had the Combination Crispy Chow Fun, it was edible. I will not be ordering this dish here because they have so many dishes that taste better. My sister in law order the crepe, yummy yummy. The Pho is magnificent here, once you try it you'll be addicted. If you like coffee you must order their ice French roasted coffee with condensed milk, there's nothing like it in this world. If I have to pick one cuisine to eat for the rest of my life it'll definitely be Vietnamese. You'll love this place.

Ordered take out over the phone... The girl taking my order was a bit sassy! When I arrived at restaurant she was sitting at cashier station... She did NOT greet me when I walked in! She told me the total, I handed her my credit card... then she asked "if I happened to have cash"!  WTF!!??? If I had cash don't you think I would have given cash??!! Duh!! Well at least she thanked me as I was leaving. 

Food was good so that's why I gave 3 stars! Too bad cashier was sassy & not friendly!!

Ordered myself a bun bo hue, it was bomb!   Reminded me of San Jose or Oakland.  Love the fact that I can go to a good Pho restaurant in Vegas.  It is the best hangover cure.  their service is ok but their food is on point.  I would definitely be here on every Vegas trip.

Yummm!  The best pho I've tried in Vegas.  The broth is very flavorful and not too salty.  I drive from summerlin all the way to Spring Mt and decatur for the comfort of a bowl of noodle and broth with beef!  

Clean restaurant and always a seat waiting.  The staff is helpful enough, but even if they sucked I'd come for the rockin' pho!

I really like this place, I eat there 3 times a week. The food is much better than Lemongrass, the broth for Pho is better too. Only complaint I have is the servers don't fill your water often enough, you have to ask sometimes.

Pretty good Pho!  

At a recommendation of a friend, we hit this place up. We rolled into Vegas and checked in to our hotel then we opted to eat off the strip. Besides you will save more money eating off the strip.  The place was very clean and staff friendly.  No long waits at dinner time and our food was served immediately.  We ordered the Pho with steak and Bun Tom Thit Nuong (grilled shrimp and grilled steak with Vermicelli noodles).  For starters we ordered some fried Spring Rolls.  Very good!  Overall the food was very good.

The restaurant was twice as big as any Vietnamese Pho place we have ever been.  Very clean and staff friendly.  Fast service but a little overpriced.  For instance 4 spring rolls for $5.95, in California you get 6 for that price.  A larger size bowl of Pho was priced at almost $7.95, a dollar more than Cali.  

Food   =    B
Staff     =   B+
Decor  =   B+

I do not know about this place being the best but it sure does get really close to it. The food is very good. I had the beef stew with egg noodles and it had lots of flavor and it was seasoned very well. I cannot believe I finished a large bowl. The pho was one of the best I had in town. I did not get any rice dishes but it looked really appetizing. They do not mess around when it comes to service. As soon as you walk in the door the wait staff is all over you. I highly suggest dining at this place.

Stopped by to grab my quick fix of Pho prior to attending a concert with my family, the food was fairly decent. I ordered the Pho Tai Chin Gan. It came with probably too much noodles and meat for me to finish, but it was okay. I'm not too much of a big fan of eating Pho with barely any soup and just a TON of the noodles so probably that's why I can't give it the full 5 stars. The service there was pretty good, the staff was quick and friendly so that's a plus. Would recommend if you don't have anything or anywhere else you need to go to.

Of all the Pho places I've been to in Chicago, Atlanta, and the Bay Area, this place had the best broth I had. It tasted SUPER clean and the thinly sliced beef they give is just rare enough that it's edible but not too chewy. Their prices are right on par (about $8 for a bowl of large pho) and they give lots of sprouts.

They are super quick which they should be. It indicates the broth is already made and they do a wonderful job even at 9 AM in the morning!

First off the service is questionable , kinda abrasive the way they are and didn't feel like the cleanest place. But the broth is good , very. However I highly recommend agents going during holidays or long weekends. They have a special menu that's very small and they get super stingy with everything. Other than that I think the place is cool at least the broth is good...
Good pho with fast service! The spring rolls are amazing! Place is really clean
Pho noodles are good, but after eating here, i am always so thirsty. I suspect the msg in the soup.  Service is fast though and the rice noodle plates are tasty.

I've had a lot of of pho in my life, and I can honestly say that this was the best I've had. I don't know if it was the delicious broth, the noodles, or the chunks of beef tendon - that are optional for those who prefer not to eat cow innards - but overall it was just a great pho. The vietnamese coffee went great with the noodles, and the fried egg rolls and meatball kabob were great appetizers. They also offer so many different types of pho it's CRAZY, so make sure to try lots! (especially number 18)

And I guess I might be stickler, but the customer service left a little to be desired. However, the food was amazing and I did eventually find the waiter to pay the bill.
I pass this spot all the time n I very glad I stopped to try it !!!! Its very yummy n fast.... talk about on point!!!!

Overall it's a decent pho restaurant in Henderson. The staff is quick and pretty accommodating to certain requests. I believe they do automatically add gratuity of parties 6 or more,  which is fine... In the past, I have ordered pho, hu tieu, bánh canh, egg rolls, and bun bo hue...This is a variety that I normally don't order at other pho restaurants. Typically I just order pho with rare steak, tripe and tendon (which is pretty ok here)...so this just means Im giving this place a chance to outshine the typically mentality I have of pho restaurants. And gladly I did!! Yes, I would come back to try other dishes on their menu....

I just live down the street so I thought I'd check this place out since it's fairly new. I thought the service was great. I was served quickly and was checked on several times throughout my meal. The staff was friendly and the food was yummy. I ordered a small Pho Tai Nam Gau and had more than enough food, the beef was cooked perfectly. Price was competitive with other Vietnamese places. I walked out full and satisfied. Will return again.

Disappointed! Pho Saigon 8 has two other locations that have been open for many years. This location is their newest one and does not meet the quality of the others. The Eastern and 215 location is the best.

FOOD: We tried serval different dishes and sadly is was not good at all. Everything was bland and overcooked, from the meat to the noodles to the soup. The most decent dish was the spring rolls.

DRINK: They sell Vietnamese dessert drinks, sodas, beers, and wine. I didn't want to get any drinks considering how bad the food was.

SERVICE: They are extremely unstaffed. They have one cashier, one waiter, one server, and one bus boy. It took forever for someone to seat us and even longer for someone to come take our order. They came and took our order three times and yet our food still did not come out. As I looked around the restaurant, I could tell that the other customers were annoyed as well. The server and the cooks kept arguing with each other and it quickly became awkward (especially since I speak Vietnamese and can understand what they are saying). They did not bring us drinks, utensils, or anything unless we asked. When it was time to pay, the cashier was no where to be found as many tables were waiting to pay, it turned out he was doing something outside the restaurant and the server had to go get him.

NOTE: I rarely give this low of a rating and review, but I am so disappointed with their food and service.

I've been to many pho places looking for the best pho and this one is probably one of the ones I would recommend to anyone. Aside from the pho, the food is great. The Barbecue plates and dishes are my favorite and it keeps me coming back for more. Love this place. It's clean and the service is great.

This was my first time ordering take-out from a Pho restaurant, so it was a bit confusing. I would only recommend they explain, or have on their site, or even have a sign explaining why it is served the way it's served.  The #11 was very good.
Great service and friendly employees. Food was delicious and served quickly, even with a full house!

Pho Saigon 8 is definitely our favorite Pho place off Eastern near the 215, but I know there has to be better out there. The broth is just OK, not salty/flavorful enough in my opinion. The amount of meat they put in each serving varies from visit to visit. The french bread is good, not great. Sometimes it seems extremely fresh and flaky, other times it seems old.
Service is fast which should be standard at a pho place. Waiters are generally nice and quick to give refills or additional items. Overall, this is better than a few other Vegas places but I've definitely had better pho in other cities.
the pho and soup is delicious, the place is nice and average size, the pho I always order is perfect, the soup tastes good, the noodles are the best part and the employees are very nice and quiet

UPDATE June 2014
I am obsessed with the pho from here. I order the spring rolls and number 26 Pho. Love, love, love it!

Decided to try some where new since every single place seems to disappoint me over time.  Decided to finally try here since it is in the top 10 with Yelp.  Nice, clean restaurant, a little small but they make it work, and it has working AC! Something Pho So 1 was lacking.  I ordered the Large #26 which has tendon, tripe, brisket? I can't remember perfectly but it is my go to set of meats in my pho.  The pho was good. Tasty and not too salty.  My only complaint is that the pho needs more noodles, a little more meat and more jalepenos to put in it.  I did read someone's else review that said she usually orders 2 larges and I should of.  A large just has more soup? Does that make sense? I felt like I was not full but hungry.  I could have eaten another bowl definitely.  The spring rolls were great also.  I would definitely good again and get more food.
This is my favorite place for pho thai. Staff is very friendly and serves quickly. Take out available and is packaged nicely.

I would have to say one of the best places to get Pho. I get the #11 mostly.  It's soo yummy. I would have to say the service isn't the best, but the last couple of times I have been here its getting better.

Service is always quick and I have never waited to be seated. The food is always delicious-- I rarely have complaints. I've been to the other top rated pho places (Pho So 1, Pho Kim Long) many times but Pho Saigon 8 is ultimately my favorite. The spring rolls have a good texture and taste fresh... I often find that at other places they get hard quickly and it just isn't the same! The egg rolls here are also very good-- they come super hot with lettuce you can wrap them in. The pho/soup comes out very fast... I have never waited more than 10 minutes for my meal! The waiters aren't very sociable, but they get you what you want/need. This place might be faster than fast food.

Out of all the Pho spots in the Southwest area, Rainbow/215, I'd choose Pho Saigon 8 rather than Jenni Pho or Pho Annie. 

Main reasons is their fast and friendly customer service. The prices are reasonable. We've been here multiple times and they are prompt with serving water(s) while you take a look at what you want to order. Never have we felt rushed or impatiently waiting for service. The restaurant is large enough to cater to large groups. They have a couple big screen TV's around with the sports channel on. Go Knights Go! 

My usual order is No. 11 (noodle with rare eye round) in a small. Broth is good. Can't forget to add Hoisin sauce and  Siracha chili to give it some kick. The egg rolls are always a must. 

No cash? Don't fret! They accept cards here. Not like another pho place I know, that was cash only (no bueno).
Pretty good. They give a lot of meat with the Pho, which is rare in my opinion but always appreciated.

Waited in line. They seated a couple that came after us. Even though my wife reminded him that we were next. The waiter acknowledged we were next and still took the next person in line. That's bs. And it doesn't make sense he put them on a 4 seat table when 2 seat table was available. He then acknowledged he made a mistake and wanted us to wait another 5 mins. 

We eat here twice a month not anymore. There is a lot of places we can spend my money. 

Next stop lemongrass cafe 3 mins away.
Our family's new spot for Vietnamese food.

It was mediocre . Pho was like warm not the broth Iv had if u absolutely need pho and every pho place is mysteriously closed I mean I guess u could come here 

I also ordered vegan print rolls . GROSS the tofu was fried but has a weird pungent taste 

14.26$ was my total for pho and veggie spring rolls def. not coming back 

Maybe they still need to tweak some of thier recipes .

We always come here for Vietnamese food, Pho is good , Pork Chop with rice and Crepe are so good !!!
We bring  our friends here and they love it as well.
Friendly Service !!
I asked two different employees & they told me that they do use msg!!!  their food taste fantastic but be aware if you do not want msg.

My husband ordered over the phone for pick up, a pho combination. Usually they would come with meatballs right??? Not at all! And that's his favorite part of it. And then only 1 piece of tendon.. really??? Never again!
Looking at it as food only it was great. As a whole I felt like they didn't want my business. Maybe next time I will show up with an Asian friend. But yes the food was great.

Hit the spot... but definitely not ranked up there as a favorite.  The eggrolls were somewhat dried out!  The soup didn't have the same taste that I have come to look for in pho broth.  The service was not horrible but definitely wasn't as good as other restaurants, even though they weren't so busy when we went to visit.

They were rather stingy with paper napkins ... and water.

Been there once... and that's okay for me.
The foods are the best, good service and excellent! Thumbs up.. I hope the have branch at Sacramento.

I'm here at least once a week! Love, love, love the crispy egg rolls - you absolutely MUST have these when you visit. The soup is always on point and I now know the staff and vice versa...Hahaha! Love this place!

After coming to this place for almost a year bringing friends and family to try what I discovered to be the best ph? Las Vegas had to offer! I was very disappointed to find that there portion sizes have been cut down. #31 white chicken breast lacked the quality egg noodle I substituted for rice noodle the broth was much more oily then before and what happened to the chicken??? Fresh spring rolls lost there fat and full zest and the service seems to have no care there guest get thirsty. I much prefer this place over any other ph? restaurant as I would drive 30 minutes just to eat at this place. I have tested this place out numerous times before writing this review and sad to say this place has no longer captured my bu$ine$$
Love this place forever it's been one of my favorite spots for a while! Great broth and amount of meat per bowl...beef tendons are also a plus whenever I'm in the mood :-)

As a first timer here, the pho tai was absolutely delicious. Everything was pretty spot on from the customer service, to the presentation, to the meal. Hopefully this isn't just because of their grand opening. Definitely think this pho restaurant will be a hot spot as long as they continue doing exactly what they're doing.

What a find!  We had the Beef Pho and egg rolls.  The broth for the Pho was really, really nice.  It was subtle and didn't punch you in the face with flavor.  I really like the delicateness of the broth as opposed to strongly flavored broths.  Super clean compared to most Pho places I've been which is a plus.
Pho was very mediocre - came out warm and not hot.

I tried two other Pho places in the area, and this one serves the best broth. The other ones are just not as flavorful. Lots of seating and service was fine. I did notice that the older female waitress appeared colder than her younger counterparts but she treated us well and thanked us for coming when we left. So maybe she's not the warmest person in the world, but we rolled with it and didn't seem to have a problem. It's worth it for the pho. Until I find a better place in this area of Las Vegas, Pho Saigon 8 has my business.

So i finally tried this place after getting some clarification on the ingredients of the broth.  The owner was very prompt and answering my questions. My main concern is that there were no animal products in the veggie broth. I am happy to report having tried it I did not detect any animal products in it. Additionally has now become my favorite place for pho as the place I had previously been going to the Brass was overly salty. They have a very mild broth with good flavor, and are extremely generous with the fresh veggies and condiments. Very important to note for those of you who are vegan you must request the veggie broth.#vegan

Food is priced well and tastes fresh. Staff waits to be told to do things rather than being proactive. For example: clearing plates bringing menus and refilling drinks. They are friendly and efficient otherwise.
Its alright. Quality of food is good. Taste is rather bland. Pho is a bit on the oily side.

The pho served here is quick and tasty. It satisfies the nightly pho cravings and is a good place for those who live in the Henderson area, as it nearby. But there are better pho places in Vegas, if you are willing to drive.
First time to this place and was impressed. Super fast service and food was amazing can't wait to eat hear again.

The food wasn't very different from other Vietnamese restaurants, with the soup and noodles tasted pretty ordinary. The spring rolls were pretty good, but still, ordinary.
  The waiters seemed like all they wanted to do was rush me out the door as quickly as possible.
Yay! Authentic Vietnamese Pho. Good size portions, not too greasy or salty. Clean restaurant.  Very little wait. Good servers.

Hey this place is alright. I mean, I liked my pho and my husband's pho. The place was filled with Asians which is always a great sign, and the bathrooms were very well cleaned. However, the spring roll looked pretty but smelled like someone rolled it after wiping their hands on a moldy towel. The service was indifferent, the waitress could have cared less to help us or to even get us the check. Would I go back? Probably, if it was the only game in town, but it is not....
Craving pho like crazy, glad I found this spot semi close to the crib past 9pm. Me and my man both ordered vegetarian bowls and they are  Hard to find good pho places that have vegetable broth too.

Pho Saigon 8 - was our first taste of Pho in Las Vegas since the move from NYC.  I love Pho!  There's just something about a nice big bowl of Pho thats just so comforting!  Born and raised in NYC's Chinatown I definitely know my Pho.  My gf is Vietnamese and from Boston where the Pho is even better than in NY.  Pho is all about the broth.  I, for one, love my soup dark, beefy, and with a little bit of oil from the bones of the beef.  Pho Saigon 8 has a much lighter broth in color and taste.  It does however, give it a more refreshing and cleaner tasting broth.  *If your broth tastes like its missing something, add some Fish Sauce (Nuoc Mum), but be warned, a little goes a long way!) The deep fried egg rolls/spring rolls were ok as were the summer rolls.  I like mine made with the white rice paper instead of the generic yellow eggroll paper.  It has little air bubbles popped on the skin that gives the eggroll/spring roll some added crunch and texture.  The summer rolls looked fresh and tasted good with the peanut sauce. The limeade soda (Soda Chanh) is good.  Many locals have prasied this place and I can see why.  Not a bad spot to get some Pho.

I love the food here everything is really tasty and the price is pretty good. They make your food really fast I don't have to wait long. Sometimes I order Togo and they take like only 10 minutes to prepare my food.

went at 2:45pm and it was packed! pho was good and authentic. bf had the grilled chicken with rice, and it was also very good. service was "basic vietnamese" (not overly helpful or attentive, but prompt). pro: good parking, next to pure foot massage.

Very Good choose #18 or #23 if you like beef.  Service is just as good.  and they watch the amount of salt on their soups if you have Blood pressure problems.  Recommend to all my friends to GO!  Enjoy one of the best Pho places in las vegas.

This is by far my favorite lunch place.  I love the soup - no matter what I have, it's always good!  It's a great comfort food, especially when the weather gets cold or rainy or if I'm feeling under the weather.  I start everything with an order of spring rolls, best shared with a friend.  So fresh!  Then order whatever soup that fancies me that day.  Make sure to order a SMALL because the LARGE is enough to share!  If I have room after eating all of that, I love to get a hot vietnamese coffee with that yummy cream.   So good!
2 stars because the Pho was really great but the service left so much to be desired that we will never eat here again.

Came to eat with some people. While visiting Las Vegas 
And this place was pretty much dead when we walked in 
But the food was alright..

It was especially cold this past weekend in Vegas so the Pho tasted extra delicious. Good quality Pho with fresh ingredients and a great tasting soup! I would definitely stop by again when I come back to the city of sin.
This was the first time I've ever had pho, I had number 46 with egg noddles. It was so good!! I ordered to go and service was fast and friendly. Would come back again soon.

If you're looking for decent Pho at a place that's consistent this is the place for you. I Always get the white chicken Pho with spring rolls or the fried rolls. I'm sure they use MSG, but haven't found a place yet that doesn't. Good overall and close to the strip for you tourists.

Food is good, but the only thing that bothered me and really caught my attention was their rest room doors are widely open and you can smell it when you are sitting on a table close to the restrooms. I wish they will make ways to just close it.

I usually get one of their Pho noodle bowls.  I like the beef brisket, tendon, and also the beef stew noodles.  Meat is always very tender and soup is very flavorful.  I also like the spring rolls with the lettuce and cilantro wrap.  Sevice is a bit lacking, after the food arrives the next time they see you is payment on the check.
