Last week went in and notice the prices have gone up across the board.  I guess a business can do that if they are busy all the time.

-15% surcharged for 6 or more

-Pho is not hot enough - frankly it is too cold for calling it Pho

-The mom/daughter served on weekday and they never smiled event when they took our orders/payment (ie: if you are in this business, you need to smile or loose customers)

-RECOMMEND: DO NOT EAT HERE go to KUNG FU (Thai Chinese on the same street near Chinatown - food over there much better)

I have to admit that I love this place. If the GF would let me I would eat here almost every day. The food is excellent, I have not even tried something I didn't love. The spring rolls are really .. really... really good. Amazing and fresh taste that wrecks the experience at any other place in Vegas. Now the Pho is excellent and no matter what one I am in the mood for they deliver. Service is fantastic most of the time however most staffers are a little light on English so you can be challenged to communicate some things. 

If only they had VN Sandwiches it would be perfect!

Drive, drive, and keep on driving pass the usual pho spots on Spring Mountain Road and you will come to Pho Saigon 8 on the corner of Westwind Road. What I like about Pho Saigon 8 is that the broth alone can be drank as a soup, and that is why I am giving them 4/5 stars.

For me, it's all about the soup. When I took a sip of the broth, I absolutely fell in love with it. I did not need to add anything to it, it was not watered down, not too overly oily, not too salty. A definite perfect balance that makes you devour the bowl within minutes of being served.

While cost is a bit higher then usual $7-$8 a bowl (small), I absolutely think it's worth it to cure your hang over or just as a meal! As it stands, this is the spot to be now for pho after a hard night in Vegas.

We always have super fast and great service! The pho is amazing! As well as the chicken. This is the type of restaurant where they sit you down, take your order serve you and that's it. Some people like when they come back a lot of times, but I hate that. 
The number 11 pho is my favorite. It doesn't have too much to it, just one type of meat. 
All in all, I think it's great!

I just moved here from LA and I wasn't sure where to go eat and I found this place and the food was delicious. In LA we have tons of these restaurants everywhere. Here I only found a few and I have to say I ate at two different places and this one is the bomb!

I decided to have lunch here today since it has been so long since my last visit.

I ordered my usual:

Pho Tai w/tripe and the beef on the side (small) $6.85
Soda Chanh (fresh lemon soda) $2.75

The small is a little too small. The broth was a little on the salty side. The beef looked good, but I think the slices should be smaller. The soup is not hot enough. I don't put all my beef in the soup right away. After about 5 minutes, the beef I was adding to my bowl was not cooking. The fresh lemon soda was good.

I gave it 4 Stars because of the price of the bowl. I was there last Friday with 3 friends and we all ordered Pho. I ordered the #21 large with extra meatballs. It cost me $11.00. That's about $3-4 more than the other pho restaurants in Chinatown and it's much better in Chinatown. Okay, it was in Henderson but make it competitive. The meatball suck. It wasn't even good. 2 balls cut in half for $2.00 more? Wasn't worth the extra. They should have a combination bowl with everything in it. The broth was very good, egg rolls were good, and the spring rolls were good. I won't go back. I'm disappointed because they only had holson sauce, Sarachia sauce and a red chili sauce.
One of the worst 10 Vietnam Restaurant I have been to so far. The service here is terrible.  NOT COMING BACK. Gave this place 2 chances.

This is my second time here. The Pho isn't bad, however I've had better. I was disappointed in that I couldn't order the combination of meats I prefer like most pho places. Like most of these restaurants they do not give military or student discounts.

I want to first say that I really like the food here, but the service is less than mediocre.  And I know this isn't Joel Robuchon at the MGM, where the bussers scrape your bread crumbs off the table with a special bread crumb brush. But for heaven sakes, you are in the hospitality industry as well! I really don't feel their hospitality here! At least ask me if I would like some water? And even when you do ask me if I want water, it is as if you are angry for me coming into the place and having to actually make you work for your dollar! Or why do I have to flag you down whenever I need something? 

As far as food, the spring rolls were decent, but nothing to honestly to rave about. The pho was not memorable, but I have had so much pho, maybe I don't know a good one anymore?  They have no sandwiches also .

The décor is maybe the best thing that they have going for them, and location.  I really dislike their tables though. I am 5'1 and very small, and I still think their tables are small! The problem is that the tables have this poorly placed bar under them where my husband kept pushing my legs.  Each table is so closely placed. I can almost hear every conversation around me. Not much of a place for a first date. 

I love pho, but if there is another pho place at least a mile away from this one... I would choose the other, cause this place can really piss me off. They can be just darn rude here.
Food was good, but halfway through the meal we saw roaches on the walls and floor.  That part was not so good.
They have amazing flan with great texture. I tried the Thai tea. Real good and rich. Also, they have good bread. I think it's like a French bread roll for dipping into the soup.

Beware! If you're a darker skinned person or do not fit the culture they will discriminate against you.  Waited 20 minutes fir pho that takes a few minutes to prep.  Went with my best friend and we're never going back.  I thought that we were beyond that. ...smh

Was in there yesterday with the family. Pho was delicious, pricing was good, service was quick but very pushy I felt rushed out place was empty but they were in a hurry to get us out.  We all felt pushed out, weird.

Stopped by here with LiLy D to grab a quick bite. 

We were in a rush so I just got pho tai. The waiter doesn't come by to check to see if I'm ready to order. He doesn't come by to check to see how everything is. They charge $1.50 for tea...wtf?

Thanks for picking up the check LiLy!

Came here for dinner a few days ago as it was really cold and we all wanted something warm/hot after a day of helping a friend move. This was something nearby and we all agreed. 

We were immediately sat at a table when we arrived and had gotten waters. 

2 of us gotten #21 large (Noodle w/ rare eye of round, flank, brisket, tendon, and skirt flank). 1 had gotten the #11 small (Noodle with rare eye of round). Another had gotten #15 small (Noodle with rare eye of round and beef ball). One of my friends had gotten the sausage/pork roll (i believe was #5) as he had other dinner plans (which got we later found out next day that they were canceled.... Lol) 

As with all pho noodle soups, it comes with a plate with fresh herbs, bean sprouts, jalapeno slices, and wedges of lime. 

Reason why i got #21 is that it is most similar to what is called "Combination Pho or Pho Dac Biet" in a lot of other restaurants, which is essentially the one with everything. The only thing that this didn't have that some others may have is either tripe or beef balls. Average sized large bowl. Good amount of meat and noodles. Add herbs and bean sprouts to the bottom under the noodles, squeeze some limes and you gots a good bowl of pho. Oh a side dish of hoisin and sriracha too for dipping meat. I don't know if it was because i was super hungry and barely had food, or was cold cuz of weather, but this hit the spot, even if it didnt last that long (got hungry later at night.. haha)

The restaurant is mildly small and could get busy due to limited seats but its a fairly decent size. Prices seem mildly higher than those in Chinatown but for convenience if you are in the area, the price difference is very negligible. 

They are willing to split the bill without restrictions which was good. Not really much complaints besides some unreasonable ones (like not enough meat, not enough noodles.. should have ordered some egg rolls (cha gio) too ! but wait werent they considerably more pricey than other places...?) lol... .right? unreasonable.. hahaha !

So yummmmmmmyyy! We were looking for a pho place and one of the workers at our hotel recommended this pho spot. I would totally come back. We came here around 2 and there were a good amount of people, no wait though, considering pho is really fast in preparation. I got the com tam and everyone else got their pho, and it was so good. I can really compare this pho place to back home in cali! The soup was amazing in taste, not too salty and not too bland. 

Thanks, will come back!
Good pho. I save a trip going to Spring Mountain when I was living in Silverado Ranch area.

One Tuesday morning, I had the misfortune of checking this place out. this is my first yelp review ever, and  ive had Yelp for over 2 years now, I just didn't have the time to review all the restaurant I eat in ,and frankly I didn't see the point of it,  it's always gonna be inconsistent when it comes to restaurants-- you simply cannot please everyone. 
Anyways I just can't move past what I've experienced in this place. The service was mediocre we ordered two pho bo vien, avocado smoothies and spring egg rolls. I'm not writing this review to comment about the ambience of the place or the sodium levels of the food, I'm commenting about the nasty cockroach that I found crawling on our food!!! Yep, that's right a big brown cockroach! I would have snapped a picture but I was so disgusted and busy spitting out my food and the waitress took the food right away. We got up so fast... Eager to leave. The waitress kept apologizing but I just can't bring myself to say ' it's okay' because it's not! It simply is not OK to serve paying customers cockroach infested food needless to say I'm disappointed and disgusted, prolly scarred for life too! 
Go get yourselves an exterminator!!!

One of the cooks went into the bathroom. And while I was washing my hand; the cook had gotten done doing her business. And I was expecting her to wash her hands. But no, this bishhh ended up leaving the bathroom with her unwashed hands. I also notice a few servers do the same. I am calling the Health Department soon!
We have been here a few times and kept thinking the pho broth would be better...it would come out warm but not hot like it should be. Hopefully it'll improve in the future!
The rare eye of round beef pho is the best I've had anywhere. It really is what makes the not-so-friendly, barely-there service tolerable.
Very good. I have been here at least 1 time my last 3 times in Vegas and the food is consistently good in all 3 locations. Portions are large and service is quick.

I had lunch here two times in two days, beginning 12/23/15.  The food was good, service was very good and attentive and the restaurant appears clean.  It's packed with families who love good Vietnamese food.  I recommend it.

The old lady w/curly hair took our orders. Needless to say she's extremely rude af! Answering w/a very quick and short one to word answer. We asked for more napkins and she just literally threw them on the table all the while we hand our hand out waiting for her to hand m them over (guess someone loss big time last night?!) Besides that food was pretty decent. Better that that Pho Kim Long that we've been eating at (due to closer location.) we've been here a couple other times but it was such a long time ago that we didn't need to write a review cuz it was pretty decent service. But today was just an awful experience all around!

They are quick! Always quick to get your order to you and quick to refill drinks. Love that the food here doesn't make you feel heavy and actually tastes healthy without skimping on flavor. Only drawback is some tables are conjoined to other patrons which can be slightly awkward. Nevertheless great place for pho!

I think everyone understands when I say: Everyone needs a good bowl of pho in their life. Luckily for Las Vegas go-ers and locals, Pho Saigon 8 is the place to get that bowl! With a murky broth, the pho is simply tasty! Add hoison sauce, sriracha, lime, and a ton of bean sprouts and you're pho bowl is set for success. 

The service is good (OMG. People actually speak engrish here!), the place is clean (OMFG. I can drink the water?!), and the food is good! (AS IT SHOULD BE!) Pho Saigon 8 continues to impress me on my visits to Vegas and it's nice breather (away from the cigarette smoke) from the strip.

Although... parking is a BITCH! as it always is!

Noodle soup has a great broth. Not a fan of some of the fatty cuts of meat though. Overall this was good and I will definitely come back... I'll just choose a different meat than the Flank and Round combo (#13).

so I got this place mixed up with Pho Little Saigon. I did originally rant a rave about how great this place was but it was not the right place. my bad, sorry for the confusion. However, I did have the pleasure of stopping into this establishment after my work out at the las vegas athletic club (same parking lot). I ordered the seafood pho and this place does it a bit different with the items of meat in the pho. They give you tiny eggs so i'm wondering if its maybe quail eggs? I don't know if they do this in all their pho dishes or if it is just in the seafood one, but one of the eggs seems to be a bit off so I don't know if it was bad or what. The broth is strangely sour if you taste it on its own.  its a clear yellow color which is not beef broth like its supposed to be. After adding all veggies, noodles, and meat it does take some of the sourness away but the broth is not authentic. Its lacking in the proper pho spices/flavor. it really was just a sour/salty broth. definitely not a traditional authentic Pho broth at all. in my opinion you are much better off going to the Pho Little Saigon in the chuck e cheese/99 cent store/in and out parking lot on the other side of the 2-15 to get the real deal, you will be much happier. Its where I always go when I am to lazy to make my own traditional Vietnamese food at home. Don't even waste your time at Pho Mai lan, its a rip off very expensive for what you get and its not authentic either, their beef broth is literally beef broth with no Pho spice flavor. $10 for a bowl of Pho is just ridiculous especially if its not the real deal!!!

This is hands down my favorite pho spot in town and I recommend it to everyone and anyone. The broth is packed with flavor and clean not oily , all of the veggies are fresh and crisp. Everything is very clean and fast-paced.  I'm a very picky eater and have a hard time most places when it comes to getting my order right but never once have they messed up my order... I even order to go confidently knowing they won't screw things up. The service is very fast for such a busy place and they're polite to my standards they make sure your cup is filled and like most Vietnamese restaurants are trying to get you fed and taken care of not make small talk to butter you up for a big tip (which I think many people are not used to and see it as bad service instead of doing a good job and efficiency ) which I find genuine and worth a bigger tip. If you do ever order to go make sure to ask for any extra sauce you may want because you only get what you order.

I don't know why this place only has 3 stars!?  The broth of the pho was de-lish!!
The restaurant was very clean.  The service was fast and friendly.  I will definitely be back pho more!!
Great spot for BBH. It was one of the better ones that I had in the states. The desert drink was good too (jelly, bean and Coco milk).

The pho here is amazing! Service isn't too great but in all honesty the food makes up for it.  This place has the best crispy spring rolls, they're fresh and absolutely delicious.  The food here is very authentic, which is another reason the service doesn't bother me that much.  No one is rude here or mean.  They're just constantly busy, which makes sense for a tiny place that's constantly busy. As long as you have time the food is worth it here and incredibly affordable.  Definitely a place to try if you're on this side of town. :)

Excellent service, delicious and fast service. Love the Pho, hot tea and recommend visiting it at least once a week! (Lol) I recommend this place for dinner or lunch, intimate setting with a clean atmosphere. Here's a picture of my food... #29, Vegetable Pho with tofu

Quick review: Came here with a vegas resident. Didn't try the pho, but did try the bun bo hue. Pretty good serving for a large. I asked for extra noodles which was perfect. The soup wasn't that spicy but had an ok amount of flavor. Wish there was more flavor. 

I like this place bc they have lots of noodle soups, not just the Pho. They have bun rieu - which I haven't had in a long time. I usually eat this at my grandma's house. 

Its quite a drive from the strip. The prices are decent.

After a couple days of eating rich French cuisine on the strip, I needed a break and decided to have some Pho to cleanse my system. Located in a stripe mall with ample parking, this restaurant is large, clean, and sensibly well decorated. The AC is on creating a cool atmosphere. This might actually be one of the nicest Vietnamese restaurant I've been to! Our pho #21 came with everything. The quality of the meat, noodles, vegetable were high and fresh. The beef broth was full of flavor and delicious. The price was a little higher than what I'm used to. But the price might be commensurate with other restaurants in Vegas.
Perfect Pho! Stock was seasoned just right; the meat and noodle was just the right portion. Nothing you could ask for more.

The worst vietnamese resto ! They wont give your receipt , you have to ask for it and they will include the 15 percent gratuity in it , so if you dont look on your receipt you will give more tip ! Worst customer service !

Yuck!!!
My wife and I went to Pho Saigon 8 yesterday. My wife ordered the Pho Dac Biet and I ordered the Pho Ga.
1. To get somebody to the table to take our order was a miracle. Service was terrrible...
2. My wife's Pho Dac Biet (means pho specialty with 5 combo meat & documented on their menu) was short changed. There was only 3 types of meat. We mentioned this to the management and they argued with us. At the table, the manager called my wife a liar. My god, the food was right in front of us. Hello????
3. Pho Ga that I received had the plastic wrapping and parts of the strings in the PHO!! Yes, the cooks cooked the strings and plastic in the broth. And, I showed this to him. 
We were so disgusted with this restaurant. No wonder alot of people told us to stay away. After this experience, we recommend the same.. 
Cons: Bad Service, menu cut corners, careful what you eat

Clean, no wait, fast food, large portions, good pho, no-English-no-nonsense. Exactly what you'd want the morning after a night filled with regrettable actions. Pretty window blinds (though I don't think that contributes to the ratings). Now if I could just locate Pho Saigon 1, Pho Saigon 2, Pho Saigon 3, Pho Saigon 4, Pho Saigon 5, Pho Saigon 6, and Pho Saigon 7...

If I could give ZERO stars, I would. I've been to this restaurant in several times of hopes it would improve but now it just reached a new low. The chicken and beef frequently taste like rubber and are hard to chew. And today, I found a dead insect in my vegetable soup!!!! Absolutely disgusting! How dare you serve food to people and allow them to eat the nasty shit that happens to "appear". I will never be eating here again. Please beware, everyone.

It is very good and always packed ! The broth is amazing ! Service is sometimes a little jumbled as there are multiple people trying to help you !!takes forever to get your check and end up just walking to the register ! 

They have a great selection of Pho ! Apps are good but been to other places and they are better !!

The best Pho in Las Vegas. I love everything here. Super clean and fresh foods. All the staffs are friendly and professional. They just remodeled the shop. Looking so much nicer. Also they serve alcohol and have karaoke after 10pm till midnight. New foods added for night time, c len xào da and chim cút chiên b is my favorite ones. Definitely recommend to my friends and clients about this place.
This is my go-to place for Pho, consistently yummy!! AND, they have a great to-go menu!!

It was empty when i entered which was odd because its right next to LV Athletic on easter. But it soon filled up. I ordered Rare Beef Pho and Spring Rolls and a Vietnamese Coffee all were on poi t and the pork in the spring roll wasnt gamey so i thoroughly enjoyed the whole meal. The staff is cool and they all pitch in to help which meant i wasnt waiting long for anything. The food got to the table lightning fast. Good place recommend it

7.1.17 @ 8pm was my 2nd visit.  Place is new and I have been to their other 2 locations.  Typical cheap Asian set up.  The food is good but the service is horrible. The young male waiter is has no social skills.  I get it, there is no service at most if not all Vietnamese restaurants.  When the check came my wife went to pay at the front. The check was like 41 & change, she gave him 45$ worth and got her change back and the SOB says to her and I quote "No Tip" with attitude, so she responded it "its on the table".  Lucky for him she didnt tell me this until we got home.  In my 48 yrs of life, not once have I encountered such attitude from the wait staff.  These Viet places dont provide service, just food and they expect 5 star tipping.  You work on tip so work for it.  My wife tipped 8usd but we shall never go to any Saigon 8 again.  Yes they talk about you behind your back when you leave crappy tip, I know cuz I can understand them.  Its the typical Viet attitude wanting things for free or more of it.  Go back to your to your caveman ways yo... from another Viet to Saigon 8....."yeah I am a banana but I love it"

We were trying this place for the first time. Not only did we ever get asked what we wanted to drink but I found a caterpillar in the lettuce that came with the egg rolls. Luckily we had just started eating when I noticed it. We were so grossed out we couldn't eat anymore. We told the waiter and all he said was oh sorry about that and walked away. We ended up leaving the place. The manager told us I won't charge you for the egg rolls but we still had to pay for the pho which we hardly touched..not going back there again.

The pho here is very good, not 5-star excellent, but very good. 

My usual go-to when out and about is Pho Kim Long but my office is located very close to Pho Saigon 8, so as a captive audience it certainly satisfies when craving pho for lunch. 

The service definitely leaves a lot to be desired in that no dialog is created (at least the times I have been here) and "friendly" isn't an adjective I would use to describe the employees.

That said, I'm not here to make friends, I want to eat soupl. And Pho Saigon 8 provides piping hot, delicious pho in less than 2 mins of putting in your order.

I ordered Com ga roti and was disappointed how dry the chicken was. Portion was small and they have a nerve to charge $10.25 .  My husband ordered bun bo hue and he said no flavor at all. He had to add lots of fish sauce in order to eat. I cant really trust some of these previous reviews, maybe those are reviews are from their own people. Service was also poor. First time and last time too

The food was decent.  I didn't expect to get good Vietnamese food in Las Vegas... This place totally surprised us.  I came here with a large group including some of my uncles and aunts.  You know how Vietnamese elderlies are, they are picky.  And yet, they were happy with the food here.  They love it.  We had pho, hu tieu, bun rieu, bun bo hue, Korean short ribs over tomato rice.  All of them were good.

AWESOME pho.  The hubby had the dry rice noodle dish and his was excellent as well.  The spring rolls were good but I could tell they didn't make it to order.  Anybody who likes spring rolls know that it has to be made WHEN the customer orders or it it's just not as good!

Ridiculous. I order a vermicelli half beef half pork. They said they couldn't do half beef and half pork for  an order so I requested that I pay extra for the other side of meat. The owner refused and say they were not willing to do it either I got pork vermicelli or beef vermicelli. They were not willing to accommodate me!!! When I was willing to pay extra. Horrible customer service and horrible accommodation for people that just want to have a meal and willing to pay extra for food that is not included in the original menu item. I was not trying to get comped or get free food I was trying to pay for what I wanted. It is ridiculous that this is the only place that does not do half beef half pork when all of the pho Vietnamese restaurants do it. Extremely ridiculous. The sever was rude and not welcoming at all. Will not be returning here ever again. Some restaurants need to realize that there is plenty of competition and other places are willing to not only have better food but better customer service. We live in Las Vegas, our industry is service, experience.... learn something from other places!

The Pho has a tasty base with plenty of meat. For those who do not care for Pho, this place has plenty of other dinner options. Pricing on the menu is very fair for what you order.  This location is always busy, and they are able to keep up with the pace. I recommend and don't forget to try the iced coffee.  It's great for those who love a great caffeine jolt!

This has been my favorite pho for over a decade and I've lived in several metropolitans. The beef broth is the best I've tasted. The space is large enough to accommodate big groups and if the place is full you're never waiting too long for a table. Highly recommended!

Um, wouldn't go back.

Service - was very bad.
Food - already forgot about it.
Ambience - nothing to write home about

Was very excited to try the snails with coconut sauce, but it was not good. $12 for about 20 mini snails. Sauce tasted fine but some of the snails were green and slimy and it just was not worth the money. It tasted like the frozen ones you can get at the oriental market for $5. 
The rest of the food was great! 
My favorite was the che 3 mau dessert. Only $3.25 and everything tasted great and cooked just right! 

We ordered rice combos, bun cha ha noi and vermicelli. 

Didn't try the pho because I read reviews that it wasn't good.
This restaurant has amazing food and the cleanest windows I've ever seen. The inside is clean and the staff is friendly.

We enjoying coming here for Pho but the past several times I haven't been getting Pho only because i don't feel good after eating it. But i do usually get the #52 Korean BBQ Beef Ribs but this time I changed my usual order to #59 Beef Tenderloin and that was delicious as well. I love how it is tender and full of flavor, i was afraid it was going to be salty but it was perfect! Also ordered a thai tea which was a little thick for my liking you can definitely tell it was heavy and creamy. We will continue taking our big party of relatives who want pho for dinner here.
The pho tai is top notch, especially on a cold winters day.  But what really sets Pho saigon apart is their crispy egg rolls.  Its a must try.

Great tasting pho, however, the my hai my tho was a bit salty. The service was good, our server was attentive and checked up on us to make sure we were enjoying our meal. That's good service, except for the only one napkin per person deal. Lol. They provided us with more when asked though. Anyways, it's good pho!
Been here a couple of times very good I like the broth here better than some other places its beefier tasting

A friend took me to lunch for pho and I was not disappointed. This place was clean, well kept, and the servers were friendly. The pho broth had some really good flavors. There was plenty of meats and a variety of choice of noodles (a new experience for me). I will have to return to try the other noodle choices. Love the fact that it's nearby.

Their food is delicious, however their customer service could use a little bit of work. We waited about 15 minutes to have someone take our order and only had our waters refilled once without having to ask someone to help us. 
Even so, we will continue to eat here because the food is great and we love the environment!

Worst service! Will not come back. Came in around 10am for a small bowl of pho with a friend. After order was taken, waited 30mins and didn't see anything. I asked an elderly server how much longer for a small bowl of pho? She walked away and responded "there's a lot of order before you, it will be out". How rude is that? I understand when you're under staff, but no respect for your customers at all? About 5 mins later my pho came out, but not my friend's bbh.... we had to yelled out at the server to get her attention and asked where's my friend's order? Did you guys forgot about it? Honestly, We were about to leave that place but my friend had an appointment at next door salon, so we tried to be more patience... So when her food came out, she had few bite and had to run. It was a wasted 45mins wait for Small now of Ph and a bowl of BBH. 
Service here before was a lot better. What happened?

I think this Pho restaurant is just fine overall. Perhaps I never had an issue with the service here, or perhaps I know not to really expect much in terms of service in small culturally unique joints such as this one. I also think the language barrier plays a role in the type of service you receive.   The service was ok, no one was rude nor made us feel rushed while we, two of the most indecisive people in the world, reviewed the menu. The Pho was good enough to warrant a return visit when I am not feeling like driving too far from my house for a bowl of pho. They provide all of the necessary standards such as the condiments (I love me some siracha!) and a heaping plate full of additions such as fresh herbs, sprouts and lime to add as needed.  I think Pho Little Saigon across the street and this joint are almost identical in service and in quality. My review is more of a 3.5 star but I will round it up as I am feeling generous.

I usually get pho here because it close to where I live and it's pretty decent. I get the chicken pho and my fiance usually gets their rare steak Pho--both are pretty good and I like their fresh spring rolls. The pho is good because the broth is flavorful enough and I feel there is a good balance of the meats and the vegetables. Can't say that I like their vermicelli dishes though, based off the shrimp vermicelli dish I got. The shrimp was poorly cooked (dry) and there wasn't enough vegetables in the mix to balance everything out. 

I've been told by my Vietnamese friends that this place is some what "Americanized." I guess I can see that....Oh and did I mention, at one point I was mortified to order from here because of their grade 'C'  rating? Yeah...I hope I didn't catch some food borne illness during that period...

One of the better pho restaurants in LV. However the service is not good. I asked for meat on the side and the waitress told me that the kitchen is too busy for them to do that. A few minutes later, I see the table right next to have rare meat on the side. Horrible. But I can't grade it too low because the food is good.
Line was long and they are not organized took long for them to serve I've been going here for 4 years they need a bigger restaurant! Food is great but terrible service

My boyfriend introduced me to Pho Saigon 8 when we first started dating.  I was skeptical because I was a die hard Pho So 1 fan.  Obviously when you're loyal to a certain restaurant it's hard when you stray...what if you cheat on your go-to and it isn't as good?  Well, Saigon 8 certainly surprised me.

I only order three things at Vietnamese restaurants: Pho Tai, Com Bo Luc Lac, and egg rolls.  Saigon 8 absolutely knocks it out of the park with all three of these dishes.  

I do slightly prefer Pho So 1's tomato rice with their bo luc lac, but the onions are more prominent in Saigon 8's version.  The fresh coconut juice here is always fresh and delicious too!

I never order anything else on the menu so I can't speak for any other dishes, but the food is always consistently great here and the waiters are friendly as well. 

When this location opened closer to my house I wanted to cry tears of joy. My lazy self never wants to drive more than 5-10 minutes for food...now, I don't have to ever again (for pho at least). YAY!

My husband, my 7 year old daughter, and I wanted to have some pho, and we already knew about Pho So 1 back home, so we decided to try Pho Saigon 8 because of the rave reviews I found on the internet. We arrived around 2:30pm on Monday 12/29/08. It was pretty crowded, but we were seated right away.

We ordered #1 Cha Gio - Vietnamese fried egg rolls $5.45; #11 Pho Tai - large bowl of noodle soup with rare eye round steak $7.50; and #54 Com Ga Nuong hay Thit Nuong - grilled sliced pork, served with vegetables and steamed rice. The food came out right away and everything was really good. We wrapped the fried egg rolls with large lettuce leaves and dipped them in the sweet chili sauce; it was delicious! I added the jalapenos and hot sauce to my pho and it was yummy too! And the sliced pork was great too! We devoured everything! When we were done, we went to the cashier with our table number to pay. The food was great, but the prices were a little higher than most Vietnamese restaurants. Next time, I'd like to try the chicken pho, beef stew, and the Korean BBQ beef ribs.
Best pho place in Vegas in my opinion. Service and food was amazing! I will be coming back here for sure and referring my family and friends.

Came here with my family looking for pho in Vegas, was a fairly pleasant experience. We waited for about 10 minutes (this place seems to get packed real quick) during lunchtime and were seated promptly. Service was good, food came out in an appropriate amount of time. I had the standard pho dac biet, which came out to taste like your everyday bowl of pho right out of Westminster. Since I had the flu, this bowl of goodness was a lifesaver. Nothing amazing, but it will get the job done if you are a Vietnamese family looking for familiar food vacationing in LV.
So happy that this place opened near work. Had Pho Tai today and the soup was hot and tasty. I also had a refreshing coconut on the side. Got a free egg roll today, which is a bonus. Will be back!

This was my first time here at Pho Saigon 8, and apparently they also have a couple of other locations. The place was clean, and the service was very good. I started off with the eggrolls, which were very good, but not greasy. For dinner I had the beef pho. The broth was really good and fresh. I ordered a large pho, and interestingly it came with a good portion of beef, but not so much in noodles. I was still very much full and it definitely hit the spot. I must say this place is one of the better pho places in Vegas, and I'm happy that they have a location in the Southwest side if town. I highly recommend this place

I'm pretty obsessed with the Pho (beef) here. Thai tea is brewed near perfect and the Boba is always an added bonus. 

The broth was clear,  and has a great flavor. I ALWAYS take a few spoons of broth and sip it before adding anything. I even have my kids doing it. You have to be able to taste it for what it is. If the broth can stand the taste test alone, then you known the bowl is worth the cost.  The plate full of basil, bean sprouts, lemon and jalapeños was plentiful, and super fresh. 

My first time there, there was three of us. It was near lightening speed from when they took our pho orders to when the kitchen staff came out and delivered it to our tables. Seriously, I don't think even 3 minutes passed. Yay, for fast service!

The wait staff and cashier are bit lacking,  which is unfortunate. I asked the waiter for to-go bowls and waited far too long. Finally had to ask cashier, when son went to pay.

Our second trip,  the food and drink was just as good as the first time.  However, the lightening speed was gone, and actually felt we waited a longer time than normal. I will say it was packed on Sunday, so I understand.

All in all I love the Pho. I'm obsessed. I think about it all the time. If it weren't for Lent, I would be slurping it down right this very moment instead of writing this review.

Thanks for bringing Pho 8 as an addition to other Vietnamese restaurants to this area. I don't have to go all the way to Chinatown just to eat anymore. I enjoyed every dish I ordered so far. Loved it!

This is the only place I go to eat pho in town, it is so authentic and delicious. Getting great food for such an affordable price in an authentic venue is probably what makes this my favorite pho restaurant.

When you first walk in the feeling I got was to walk out and don't eat here . But we ended up staying. The service is very whatever . I ordered a drink it cane in a styrofoam cup which wasn't what I expected from a sit down restaurant ... We ordered the food  it came pretty quickly . It was ok nothing to write home about..  just so so . Don't see myself coming back to this place . there's plenty of good Vietnamese restaurants on Spring Mountain Road..

Absolutely the worst customer service I have ever had. Actually I wouldn't even call it customer service. From the minute we walked in the atmosphere was unfriendly and uninviting. People that came after us were helped first. They never took our drink order and right before we ordered our food we almost walked out. We should have... Because it only got worse. Once we ordered our food and it arrived we were never asked if everything was ok or if we needed anything else. It looked like all of the employees had a frown on their faces the entire time we were there. Their lucky I paid and I definitely didn't leave a tip which I have never done in my life. The food was descent and with horrible customer service I would NEVER GO BACK. This place needs some customer service training, good luck.
The food is always great and comes out quickly.   Crispy eggrolls and pork vermicelli bowl are some faves.   Service is polite and never pushy.   Great place for a delicious lunch!

when i lived in the area this was my go-to spot

it's better than 8/10 of its neighboring competitors... 

I always went for the spring rolls and the steak pho or the combo pho and it never disappointed.

solid and reliable
The food is the best in town but the services is below par. But you know what they say about asian restaurants. The poorer the services the better the food is.

I've dined in this place at least five times this past month, which should pretty much illustrate how devoted I am to this restaurant. Food is delicious, reasonably priced, and much closer than Chinatown. Above all else, it feels very clean there. My new go-to spot for Viet food - don't go to Annie Pho, Pho 88, or Jenni pho.

Maybe I'm spoiled that I use 2 live 5mins from little saigon in OC. . .
Its always good to go with someone that speaks vietnamese fluently! hehe
We ordered eggrolls, 3 small bowls and 1 large bowl of pho. . .
the noodles didn't seem fresh.  . .but the eggrolls were delicious!
The place was pretty full for lunch.
But to our surprise when we asked for the bill, it came to $40!!!
$40?!?!! r u serious?!?! we were used 2 $4 bowls of pho in OC!
It was worth a try.

First off let me say that I rarely write one star reviews (check my other reviews on different restaurants) but I had to write this because of the HORRIBlE service that we received today! We ordered on the phone and they don't repeat your order back to you but when they get your order wrong, they claim that it's your fault. I am honestly not a difficult customer by any means but this place lacks any sort of customer service. We placed a simple order on the phone and repeated it to the lady multiple times. 

When my bf arrived to pick up the order, the order was wrong. Instead of 59 it was 69 that they gave. The lady said, "this is what you got, what do you want? An add on?" And he was trying to explain that the order was wrong. They started raising their voices at him basically blaming him for their mistake. So they get him the correct order and the order looked half of what is normally served. They clearly were annoyed and didn't care. They're lucky that he already paid and tipped before noticing the error because they did not deserve the tip. 

I completely understand that mistakes can happen but blaming the customer and raising their voices because THEY misunderstood is terrible business ethic. If they simply acknowledged their mistake and corrected it appropriately then all would be fine. This is not how to run a restaurant or any business for that matter. What a shame because I have family, friends, and co-workers that love pho but I would not recommend coming here to any of my friends and family any longer due to the terrible service. I'd recommend going to a different pho place, there's a ton in Vegas anyway.

Unfortunately, I'm not a fan of pho, so I hope this review proves to be useful for those who are like me, and would rather eat something else at Vietnamese restaurants.  This place is closer to me than Chinatown, so that's a plus for me.  My favorite dish is #71, the Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio, a.k.a. grilled sliced pork and fried egg rolls over vermicelli noodles and vegetables.  The pork has great flavor, almost a sweet taste to it, and I love the combination of pieces of pork and eggroll, noodle, and peanuts in one chopstick-ful (as opposed to spoonful).  Delicious and cheap!  

It can get pretty busy during both lunch and dinner, so the service leaves much to be desired during those times.  Also, the parking lot is shared with various other popular establishments, so it can be hard to find a close parking spot during peak times. 

My experience with takeout orders has been positive as well.  The orders are packed well and the time estimates are pretty accurate.

Very very good pho broth! I get the special with everything on it! Their fried rice is good as well however it's on the stickier side . I often order to go, they are very fast! So far best pho broth I've had here in Vegas!

Pho' Saigon 8 is such a pleasantly wonderful surprise for me! My son and his beautiful girlfriend brought me here for lunch over Labor weekend. I have been back 3 more times this week with friends!!

The soups are a rice noodle base with almost unlimited combo's, seriously! (Maybe 50 different combo's!) portion are great, the small is not small and the large could possibly feed a family of 4! Jk

Absolutely love this place!! Get the today!! This is a great, fresh soup meal! You will be full on their soup, yes, on soup!
Best PHO in Vegas.  A must "hangover food"restaurant  or just for a great meal, I've eaten PHO all over Vegas and Los Angeles this place is the best, great flavor , good size meal , fast service.

So this review has been a long time coming. As the Duchess of Pho Saigon 8 I figured it was about time to show some love. I've tried just about every bowl of pho in Vegas and I must say this is probably my second choice (Viet Noodle Bar being the first). Flavorful broth, tender meat, fresh greens, everything goes together so well. Also, we love our waitress too. Ngon (short hair & glasses), she's the best. Super sweet and always takes great care of us. My kids love her, she's one of the reasons why we keep coming back cause some of the other waitresses aren't as good at their job...you'll know who I'm talking about when you go. 

Now back to the food. Your bowl is at your table within minutes of ordering. The Pho here is "Phonomenal" Perfectly flavored broth and very consistent. The noodles aren't soggy or clump together like most places. I suggest #11, #13 or #18 and ask for some hot tea as soon as you sit down. Egg rolls are always fresh & extra crispy. So many tasty rice dishes but the grilled pork chop & Korean BBQ short rib never disappoint. And the coffee, WOW! Get a cup if you need to be up for two days straight, haha!! 

Great food. Service could be better (with the exception of one waitress). I know many ppl are partial to Pho Kim Long down the street. I've been there too many times to think that ppl probably only go there because the of the name. So if you're looking for authentic Vietnamese food, eat here.

Best pho I've ever had! I usually don't like pho because I think it's too bland and most people prepare them in a way that the broth and the meat really smell (I'm sensitive to beef smell especially, if it's not prepared carefully). Anyways, this place is good! I don't remember the name of the pho I got, but it was spicy and had "special" noodles that took them a while to prepare if they have to make a new batch. The pho had a subtle pork flavor broth, and the spicy paste adds the right amount of kick (not too hot where your tongue is in pain). And FYI to those people who love flavor, pho is not meant to be super flavorful like thai boat noodles and such. Think of it as your chicken noodle soup but Vietnamese style. 

I also love the spring rolls, they actually had quality pork, and the egg rolls. The egg rolls came with all the veggies so you can wrap them in it! I've never had that before! It adds that needed veggie crunch to your egg roll.

And what amazes me the most is GOOD SERVICE! lol I'm very impressed! The waiters are polite and they don't give you the look like most Asian restaurant workers give you. Overall, good experience and I'm always down to go there when I'm in town.
Probably the best pho I've ever had and the most hospitable service also! I will recommend this to everyone around.
Great food and service! Came in because it was close to the house and was pleasantly surprised considering there are several pho places in the southwest area.

walked in at 11:42, and was told they were closed. Signage said open till 12:00. I realize people don't want to stay later than they are open, but I asked to order to go, and was still turned away, Oh well, a 10 minute drive to China town it is...
I am local, been there multiple times and never disappointed. The portions are big with lots of meet, service is very good for this type of restaurant. Price is also reasonable. Parking is plentiful.
Been there twice, try their Bun Bo Hue,  the size is small and expensive. poor service. other pho downstreet is even better and cheapper.

This is one of the nicer pho places I've been to in vegas - it's really clean, and there's a peaceful little fountain in the front of the restaurant that prepares you for your zen like pho experience as you enter.  I got the #18, and the soup was pretty darm good.  Not the best I've ever had, but probably one of the better ones I've had, especially in vegas.  It's a bit more beefy and less marrow-y/stinky, and doesn't have as much onion flavor as I would like, but it's still a pretty densely flavored soup.  One strange thing is that they didn't have any fish sauce at the table - we were going to ask for some, but ended up not needing it since the broth was pretty tasty (even though it was stink-less).  The summer rolls are so-so, and kind of on the pricey side, but they do have these really delicious chargrilled pork summer rolls that were REALLY good - they're pretty much pork sausages wrapped with scallion and a crispy egg roll shell with a really tasty satay dipping sauce.  Yum.  As a side note, they don't really give you too many vegetables, but if you ask for another place they'll give you one.  And the basil and bean sprouts were really really fresh, which is always a big plus.

The food is fabulous......always hot, fresh, and super yummy! The service is kind of slow and hard to get refills on drinks but otherwise its great....I don't mind the mediocre service in exchange for delicious food.

If you really like pho and enjoy the atmosphere and quality of a good pho then this is the place to go. The staff is always doing something to better the experience which is great and the service is quick as well probably my favorite place to eat pho within las veg

I come here pretty often when I'm craving pho. Especially a nice big bowl of soupy goodness after a night out on the town. I sometimes take my parents here for lunch or dinner because they love noodles. They always like coming here. It is packed here no matter when I'm here but I barely have to wait. I love that as I know everyone else loves to eat here too but I won't have to sacrifice for that validation.

I've only been here one time, but I didn't have a single issue that a lot of the other reviewers harped about. I was promptly seated and had my order taken. I went with a standard Phó dish, a combination beef bowl, and was thoroughly satisfied with it. The prices, contrary to what some people are saying, were also completely fair... Especially for Vegas. I plan on eating here again!

When I used to live in Vegas this was the only place my family would go for pho. 

4 years after I've moved away and this place is still just as good.
The soup is nice and hot, large bowls, lots of noodles and meat, soft tendons.

Served me cilantro, twice. I was very clear about my allergy to cilantro and could very well have ended up in the ER getting a shot. But because of my husbands good eyes the crisis was avoided. 

Were they apologetic? No. 

Remorseful? No. 

Did they do anything to compensate? Only after pitching a fit was my meal comped. (which by the second send back I told them not to bother making again). Seriously?!? You want to charge me for a meal I sent back twice and did not eat a bite of? Bye!
I have been eating here for the last year. This is a great pho place. They have great service and the pho is delicious. I eat here 3 times a week and i would recommend the number #11.
The best pho and bun cha dish I've ever had. This place best Pho 88, Jenni pho and Pho Kim Long in my book. Fresh food and clean and cozy restaurant. Thumbs up recommended.

One Friday night I made a call to pick up some food. when I arrive there was nobody around when I finally found somebody I guess he was a bust her I let him know I was there for a pick up he didn't even say hello to me didn't smile and when I told him I was there for a pick up he didn't even respond to me he just looked at me with the blank face and then walked away. I wasn't feeling good and I was already upset that I had to wait finally I found another man asked me how can I help you and I told him I have been waiting for my food I let your other employee know but I guess he didn't tell you anything. He apologized and guess what my food was on the table right there for like 10 minutes or longer so I told him I don't know why he wouldn't say anything or if he didn't understand my English maybe he should've asked somebody for help. He then said oh sorry and he said I wasn't wearing a jacket it's cold out and I told him yeah I was just planning to run in and out but I'm here waiting. So I paid for my food and went home when I got home my chicken and noodle plate was cold and I had to re-cook them at least my pho still somewhat hot. I was very annoyed with the service here I don't think I will be back and it's unfortunate because it is very close to my house.

My favorite pho place so far. They do it correctly, you can get tendon and tripe (my measure of authenticity), and they always have plenty of lime and basil. I like the spring rolls, you gotta add Sriracha to the peanut sauce tho. They only have like 3 smoothie flavors but avocado is one of them, so none of the other favors matter, and they also have Thai tea for when you don't want to drink avocado (which is rare). I can't give it 5 stars bc it's not the best *ever* but it's definitely the best I've found in the Henderson area.
This place is FRESH!!! Good prices too! Good vibe & clean!! They gave tendon & tripe too!

Ate here after cruising around Spring Mountain Road for a bit...realized that I came here a few years ago based on some yelp reviews.  Ordered the Bun Cha Gio this time...pretty average meal and not a fan of their Cha Gio.
Great Pho! Actually hot like it's supposed to be (not like other local places where the beef doesn't even cook).

My husband and I are always willing to try new places! 

We were greeted by a guy who sat us right away. Our waitress came by and brought us waters to start. Being first timers, we asked our waitress her favorites on the menu. She was so helpful, nice and patient with us as we decided on our order. Our food came out quick, hot and tasty. Our drinks were refilled in a timely manner and our waitress checked on us a couple times to make sure we were satisfied and liked our food.

The least friendly person in the whole place was the cashier. He didn't say anything to us except to tell us our total. He didn't even offer me my receipt, I had to ask him for it.... probably not a big deal to most people, but I expected the great service until I walked out the door. 

We'll definitely go back to try other things.

If i were still in San Jose then i'd only give 3 stars but considering the Vietnamese population isn't as dense this place is pretty much the only place to get a decent bowl of Pho, 

I give it a 4 because unless a whole shop in San Jose sprouts some wheels and drives down here to set up shop i don't eat Pho anywhere else

Drink a lot of water the MSG is noticeable

I come from the Bay Area in Northern California, so I was surrounded by so many Vietnamese restaurants growing up and I absolutely love the Vietnamese cuisine. So, since I've moved to Vegas, I've been in the search for my regular Vietnamese spot for whenever I'm craving pho or a vermicelli dish. 

Food:
As I tried Pho Saigon, I was a bit disappointed. I ordered the chicken pho and spring rolls. I usually always order size small when I get pho, but Pho Saigon only does size large, which sucks because I ended up wasting half of my soup. Plus, I was really disappointed for spending so much when I didn't eat it all (my cravings were too strong, I needed to buy pho!). Also, the broth was lacking flavor, and trust me, I love my pho so this really was mediocre. Well, moving onto my spring rolls.. the meat was so dry.. thank god I was able to drench each bite into the peanut sauce and sriracha, cos I couldnt just eat it by itself. 

Service:
I called in for a pick up order and the lady was in such a rush! Once I said my order, she quickly said, "okay give me 10 minutes" and hung up. Lol, she didn't give me a price for my order or anything, which made me not even want to go and pick up my order because I actually wanted to make sure I was getting a small size. When I arrived I said I was there for pick up and the lady said the price and it was about $17 for pho and spring rolls, so I know forsure it wasnt a small. I asked how much the price was for a small and that was when she informed me that they do not have small sizes. If I had known that from when I made the order on the phone, I would have said nevermind and didn't order at all because I forsure wouldn't finish that and I didn't want to spend that much on something I wont finish. But because I am not rude, I paid and accepted it anyway. 

Probably gonna try a different Pho joint because this just wasn't what I was expecting from reading all the good reviews.. very disappointed.

It saddens me to give this spot 2 stars since it's been my favorite pho spot for the past 4 years. Last night, half way through I found a bug in my soup! My appetite was ruined and I just wanted to leave. Without making too big a deal I showed the older waitress and she told me it was just an onion, then walked away and had someone else help us and rambled on and on in a different language. The only reason for the 2 stars is the nice girl who helped us after. Won't be coming back. Be better.

Best Pho in Vegas now that the big pho shop at Spring Mountain and Decatur closed.

I usually get chicken pho or the rare flank steak pho - it's kind of fun to get your bowl of pho full of rare beef and watch it finish cooking in the steaming broth.  I find the broth quite flavorful, but I also like to add squirts of lime, splash of rooster sauce, and sprigs of mint to kick it up a bit.  Even a "small" bowl will be plenty for you.  Noodles are plentiful and perfectly cooked.

Service can be a bit sparse, but it's gotten better.  Also, the pho gets to your table FAST - so there's not a lot of coming and going to interrupt your dinner conversation, reading, etc.  Pleasant little dining room.

Love the food, not a big fan of the service and the seating is horrible. Don't know who was the genius that bought the tables and chairs for this place because the table legs aren't wide enough to accommodate 2 chairs to where they fit UNDER the tables! Was just there last night and this lady behind me kept pushing her chair into the back of the chair next to me (which was empty, gf sat across from me)  but my chair ain't going noway because it wont fit UNDER the table, since the legs of the table isn't wide enough for 2 chairs. 

Depending of which server you get, service can be bad or decent, getting the order in can take a little while but the food does come out fast once the order is placed.

#1 is delicious, Vietnamese Fried Egg rolls wrapped in veggies then dipped in fish sauce
#15 is my favorite,  beef noodle soup with meatballs and rare round eye steak .
#66 is also very good, Grilled sliced pork over vermicelli and vegetables

Haven't ventured out of trying anything else............

so we took a shot coming here.. we thought it'd be a sister spot to the saigon 8 on eastern.. and it wasn't.

um, it was ok?  it wasn't as fresh as the one on eastern and a little dingy. the waiter wasn't pleasant and didn't come back at all to see if we needed anything or to refill our waters or drinks.  we had to ask another waiter for refills... so yeah,  we'll never come back

i like this place!  a good pho place is hard to find, and when I get a craving for good pho, this is definitely the spot.    

the variety is awesome, and they offer rice plates as well.  the grilled pork is good.. and the seafood pho is a favorite.  we always get the eggrolls as an appetizer and it comes with fresh lettuce and cilantro to wrap them in. 

the waiters are friendly... and always good about answering my questions and getting our order right.  

i agree with the other reviews that say your practically sitting in your neighbors laps... but its usually packed so it's not a surprise that they try and accommodate a lot of ppl.  but the pho is the best i've had in vegas so far, so when it's pho the fam wants, it's saigon 8 they'll get!

I've read some of the reviews of this restaurant, and cannot believe they were in the same place.  Some mention Chinatown, by the way, and that's not where Pho Saigon 8 is.  It is well west of there.  One reviewer mentioned smelling the fish sauce at the table.  Sorry, they don't have fish sauce at the table unless it comes with the specific food you ordered.  They have srirocca (hot sauce) and hoisin (sweet sauce) at each table.

I don't know how you can complain about service here.  You are given a table, and a waiter quickly comes to take your order.  If you order pho, which I usually do, it takes three to five minutes to arrive.  There are three types of broth for the pho, and all are delicious.

I have been to Pho Saigon 8 scores, perhaps hundreds of times over the years, and never received a poor dish or bad service. I consider it the best pho in town, and it is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  Oh, and I have met several of my favorite Vietnamese professional poker players here.
I am a big Pho fan.  This place is kind of hidden in the back of a shopping complex, but it is worth finding.  The flavor is there and the serving size is pretty good.

Best pho in the city! My favorite is #18
Ive tried lots of others but the broth here is the best!
Order food from here almost weekly. The food is great and the pho is one of the best in town. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I recommend this place.

I've had some bad pho back in the day and this is one of the places that serves bad pho. The blandest tasting broth I've ever had. Limp ass bean sprouts. Withered basil leaves and watered down hoisin sauce. If I were to rate it on service alone I would give it 5 stars cuz the ppl working here are nice but that's all the compliment I can give this place.

Pho was excellent! Tasty broth, fresh mint, bean sprouts, cilantro, jalapeño, limes everything you need to squeeze and tear to yummy up your Pho. Price was reasonable and service was good enough although our waiter had little sense of humor of my jokes sucked. Could have been those EDC gummies from last night ......... but, that's another story. Stop by, I recommend it and that's really all that matters isn't it? Enjoy

Can't really give an accurrate review. Decided to walk here from mandalay bay. We made it but not before we were too hungry and went to Pho Kihn Do on the way. Definitely take a cab if ur on the strip. Chinatown is allot farther than it seems on the map...lol
This place is great! They are quick and the food is good. They are always packed. Great atmosphere and friendly service.

If you love Pho, then this is  the place to get it. I have been to multiple Vietnamese restaurants in Las Vegas and Henderson and this is by far the best location for Pho.

I order the vegetable tofu pho and vegetable spring rolls (my most favorite Vietnamese side item) . The vegetables are always fresh. 

The down side is the customer service. None of the staff smile or seem happy for business, but the GOOD Pho out weighs the slight negative. I always come here when I'm in Henderson.
I would eat here everyday if i could.

If you want some very very very BASIC PHO, come here.

Their pescatarian options are not really pescatarian. They do not carry seafood broth. Their sizes are very small. 

Their beef pho is adequate enough and okay but could be better. They don't use a lot of different beef products. Just flank tendon and etc. 

If you want amaetuer and mediocre pho. This is the place

My family and I have been a customer here for many years. This is one of our favorite Pho restaurants in Las Vegas. The service and food is consistently excellent and very good taste. Today when paying for my food,  an automatic tip was added to the bill. Not a big issue for me as I always tip. But if you're not paying attention, you might not knowingly double tip as they didn't tell us upfront of adding the tip automatically to the bill.

In adding to my quest to try to find the best pho in Vegas I decided to try this place out next. I'll keep it simple for places not up to par.

Tables were dirty with sticky stuff not properly cleaned.

Never got my drink refilled.

Pho broth was way too salty and no beef flavor or pho aroma.

Skimpy on the noodles.

No option of a combo with tripe, tendon, meatballs, and rare beef on the menu.

Soup cooled down immediately when vehgies were added and did not wilt at all.

For having so many employees you would think they have time to properly clean the tables and refill your drinks. Guess not. I will not be returning.

I've ate here a few times. The service gets worse each time. This past trip we noticed the broth had an overload of MSG in the Pho. It's bad when you can notice it! Find a different option for pho, this place is a major bust!!

I love Saigon 8.  One of the best pho spots in Las Vegas!  Don't expect the friendliest service as no pho place ever does, but the staff is pretty pleasant.  Broth and food is flavorful.  Speedy service.  Never been disappointed.  I recommend the crispy spring rolls that you wrap in the lettuce and the Bo Kho(beef stew) with rice noodles.  The spicy bun no hue soup.  Delish!  .. Eat greedy, yours truly -Mizz Loveli

Wifey ordered a soup and waiter brings out wrong soup. Wife says wrong soup" 
Waiter: no it's what you ordered. 
Wife : can I have the other soup 
Waiter: no 
Me:hahahahahahahajaha
Wife :pissed.

This place has really good pho. Their noodles are cooked perfectly and their broth is so tasty. Price is very affordable, service is friendly, and parking is convenient. One of the most authentic pho places I've ever been to.

Dropped in for late night dinner after a workout at Planet Fitness conveniently across the street. I can't find anything bad with the place so it must be good? It's open till midnight, it is easy to get to and park, the setting is chill, the service is friendly, food came out timely and was good, $11 for a rice dish with pork which is ok. I got fried rice with pork & egg which was pretty tasty. They also brought out an extra egg roll which was a nice touch. I definitely will drop in here again!
My favorite pho place in Vegas ! I got the #16  (rare eye round, flank, and brisket) and the BBQ pork rolls. They were both really good and the service was awesome!

Ok, we just moved here from San Diego, and we had not found any good Pho resturaunts for at least 6 months. I was famished (btw I am 5 months prego) and I was craving Pho, lo and behold near Chinatown, this was the Oasis of Pho. I tried #18, and the broth was heavenly. I went here 2 more times by myself and got the same thing, it was around 10 am on a weekday when I had these heavenly encounters. The service was impeccable. Then on a Saturday morning I decided to share this with my family, and the service was very slow, and the tendons were not added in the soup. Also, I tried the fresh rolls for the 1st time, and they were too sticky, the rice paper was too moist!
So... the reason for my 4 stras: Try not to go here during busy times..other than that, this place and the soup is awesome!

Definitely one of the better pho spots I have hit up in Vegas. The bowl came out boiling hot and the large size was piled on with noodles and meat. The vegetables were fresh and crisp. I also tried the eggrolls and though they came with a batch of very fresh and tasty vegetables as well, they were pretty small. I would say just stick to the pho here.

So far from my experience at several pho restaurants in Vegas, I would recommend this place first to any friends visiting.

Juicy Pho off the strip

This place is pretty good for Vegas Pho. Vegas Pho is not the same as SGV Pho. 

Ordered the pork chop rice. It wasn't that good and the amount of pork chop there was very small.

Ate some of  my friend's korean bbq ribs, it was pretty good. 

Ate some of my friend's Pho, it was decent. 

What was really good was the Egg Roll wrapped with lettuce. It was delicious!!!!

Kinda far from the strip, was driving at least 10-15 mins to get here.

This place is a few miles from the Las Vegas Strip... but well worth the drive.  They are very clean and serve some of the best Vietnamese Food I've had!  I recommend trying their #12 Pho, which includes tripe and beef flanks.  

I find it funny that they are called Pho Saigon 8 and my the meal I ordered was $8.00!  

Get here either early or late just not during regular dining times, since parking is limited.
Came here with a few of my co workers, we had a good meal. The prices are great and the food portions are decent. I would definitely come here again. Especially when it's so close to work :P

Probably one of the decent places to get Pho at in Vegas.  I used to live in Cali so I am spoiled over there with Pho.  Pricing for Pho here is pretty high, but worth it to get a bowl after a night out in a club.  The portion is very well and the quantity of meat in the bowl are plenty.  Broth is always warm and offer amenities/condiments with a bowl.  Place is okay clean.  Place gets busy on the weekends, but service is still quick.  

Parking is easy, lot parking.

Went to this place twice. Had pho twice. It was ok twice. 
The servers are, how should I say, special? The broth isn't the best I ever had. Meh.
This is a great place for noodles everything is fresh and prepared well. Everyone I've brought here really enjoyed the food  and the prices are good.

Definitely my favorite place to get Vietnamese food. 

Some other places offer great pho, but not much else after that. Other places offer not so great pho, while offering other great Vietnamese dishes. This place offers both. 

The pho especially has great broth, which is served piping hot. And the portions are pretty decent for the prices. The restaurant itself is pretty clean as well, something you might not find at other establishments. 

Service is a hit or a miss for me though. 80% of the time service is better than most other establishments. The other 20% isn't bad service, just mediocre. They're pretty fast and attentive, but few speak English. 

Don't forget o get Vietnamese coffee when you go. =p

Ate lunch here and the food was excellent. 

The service was very lax and non professional. The waitresses were just sitting in the dining room chatting, the kitchen staff were outside smoking. The only person working was the waiter who was an older man. 

The food was really good and arrived to the table fast. I would recommend coming here if you don't mind being niglected after you get your food.
Food was okay... rice was undercooked... service was okay, not the best.  Wouldn't be my first choice.

First time that I went here, it was fine. I wasn't feeling well and couldn't taste no difference in the Pho. I was just happy that we were getting Pho and I think this was one of the places that pop up while we were trying to Yelp close by places for Vietnamese food. Everybody was hungover so we all got Pho. It's only 50 cents more for a large size I believe. 

The next time that I was in Vegas, we went here again because we were lazy to look into other Vietnamese places and I got a different type of Pho which was fine, but service was lacking that day. I think they got kind of annoyed that we wanted to split checks, but the next couple days we got food here again which I will avoid coming back after his trip because I used the bathroom and there was a cockroach laying there dead which made me question if there's any in the kitchen. 

Food is decent, you have a lot of your traditional Vietnamese dish here, even the Vietnamese coffee is made the traditional way with it dripping. But I would question the cleanliness of this place. Thanks for all the food you have provided, but I'll be moving on next time I'm back in Vegas.
My fav vietnamese restaurant in the southwest. The food is fresh and delicious. Worth every penny.
Food is good but SERVICE SUCKS. They forget to put in our order. Waited a long time and charges us 18% gratuity. I don't mind paying it but damn why should I tip for SUCH A HORRIBLE SERVICE.

This is the second closest Vietnamese restaurant to my locale, and is pretty much the only one I frequent if I'm close to home.

Good food, quick prep, normal service.  Vietnamese places aren't renowned for stellar customer service, guys - it's nothing personal.  =P

They recently raised the prices so don't use the online menu if placing a to-go order... Grab one inside on the counter.  That's what I did.

Their Thai tea is pretty darn good, surprisingly.  Sadly, no sauces included with noodle bowls... that's why I keep sriracha and hoisin at home.

#71 with a fried egg = nomz.
Pho Saigon is great, me and all my gfs go there all the time. David is the best and he always tries to make us have a great experience he is really funny and they give the best service!

I've only had the Pho, but it's delicious. The soup base is amazing. The avocado and jackfruit smoothies are also very good! On top of that, customer service is phenomenal especially the boss lady who owns the restaurant. She's super friendly and makes every feel welcome.

Me & my girlfriend as well as my 1yr old son love this place. Clear deep broth tells me the stock was cared after unlike a cloudy dirty looking one. Anyhow I get the 18 with all the goodies..........finish with fresh thai basil, lime & a little siracha...whats not to love.
Excellent! So happy this location finally opened. The food was great and we loved the soft jazz music in the background. Peter was very attentive and friendly. We'll be back soon!

Pretty decent spot. I have been to a ton of pho spots in Vegas, and this one has some of the best pho broth. Quality of the ingredients is above average. The pho bowls here are a bit smaller then other places, and seem to have smaller portion sizes, however they are much more generous with the meat compared to other places. Also wanted to add, food was served crazy fast.

Honestly my only complaint is the staff where not very attentive and kind of ignored us. 

Besides that, nice spot.

My family always find Vietnamese food very homey & healthy (for the most part). We enjoy the nice hot tea while we wait for our food. The fried spring rolls are really great. 9/10 the vegetables are super fresh & the rolls always come out hot and crispy. We think the pho is really tasty. The last night we had pho the brisket was so perfect & flavorful. My 8 year old splits a bowl with me and we order a side of the amazing grilled pork! The flavor of the pork is out of this world...a little Smokey & sweet. Super yummy! The staff are all very friendly! We come here often due to it being a very clean restaurant.

3.5 stars

Solid pho & pretty tasty egg rolls. Besides the slightly high price for Vietnamese food, I think this place is the best in place in the Henderson area. Like all Vietnamese places, the service is fast and the waiters don't speak English. So, you can always order by the numbers next to the food item. Even though it's not the best pho I've had, I still come here regularly because of its location and good quality. Oh yeah, their fried rice is actually good too, give it a shot!

This is becoming one of my favorite vietnamese restaurants. I don't have to drive all the way to Spring Mountain and it's near my house. It is located in the plaza accross the street from Walmart on 215/Rainbow. 2 of my friends kept telling me to try this restaurant and I am sooo glad I finally did. It looks like the have 3 other locations in town.
My favorite items to get from here are the vegetable spring rolls-fresh and sooo delicious and veggie pho with beef broth (and no I am not a vegetarian). Each time I have gone here, it's packed with people, but you don't have to wait too long to be seated. I can't wait to try other dishes on their menu.

I have been eating pho for 25 years, not bad for a white guy, and have tried almost all the pho stops in Vegas and this one is the best.  My grad school advisor who is from China loved it even.  Their prices are no different than other places around the country.  I laugh when people say their grandmother's is better.  Well my grandmother's lefse was the best to me but maybe not to you.

The only Pho restaurant my boyfriend and I have been going to for years. The only bad part are the rude servers. I guess that is what most Asian restaurants seem to be. Service needs to change, the food is still great every time.

I usually get the Vermicelli with chicken or pork. It gives you that garlic taste for a while, so bring gum! It's pretty good, average. For an appetizer, the Spring Rolls are crispy and hot with the lettuce on the side. I like to dip it in their fish/vinegar sauce.The Pho with everything in it, including Tripe is just right! You can never go wrong with that. Broth is flavorful. I love Pho!

I ordered #16 Pho and an order of tofu spring rolls to go. Everything was packaged very nicely and tasted absolutely delicious. I ordered the large thinking I was somehow going to finish it on my own, but I was wrong the servings are huge and now I have delicious leftovers. I loved the crispy tofu inside the spring rolls with the peanut sauce. The broth from the pho was outstanding. I will definitely be coming back here.

There are many-a pho restaurants that seem to be on every corner of Eastern and the 215.  My friend had heard that this was a decent spot for a bowl of pho and upon arrival I was happy to note that it was not too crowded.  Once we were seated, we ordered 2 small bowls... I can't recall the number, but it was with the rare flank steak.

The bowls came out quickly and I requested some nuoc mam sauce and lettuce to put in my soup.  Our server brought back the sauce, but not the lettuce.  I guess it's my fault for not calling him back to the table... The taste of the soup was good.  Not the best pho I have ever eaten, but decent.

The restaurant began to fill up for the lunch rush while we were eating, so I guess we got there just in time.  Our check was dropped off at the table without a word and since we had never been there we weren't really sure if we should go up to the register or wait.  We opted to walk up to the front, which seemed to be the right decision.  I then saw a sign that said Debit/Credit transactions must be over $10 and my soup was only around $7.  I expressed my concern and the lady and the register gruffly told me that I would have to add a tip... which of course I was intending on doing, but the tone and demeanor in which she said it was kind of off.  I'm not sure if I will return because I want to try out some other pho restaurants on that side of town.

Food: 
spring roll-okay
ice coffee- good

family member had the pho they said it was salty
GF had the bun bo hue - was good

Service: simple

Wait: no wait

First let me start by saying that I had read a few reviews before trying Pho Saigon 8 and most of the reviews were regarding how horrible the service was. We actually did not have bad service. They were fast, friendly and ready to go with our to go orders. 

Now for the food. It was just horrible. We ordered:

67. Bun Ga Nuong 7.45
Grilled chicken over vermicelli and vegetables

74. Bun Cha Ha Hoi 7.95
"Ha Noi" style grilled sliced pork & pork meatballs served with vermicelli and vegetables

54. Com Ga Nuong hay Thit Nuong 7.45
Grilled chicken served with steamed rice & vegetables

47. Hu Tieu hay Mi Bo Kho - Small
Noodles with beef stew (egg noodles)

The noodles were freezing, the chicken had no flavor and was really dry and the beef stew was so oily and salty that we couldn't get past the look or smell. It was the worst food and such a waste of money. We will not be going back.

I ordered a small pho with veggies and shrimps. They gave me  only 3 shrimps and the noodles was already shredded! The caused of shredded noodles was if cooked too long. Also, I placed 1 ordered of spring rolls. When I grabbed the spring roll, it was super cold. Obviously, it wasn't made fresh or right there being made. Seems like it was just taken out the fridge. I'm a Lao girl and that's not how they should serve food like that and am not happy at all! It's a bit pricey and I didn't give them tips at all! I'm not coming back.
