Very kid friendly and excellent service!! They have scissors, spoons, forks, extra napkins all ready for you so you don't have to ask 5x. The best kid friendly place I've been! Food is delicious as well. We recommend the Thai tea!

Food on the strip tends to be cheap and disgusting or super expensive and delicious.  Since we didn't want to spend an arm and a leg for every meal, we tried this place.  Just a mile down from the strip where all the asia restaurants seem to be, this place was humble in decor, which was a good sign.  However, it was not too packed on a Friday night, not a great sign.  I ordered the Wonton noodle soup and the broth was good but it didn't taste like it went through many hours of meat, bone, and marrow stewing.  The meat within the wonton tasted like it was previously frozen and it didn't have a great balance of meat and veg.  I ordered Thai Ice Tea with Boba and the Boba were super gummy, which meant they had been sitting in syrup for a while.  

Overall, better than McDonalds but not the best Pho place.

Woke up that morning feeling extremely sick. I tried taking a hot shower but it only helped so much. It felt as if someone was sitting on my chest and I couldn't breath. My boyfriend said he was going to take me to china town for pho. The miracle cure for sickness. I surely didn't believe him. 

Walking in I was amazed by the aroma of the building which was beefy goodness. 

Being seated immediately we were given menus but every single pho item looked too similar. How the heck was I supposed to make a decision?! When the waiter came I took trust in his experience and asked if he would order for me and I let him know I was ill. He looked my boyfriend and I up and down and said two #16. One small for you, one large for you. We laughed and said we would also order a side of egg rolls for an app. 

The egg rolls appeared within minutes. When we entered the place was half full and now we noticed the place was packed. Great sign! The egg rolls were in a translucent wrapper and you could see the shrimp and veggies. It was very meaty and fresh and was accompanied by a peanut sauce that looked like gravy. I mixed the red pepper sauce with the peanut sauce to get a spicy salty sauce for the egg roll. Yum!

Next the pho came and my boyfriend immediately said he could have gone with a small bowl. I was a little reluctant as I am picky when sick and the fresh fish that it came with was weird. I'm not used to getting a dish with bean sprouts, fresh herbs and jalapeños with my soups. Alas I trust my boyfriend and dug in. My pho first off was only 8.60 had tons of brisket in it (and another meat I cannot remember) noodles, and onions. My favorite. The broth was the best broth I've ever had in my life and I've had tons! Speaking from experience was I ate only broth for 4 weeks after my tonsils and muscle lining underwent removal. The broth was beefy, flavorful and had depth. There was an enormous amount of meat. Every sook full had meat and onions. The fresh herbs when added kicked up the flavor. After finishing about 1/4th of my bowl my lungs expanded. No joke instantly I felt relieve.. I could breath! Next I could breath through my nose as well. My fatty self couldn't stop and I ate the entire bowl.. Feeling completely better. I was amazed. So amazed I asked to have another bowl of it to go for work tomorrow in case tomorrow morning i woke up sick. 

This is gonna be my go to place when I'm ill.
Why the heck did i try this place again? ... Horrible walked out service just awful didn't even order.

Pho Saigon 8 is a solid place to get pho and they have multiple locations s in the Henderson area. 

Came with my family and we all ordered a large #18 pho which comes with rare eye steak, flank, brisket, tendon, and tripe. It was delicious and definitely a good portion of meat and noodles. A solid 4/5.

We also ordered a small bo of bun bo hue - a spicy beef noodle soup which came with a thicker noodle. Wasn't a huge fan of the broth, almost felt a bit watered down spice wise compared to what I've had at other places. For the small bowl for $9.45, I'll probably skip this for next time. 

Other than that, service was good and they gave generous portion of bean sprouts, basil, jalapeños and limes for the pho.

Tried several pho places in Vegas so far and this by far has been the best that we've had near Vegas.  Pho #21 and #24. Even better than some we've had in SF.  Soup was very flavorful and the meat was especially so.  My wife also really  enjoyed the plum drink as well, very good and soothing for dry Vegas weather.

Great food and prices!!! 
Have had several dishes and every one has been outstanding, not only the best pho but some of the best Asian food in Vegas.
And great easy to get to location right off the highway.

Food tonight was not good --- bean sprouts brown, lettuce in wraps was brown also.  The lean meat soup was good.  The service in the restaurant has never been stellar but tonight the service was the topic of our conversation- we had to stand up to get someone to come to our table for a fork- water was never refilled and when we were ready to leave I wanted a to go box and not one person would come to the table. We just decided to leave. When I went to pay the check it was more $$ than I expected and because English is not that well spoken I asked for the receipt. To my surprise they charged a 15% tip--- for a party of 5!!!! It wouldn't have been questioned if the service was good!!!   Won't be back and I will for sure tell everyone I know!

Greatly disappointed previously, but thought we'd give it another try...and still was unsatisfied. My wife and I enjoy visiting different restaurants on our days off and sadly, Pho Saigon 8 has continued to disappoint. Latest meal was an appetizer of Banh Xeo followed by Korean ribs for her and a small bowl of Pho Tai for myself. The Pho Tai arrived first, then her ribs...after we'd gotten about half way thru our meals (I figured the appetizer had been forgotten), the Banh Xeo was brought to the table.
 
The Korean ribs were not bad, but were nothing special. The ribs were served with rice and kimchee..the kimchee was kinda bland, almost sweet, not red pepper spicy as you'd expect.
 
My Pho was not so good...altho a small bowl, there was not enough broth in the bowl..which was probably a good thing as it tasted like dishwater. 

The Banh Xeo...my past experiences in other Vietnamese restaurants had the shrimp, pork, bean sprouts and scallions included in the frying of the batter.  The Banh Xeo served at Pho Saigon 8 had the batter wrapped around the cold ingredients (the shrimp, bean sprouts and sliced pork) much like a burrito. Very disappointed as it was quite a mess trying to prepare and eat it. And the fish sauce certainly was weak as if it had been watered down. 

We drank water and paid over $30 for this evening. 

None of the people working there are Vietnamese anymore, I'd expect they are Chinese and just don't have the Vietnamese style that once made this a favorite place to eat. We were there at dinner time, 6pm, and it was pretty much empty. 

If you want good Pho, go up the street to the 168 Market and find Pho Sing Sing in the shopping center. An excellent place to eat good Vietnamese food by a Vietnamese family!

Excellent pho! Would definitely go back for the food, although the Thai tea was terrible. And can't really say much about the service. I would like to think it's maybe the language barrier or maybe the culture, but I've experienced excellent service at other vietnamese restaurants so I am not sure. But I would probably just have to prepare to ask for EVERYTHING I needed from my server before I never see him or her again. Thought it might've been an off night, but it does seem like everyone complains about the service.

When in Vegas for too long,  I get tired of smelling second hand smoke and seeing all the drunkards.  It is refreshing for me to get off the strip for awhile. This pho restaurant is a bit far but worth the drive. It is a big place so no need to wait for a table. Very clean and many severs for quick service. The soup broth is very good, not full of msg. It does not make you thirsty for days after consumption.  I get the small Pho and it is more than enough for me. I have never finished a bowl of pho before. 

Egg rolls are also good. Crispy hot and meaty filling with lots of lettuce and mint for wrapping. My favorite!

Potent Vietnamese ice coffee will revive you for another night of debauchery.
One of my favorite places to eat! Consistently has great tasting Pho. I get the chicken soup with egg noodles which is loaded with flavor. Must try this location!
I eat here several times a week.  Their service is great and their food is fantastic.  The restaurant is clean. I recommend everyone to at least try it once and you eill not be disappointed.

I came here with a large group of friends for lunch and I was very happy. There is a parking lot and the restaurant is clean and easy. I ordered the meat and tendon pho and they do not skimp at all. The prices are very good and the service was great. I suggest coming by here if given the chance. The food is pretty good.

My favorites are the fried spring rolls, Pho soup, Won ton soup with egg noodles, clean and fast service. 

There are 2 downfalls which is they don't have very good vermicelli noodle bowl and no Vietnamese BBQ! 

I still rate it high for my favos!

A bowl of noodles as filling and satisfying as a Thanksgiving dinner!

After spending 12 years living in Southeast Asia there is one simple meal that I miss most, a simple bowl of noodles.

Pho Saigon 8 will be my local bowl for authentic Asian noodle soup. Their noodle soups are spot on.

I had the Pho Tai Chin, rare and well cooked beef noodle soup. There are two size options, small or large for .50 cents more. The large double the size of the small and is helmet sized steaming bowl of satisfying noodle goodness. 
Before the soup arrives the server delivers the vegetable condiments that you can use to customize your bowl, don't be shy, add them all, the flavors and freshness they add lifts the noodles to a heavenly level. Also, don't forget to spice things up with a healthy squirt of Sriracha and a salty dose of hoisin sauce. There is also a wickedly delightful bowl of chili garlic sauce that adds a solid hit of heat, garlic and a touch of sour.
The rare thin sliced beef sirloin rests on top of the perfectly cooked rice noodles. Once you stir the beef into the bowl, the rare beef becomes medium well in the steaming hot broth, tender, fresh - scrumptious.
The depth of flavors is uber stimulating to the palate and the sheer volume of food is tummy satisfying. You may need a nap if you finish the whole bowl!

My wife enjoyed the Hu tieu hay Mi Dac Biet (pork soup with seafood with egg noodles). She agreed, a fantastic, tasty, satisfying bowl of noodles. The egg noodles are thin and curly. She commented that the squid was fresh and cooked perfectly.

For an authentic taste of Southeast Asia, Pho Saigon 8 can't be beat.

Their menu is extensive and includes many other non-noodle dishes that we will certainly be returning to try. We just couldn't handle anything else on top of our hot tub sized bowl of noodles!

Aloha!

There service here is so very hit or miss, most of the time they ignore you and other times your food is served seconds after being seated. The place is fairly clean but the food is awful, the pho is nothing but MSG.

Pho Saigon 8 is alright. It's not bad but not amazing. It's right there dab in the middle It's like your usual pho place. It's located near 215 and S. Eastern near LVAC. Of the 3 or 4 other pho places in the area it's maybe my #2 or 3.  It shares the parking with a few businesses and it gets pretty busy during lunch so sometimes there aren't any parking right in front and you might have to park farther. Also getting in and out might take long.

When I come here I usually get the pho with everything except the meatballs and tripe, just not a fan of it. I think it's the #21 on the menu rare eye round steak, flank, brisket, soft tendon, skirt flank. All of that with the various veggie ingredients and sauces makes a good meal very tasty.

Services is usually good. It's cluttered near the entrance. Seat a good numbers of people. There's a sign that says $10 minimum for credit charges but noticed that they aren't always strict about that policy. 

I don't always like eating here cause sometimes it doesn't feel so clean.

first time at this location in a while but the food is alright but used to be WAY BETTER. first off the fat lady at the cashier that looks like a bouncer didn't refund my fathers food because it tasted weird. she was rude and had no uniform & she looked like she was from dirt ghetto Vietnam. She probably eats all the food in the kitchen. Hope she reading this cause I'll brawl out with you any day and choke you with pho broth. and what pissed me off the most was how they only gave me one fuckin piece of chicken when there should of been 2 pieces. If I see that bitch again ima punch the weight outta her
I usually come to this location since they recently opened next to my favorite foot spa, Pure Foot & Spa on 215 rainbow. This location is small and offers a variety of items on the menu.

I ordered pho that says seafood. My food came out with pork blood. I don't eat pork blood. I told the server to just put away, She rudely replied "just removed the blood!" and walked away. The server said that you ordered it and you pay for it. I didn't ask them not to charge me but just take away. She even argued saying " i told you that is not good, #40 is better" which is a lie. These kinds of people has no right to be in this business! Very very bad service, notjing doecial with food.

Pretty much one of the best pho I've ever had. The place is clean, good service and the food came out fast. Pho was very tasty, the beef quality is better than most places and the soup was very on point. They got one star taken out because I ordered the large and was more like between the size of regular and large. 
Price is also slightly higher than most places.

Never come here again.. Tried 3 fucking times already but no use. The young waitress in the front was a big ass attitude. I usually don't write a review on yelp but I had to this time. They don't clean their stuffs so becareful people.
Pretty average. I picked up on a Sunday evening. Had one of the beef Pho. It wasn't bad but I've certainly had better. Not a lot of flavor

Dude, anything with soup/broth, noodles, and filling is always good! Ive tried several pho dishes and their spring rolls.  I'm always full with the pho.  How do they slice beef so thin?  The pho broth is everything. It ties it all in.  Pho is a PIA to make if you don't have a pressure cooker.  I can appreciate the variety and toppings of pho. I literally can eat pho everynight.  I think when winter rolls around and the next time I catch a cold, I'll see if pho can be a good alternative for chicken soup.  I've been here several times already (yet I forget to check in!!!!) and will be back again when I'm itching for some Vietnamese goodness!

I've been here a couple of times. My thoughts:

My boss introduced me to this place and I thought it was okay. No complaints whatsoever but didn't think it was that great either but I thought I would go back again...but that was then. 

This is now...A friend from Reno moved to LV to study and she said she misses her pho back home so I said I'll take her to a good place so I took her here. She ordered exactly what she would order in Reno but boy was she disappointed when she tried her order. I didn't really know what the difference was compared to what she was used to but I guess it was really that bad since after having only 3 spoonfuls, she gave up to the point that she decided she didn't want to finish her food. I felt embarrassed because on our way there, I was prepping her to look forward to some awesome pho but the only thing that she had was disappointment.

I tried something new here. Some kind of crab soup. It was NOT good. I ended up not eating it. 

The second time I just got the pho. It was MEH. Nothing about it stuck out in my  mind. 
We came with a group of people. Two seconds after we sat down they asked Do you know what you want? Ummm, no not yet. Not more than a minute later two other servers asked us if we were ready... Ummm, could we have a little more time please?? Then when we were finally ready, we had to flag someone down. Not great customer service. They also put auto gratuity on our bill and didn't tell us so they ended up getting a double grat for not great service. 
I won't be back.

It's been a while to get pho, so I went to Sigon8 with Jieun.
I didn't notice noddle portion was cut down, but bean sprout and other herb portin was cut down and they serve lemon instead of lime(I guess they have some reason).
Maybe the season matter with vegetable.....not sure.
Broth was OK as usual(I mean everybody knows every place put MSG in the broth anyway) 
I didn't try spring roll and best vietnamese coffee(my favorite) this time so maybe next time ...
I've been here a few times and it never fails me.  Their pho is seriously delicious and it's near my house!  I always order beef meatballs and fresh spring rolls with peanut butter sauce.  YUM!

First time to this location.  I was very impressed.  Its very new and super clean.  Hope it stays that way.  Food was very good and seemed a bit bigger than other locations which I am definitely not complaining about.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Definitely helps that its closer to my place.  Now we don't have to drive to Chinatown to find a decent pho place.
Excellent Customer service worth 5 star. Pho was delicious.  The calamari was greatly seasoned and perfectly cooked. The place was clean ^-^ worth coming back! !

Never again!
I was so sad to see my regular go to pho restaurant was closed today and we chose this dump out of all the other places to choose from. 
First off let me start with trying to get seated.... One guy says follow me, we start following him, then a lady stops us and says how many? Um 2..... She then tells the guy we were following and he waves come this way again. And as she turned her head she whipped my fave with her ponytail! Wtf???
We sit down and get water. We ordered hot tea and we got our appetizer before the tea. The spring rolls were not only disgustingly gross and Not fresh but the shrimp were not even cleaned! Disgusting!!!!! We got our pho and I asked to order some eggrolls since the spring rolls were nasty! Needless to say I never got my eggrolls because they never put my order in. I ended up paying $30 for the most disgusting Vietnamese food I've ever had! And our table was dirty! Sticky and dirty! The place even felt dirty! 
Do NOT go to this place, unless you like dirty shrimp, old wilted lettuce, horrible service and like dirty dining! This place should be on news for their Dirty Dining segment.... What Channel is that? I should call them!

This place was delicious! After flying all day we ordered take out and brought this back to our suite. We ordered a seafood and chicken pho both with yellow egg noodles. 

Portions were filling, broth was tasty. Only complaint was the containers they put them in. We both ordered the large portions and struggled mixing the meat and veggies without spilling it on the table.

Great pho. 
Definitely better than the rest of the pho places I have tried in Vegas, and I have been to all the Vietnamese restaurants on spring mountain rd. ( china town area). 

Definitely recommend.
One of the best viet restaurants in vegas. Reasonable prices, good service. I used to go here maybe twice a week when i lived in vegas.

I've been going here for years, and it has been great. The soup comes out fast, and it comes out good. What more could someone ask for? I normally order the tendon, and they do not disappoint. Along with the rice dish of chicken, that is one of the best on the menu in my opinion. Down a star though because service could be a bit faster when getting order to send to the kitchen.

Pho Saigon 8 is my favorite Pho shop in town. I order the same thing every time I go so my review doesn't encompass the restaurant as a whole but for a solid experience please feel free to follow my lead.

Upon walking in you will typically be greeted with "How many?" After they are informed of the number in your party they will typically point across the room to your table. Service is routinely cold but efficient,everything is quick, if you are not clearly asian and you order pho' expect a condescending fork to be dropped at your table.

I usually order the spring rolls and a large pho tai which is rare beef. About 1/5 of the time you will get a bowl that is lukewarm or a bowl that has sat for 1min too long making your rare beef well done by the time it arrives at your table. Its just a necessary evil of dining here. The spring rolls are light and fresh tasting made up of shrimp, noodles, herbs and served with a hoisin sauce. The Pho Tai typically has a great salty broth perfected with some siracha, jalapenos, sprouts and lime. If you want a great filling $8 meal just order the pho and you should be good to go!

My two boys love this place. We always order the pho, Thai tea, and egg rolls. The service is fast, but not very friendly. It's a small restaurant with tight seating, a bit uncomfortable. The soup isn't usually hot enough to my liking, but temp is good for the kids. I hate the fact that they never bring you an itemize check, so you have to trust them. Mmmm...I don't think so! The floor is a bit slippery so don't wear your cute heels you might eat it. Also they don't have fountain soda, only cans (just saying). All in all decent restaurant, close to home, fast unfriendly service, tight seating (you might even make a new friend, not by choice), food is consistant, don't order soda (can) or drink the water (gross), have them give you and itemize check or repeat back your order when paying, if the soup isn't hot enough send it back, and wear shoes with grips so you won't fall on your ass. ENJOY! :)

The pho and broth was exceptional and recommend number 18 for meat lovers. 

Disappointment was with the spring rolls and service, however the pho made up for all of that.

Pho phanatic here... Hands down the best pho we've eaten in Vegas (so far). We've tried many different places but nothing beats the broth here. It's the beefiest broth we've ever had. Perfect amount of noodle to meat to broth ratio. Seasoning and spices are on point. And good size portion for the price you pay. We visit Vegas at least once a year and always come back to this restaurant (and this specific location).

this place is absolutely horrible. the waiters are incompetent and clueless about anything that's going on. if you go in with a party of people most of them will finish before the others food come out. in the end, this place is TRASHHHHHHHH. dont come here peeps
This is the best pho I've had in Vegas. Hands down. Will be coming back next time. The beef rice plate is also good

It was a decent breakfast. I had the hu tieu mi dac biet. And it tasted great. Excellent broth. I drank more liquid than eat noodles or meat. Big bowl too. I didn't finish all of it since it too big for my stomach.
This place is has the best PHO in Henderson. Definitely a regular

In the spirit of Don King, I'll have to put up two heavyweight contenders:

Pho Saigon 8 "I 8 pho" vs. Pho So 1 "yea so, we #1" 

This is a lot like Ken vs. Ryu (Street Fighter!)... if you don't know what the hell I'm talking about, than you missed out on an era of video games, and my set-up for the review was wasted because than I can't explain it to you terms of Kens flaming dragon punch vs. Ryu's flaming fireball. If you do know Street Fighter, than you'd know that I'm trying to say is that I think both restaurants are almost comparable to each other.

This is how I see how each breaks down - I order "Pho Tai Nam Gau Gan Sach hay Pho Dac Biet":

Pho So 1 - 
PRO'S:
. This is typically the place I normally go to when I'm hungover like I normally am in Vegas. Pho does a body good after drinks.
. It's clean, it's nicer looking than most Pho restaurants, and it's usually packed...most often with some hotties.
. They have an extensive menu
. huge parking lot
. Catch up on finding a real estate agent because they advertise in the menu.
. Meat quality is better than most LA Pho restaurants I've been too.
CON'S:
. Mediocre pho broth. Can sometimes taste like beef broth in a can. The 99.8% fat free kind. Come on! Fat is flavor!
. Service??
. Get distracted by look'n at the menu cuz a bunch of real agents advertise in the menu.

Pho Saigon 8
PRO'S
. Pho broth is slightly better than So #1
. Won numerous awards in several publications for best Pho/Vietnamese restaurant.
. My friend "Double D" says this is her favorite place, and she's a local.
. Meat quality is better than most LA Pho restaurants.
. The #8 is a goodluck number to Asians. Esp, Asians who gamble.
CON'S
. Smaller parking lot
. The day we went they forgot about our drink order.
. Older and less appealing interior
. $7 freak'n dollars for a LARGE bowl which isn't any bigger than So #1's large bowl of Pho. In fact, I think it's slightly smaller.
. My boba in my Thai Ice tea was like rubber pellets.
. It's located further west on Spring Mountain than So #1

It's almost a toss up, but I'd have to give it up to Pho So #1 mainly because it's more convenient, and it's a slightly better value than #8 regardless of taste.

You know... I've tried a lot of Pho restaurants in Vegas but none of them has really blown me away. Much like this place... it was okay... got my fix and that was that. 

They really maximized their space though, I felt like I was eating with a group of 50. Mediocre service, price, quality... abundance of parking.

The spicy pork noodle soup was amazing here.  They were very generous with the sliced pork and the pork blood was fresh and silky, which is usually so hard to find since places always overcook it =T  The slice of pork leg was cooked perfectly, it wasn't too soft and it wasn't too chewy.  It had just the right amount of give...mmmmmm I can't believe how many good Vietnamese places are in Vegas =d

Stopped by this pho restaurant before driving home. We were seated right away and the food was amazing. Reminded me of the pho and Asian food back home! I recommend anyone that's craving asian food to try this place out!

I'd have to say Pho Saigon's broth is the best flavored pho in the southwest. We'll definitely be returning here during the days we don't feel like cooking or when we just need that bowl of quick pho fix. 

My husband ordered a large pho tai nam, and I ordered the small #20. The bowls had tons of meat. I feel like I usually don't have enough meat to noodle ratio at other places. We also ordered the Chinese sausage fried rice for the kids. That was really delicious, all of my kids approve!! 

One star off because a few of the utensils they gave us were dirty. They had residual smear marks on the soup spoons and regular silver spoon. Also, when we asked for a box to take our left over fried rice, the guy was looking another direction while handing the box to my husband. It was kind of funny, but since he wasn't paying attention, he almost hit my husband in the face with the box hahaha. My husband was so annoyed but I thought it was funny. Please just pay attention to who or where you're handing something to.
Very good service... excellent food... very clean environment...not expensive... large menu to choose from... beer and wine available... and dessert

So happy about this new SW side location, the best Pho in town is now just minutes away instead of driving to China Town. Order the egg rolls, pho with brisketanf shrimp fried rice!!! All of it is amazing and authentic. The Avocado smoothie with boba is a delicious sweet dessert!! 
So happy to have this in the neighborhood!!!
The staff is super attentive and there to please.

Good Vietnamese restaurant. Seating for large groups and tables for two.

Service 4/5 

Food 5/5

Price 5/5

I came with some family visiting from out of town and they were able to accommodate a party of seven easily. We ordered pho with beef and variety meat bowls (6) of them, the grilled chicken with rice and 6 egg rolls. There was plenty of plates of toppings for the pho including bean sprout, limes and mint. The fish sauce for the chicken and the egg rolls was also tasty. I mixed up some hoisin sauce and Sriracha to dip the egg rolls in. The chicken was tender and seasoned well.

The bill came out and most dishes were about $10. Very reasonable for the price since all the bowls of pho were large. 

Definitely one of my favorite pho restaurants in Las Vegas. Of course I will come back again.
6 years ago this pho spot was great, the broth was rich and flavorful but I came back last week to Vegas and it was average at best.

Only got 3 stars because even tho the Pho was awesome, I ordered and paid for Spring Rolls, but when I got home they weren't in the bag :( I wasn't driving all the way back during rush hour to get them. Plus my Pho would get cold.   Next time I'll check the bag before I leave.

Ordered #70 Vermicelli noodles with shrimp, pork and egg roll. Portion of noodles/meat/veggies were pretty even all around. Cooked hot & fresh.

My dad ordered #35 soup. Not sure what it was but he said he really liked the taste of it. Tangy with lots of meat!

This is Carla M.'s favorite pho joint in Vegas. It was a no-brainer that I had to try it out when I was in town visiting her. To be quite honest, I've never had bad pho. How can you screw it up?! Pho Saigon 8 did not disappoint. I wouldn't say it's the best pho I've had, because I really can't taste the difference. It's all the same to me.

Service was very good, fast and easy. They have plenty of options to choose from. Portions are decent for the price. Everyone was very friendly. The restaurant was clean and tidy.

Good as usual.  Broth is not fatty and the meats are really tasty.  Their noodles are the thinner kind but very good.  Get the #16 for a nice combination. The regular size is $7.55 and they want a little over 8 bux for the large. Do the math.  I held one star back because the large isn't really that large.

It's not the best pho I've had but it's still good. I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to come eat here though. If I'm around the neighborhood, then why not but it's not something I'm crazy about.

Late night eats available here until midnight except Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday only open till 11PM.

After looking the menu over we ordered the Beef broth pho with steak, delicious noodle and tasty broth 5/5. And the chicken breast rice plate with soup 4/5. Tasty chicken flavored well and some fish sauce to dip it in. 

For dessert we chose the Suong Sa Hat Luu, which is tapioca jelly with green bean paste and coconut milk, 5/5!

Very clean new restaurant and good service 5/5. Will be back again when we need our Pho fill...

Party all night? Hungover in the AM? You've arrived at your cure. A short trip from all the bright lights. I found out about this place from my GF and hot damn if it isn't one of the better pho places around Vegas. 

When you arrive the parking lot has ample spaces for you to park. Walk into the restaurant and you are hit with the scent of pho all over and you'll feel your hangover start to subside. Their iced coffee with milk is awesome as well. It's the old school drip style that drips into a glass with a layer of condensed milk at the bottom. When the coffee finishes, pick up the strainer and be hit with this aroma of some good coffee and you'll feel awake before the coffee even touches your lips. If you want to feed our hangover they also have a small selection of beer as well.

They have all the standard fare pho and dark/white meat chicken pho which is just as good as the beef. Regular or large bowls are available. If you're feeling rice they also have that along with other standard apps like spring/egg rolls which are just as good.

The only dessert I ever get at Vietnamese restaurants is Che Ba Mau...if you don't know you're missing out. Their Che Ba Mau is ok but nothing really to write home about. It's a good finisher if you've still got room for it at the end of the meal.

My only gripe with this place, which is only because when I'm full I feel pretty lazy, is that you have to walk up to the register to pay for your meal. I think of it as a good thing though because you're forced to get up and move after you eat a good meal instead of vegeing out while you wave your hand up to get *makes writing check motion* the check.

This is my favorite pho restaurant and I am southeast Asian. Much cleaner than the "other" pho places. Spacious and good service. I like the sausage in the spring roll. The portions are large for pho.
The pho here is great! The food is served fast and is always tasty. They have a wide selection of pho and other authentic dishes.
Best Pho in Vegas! I know it 2 years ago and still the same feeling about it. Great job for keeping it up with your service.

Disclaimer- The food is definitely four stars, but the service is one to two stars depending on the day. Therefore, I'm giving Pho Saigon 8 an overall rating of three stars.

My mom and I have been coming to Pho Saigon 8 since my family first moved to the valley, almost four years ago, and the customer service over the years has just gotten progressively worse. The staff was great when we first started coming here and then as of lately, the staff has just been rude and unpleasant to be served by. Although this restaurant is not close to home, we still drive the distance when we have that craving! We used to come at least once a week, but now every other month or so.

We usually come for lunch on the weekend, so it's always busy during that time. The wait time can be a hit or miss.

I am a creature of habit and order the same exact thing every time. I order the #11 (Pho Tái) which is the broth, noodles, and rare eye round. As far as the pho goes, the broth is always hot and never warm like other Vietnamese restaurants I have been to. It's rich in flavor and there is a good amount of rice noodles in the soup. I love the rare eye round because it's not fatty. A plate of garnishes are provided for the table to share. The traditional Thai basil, jalapeños, lime, and my favorite, crunchy bean sprouts. I love my pho with extra lime, and if more garnishes are needed, you can always ask for more! You might have to ask more than once though because they can be quite forgetful. Also, condiments are a must! A nice squeeze of Sriracha and Hoisin always go into my pho.

If I'm hungrier than usual, I'll order a plate of the crispy fried egg rolls to share. The crispy fried spring rolls are a favorite amongst my family! There are four per order and it comes with four leaves of fresh lettuce as well as the dipping sauce. I'm not too sure what the dipping sauce is made of, but it's delicious! The spring rolls are filled with pork and a variety of veggies.

Overall, the best place for pho in the Henderson area! The food is great and satisfies my craving every time. The service isn't the best, but it'll do.
Pretty decent Pho and rice dishes. The egg rolls are decent. The taste is consistent so we usually alternate btwn this pho place and another one way up the street.

I had a bowl of beef pho tonight from Pho Saigon 8.  I'm no expert on pho, but I just wasn't all that impressed!  The broth of the pho was just ok.  I thought it was a little weak (Thai food has ruined my pallet though).  My favorite pho spot has a lot more richness to it.  The side veggies were fresh and good for the most part, however they did skimp on the amount given.  I ordered a side of vinegar onions, and they were pretty flavorless.  All that aside, I liked it!  

Combined with the fact the service was pretty unfriendly, and the pho wasn't any better than a couple of other spots I've been to in town, I probably won't be going back.  2.5 stars and rounded up to 3 stars for the overall experience, I guess.

Some friends and I were on a birthday trip to Vegas when we decided to get some pho and asked several dealers and bartenders at MGM Grand where we could find a good place.  We got several recommendations and we couldn't decide, so we randomly picked a place.  Luckily we picked Pho Saigon 8.  We were seated right away and by the owner no less.  We ordered the following: egg rolls, spring rolls, 2 special pho bowls, 1 cubed tender beef dish, and 1 rice with grilled pork.  The egg rolls and the spring rolls were pretty standard for vietnamese apps, although the dipping sauce for the spring rolls was better than usual.  The bowls of pho were good and the pieces of meat were generous.  The beef dish had such tender big chunks of meat that were cooked to perfection.  The pork dish was standard, but tasty nontheless.  This was a welcomed escaped from the over priced food and buffetts on the strip.  Total bill was around $50 for 4 of us and my favorite part of the meal was my green soy milk, mm mm sooo good.  I highly recommend this place to any wary travelor to Vegas.  Hope this helps!

Sat for 10 mins. Finally flagged server down and he took our order. 5 mins later and I still dont have a beer. They were in the weeds busy but kept seating the door for some reason. Got up and left...

Went there for lunch today during work.  Place was pretty packed for a Monday afternoon.  I had a bowl a pho since this is how I measure the restaurant.  I ordered a coke and a glass of water.  Never got my water.  Waitress never returned to check on me.  Now for the pho.  The broth lacked flavor.  It was bland and lacked rich broth I look for.  I've had much better.  Also, the large is probably a medium bowl in most places.  Pretty disappointed w/ the food considering the high rating.

I'm glad I tried Pho Saigon 8.  I ordered the pho with round, flank and meatball, but asked to replace the flank with brisket, and I'm not sure which I got, but it was inedible -- way too fatty and chewy.  Luckily, there were only 2 small slices of it, and plenty of the other 2 meats, so now I know -- next time I'll stick with the round and meatballs. 
 The basil and sprouts that came with the pho were THE FRESHEST I've seen at any pho restaurant, with no brown spots on the basil, and no yellow tinge on the sprouts.  I started with the BBQ pork rolls, which are like spring rolls but with pork instead of shrimp.  At first, I thought the meat was Spam, but it wasn't salty enough, more like thick bologna.  I've had pork rolls elsewhere where the meat was recognizable.  The peanut sauce for the rolls was thin, and not as flavorful as I'd like.  I tried a drink made of raw egg white, seltzer and condensed milk, and it was delicious.  The staff was good -- some were friendly and others were serious, but the service was excellent.

Gotta admit, saw this place on dirty dining but their food is soooo delicious!

I still go here regardless.

I love their pho as welll as their dry noodles. For the life of me, I can't think of the name of the dry noodles! Lol anyway, I also love their crispy egg rolls. So delicious and cheap!

Highly recommend!

I would never go to this place ever again. The waitress/host was so rude. She got an attitude when I asked nicely for a high hair then ignored our table for 15 mins and never bothered to even come take our orders. We got up and walked out. Worst service I've ever had.  I don't recommend this restaurant to anyone .

I went here to try to find an authentic version of a vietnamese curry chicken dish i had at TI's Pho restaurant.

I ordered a chicken noodle Pho and a curried chicken over rice dish, the latter of the two dishes being awesome, sweet and and just the right amount of spicy. Generous large portions reasonably priced. It was my first time trying Pho, which was a  huge soup with everything in it but the kitchen sink. It was good, not amazing but good.

Also ordered a weird drink, it was like a strawberry shake but had these weird balls inside of it that were hard to suck up a straw also this weird texture once in your mouth...felt like I was chewing on an eyeball or something, weird .

I'd try this place again and maybe get a little more adventurous with my Pho selection next time. Nix the drink though.

This place is sooooooo good. After eating on the strip for the past several meals a bowl of authentic pho noddles was exactly what I needed. Soup base had a lot of flavor and the pho noddles had great texture. Minus one star because their "large" is extremely small. I had to order two large bowls just for myself.

THIS IS THE BEST PLACE FOR PHO IN LAS VEGAS. Don't be fooled, they have another location on Spring Mtn Road in Chinatown, but this location in Henderson is much better.

For me pho comes down to 4 things. 
1. the soup. 
2. the noodles
3. the meat
4. cleanliness

The soup here is real, some places try to cut corners by not using real stock, they go with the "gaijing" or chicken/pork base, this saves hours of prep and time (and is cheaper) but the taste isn't there. If you want to know if real stock is being used, take a cup full home, put it in the fridge and if it has fat settled on the top in form of white dots, its the real deal. THIS PLACE USES REAL STOCK AND THE FLAVOR IS REALLY REALLY GOOD.

The noodles here are good, they don't give you a ton, so if you are a big eater like myself you can order extra, or load up on the sprouts and basil. I am 6'4 and push 300 lbs, this place fills me up with out extra noodles, mainly due to the generous portion of meat.

The meat here is perfect. IT IS CUT THIN!!! There are so many pho places that simply slice their meat too thick and it tastes chalky and hard to digest. Here they do it perfect. The rare eye of the round, brisket and fatty brisket are perfect. I get the #18 that comes with all the above with tendon and tripe.

You can tell this place is well taken care of. The hoisin sauce bottle is clean, the hot sauce container doesnt have 3 week old hot sauce jerky hanging from it (foodies will know what i mean) and the place is decorated nicely, service is fast and nice.

We live 2 mins from Chinatown but will travel 30 mins to Henderson to eat here. BEST PLACE FOR PHO IN LAS VEGAS, HANDS DOWN.

i've tried a lot of pho places here in the vegas area and i must say pho saigon 8 henderson location is so convenient being away from the strip. shrimp spring rolls with no pork, is great with peanut sauce and a hint of sriracha sauce. they taste so fresh compared to other places. i get chicken vermicelli and i love it. but (-1 star) for their service, they can work on smiling and refilling water faster.

Me and my sister went and got a massage and was craving for pho and this is the closest one.
The pho is just ok, not very flavorful even after i put some sauce in it. We were still eating but theyre already cleaning the place throwing you with "hurry up" look. I asked for thai tea with no boba but they still gave me the boba. My sister said her durian boba is tasteless. Not gonna come back.

Terrible, Awful, Craptastic, and Sh*talicious are the best words I can come up with to describe this absolute dump of a restaurant. Our order was taken by the rudest little b*tch east of Saigon. This old jabba the hutesque looking troll continuously gave us dirty look after dirty look.  We ordered 2 different bowls of pho and an appetizer of deep fried Vietnamese egg rolls. The egg rolls were actually pretty good, however the pho was terrible.  Trust me people I am well versed in the world of pho and when I say it sucks, it sucks. The broth was the most uneventful bland liquid I've tasted in a while.  I shouldn't need to continuously doctor up my pho by adding ingredient after ingredient to provide my taste buds with the slightest resemblance of flavor.  

Ok so the food sucked. Fare enough, lets leave.  Easy feet to accomplish right...wrong.  God forbid you get somebody to acknowledge you after your food has arrived.  Just getting someone to look in you general direction so you can flag them down is like pulling teeth.  Crap food, terrible service, grumpy employees. One star is one to many.

I am always pleased and quite full when I leave here.  Don't bother with Pho Mailan up the street, you can read my post about them as to why.  It's better than Lemongrass which is almost across the street.
As for the people whose problem with this place is service....  In my not-so-humble opinion, crappy service is quite common in southeast Asian cuisine restaurants.  Many seem to lack any personality, and any server etiquette.  Same applies here.  But the food is consistently great and I've never been let down.

This is the only Vietnamese restaurant I have eaten at in Vegas, and I was thorougly satisfied with the food.  Relaxed atmosphere, great place to bring kids, but the tables are a bit too cramped in places.

We've had both the chicken as well as various beef pho, and it was all excellent.  Great broth!  Mmmmmmmmmmm.  The spring rolls were very tastey as well.

This place is actually alittle bit better than Pho So #1 but of course not better than the ones in San Jose!

Pros: Pho is decent, nice servers

Cons: Pho bowls is alittle small, alittle pricey

Overall great place to try out if you havent.
So yum. Always busy and service is good. Have only had spring rolls and Pho. Happy girl.

Quick service, large portion sizes, relatively clean, good desserts, decent prices.  The flavor of pho was good but a little on the blander side, but I actually prefer it that way because I don't feel like I ate a boullion cube with the pho soup.  I was really impressed by the clean bean sprouts. My family and I eat a lot of pho at a lot of Vietnamese restaurants and this is only the second time ever that the bean sprouts came with the root ends plucked off.

While traveling around spring road near Las Vegas, I stumbled upon this pho vietnamese restaurant that was recommended to me from a local. He said this place was the best he tried and he went to most of the places on this road. Let me tell you, there are plenty of other choices for Vietnamese restaurants around. I definitely took his word for it because he's a crazy foodie who loves to eat. 

Inside, it is ambient. The waiters and waitresses are Vietnamese and the service quality is excellent. The inside is decorated with Vietnamese culture and is clean. The pictures on the menu look better than the food themselves, but the fresh taste of ingredients is definitely there. 

 The food is very cheap, I would wager based on the pictures I've posted, everything is about 10$ ish and lower. The appetizer I ordered is the spring roll and it was immaculate. 

The parking outside is full and hard to fill probably because this place is so good!!!! The outside is hot and surrounded by other small restaurants on a large open road. 

 If you are wondering if it is noisy inside, it is peaceful. The desserts here are very cheap, 3$ and below. The smell of the food is just mind blowing, and the service is about 10 minutes of waiting. The drinks come out fast, less than a minute and refills are also quick. 

In the end, if you love Vietnamese food, this place is top of the line in quality, service and price. The meal I had was a tofu and vermicelli combo. The other ordered item was a grilled shrimp and vermicelli. The only Con is nothing. I highly recommend this place if you are hungry and want to give Vietnamese food a chance. One of the best Vietnamese food I have ever eaten. Cheers!

First time here recommended by my sister who frequently goes here .. great for a first impression. Great service, friendly staff, and food was out on our table within minutes, plus the place was packed!! Great food! Well recommended!!

LIke I've said..I only eat here when my BF wants his Beefstew pho! 

Service is not that great. I don't know if its just the way they staff it. Then the pho wasn't great today. Not tasty and a lot less noodles. Some days I'll have too much.

Seriously yummy Phò!  The broth is amazing. I usually always get the #11.  The "add in's" are always super fresh and fragrant and they serve  very generous portions.  

The soup comes in two sizes, they just have the price for the large size in the menu, you need to ask for a small if you want that.  

My friend introduced me about a month ago, and I have been back 3 times already.  You could say it's my new favorite.

The service is very fast, but strictly business.  Never anyone rude or unhelpful, but not warm or inviting really either.  But seriously I couldn't care less the soup is amazing and I don't necessarily care for overly talkative waiters anyhow.

Best pho in town. We've ventured out to most Vietnamese places in town but the pho doesn't really compare elsewhere. The rice dishes are also very good. You can't really judge Asian restaurants on their service so don't expect much. If you want something just ask until you get it.

Driving up and down Spring Mountain, you'll have your endless pick of Pho places. We stopped here based on a friend's recommendation. The restaurant is moderately sized with as many tables cramped into the room as possible. And you can tell that this is a genuine Vietnamese restaurant based on the service. You're never quite sure who your server is so you just flag down whoever walks by. You're also expected to know what you want to order within 3 minutes of sitting down. However the service is fast and the food is delicious. Either way, it's a nice little joint where you can chow down away from the strip. Pho-Sho!

I'm from southern californa, and I'm vietnamese so I think I've had my fair share of "authentic" vietnamese food, and I think Pho Saigon 8 does a pretty good job. And for a decent price too! 

I've gotten the Pho Bo Vien (meat ball Pho) which was good. The broth was a good flavor. I always add tons of lemon and Hoisin Sauce anyway. 

And I've had their Rice platter with grilled pork (Thit Nuong) and egg rolls. I thought the meat was awesome. It had a good flavor and the egg rolls were pretty good too. My one complaint is that the rice wasn't your typical "broken rice" where the rice pieces are smaller. They served whole rice grains, which is fine but I was really looking foward to the traditional Com Tam.

My fiance has gotten their Bun Thit Nuong (Dry noodle bowl with grilled pork) and he didn't have any complaints. The fish sauce (Nuoc Mam) was decent, nothing too spectacular. 

And the service isn't too bad either. I've gone when they've been pretty busy and I thought the service was moderately attentive. Overall this is a great place to go when you're craving a nice steaming bowl of noodle soup or just some good ole vietnamese food and you're too lazy to drive down to Spring Mountain haha.

Pho Saigon 8 has always been one of my favorite Vietnamese restaurants to eat at. So happy they opened one up by our house. We always get the same every time, husband gets pho dac biet, spring rolls, egg rolls, and my favorite bun bo hue. It's always on point, the service is on point, and it's clean. Enjoy.

My go-to pho place in town! Pho Saigon 8 serves the best pho in the area hands down, and I've gone to quite a few of the other Vietnamese restaurants in town to find the perfect place. I'm from Orange County where there is some of the best pho restaurants you can find, so my standards were pretty high when I went on this search. Trust me when I say the best is here. 

The wait staff is friendly and the food comes out super duper quick. They are always pretty busy but I have never had to wait for a table to be available. 

The only fall back is that you are going be in close proximity to those around you, whether it be at your table or the table next to you. The tables feel kind of small and you have to be mindful when maneuvering around so you don't knock into other people... but this is a small price to pay! And speaking of price, the dishes are very affordable :)
Soup is ultra salty .  Good portion of food thought ..ok   acceptable .    Casual lunch
Ughhh nothing worse than half ass food. I had the pho here before but today I ordered the grilled chicken with rice. Needless to say... I will never order that again. Strictly only pho here.

Quick service, friendly servers, nice presentation, reasonably priced for its huge portion. However, food is salty and lacking taste. Noodles taste pre-packaged. At least from what I ordered - number 38 on the menu - crispy noodles or Hong Kong style fried noodles. The hubs said his combination pho is good. He likes this place because they serve good pho. I guess I should have ordered pho. The place is easy access from Spring Mountain, ample parking, clean, but always jam packed.

This place is great for lunch!  The service is quick, the food is relatively fast and always tastes great!  I stopped in for a late lunch (closer to 2 or 2:30pm), and it wasn't busy at all.  During peak lunch rush there can be a wait.

The menu has lots to choose from.  I've gotten into the habit of getting the same things each time I go - but otherwise I'd say try something new once in a while.

The atmosphere is very casual.  Great food!
Amazing as usual! I go to this Pho spot after every EDC the AC is blasting and the food is great. Recovery to the fullest

Maybe not the best PHO I've had but definitely decent and worth trying! I'll be frequenting this joint for take-out since it satisfies my cravings for Vietnamese food. The place itself is very clean, modern, and service is pretty darn good. It's a comfortable environment and it's not in Spring Mountain mixed in the cluster of Asian restaurants. That's a plus! Oh, and the menu is pretty comprehensive so you'll find something!

So me and my friends were in Vegas and getting broke so a bowl of pho sounded like a good decently priced meal. We get here at 9:30pm and its packed. We waited 5 minutes and were seated and I ordered my usual Pho Dac Biet, beef noodles with everything. Their broth was really good with not much oil which is surprising. The noodles were cooked perfectly, not too soft with a bit of bite left to them. The meat was also cooked well, the tai, raw meat, was really tender. The gan, tendon (my personal favorite), was also nice and soft. I wish they had culantro but at least they had limes, basil, jalepenos and bean sprouts which is a must. My friend got the Goi Cuon, the summer rolls, and they looked pretty good with the shrimp and pork. The cafe den da and sua da, iced coffee with sugar or milk, was definitely strong and kept me up which was the point. When I come to vegas again I definitely will come again and try their Banh Canh, thick rice starch noodles, with either the traditional shrimp and pork hocks or the thick orange soup with crab.

I stopped by to get some take out. Here's what I got:

* #61- Bún Bo Nuong Sa ($7.50) -it was a large portion of lemongrass beef. The beef was lean with very little fat; tender and flavorful.
* #71 - Bún Thit Nuong Cha Gio ($7.75) - excellent  grilled pork and there was plenty of it. I wasn't crazy about the egg rolls. The wrappers were thicker and not as crispy as I would have liked.

While the food was very good, the service (even for takeout) wasn't. No eye contact, no smiles, no "thanks for stopping by, come again." The old guy behind the counter was just plain grumpy and seemed like I was an inconvenience to him. Call me crazy, but good customer service is important to me. I'd rather go some place that appreciates my business, like Bosa 1.

It was an easy fix for PHO off of the S. Rainbow Area. One of my favorite appetizers/starters at a Vietnamese Restaurant is Spring Rolls and I wasn't all that impressed with them it had more lettuce then noodles or anything else. The service was not the greatest either considering there was only 2 other tables occupied in the restaurant, they were extremely slow taking our order, getting our drinks and our bill. However we enjoyed the egg rolls and the Pork & Shrimp Vermicelli very much

Pros: This place has great beef tenderloin, I highly recommend eaters to get #59. You can either get steamed or French rice and a side of sliced carrots and a piece of cabbage. They also served me a cup of soup which was delicious!!! 
Cons: You're forced to be seated next to people you don't know and you're also forced to share the siracha/hoisin sauce with them. I would prefer that they separate the tables for some privacy. They're not that quick to fill up water. They ended up filling my drink towards the end but I would still like to have the water throughout my meal. 

Overall great place to eat at!!

Pretty solid pho spot. I always order the small #7, which is just pho with the rare flank. I get my pho pretty basic since I don't like all that meat. Their rice dishes are pretty solid too. The BBQ pork is really flavorful and tender, even when you eat it the next day as left overs. Not a huge fan of their service. The couple times I've been here, the servers speak little English. And when we went to go up and pay, the cashier asked what table were sitting in. Um, I didn't know that I was in charge of knowing my table #. I went there to have dinner, not get quizzed. Plus there were only 3 other tables that were occupied. Do you not know who is in your dining room?! Ok that's my rant. Otherwise I'll be back for more pho.

It's great pho, and the service is quick and smooth. I've come here a couple times and every time has been very pleasant. It's comfort comfort food for me, so it is nice to come someplace welcoming and with good food.

the pho here is pretty good almost comparable to the pho places in rosemead back in good ol SGV.  Been coming here to get my pho fix while I'm in vegas but thats it. Food is consistent and done very well but for some careful on the off days and that's why the 1 star off

I only give 2 star because this place's food is average. Service is HORRIBLE. Me and my mom came in and stood there stupidly for at least 5 minutes (I'm not exaggerating) and this old lady who work there waved me off when I put up two fingers of table for two. She looked so pissed and grouchy and she literally gave me a mean look when she waved me off. That was extremely rude and I did not come to this place for this kind of service, and certainly no matter how good the food it doesn't keep me coming back for this service.

Went here over Memorial day weekend and I was not impressed.  It was dinner and the place was not super busy but they messed up our table's order and were not ver accomodating.  I ordered Com Ga Roti, which I've eaten at a lot of Viet places.  This was the worse.  The hen is supposed to be crispy but mine appeared to be boiled or steamed with a lot of soy sauce dumped on it.  And for whatever reason, there were a lot of 'eggroll warpper' flakes all over the chicken.

I would never ever come back to this place ever again and it was my first time here. I wish there was a way to rate this place 0 stars. They're customer service sucks. They never came to check on us so I never got a chance to tell them that the broth sucks and that the noodles they gave me were broken into pieces. They tried to tell me that it was cause it's been sitting in the broth for too long. How is that even possible when they just brought out my pho. I told the "Guy" in charge and he made it seem like I didn't know what I was talking about. I was simply just letting them know that I didn't like it it wasn't cause I wasn't trying to pay. They were very rude about acknowledging the issue. DONT COME HERE even the spring rolls were tough!!! I didn't even get an apology

This is the best pho in town. Their broth is always on point! Service is fast, even when it gets busy. The quality of foods is always high. Prices are a little higher than others but it's definitely worth it! If you're looking for good quality pho, this is definitely the spot
My go to spot for Pho noodle. The food is hot and delicious!!! Try the spring rolls!

Everything is great and beyond my expectation for Vietnamese food in Vegas. Their pho is yummy and the vegetable is always fresh especially the bean sprout. I definitely recommend to try other food such as egg-roll or udon, you will be surprise how good their food is. Thumb up for the service!

Great Pho place by 215 and Rainbow, same plaza as Einstein Bagel and the 7 eleven.
I was reading reviews about Pho over the weekend and this one guys, because of your reviews... made me think pho pho pho lol
Took my friend there for a quick lunch today. Place is clean. It was busy. As soon i walked in the waiver found is a table and iced water was served right away without us asking.
Service was fast and good.
i ordered pho meat ball (of course) and we ordered beef luc lac. My pho broth was delicious and very tasty. I ate it all and even drink all the broth LOL
the Beef luc loc is accompanied by a bowl of broth (nice)
the beef luc lac comes with steamed rice or tomato rice. Never had that before, the rice was so so Good! I was looking around what people ordered ... PHO PHO PHO so i will have to come back and order other dish and try it all!
$24 lunch for 2
I will happily go eat there again :) 
they open from 10:30am to midnight!!! is that awesome??

Easily Pho-gotten Experience

Can't really comment on the sister restaurant in Spring Mountain, but I stopped by here since I currently reside on the east part of town and I wanted to check out the Las Vegas Athletic Club located not far behind.

A good way to judge a Vietnamese restaurant is the quality of the their beef pho broth.  While I was fairly hungry having scheduled a late lunch, I was both delighted and simultaneously skeptical regarding the fact that my steaming bowl of beef pho with flank steak and tendon came within 2 minutes of placing my order.  One of my Vietnamese friends taught me some easy signs to spot a good broth are through sight and smell prior to tasting.  One should detect an immediate aroma upon the bowl being placed at your table and I'm not sure if that was the case.  The clarity of the broth both in term of being able to visualize the ingredients and the absence of an abundance of oil at the surface also is a positive sign and this broth appeared to pass the sight test. 

Poking my chopsticks around followed by adding the standard sides (sprouts, jalapenos, lime, and basil), I began to slurp and taste.  The noodles were the right texture and not overly clumped together, although this can be the most forgivable fault if all else is right.  The meat was problematic in that the thin slices were clumped together like miniature meat softballs and the only way of preventing any undercooked areas would be to OVERCOOK the whole mass.  Anthony Bourdain once commented in his book Kitchen Confidential that one should never order steak well done since you will likely get the worst cut of meat available since one cannot tell the difference between the best and worst when it is well done.  I feel the same holds true when you are trying to assess the quality of the thinly sliced beef in one's pho.  The tendon was actually the star in that they were sliced with a good combination of collagenous goodness and the occasional hint of meat and cooked to perfection. 

 Last but not least, the broth is what makes or breaks the dish, and in this case, my nose trumped my eyes in that the taste of the broth was fairly one-dimensional.   The broth is usually a matter of pride amongst Vietnamese moms and no two are alike since hours to days are spent perfecting the signature combination of beef bones, ginger, onion, and aromatics (cinnamon, anise. cloves, peppercorns, etc) guarded in households much like the Colonel Sanders' original recipe.  I could barely detect anything beyond a mild sweetness which could have been MSG or a bouillion cube (we'll see how thirsty I am a few hours from writing this review).  I am probably being overcritical since I have had some great broths in the past, so I will say that much like the clientele which was mostly of mixed caucasian/asian couples, this place would be a great primer for someone new to pho since I would think perhaps the addition of the other subtle flavors may weird out the newcomers and sometimes one has to sample an average broth to appreciate an excellent broth.  

P.S.  Probably the only pet peeve of mine is avoid taking home noodle soups unless you plan on consuming them later that night.  It is a food crime to eat them as leftovers when the noodles have had a chance to get soggy and release their starches and muddle the broth.

Delicious Banh Canh with fresh crabs, totally worth it. Open at 9am perfect for breakfast before heading to your next destination.

They even have legit cafe fin, which drips before your eyes. A must try if you want to stay awake all day :]

Pho broth clean, not oily, full flavored - beautiful broth. 

Very generous with their meats in the pho - I couldn't even finish a small bowl. I got the combo with tendon, flank, eye of round, etc. What I love about their pho is that they aren't afraid to give you fat. A little fat on the meats is a wonderful thing, especially since the broth is so light.

Restaurant very clean and tidy.

The pho was really yummy, it was our first time there.  We had the #18 with two orders of spring rolls. Since it was on the way to our doctors office, we decided to check it out. The atmosphere was good, the service was fast and friendly.
Love this place ! Been coming here for years . Great and nice people . Never rude nor rude comments . Favorite place !
I have ate at pho Saigon 8 twice in the last 2 months. Great service and tasty food.  I had the #16 which was really good.
Love this place the food is great!! I've read some reviews and never experienced any of what people are posting. Try them for yourselves.

A family friend referred Pho Saigon 8 as "The Best Vietnamese Food in Town."  Since we were in the area, we decided to give the pho a try.  To my taste buds, pho has to be piping hot.  Lukewarm soup does not make me happy.  In fact, it ruins the whole meal.  I ordered Pho Tai and I didnt observe any steam coming out of my medium sized bowl.  The meat was fresh and not tough at all.  The egg rolls were eh.

Funny story: so apparently people still go by word of mouth and not by yelp, but my dad was obsessed with finding a "Pho Saigon 88" because his friend had been there and thought it was amazing. We drove all the way down spring mountain road trying to find this non-existent place and all the while passing perfectly good korean, chinese, japanese, and other pho places! i was starving and getting angry until my parents were like "hmm...do you think its 8 and not 88? i don't know...lets do it!" so we finally stop and eat! 

the restaurant is clean and pleasantly decorated. I loved the pho bo's soup, tasty and steaming wth good pho-ness. I give it a 3 because the meat had a meaty smell, not a tasty beef smell, and my dad's bun bo hue (usually a favorite) didn't have the spice it should have.
Pho was delicious.  Taste like the pho Saigon in Sacramento.  The beef was very flavorful and you must try the colorful dessert.  It's so good.

Small and cozy place to eat with low light setting.
I was happy with the food that we order. I got "com suong bi cha thit nuong" which is not bad. My friends say the pho is good too. Would come back.

I love that this place is open late.  On my recent visit I was stopping by for take out.  The employee at the register was friendly, patient, and eager to make suggestions.  After I ordered they even offered me iced water in a to-go cup while I wait. I ordered pho among other things and it was well packaged and I had no spills in the car.  

I enjoyed their meatball pho, seafood flat noodles, and chicken porridge.
pretty good vietnamese food here.  pho is done well but seems to be heavy on the msg side.  best thing about this place is that it's open 24 hours and a short drive from the strip.
Our new favorite place for Pho. The amount of meat they give you beats any other I've ever had. The broth is great. Perfect for anything that ails you!

Right next to BBQ king, pretty big inside and the pho is delicious. Service isn't the best, but they get the job done. Kind of pricey though. Plus I feel the need to drink a lot of water a couple hours later.

Based on my friend's suggestion that "the noodle soup was to die for", I decided to check out this place as part of my montly book club meeting.  Walking in, the place is exactly what you'd expect of a restaurant located in Vegas' version of China town: neon flourescent lighting; no-nonsense tables and chairs; and a statute of a laughing Buddha set in front of a bamboo screen. 

Admittedly, you don't come to Saigon 8 for its fantastic decor.

However, where the place lacks in ambiance, it makes up for in a great meal for a steal! We started with their veggie spring rolls, which were perfect -- not too oily but just enough crunch -- and  accompanied by a fantastic brown sauce.  No sooner had we finished washing down the spring rolls with Soda Chanh (Fresh lime soda), servers were clearing away the appetizer plates to make room for the star of the show: steaming pho in a delicious broth, accompanied by the classic pho condiments (cut jalapeno peppers, bean sprouts and fresh Basil). In one word: yum.  And, when we found that the bill for 7 people came to just under $90 -- double yum! I heartily recommend this place!!

First off, I'm not quite sure why they have such low reviews because they are BANGIN'. 

Anyways, their broth is delicious and always piping hot, noodles are always al dente and chewy. The only complaint I have is that they don't always have the best service. But when they do, OH MAN. 

If you do get a chance to come here, ORDER THE FRIED EGGROLLS. They are super crispy, crunchy, and always hot. An order comes with 4 and I believe it is $6. *There is pork in there, so for my friends who don't eat piggies.....  None for you! :P

Along with the eggrolls, I always get their veggie pho #29 with extra steamed bean sprouts!!!!! Oh and fresh coconut juice if I'm feeling extra hungry! Make sure you try to carve out the flesh of the coconut..... It's a struggle but it's totally worth it.

Havent been to a Pho House in a while so this was pleasant. Parking was okay, but tight. Location is pretty far off the strip.

Fresh Spring Roll Appetizer was good, I had the Rice combo. Your choice of BBQ Pork of BBQ Chicken, I took the Chicken and Egg Rolls. Great. Love it. It came with a broth soup.Pickled Carrots and some dipping sauce. The other dish was Pho and Viet Ice Coffee. All together $20. What a deal.

This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant on rainbow! Nice atmosphere, friendly servers and good food. We tried the Vietnamese udon and grilled pork with egg rolls over broken rice and some spring rolls. Spring roll were fresh and the sauce was so good! I can't wait to try the rice flour wrap with pork pasted they just put out!

This review is so troubling for me because of my deep love for Pho Saigon 8 on Eastern Ave. I am a regular there and have never experienced anything less then great, efficient service and consistantly high-quality food. I don't know how they were ever able to open a second location based on the first. Yikes.

My friend and I walked up to the front door only to have 3 employess with aprons and name tags on smoking in front of the front door. Literally blocking the entrance. One opened the door while talking over us with his cig in his mouth. It was a disgusting way to enter a restaurant (ithrough a plume of smoke) especially when you're starving.  Upon walking in,  nobody said anything until we asked if we just seated ourselves. The employee, looking bothered by the interuption, asked how many and looked behind him and pointed to any table. Never even stepping away from his task. So, she and I chose the closest table. We then had to ask for a menu which appeared to annoy them as well. She and I were kind of in disbelief as we wondered if we should even stay? Afterall, we have both frequented the second location and enjoy it so. A woman came to the table and stood there, never asking anything. My friend ordered her Thai tea and I ordered the same with boba. The woman left. When the tea arrived I can tell you fairly (not because of the awful experience) that the tea was watered down and the boba was mealy. So gross. I didn't finish it.  When the waitress came back, she stood there for a minute and said "do you know what you want?". Again, another sign that we should have departed. 

We did have a good laugh that the menu prices were crossed out with marker and re-written in with higher prices. 

The food came quickly and of the quality I am used to which was a nice relief from the otherwise disappointing experience. Nobody ever came back, we had to get what we needed ourselves from other tables. I saw another server holding his pack of cigs on the floor in front of tables. He eventually went outside as well. When finished, we went to the register only to see both people behind the register eating Balut with their hands only stopping momentarily to take people's money while still chewing. No handwashing, people. BLECK.  By this point we were especially grossed out at the sanitary standards (smoking servers went right back to work, no handwashing) and wanted to get the heck out.  I am almost so bummed out by this experience that I don't even want to go back to the Eastern location!  What. A. Shame.

3 stars.

This is the location just next to the massive LVAC on 215 and Eastern. Its in that little center on the corner right next to Teriyaki Boy.

The place is pretty small and feels really cramped if there are more than a hndful of people inside. 

As for the food itself, its alright. On my last trip here I had the chicken pho and it was good. Tasty broth and nice juicy chicken. I think there was too much cilantro in mine, but it certainly wasn't a deal breaker.

Service was okay. 

I dont know, nothing was terrible, but at the same time nothing really stood out either. I think the Lemongrass Cafe nearby is probably a better choice for some good Pho.

So 3 stars it is.

It was a cold night at Vegas so my husband and I decided that it was Pho for dinner. Usually we would head to Pho Kim Long but we thought of the busy parking lot and customers at that place. So Pho Saigon 8 it is. Less crowds and no hassles of finding parking so far. 

Service is okay. Simply just bring what you want and your order and check up on you once. My husband and I ordered the same thing #14 pho noodle soup with round steak and tendon. It was good especially on a cold night. The beef broth soup was to my liking with enough flavor and not bland at all. 

We will definitely be back. Price is reasonable and not as noisy. 

Tip: on a cold night, dont sit near the entrance. The ins and outs of customer through the doors sends a wind chill your way. The soup warms you up but later it will dissapate towards the end of your meal.

Oh, i deducted a star. I believe the restaurant could use and updated look. 

HAPPY EATS!!!

It's Friday....and decided its "Pho-day" . Located near our hearty home we wanted to check this place out after shopping. Food was quick to serve,  taste was on point to our liking,  staff was friendly, and meals were reasonably price.

We ordered 2 Large #14 pho noodle soup with round steak and tendons and spring rolls as an appetizer. Mmmm, that was delicious. We will definitely be back. Happy eats!
By far the best Pho in Vegas!  I've been a loyal customer for 4 years now!  I don't go anywhere else!

Can't F up soup.
They got some good soup.
Cheap on the meat though.
Add more meat...not tripe.
Other than that....
Cup O' Nooles BE GONE!!!!
Service has definitely gotten worse over the years, it's a shame this is one of the only places near Henderson.
So happy that pho Saigon 8 is in my hood,I'm up in here 3 times week.best Vietnam food in Las Vegas....no bullshit!!!!!!

Best pho that I've found close to home. Great because it's generous portions at reasonable prices. It's always busy, but the wait is never too long.
I did find that if you are a known regular, or can speak in your server's native language you generally get a lot more attention. That's why they lost a star in my book.

This is the only Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas that I go to even though I live here. In my opinion, their food taste the best compared to all the other places. All of the food is a good portion size except for the soups. Even though you choose large, the bowl won't be as big as you think it'd be. I really like their Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio and Com Bo Luc Lac. My boyfriend always gets their porkchops. My favorite drink to get is their soymilk. It tastes amazing and you can't get it anywhere else. 

When it comes to service, I think that they are fast and nice. I always get greeted and seated right away when I walk in and the food always comes out fast. One of the servers even gave me a free calendar since they give out free calendars around New Year's! I use to come here everyday when I was younger and now that I'm older it's still my most favorite Vietnamese restaurant to eat at.

Great customer service !!! I order bun thit nuong and com ga roti so delicious I will be back . I been to alot of viet places but this place is the top of my list now I would recommend this place !!!!

I just got back from a two week trip to Vietnam and was excited to test out Pho Saigon 8 after reading some good reviews from John Curtis.  

First, I noticed that some have complained about the service.  It's not prompt, or attentive, but trust me, that's authentic!  In Vietnam servers don't get tipped so they have no reason to be attentive, and there you have to ask for your check... So, if it really is Vietnamese staff working there, expect to have to request your check and realize that it's not rude to approach them.

Now for the food!  We ordered vegetarian spring rolls which were tasty, although they could have used some more herby additions.  The dipping sauce was delicious!  We split the Pho Tai (thin strips of beef in the beef pho broth).  The pho was good, not the best I've had, but a solid middle of the road.  It was pretty flavorful, add-ins are appropriate (giant basil, bean sprouts, hot peppers).  But, what impressed me was that they had the rice crepes that have become my favorite Vietnamese meal!

The crepe is made with rice flour (it's a savory crepe, folks), cooked in a pan until a bit crispy, and filled with bean sprouts, shrimp, and pork.  It comes with a fish sauce based dripping sauce that augments this dish wonderfully.  With this meal (which appears in the appetizer section, but I use as a main course) comes a giant plate of ruffage.  The proper execution is to take a lettuce leaf, cut off a chunk of the crepe + filling, and use the lettuce leaf as a wrap to make your own little spring roll out of it.  Add in the carrot, some kind of other root vegetable, and mint that they provide.  The rolls are cool and crunchy on the outside, warm, crunchy, and flavorful on the inside.  Don't forget the dipping sauce, it's well worth it.

Most Vietnamese restaurants in town don't extend past pho and some stir-fried rice dishes, and maybe a "clay pot" type dish if you're lucky.  This rice "crepe" will keep me coming back for more, yum!
