I love this place top 5 pho for me great service small cozy quick and cheap! Lots of families come here so it's great food as I see it!

Amazing, tasty bowls of goodness! The prices were excellent for the portion size. Great for any time of day, this soup will put you in a full, healthy mood. Superb balance of soup and meats. Service was quick, but communication was a stretch. I still would go there everyday if I could!
The Pho is good of course but nobody in town can beat their fresh spring rolls..I just hate the fact that this place closes so f!#*ing early..

A very functional, yet charming venue in Spring Mountain.  Service is robotic but fast.  Food comes out even faster, which is ALWAYS a + for me.

The noodles are prepared tasty and the soup is not too oily as well.  Very good combination of the two.  I don't know about their dish menus too much, but I tried them several times before and they were OK.  Bottom line, the price is good, food is awesome, I recommend it.  It is one of the better Pho locations in Spring Mountain.

PRO: Pho is good, service is fast
CON: Not too much to complain about, service can be a little iffy at times

Over the years I've come to appreciate Pho Saigon 8. It's not perfect but warrants higher than my previous two star rating. Went there for lunch today and the line was crazy long. Should've seen that coming on a cloudy/rainy day. Pho just seems to go so well on cloudy days, doesn't it?

I had the pho and damn I have to give it to them for their consistency. The flavor hasn't changed in years so you always know what you're getting. Your expectations will always be met. I didn't like the fact that the noodles were still pretty hard and had to sit in the broth for it to soften but it's not the end of the world.

The egg rolls are good and the peanut sauce is actually better than other places I've had it at. The service has gotten much, much better over the years. This is probably my pho spot on this side of town.

Tonight after 9pm  i ordered 2 appetizer togo,because half price,and when i pick-up my order and they said the happy hour only for dining,togo is full price,alright,why doesn't say anything when people order happy hour food,and there's no sign or anything says when you order to go you can't get happy hour price?and the waiter has a bad attitude .

Ordered two bowl of pho. Typically comes out in 5 minutes or less. Our 5th time here. Never coming again. Waited over 20 min. while 3 other tables who came in after us got theirs before us. I understand if the food should take long to prepare, but didn't make sense that other guest who came in after us got their pho before we did.

We end up going to Hue Thai instead. Fast friendly service there all the time.

This has been my go to Vietnamese spot since I've lived here. Consistent and good Vietnamese food at a fair price. The service could always be better, but that usually goes for most Vietnamese food spots. I will say I do like that they bring out scissors to cut the kid's noodles, this helps.

Since I have been spoiled by Golden Deli in Southern California, it is very difficult for me to give a 5 to any vietnamese restaurant. I did enjoy Pho Saigon 8 more than Pho Kim Long because I believe that the food has much more flavor. I ordered the beef pho with tripe and tendon and it was quite good. It was the first Viet restaurant in Vegas that I ate at and gave a nod of approval to.

Busy night on Thursday but solid service. Pho was mediocre with the broth arriving to our table lukewarm. Not ideal. Also had beef spring rolls, good not great. Overall I've had better Vietnamese in Vegas.

This is my favorite Pho place to date!!! Their broth just rocks with beef flavor and huge portions. They also don't gyp (no offense to gypsies) you on the bean sprouts, basil, peppers, and lime like most places do. Everyone gets a heaping plate full, not for all to share.

I always wash it down with their home-made soy milk. It's nutty with the right amount of sweetness, and refreshing even in the hot Vegas weather.

Pretty damn good vietnamese food i must say.  Been coming here alot actually this past year and some occasions we'll visit twice in our trip.

Pho broth is VERY tasty, meats are fresh.  Mi soup broth is great as well, they give u so many wontons.  2 sizes but both bowls are massive.  Favorite dish there is Com Tam Bi Cha Suong Nuong.  The pork chop is tender/great flavor compared to other spots and their egg cha is superb.  I normally am unimpressed with egg cha at other places even tho i love it, so its awesome that I'm able to enjoy it again.  And their Bi is not overly dry which is great.  

The restaurant is big and their turn around time for tables are quick even though they get busy alot.

Service is a hit or miss.  I mean its a vietnamese restaurant, ur not gonna be catered in royalty.  Just expect your first requests for items to not come and be patient to flag them or someone else down for it again.

This place is great if you're looking for a quick lunch or dinner. Their ph is pretty good and their servings are pretty large as well. I always order the egg rolls as well whenever I come here because they are very delicious, and never overly fried. Most of the time I've gone here, customer service has always been average and tonight was just horrible. The staff was just not attentive and were were given attitude the whole time. I definitely won't be coming back here anytime soon.
Pho here are always consistent in flavored and deliciousNess!!! Great price and portion. Quick service.  In and out lol... Ordered #18 if your down with tender beef flank and tendons, yum.
The fact that the server wasn't friendly enough ticked me of. I rather eat at a Thai Restaurant anytime. I didn't try anything at all. My friend said it was good. He tried the soup or something.

Typically my family goes to the Pho Saigon on Eastern but since this was central we decided to come here and big mistake it's worth the drive to eat at the other location. There is this one lady I believe her name is Thuy (older with a mean face) she wouldn't let the other wait staff take our order or even help service our party of 8. She was rude and obviously doesn't care about customer service! They messed up our order 2 times and she tried to blame that we said it wrong, when clearly she could easily just fix it. I will never come here again!

First timers. Felt optimistic because it was packed, must be a good place right? We ordered egg rolls and halfway through saw a giant bug crawling around the lettuce. Bug in the food. Need I say more? If one is crawling around our food, imagine the kitchen. Couldn't get the feeling that I ate bug filled egg rolls out of my mind, total bummer.

I get the 66 or 71 (same as the 66 but comes with an egg roll) flavorful charcoal grilled pork with a nice array of vegitables and peanuts over vermicelli noodles. Today I am getting the 71 for lunch. Oh, and their Pho is delicious I like it with the softened tendons. What can I say, I like visceral meats.

Let it be said that there is absolutely nothing horrible about this place.  Everything is just mediocre.  

First, the decor was the best thing about it.  It was new, well-painted, pretty paintings and new chairs and tables with granite on top.  There were nice fake plants on the ceilings and walls, and the bathroom was clean, and nice.  The problem is that the tables had this bar under them where my friend kept hitting his knees against.  The tables were set so close together that I could probably have reached over to the other table and stolen a spring roll off of it.

Speaking of the spring rolls, they were just not good.  The flour sheets on the spring rolls were chewy, and they did not have that nice crunchy stuff in the center that tastes really good, like the ones at Lemongrass.  The dipping sauce was good, but not exceptional.

The pho was the biggest let-down today.  Pho Saigon 8 on Spring Mountain had rich, full broth, that seemed just a little too fatty, and was very good.  This one was rather thin, and its flavor was easily masked by any of the things that you could put in it.  For example, more basil meant that the pho tasted like basil and not pho.  Add bean sprouts, and the pho tasted like water and not much else.  The meat was good, though, and they put a liberal amount of green onion, which I always like.

I also tried the lemon soda.  This was a very good soda, although it was much too sweet.  I think it could have benefited from having more lemon flavor and less sugar in it.  

They have no sandwiches.  

In addition, everything there is smaller, and/or more expensive than Lemongrass, right across the street.  For example, the large pho was the same price for both, but the bowl is smaller was easily finished by myself and my friend.  We've almost never finished a large pho at Lemongrass.  The Vietnamese seafood crepe was both smaller *and* more expensive, by as much as $0.50-$1.00, and while good, made me a little skittish about ordering it again.  The Spring Rolls were the same price, but came with only two instead of three like at Lemongrass.  

Much as I want to see more pho places around, I simply cannot recommend this place with Lemongrass Cafe so close to it.  Maybe if it was in the middle of rural Nevada with no other competition, it would have impressed me more.  I'm sorry, Pho Saigon 8 :/
fast service great pho !!!! i love their wonton soup and combo fried rice !!! i know they improved in cleanliness from dirty dining over 2 years ago!!!! keep at it PLEASE!

I'm new to Vietnamese cuisine. I have been to a few spots in town & I must say the chicken pho was phenomenal! Lots of meat, veggies & awesome noodles. The broth was NOT salty, it was perfection. 

My mom tried the veggie pho with tofu, broccoli, bok choy, carrots & onions. She was in heaven. 

We also ordered tofu spring rolls.. Did not disappoint. 

I will definitely return.

Decent food, fast service and good prices.
Service is so-so! We went around 8:15 and they were closing at 9pm.
One of the servers came by the table and pick up the sauce bottle even before e ordered something. Later on, after we were already eating, one of the servers stop putting the chairs up and sweeping under the table right next to us, event if it was 8:50 only. Would eat there, if I have huge crave and I want something quick, but I would check other places as well
Dry pho noodles are super good.if you haven't tried it's a great variation to the classic. Even the small size is filling. Very pleasant service here. Thoroughly recommended.

Decent pho.  Not the best nor the worst but it hits the spot.  Their springs rolls were mediocre so I would recommend skipping that since it's not worth the cost.

I thought it was annoying how they listed all these different combos for pho.  I usually like to order everything in my beef pho (flank, steak, tripe, tendon, etc) so it would have been nice to have one that is labeled the works or something.  Oh and they charge extra if you want meatball so you have been warned.

Btw, you pay at the counter. ;)

I give asian places a pass on service b/c they aren't known for providing good service, but with over 170+ reviews, my 1 star review won't really affect the Yelp Rankings.  Anyhow...

There is an asian troll lady with short hair and glasses, probably in her 30's.  She probably moonlights at one of the 50 Massage parlors on Spring Mtn afterhours.   She is the biggest d-bag.  I will call her VFDB, Vietnamese Female D-Bag for short.   Here is the play-by-play

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Me:  (scanning order)

VFDB:  What you want?

Me: #12 and 13 look really good to me.  I'm pretty torn.  Which do you think is better?

Me:  hmmmmmmm, they both look good.

at this point, most would probably leave but my friends and i are laughing b/c we find it funny.  i end up choosing 1 of the items.  

after we're done we walk up to the register to pay and my friend asks if we can pay separately with cash to which VFDB replies - just pay one - it's too much work for her to split it up.

the food here is always good, lately the carry out service has gone to sh!t, they'll tell u 15 minutes then it'll take a half hour, & they'll just leave it on the counter when it's done until u ask.  today the guy then asked for my order number & receipt which they never gave me & tried to make me pay a second time when I had just paid and sat there waiting

I spent my childhood in Vietnam and my young adulthood in Orange County where the best Vietnamese food is outside of Vietnam.  Having said that, this restaurant is a good substitute of Orange County Vietnamese food.  

Most non-Vietnamese will come here for pho, and their beef pho is good.  But their chicken pho is better.  You can order it with white meat or dark meat or a combination of both.  I prefer the combination.  You can also get Mien Ga, which is a noodle soup with the chicken pho broth and bean thread noodle, very healthy and yummy (bean thread noodle is a good source of fiber).  

Another good dish here is the Hu Tieu My Tho, which is a noodle soup with pork broth, clear & chewy rice noodle, topped with shrimp, calamari, ground pork, and quail eggs.  It is a very authentic dish from south Vietnam and Pho Saigon 8 has a very good version.  

As with most Vietnamese restaurants, the service can be slow and sporadic but the decor is nicer than many other Vietnamese restaurants in town.  I really recommend this place if you are in the Southeast side of Vegas.

Horrible service! They took my order incorrectly, we returned to pick up the correct order, no apology, no discount for us having to return back to their store a second time and they didn't even refund the order that we paid for that was incorrect in the first place! They have a bad attitude and horrible service!! Don't go here! There's another pho place right down the street in the same parking lot of inn and out and their service is sooooo much better!!!

I didn't get any headache after having their #72.  Usually I'll get a headache after consuming MSG.  The meat was soft and tender.  Vegetables are fresh.  Staffs are friendly.  I can't say anything bad about this place.

Unless I am so far from this location AKA in Centennial Hills I'll travel to go to Pho Saigon 8. Nothing beats this place. I wish the prices hadn't raise almost a dollar, but that's inflation for you. Oh well, I'll still come back!!
Amazing food! And prompt service!!  Could use more English speaking waiters/waitresses due to the language barrier but the fantastic food makes up for it!! Eat here!

Atrocious service. Seriously the worst. Bad attitudes, grim faces. The food is good if you can get someone to serve you. No welcome. No greeting. No thank you. They make you feel like a burden. Deserve zero stars but the food is good enough if you're desperate and patient

Great Vietnamese food! As authentic as it can get! This place has been around for a while and seems to get better in time! I had the Bun Bo Hue! Delicious broth and plenty of meat! Dave had the special fried rice! Generous portion! Also ordered their Pho specials to go for mom and her sister! You know this place is good when mom says it is!

Everything's relative.

I've read some disappointing reviews on Pho Saigon 8 from some Californians here on Yelp.  You see, they come from environs where Asians are not a small minority, but a small majority.  Just by virtue of sheer statistics, I'd expect that the pho experiences they've had are "better."

That said, I love pho.  I've been eating it for years.  I've lived in NoCal and SoCal, and in my opinion, Pho Saigon 8's a good joint.  As the best in Vegas, it may not better the best in Cali, but I still only go here whenever I crave pho since I live here in Vegas - and I have frequent cravings.  I've eaten pho from about half a dozen different spots in Vegas, and this is the best one out of all of them from a value and pho quality standpoint.  Pricing is pretty reasonable - not a killer deal, but a very good one relative to the other pho restaurants in the area.  There's a wide variety of different pho combinations (deriving from variety in the combinations of beef offered, from flank to tendon to beef balls to tripe).  One observer noted that the broth is quite salty and not oily - she is dead on.  I have a weakness for saltiness, so I don't mind it, but you'll be reaching for water after you finish your pho, especially if you delve into the broth.  Another small plus is that they are quite generous with the basil and sprouts add ons relative to other Vietnamese restaurants I've had pho at.

Also, since the restaurant is relatively new, the dining area seems relatively clean, if spartan.  Pho Saigon 8 always seems busy whenever I go, which is good from a food turnover standpoint.  The bathrooms aren't particularly nice...a bit skeevy...but could be much worse - by Asian restaurant standards, I'd say it's slightly above average.  The servers are generally workmanlike; not particularly friendly, but not rude either.  You may have to work to get their attention if you need something though, and they never check up on you after serving you your food like non-Asian restaurants.  The non-pho dishes I've eaten and seen eaten by friends have always been of comparable quality to the pho too.  The pho comes out quickly, and the restaurant can accommodate everyone from single diners to large groups.  

I'd like to give this a 4.5 out of 5, but since you have to award a 4 or 5, I'm giving it a 5 because I eat here regularly as a fan of pho, it has very good value, and I believe it to be the best Vietnamese food in the area.  As a bonus, they don't have any annoying credit card minimums which seem to sneak up on you in some of the local Asian restaurants.

The food was rather good. The service was decent. Clean. And they didn't kick us out (even though the lunch rush was starting to come in) for sitting and chatting even though the last child finished eating half an hour earlier. HaHa!

The Pho is really good here.  I love the little cart on the table with all the equipment you need including sriracha and what I think is eel sauce?  They are really quick, you order and they bring it out within minutes.  The size large is super large though!  The decor is odd, but not bad for a Mom and Pop Shop atmosphere.  It is pretty cheap too, I think I spent $11.00 on mine for a large bowl and water to drink.  I really loved the fresh basil leaves, it was delicious.

Came late night for dinner and even though we were the last ones there the food was still great. We ordered the Saigon noodle soup (#51 I believe) and it had an amazing flavor. We also tried #53 the fried noodle with meat, seafood, and veggie and it was delicious. We had a good overall experience and the waitress was nice about suggesting certain popular dishes and her favorites.

Yummy. Solid bowl of pho. Spring rolls and summer were both great. My friend got the mango green tea and it was really yummy. Sweet. The red chili sauce was good with the summer/spring rolls. Good food, decently priced.

I have traveled to many different establishments in search of some pho that matches the taste and quality of my mother in laws. Pho Saigon 8 on eastern and 215 is the closest yet. I routinely get the number 11. It comes with a plate of different garnishes such as bean sprouts, mint leaves, and sliced jalapeño peppers.  I add plumb sauce and saracha for an extra added kick that broadens the journey through taste town.  It tastes like life. It's a spiritual journey for me every time I dive into a bowl of this magic bone broth, thin sliced raw meat, and noodles. It's always clean and I've never had to wait to be seated.  The place stays full with a steady stream of regulars and workout veterans from across the parking lot. The café ser da is another amazing coffee treat that will spark off your day proper.  I've had a few other items off the menu, all of which were rich with flavor and filling. The meals are reasonably-priced and the service has always been superior. If you are a fan of delicious food from Veit Nam, a stop by here won't dissapoint. Lastly, don't fear the fish sauce.

This is the only place my wife will get pho. We have tried other places but she said they don't compare to a bowl you'll get here. I usually stick to a rice dish and a meat and recently had the pork plate with white rice and egg roll. I don't remember the number but it was a great portion for the price.

The service is hit and miss as you might not get a waiter back at the table after you've ordered.  Food comes out pretty fast especially if you have ordered the pho.

Good place to go for pho if you're craving noodles and not in Chinatown. My friends and I went here on a Saturday night, and were pleased that it wasn't too busy. After perusing the menu, my friend and I decided to split a large #11 (Pho Tai- Noodle soup with rare round eye steak, $7.50) while my other friend ordered the #67 (Bun Ga Nuong- Grilled chicken over vermicelli and vegetables, $7.45). I asked for extra bean sprouts to which the waiter didn't seem to have a problem with. Our food came out quickly, which was a plus. 

Pho Tai- Better here than other pho places in the neighborhood. The noodles were the perfect texture- not overcooked, but still soft with a chewy bite. The soup was a little more oily (I could see oil puddles floating on the top) than what I'm used to, but still good and hot nonetheless. And the accompanying plate of veggies & herbs (bean sprouts, basil & lemon (not technically a vegetable or herb...) was fresh. The portion size was good- plenty of noodles & meat- with the addition of bean sprouts, I was definitely full. 

Bun Ga Nuong- I only tried the grilled chicken, which I thought was flavorful and very teriyaki-y, but some of the pieces that I ate had too much fat on them; however, I liked the sweetness and charred flavor of the chicken. 

I didn't really feel like the service was bad. I mean it did take a while for them to bring the check, but my friends and I didn't really have a problem with that because we were too busy talking. I thought the servers were nice. I also like how this place is cleaner than other pho restaurants I've been to. So I think I'll come back when I'm craving pho not only because the food is good, but because it's located right next to my favorite frozen yogurt shop.

It was 8:30 p.m. on a cool Thursday evening. My daughter and I had just been in the neighborhood and thought about eating Pho. We had seen this restaurant many times as we drove by but never stopped in. I wish we never had. We walked in and there was no one in the establishment. One of the employees were cleaning the floors and chairs were pulled out from the tables. We asked if they were open and the owner waved us in and we sat. (They close at 10:00p.m.)The two flat screen tvs were off and it was very quiet....really quiet. We ordered a large pho tai and salt and pepper shrimp to share. The soup broth was not the best and you could see alot of oil floating on top and not to mention hardly any noodles. We were thirsty from the saltiness and needed a refill on water but all the employees and the owner were sitting down eating dinner. I had to get up and ask for service. Three other tables came in and were seated at 8:45pm. Once their food was delivered the employees once again sat at "their" table and continued eating. I had to stand up once again to ask for the check. I'm sorry I had not gone to Lemongrass Cafe to eat in the first place. We will never go back to this establishment. One more thing. As one of the employees brought our dish of the shrimp, he asked if we wanted rice (which comes with this order). We said yes and as he walked bakc to the kitchen, sneezed a very large, loud, yucky sneeze, we almost didn't want the rice!!!!! Gross!

I used to love this place. I've been here quite a few times over the past year or so. Quality has gone down and service always bad. I've yet to have my water refilled here, ever. You have to flag someone down if you want a to go box, extras, a napkin, anything. .. Sometimes I've been ignored. I went recently and the soup was cold, broth not as great as it's been and my meat looked old and had spots??? On it.... There was also something in identifiable in the soup. I always order the same kind so not sure what was up. I'm very disappointed and may just find a better place from now on.

I ordered the Bun Bo Hue with rice noodles over the phone for pick up and I think this dish is better to eat in the restaurant, the broth was still super hot when my dad dropped it off. The broth wasn't spicy to my liking even with the chili on the side but overall it was still good I just added more chilli oil that I have at home.  I would order the soup bete again the broth is really good not bland like Pho 88.  Try this dish with rice noodles it's so much better than regular noodles you don't feel guilty.

Best pho I have found. They also offer tripe which is very difficult to find in Vegas. I recommend only going to this location- the other location I have walked out of three times before ordering because the service makes me want to hurt people. This location has quick service and the bomb pho.
Pho has always been my favorite noodle soup. This place was very affordable, even the imported beers were cheap.  A lot of options and great service!!

I've eaten here a few times.  I can't say if it's the best pho in Vegas - as I've only been to a couple other places around town for pho - but it is delicious.

As others have stated, the broth is a bit on the salty side.  I don't mind salty, but it tends to overshadow some of the sweet component of the broth that makes pho unique and not just some generic noodle dish.

I ordered #18, dac biet - which includes rare beef, tripe, and tendon.  There was a really large chunk of tendon at the bottom of the bowl and that was my favorite part.  I also ordered a banh mi french baguette for one dollar which helped sop up some of the broth.

The place is clean, easy parking, and super fast service (pho arrived less than 2 minutes from order).  I'll be back for sure.

This place is just as good as the original one on Spring Mountain.  The good news for me is that it's right next to my office so I intend to sample everything off of their extensive menu instead of just the pho which I normally get.

Just in the last few weeks since it's opened I've tried some new stuff like the #2 veggie spring rolls which had some good tofu inside, #7 Banh Xeo which I really liked (its like putting a savory, greasy shrimp pancake inside a lettuce wrap and then adding fresh mint and dipping into sauce) and the #73 Bun Bo Hue which was a little underwhelming.  

The manager, Eric, is really nice and helpful.  I will be going back again and again until I've tried it all!

The food is good and they are very quick and friendly

Only drawback, I don't know how many English speaking customers they get  here, but there it's usually not a member of the waitstaff who speaks any form of English. You usually have to point at the menu and hope for the best..

This is my go to spot for pho.  I have been everywhere.  This place is the best.  The broth is consistently very good and the meats are piled high.  The restaurant is large and spacious.  Staff is friendly.  I always leave here full and highly satisfied.  if you want pho, this is where you need to be!!

This place isn't as good as the spring mountain location, but it's a great lunch spot for me n my coworkers. The service is not too bad and it's fairly clean. The pho broth is tasty and better than anything else in the SE. Lemongrass n pho little Saigon across the street aren't as good. I think this place is more of a 3.5 stars, but I give them the benefit of the doubt.

I usually get a large #21 and an order of fried egg rolls.  Bill usually comes out to around $18.  A little steep, but totally worth it.  

The egg rolls are always hot and crispy served with lettuce, cilantro, carrots, and radishes.  I love making lettuce wraps with my egg roll or with some noodles and meat in my bowl of pho.  I guess it is the korean in me that makes me do this.

The #21 has pretty much all of the meats including tendon.  Only thing missing are the beefballs and tripe.  The broth tastes the same as their location on Spring Mountain.  I feel like the bowl is a little smaller than most other places that serve a larage, but i always leave super full.  So it could just be an optical illusion.  

Service is ok.  I wouldn't say it is great, but it isn't bad either.  This location is new so I figure they are still getting the kinks worked out.  I highly recommend this place for anyone craving pho.  You will leave full and happy.

One of my fave pho places in Las Vegas. The food comes out fast and the dishes are tasty. It's hard to steer away from my usual pho tai, but when I do I go for the bun bowls. I'm always stuffed to the gills when I leave and usually go home for a nap. MSG? Yeah... maybe but it's so worth it.

Went to eat yesterday with my mom and sister. My sister order some pho and found a roach in her soup. Asked to speck to the owner or manager whoever he was. Anyway told him about it and he didn't even care about the situation and still charged us for the soup. Told him we're gonna report u guys to the health department. You know what he said "Do whatever you want. I don't care." Yup we did already. End of story.
Broth is wayyyy too oily.  What Viet restaurant doesn't have Tai Sac on the menu?  Rice dishes aren't great either.

Nous avons bien aimé notre diner. Petit restaurant familial ou nous avons pu apprécier un 78 et 56. Bons plats copieux pour 30$ pour 2 personnes. Arriver vers 18h30, la salle était tranquille.  Vers 19h30 il y a plus de monde. Nous reviendrons !

I was told that this place had good food, so my friend and I came here in observance of my birthday. When we were seated, we told the waiter that we needed time to look at the menu. We hadn't seen each other in a while, so we were chatting while looking at the menu. Within less than 3 minutes, we were abruptly asked by the same waiter and a waitress whether we were ready. Talk about pushy. I picked something quickly on the menu so they would stop pestering us, and my friend found something shortly afterward. I honestly wanted to leave, but my friend didn't want to fight traffic to find another place, so we stayed and tried to make the best of it.

When we received our food, it was fine, though we have had much better Vietnamese food elsewhere in town. I put some chili sauce on my noodle bowl and left it next to my food in case I wanted more. An older male waiter came by and snatched up the chili sauce without even asking whether I was done with it. I'm not joking. When I went to the restroom, I saw that they had several large containers of chili sauce on a shelf in the hallway, so it's not as though they were short on sauce for other customers. 

Overall, it was a bad experience, and the staff showed themselves to be rude and impersonal towards their customers, which is nonsensical since customers are the ones who provide their livelihood. Maybe they should remember that. We will not be back.
I come here when I want some pho. Think its somewhat better than other pho places. The pho taste a little less oily.

This place has the right grilled pork dry vermicelli bowl that I like. I would suggest trying that dish here. Lemongrass has half the amount of the same dish, and this place makes it the way I like it. I'd recommended it to my friend, and he likes it too. Pho is okay here, I would prefer Lemongrass for if I wanted pho.

This pho joint used to be pretty good, but now it's not even a thought when I'm craving any type of Viet dish. Went here with my boyfriend for a lunch and I ordered a Seafood hue tieu and everything in it tasted so gross I just ate the noodles! The squid, the shrimp, eck all of it tasted frozen and old. My boyfriend said their nouc mam was really weak and I just felt like the service just sucked too. I know how these places are, but can anyone just smile? Way better pho joints in town, trust me.
Coffee is okay food is great staff is blahhh . Maybe it's because they don't speak English.

They have plenty of food choices and everything was very good. The food also came out fast and I like that.
However, I wasn't a big fan of the customer service.. they don't greet you when you walk in or really talk to you at all. They just ask if we're ready to order and write down everything we order quietly and leave. 
They also don't check on us and ask if everything was okay. I noticed 4 of the waiters/waitresses would sit in the back booth and talk until one of us had to wave and ask them to come over. 
I don't think their customer service was all that great and I suggest to work on that.

This restaurant had great food and a clean, comfy environment. There were 30+ types of pho. I loved the vegetarian Vietnamese spring rolls with peanut sauce. I appreciated the sturdy armless chairs and sturdy tables as well. The servers were friendly and helpful. A+++

I haven't had some yummy Viet food in a while so I was super stoked when my aunt and uncle took me here!
My craving for bun w/ pork & spring rolls were satified (I also got shrimp & beef in there too! LoL) PLUS the 3 color drink was delicious!
My aunt says this is the best Viet spot in town...I won't try another one! ;)
YuM!

This place is pho-tanstic! 

Two of us arrived on a quiet afternoon and filled our table with fresh spring rolls, hot coffee with condensed milk, and two huge bowls of pho. The spring rolls had an abundance of ingredients tightly wrapped within. You can see through the sheer wrap and find large pieces of shrimp. Dip it into the peanut sauce and savor each bite. The hot coffee was particularly refreshing since we were both sleep deprived. My bowl of pho had rare eye round steak, flank, brisket, and soft tendon. The broth was the star. The flavor was so blatant that you can tell they spent hours putting this concoction together. The broth had a tight grasp on each strand of pho making you yearn for more after each bite. The meat was tender as well but the soft tendon really did the works for me. It was so delicate and spongy that it absorbed most of the broth. Each bite came with a burst. 

This is another surprising find that I will look forward to repeating when I am in the area.
Im a fan of the one on spring mnt but I thought I try this one. I must say the service was good and pleasant. The noodles were a bit over cooked and mushy but the pho was still good.

This is now the best Pho restaurant in town. Excellent customer service and the pho are amazingly, addictive. Better than Pho Kim long! 

If the drinks were free refills, then it would be 5 stars hands down! 

Overall, excellent place! Booyah!

Service is fast.  Bring the family here twice a month.  Large portions of the Pho with great broth and they do not skimp on the side ingredients.  Great price for the food.  The #11 is fantastic, meat is lean and not fatty.

I rarely submit negative reviews but had a bad experience at this restaurant. I work walking distance away and have always eaten here for lunch however today the waiter brought out an incorrect item which I was fine with. I asked for clean brisket with no fat and the person brought out brisket with a ton of fat. The lady replaced it and apologized which I was fine with. When I went to pay, the cashier took my $100 bill and used the counterfeit money marker which is totally fine but even after the marker showed it was a real $100 bill, he asked for a second opinion. The next person came and used the pen again and then asked for a third opinion. The lady held my bill under the light and clearly saw it was real but continued to inspect the bill. She also put the bill next to a counterfeit one to feel the paper and see if its real. At this point I was very annoyed and took out a $1000 of $100s to show that they are all real. I had to pull out my badge to show them I am a neighbor of the business and have always eaten there. The food is great but the experience was terrible. I refer everyone at my work to eat there but that will not be happening going forward.

Worst service ever.. order soup based upon picture.. waiter brought out a different soup. When I request to switch he said no that's what you ordered. I never like to send food back but I was craving a particular soup so it was very annoying. I come to this restaurant at least once a week and the lady server is always nice. She was not here today so my order got messed up. :-(

Thank you for relying but I didn't change my mind. It was not what I ordered. After he refused to take it back I didn't want to make a scene & uncomfortable for my husband. I've been in community for many years & many of our friends and family go there but we will take our business somewhere else since both you & your staff are missing the svc point. Thank you.

bun bo hue yummy,
but i dont understand about the purple basil.
but i  tried ,the first i ate purple basil.
the taste difficult for me, but my hubby like it.
this place  my  friend  recommend for me.
i believe her, because she live at henderson ,las vegas.

Until now, I really did not know the difference between good and merely average pho.  I have eaten at different places in LA and Orange County, but I suppose I was eating at places that were not Vietnamese neighborhoods, which presumably would have the best pho.

In any event, the key to good pho seems to be the broth (blinding flash of the obvious).  And whatever they do to their broth, it has a much richer flavor, much similar in the sense that the right broth makes miso soup or ramen excellent.

Even at 3pm on a Saturday afternoon, this place is crowded, though we got a seat right away.  It has big tables for parties of 10 and it was being used as such, rather than a bunch of small parties.

The service was incredibly good for a bustling Asian restaurant and tolerant of our non-pho expertise.  As a note, instead of getting a bill at your table, when you pay up, just note your table number to the register.  Very efficient.

After being charged $12.99 for essentially a grand slam Denny's breakfast and $3.99 for a glass of juice at the casino, I was happy to pay $35 for 2 large bowls of pho, 1 small bowl of pho, 2 order of spring rolls and 2 hot teas.

Pretty great pho place!

My friends and I have tried the other Pho Saigon in the area and we all agreed that the food was better at this location, but the service was better at the other location. Service wasn't too attentive, we waited a while before we waved someone down to get them to take our order. Service didn't stop by to check up on my group, but everything was alright.

This is the only pho place I've been to that serves pho with red onions instead of white onions. Was very satisfied with the amount of rare steak in my pho-- perfect meat to noodle ratio. The broth was also good, not watered down like the usual pho places I go to in California.

Will definitely return!

It is located where The American Grill used to be.

I have prepared more Vietnamese food at home than I have dined out.
That being said , I found it to be tasty.

I had the Hue Style Hot & Spicy Soup, although not spicy enough.  
A little Rooster Sauce took care of that though...

We went in the first few days of them being open.  
The service was ok.  Hopefully, it will get better.

I think we'll try Lemongrass Cafe next time...

I've had better Vietnamese food, but this place is not bad (Vegas standards). I got the Rice with Grilled Chicken and Egg rolls, and it was only decent. The chicken looked old and was super hard, while the egg rolls were okay...wish they were a bit more crunchy. Portion was big though, and I was pretty stuffed by the end. 
Probably won't come back, but it was still a good experience nonetheless!

Came here for lunch after checking out other places decided to come here because of the many reviews it has. The restaurant is spacious a lot of tables, the servers are friendly and helpful and very fast! We sat down and immediately had water served. Our order came out in minutes and it was very fresh. I absolutely love Pho and can say it was very very good! I will definitely be coming here again!

I went here a couple days ago and I loved this place. I ordered the well done beef with beef meatballs and it was delicious! You can tell this is your better than your average pho restaurant because the locals seem to love it and it was packed when I went in the early evening. Don't know why it has a 3 star rating...should either be 4 or 5 stars.

Also, you know it's a good pho restaurant because it has pho in its name and a random number.
Post-Vegas escapade meal? Hangover food? Whatever state you're in,  you can't do wrong with a place selling Vietnamese food that is filled w Vietnamese customers.

Went there on a 6/18/16 Saturday, around 4 during EDC week and wanted some comfort food so searched for the closes place I could get pho from my resort... 

Service: no complains at all... Unfortunately I didn't get his name, only saw he was wearing a white Nike hat. I changed my order after I've ordered already cause I couldn't make up my mind, he did not give me any ugly looks, my ice water was never empty, always has a smile on his face and that's major plus to the restaurant... I was a server as well so I pay extra attention to servers performance and he did great.

Now food, here's the down side... I ordered a large Bun Bo Hue and instead of regular noodles I requested for pho noodles (personal liking, chewier). It could've definitely use a lil more flavor for sure, I ordered pho so it would be more chewy... But mines came out really soft, kinda disappointment... It was filling... But I did order a large. 

Service was great
Food wise wasn't bad, but definitely had better
That's what took the star away for me
Will go back for sure, to see if it'll be better to get that five star

Always good pho !
Love their spring rolls.
Good Char meats - beef, pork, chicken and pork chops.
Fast friendly service.
Would highly recommend .

We came here on a weekday for lunch. The food is pretty decent but the service is where they're lacking most. Someone was seated a few minutes after us on a connected table and they took her order first and instead of taking ours immediately after, they left and came back.

After I ordered about $50 worth of food to go... I asked for a little bit of soup broth for my rice meal(which usually comes in free when you dine in)... she said it's $2 extra for it. Fine then, no more Saigon for us... there's plenty of Pho places now out here on the SW side. Thank you for being stingy...should be minus star!

UPDATED:

So I totally understand about controlling your costs. I am all for it. So tell me why INSTEAD OF TELLING ME I HAD TO PAY, she just tells me no, I just can't have it. I explained to her I didn't expect to get the PHO veggies for free. 

Then, when I asked for extra veggies of WHAT COMES  WITH IT, I am charged another $2?!? 

Come on. The location on JONES and Spring Mountain HAS NEVER EVER EVER charged for extra veggies. 

ON TOP of the AWFUL customer service I experienced from the elderly woman at the register. She's rude and interrupts you when you are asking questions. 

If I could give negative starts for the experience I had tonight, I would. -- $4 for veggies. Absolutely unbelievable. More than HALF the cost of my actual food I ordered. There is something WRONG with that picture, especially when I get home and see THE VEGGIES ARE SKIMPED ON ANYWAY!!! (Hahah!) Geeeez man. 
_____________________
_____________________

I ordered egg rolls and asked for extra veggies - 1 bag of what usually comes with it and another of what comes with the soup. Instead of offering to have me pay a little extra, the woman just straight up tells me "no" / "no what?" / "you cant have that. We can't do that." 

Now, I didn't say this to her, but I'm just thinking TJ myself, what on earth do you mean you "CANT" do that? I am a paying (AND RETURNING) customer for crying out loud. 

It's the LITTLEST things that can either bring your consumers BACK or ensure they bad mouth you to whoever they know that will listen; ultimately resulting in loss of business for your establishment. 

I mean, really? A bag of veggies? How petty can you people seriously be?

Located around the corner from Yogurtland with kind of a limited amount of parking is this wonderful place. Honestly I only get the bun bo hue here and it's a spicy beef noodle soup. It's perfect for a rainy cold day. It's not too spicy and they do offer chili oil to make it spicier if you'd like. My husband always gets just the reg pho tai which is just thinly sliced beef in a clear bone broth.  The give ample veggies (like bean sprouts, mint, basil and jalapeños) to add to your soup. So here's the big secret about Vietnamese soup....best hangover cure ever!!!! The noodles to absorb all the alcohol, the meat to fill your belly, and the natural oils from the broth to satisfy that need for greasy food with a healthier option!

Anywhere you have a decently sized Vietnamese community.. you can count on Pho restaurants being around... and typically there is going to be much more than one of them.. So how does one decide which one to go to??? Family, close friends, and the help of Yelp reviews are what I usually go off of.

So this little gem way off the strip.. and past I dunno how many other pho restuarants along the way.. was suggested to me by my family about a year ago and still remains to be one of my favorite pho places to go to while in Vegas.

What typically differentiates pho restuarants from each other is the combination quality and freshness of the ingredients, how everything is cooked.. but most of all, the broth.

There's no doubt that most people tend to add hoisin sauce, sriracha, lime, and various other condiments to cater to one's taste... but you certainly need a solid foundation to begin with... and the broth here is most definitely done very well.

I'm not so sure about the soup based dishes, but the broken rice dishes are trash. Me and my brother ate the com suon and the rice was really soggy and terrible and the meat was incredibly dry and somewhat burnt. It seems like they quickly reheated the meat and gave it to us, I'm dissapointed. Whatever happens, don't eat the rice, it's cheap and nasty rice. And the dish was around $11 not worth my money.

AWSOME! First time I came here and it was very good! Good service! Clean and nice looking place, and the best part the soup taste exactly like it suppose to- incredible!
Will be back soon :) (ordered vegetarian broth with tofu)

I got take out so this is just my observation from the waiting area. Plenty of local customers so this place is popular. It's located off the 215 at Eastern so you don't have to drive 30 minutes to the Chinatown area of Vegas for Pho. But they have yummy Bun Bo Hue, Banh Xeo, goi cuon rolls and decent. Vegetarian selections too.

This place is absolutely amazing. If I could eat here every day I definitely would. I have to say, this is my favorite restaurant ever. I am a HUGE fan of #56 is a plate of Korean barbecue pork, rice, egg rolls, salad and broth. I always come with the thought of trying something new but I am hooked with this dish, I will never be able to say no to it. The prices of the food great.

This place was delicious! Yummy fresh coconut juice, Thai iced tea with boba, and Vietnamese coffee. My parents ordered pho and com tam. My boyfriend and I ordered bun thit and hu tieu. I must say it's great food for being in Vegas! Great day after recovery food!

Vietnamese BBQ  Shrimp Vermicelli or Bun Tom topped with grilled pork (thit),  is my favorite Vietnamese dish!   I love Vietnamese bun because it's not only tasty, but very healthy as it's not greasy and comes with all sorts of vegetables and herbs. Every bite is refreshing and appetizing; a noodle dish that is both filling and satisfying. Most people who have tried Vietnamese food are familiar with Pho, unfortunately for me it's fun to say but not to eat, I've just never had a taste for it.  So, if you're like me and have family and friends who dig Pho give this dish a try.  You're welcome!  And don't forget the Thai tea with boba.

I normally don't give out many 1 star ratings, but sadly my recent visit to Pho Saigon 8 was horrible. The first time I tried this place years ago, it was really good and then I came back again around 2012. I noticed even that visit in 2012 wasn't as great as my first visit. Now, 2014, I found out the old owner had left which explained the decline in EVERYTHING for this restaurant. Customer service AND food were absolutely horrible. Gordon Ramsay needs to host this place in Kitchen Nightmares!

The server had a horrible attitude and wouldn't let me make modifications. Hello, you're a vietnamese restaurant, not a high end michelin star place so slow your role! In the end she still got my order wrong. I ordered the chicken vermicelli w/ cha (steamed egg quiche) w/out vermicelli. My order came out w/ vermicelli and NO cha. I figured maybe she forgot and it wouldn't be in the bill so I didn't bring it to her attention, but after we got the bill we noticed she did charge us for it!

Chicken Vermicelli - Noodles were over cooked, chicken was disgusting. I've never had chicken as dry as the NV desert in the summer. There was no flavor to the marinade either and too much black grill marks. TBH, they used chicken thigh and it shouldn't be this dry/bad. This is probably the first time I couldn't finish my plate because the food was so bad. Normally I hate wasting food so I would suck it up and try to finish it, but this was just beyond edible.

Chicken broken rice plate - Again, same crappy chicken that I had in the vermicelli. Rice was super old and dry. Everything seemed microwaved

Pho tai bo vien - The beef was overcooked as well as the noodles. The bo vien was ok

Bun Cha Hanoi - OVERCOOKED PORK, again marinade was off. At least the veggies seemed clean & fresh

Mi cha siu kho - the cha siu (bbq pork) was like rubber/microwaved. Again, my friend couldn't finish this plate either

Cha gio (egg rolls) - not the best I've had, outershell wasn't crispy enough. Was too oily

Bo luc lac - Normally anything w/ oyster sauce & garlic seasoning/marinade should taste good, but this dish like all the others weren't palatable. Plus the portion was small for the price

So basically we paid and left hungry still. Never coming back

Great Pho, loved there fast friendly service. 
Definitely recommend to all Vietnamese food lovers!

I wanted to try Pho for the longest time but never did. I finally got up the nerve and can't believe I waited this long. Pho Saigon 8 is awesome. Incredible prices and even better tasting food. The hubby even said it's the best he's had ( in Vegas) so far.  Most likely gonna make this place a weekly tradition.

The service sucks. They lost a customer over $8. Is that what the 8 stands for? ? My food wasn't good, so I asked for a different item & the server told me I should've read the menu better & what happens if I don't like my next dish? Will I keep asking for more? I told him I come two to three times a week so I know what to expect & he said he sees a million faces a day how would he remember. I wasn't expecting him to remember I was just trying to make it clear I know what their food is supposed to taste like. On to the next pho restaurant down the street.

We were told that this place has really good "bun bo hue" so we came to try it out.  It definitely was not a disappointment.  There were plenty of meat, noodles and the thin cabbage made it all come together nicely.  The broth was very favorable and you can tell they use furmented fish paste.  This flavoring was very authentic to those who cook Vietnamese food.
My daughters ordered the traditional pho tai and they said that it was above average.  We also ordered the tri colored dessert and it was tasty.  There was nothing that stood out from the dessert other than it was good and we would get it again.  This place was definitely not disappointing and the price point on the menu was very reasonable.  The place is located about 5 mins away from the Chinatown plaza so getting there was an easy.
Consistent quality with the best bun dishes in area. They have a friendly staff and very large portions.

Definitely the best pho I've had in Vegas. I used to be a loyal Pho Kim Long fan, but Saigon 8 won me over. Their meat is much more tender, and it doesn't come out overcooked and rubbery. It does tend to get a little crowded sometimes, and I definitely like the seating at Kim Long better, but for the overall value and quality Saigon 8 is the place to go for Pho.

So glad to find their new location is open late! Just as tasty an hour before closing as it is during busy lunch hour. Favorites are rare brisket pho and seafood pho with extra limes. Never disappointed!

I've been here a number of times and mostly enjoyed the food. The service is pretty mediocre but I don't blame them-- at least they try. 

The eggrolls are different here, and while they aren't my cup of tea, seem to be popular among other regular patrons.

The prices are pretty fair for the amount of food you get--you'll be pretty full from just one bowl of soup. I love the traditional leaves and beansprouts that they serve alongside the pho. I always douse mine in hot sauce as well. When I've got a really bad cold, there's nothing I crave more than a steaming hot bowl of spicy, salty, hydrating pho. However, I've been elsewhere in clark county and must say that this is far from the best pho in town. Its conveniently located for me but don't settle for this place because there is much better to be had in the asian districts closer to the strip.

Amazing Pho! Right by my house!! 
Yay!!!
I asked for extra jalapeños and boy did they give me extra. 
#16 is what I always order and it hasn't failed to be delicious once!

This place is always  busy but it beats driving all the way to Chinatown. Food is delicious  I like their  tendon and beef pho. I also order their small egg rolls with lettuce. Their combination  with noodles and shrimp is great. I just  wish they speak more  English.
Awesome place. Eggs rolls, pho & coffee were top notch. To bad it's not closer to my home or I'd eat there more.

Great Vietnamese place in Las Vegas. And it's not even in the chinatown area. Pretty authentic Vietnamese food, especially for Vegas. The bun was good, and the pho had a really good broth, not too sweet like many others.

I do like this location simply because they do takeout and its nice to take my pho home. Admittedly they only get 4 stars because sometimes I've called in an order, they tell me it will be ten minutes and by the time I get there, my order is not ready nor does anyone seem to recall me having put one in. I go at least 3 times a month if I can. The males seem to do this more then the females working there. It has happened more then once and it does get annoying after awhile. It is also a hit or miss sometimes with the soup itself. There have been times I have gotten meat that appears a little off putting and I get sick after eating it. It's rare but it does happen.

Overall I enjoy coming here, as I can just pick up my soup after I get off work and go. Admittedly I wish they stayed open until 11 instead of ten like their spring mountain locations but otherwise no other complaints.

As good as Pho Kim Long with comparable price ranges but they could probably use a new interior decor and upgrade to a more modern look. They'd probably get the same amount of business as PKL with how delicious their entrees are. I'm going to keep comparing both Pho Saigon 8 to PKL just because in the Pho business out on Spring Mountain, PKL really has the title for "Best of Las Vegas." I believe this place has so much potential if only they'd consider making some arrangements that can pull in the interest of foreigners, travelers, and even locals. Their food is mouth-watering; I can't even begin to explain! I love ordering their Korean BBQ and they're not even a Korean Restaurant! Their Pho tastes so authentic as well! I love how their selections, so much goodness in such a limited menu. I really suggest you give this place a try. Don't expect too much from the environment but their food is off-the-charts amazing :)

Great place amazing customer service and food! This place is very clean and the pho is amazing! My wife and I had the spring rolls which were Nom Nom! I had the #23 meatball and beef the noodles and meat we great! My wife had the #61(?) egg noodles and wontons! All in all we will for sure be going back. everyone was very nice and refilled drinks fast which is a plus for me! Plus they have some good beers!

Pho dinner?? Sure this is a great place for just that. Aside from pho can order what eve you want on the menu. Perfect me for cold nights like this. 

Probably one of the best pho restaurants in town. I can tell it's very authentic, soon as you walk in you can smell the grill and what ever the kitchen it cooking up. I can attest that the service, 10/10. 

Order the pho, you won't regret it. Generous portions and the price is right. Hurry and check it out !
Came here with a friend for the first time to try out pho. If you don't know what you're doing don't order the large pho bowl. It's hard to finish everything. But I loved trying something new.
This is my fav location for pho in vegas and I've had it everywhere! They give you a lot of chicken they're fast and the flavor is the best pho around :)

Came here for lunch with the family. Overall, the food is ok. It's not the best pho, but it wasn't bad either. The bun bo hue was a bit lacking in flavor, although it came with all the right ingredients (the coagulated blood was nicely cooked). The spring rolls were ok, with too much lettuce inside, but the dipping sauce was flavorful. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if you live around here, it's not a bad option.

Most Vietnamese places serve southern Vietnamese food, because most Vietnamese immigrants are from south Vietnam. It is RARE to find a Vietnamese place in the US that serves Bun Cha Hanoi! So we were pretty excited to find this place. I thought we would have to fly back to Vietnam to have this dish again in my life. So ooooo good! 
It was clean, fast, friendly. 
The Bun Cha Hanoi was great. The spring rolls were awesome and the Pho was awesome too!
Highly recommend.
Fresh ingredients and authentic atmosphere set this place apart for Pho. #18 was excellent and the regular size was plenty
This place is the OG original,  one of a best restaurants, food is made fresh and hot also customer service is outstanding
Good place and clean. Pho isn't really my thing but this place is better then Pho Kim Long. The Avocado smoothie was amazing.

I abandoned Pho So 1 for this restaurant, and for good reason. 

Prices for regular bowls of Pho range anywhere from $8 to a little over $10, and there is a size-up option. For me, a regular bowl has always been big enough to satisfy my hunger. The portion sizes may not be as big as the ones at Pho So 1, but are very well worth the money. The soup is great and doesn't taste as much of MSG as many other pho places do, the meat comes out fresh and red like it's supposed to, and the noodles are neither under- nor overcooked. Of course, soybean sprouts and limes are served with the bowls, as well. 

The service is good. I have yet to find an authentic Vietnamese restaurant where the servers actually smile at their customers, but they're getting the job done. Since there is no hostess, and the waiters are often busy, customers often just seat themselves. Once the customer is seated, the servers will quickly come over and take the order. I don't think I've ever waited more than 10 minutes for my food to come out after ordering it. While the customers are eating and talking, the servers are good with keeping the drinks refilled and following up on any other requests.

The bill is paid up at the cash register. There is always someone there, and the cashier is pretty fast, so customers can walk out almost immediately after they finish their food. This is my go-to Pho place. Remember to tip!
This place is good, decent prices good portions. Try the #46 beef stew with rice noodles it's really hearty!!

Hubby and brother-in-law wanted to eat Bun Bo Hue so we chose this place.  I've had it here before and it is quite decent.  However, this will be the last time I eat here.  

Both hubby and BIL ordered the Bun Bo Hue Large and I ordered the small.  The bowls came out quickly and as they were finishing up their bowl, I finished almost 1/4 when I noticed a bug that looks similar to a rollie pollie in my bowl of soup.  I spooned it out, waved down our waiter, and at first glance, he said, "it's good.."  I said, "that's a bug in my soup."  He took the spoon with the bug and brought it back to the kitchen.  Moments later, another waitress that spoke fluent English came out to apologize and ask if i want anything else.  At that point, I am disgusted already so I said no and check please.  

They took off the small bowl of Bun Bo Hue off of the check, but still charged for the bowls of the same soup that hubby and BIL ate.  We came to the conclusion that the bug must have been in the big pot of soup that they served to all customers as how else will the bug appear in the soup.  But nope, if they continued to charge us for the two bowls, we are sure they continued to serve that to other customers.  

Very disappointed and will not return.

Horrible service!!! They said 10 minute wait for my party of 6, we waited almost 20 minutes when a party of 2 were seated. Continuing to wait another 10 minutes 4 people walk in and go to seat themselves. I explain to the hostess that they just cut us. Apparently, they were joining the previous party of 2. The hostess said that she was saving a bigger table for my party. I then explained to her the 2 people + 4 more =6. She continued to be passive and not tell the 4 people whom just walked in that we were next. This place is awful, no wonder why it only has 3 1/2 !

Wow!!! From my last review I talked about customer service being my only problem but ever since then, I came here 3 more times in 2 weeks and every single time was AMAZING customer service! Even the last time I came in today they were extremely busy yet greeted everyone and sat them right away! Service was so fast and attentive and everyone was so nice! This definitely adds the final star to complete my review! My favorite pho place of all time! Perfectly yummy and GREAT service now too!!!

My family and I love this place. The ambiance could be better, but the speed of service and helpful happy staff make up for the decor. All the ingredients are super fresh. 

We usually get the pho beefballs and lean beef, we also get the spring rolls. Yum!!! You won't regret you are here!!
The chicken pho is really good due to the authentic broth!  Awesome Vietnamese pizza!
I really love this place! Sometimes a little wait but that just means great food! They always have good service too

I always order #29 and it's really good but service sucks big time. I don't mind waiting if they're busy but it's the second time that a friend and I were kept waiting while another couple that walked in after we've been seating and ready to order, got not only their drinks first but also their food way ahead of us. Not cool. Not going back.

I come here often with my family and I always order the vegetarian noodle soup. My most recent visit was very good. The food arrived within 10 minutes and the soup was great. We also ordered the spring rolls which were great too. I would definitely come back for more.

The beef stew isn't what everyone else here made it out to be. It was more like a thick starchy soup (as in, some cook threw in corn starch or something like that) and but not extremely flavorful and beef-y tasting (like how a real stew should be). 

I also tried the grilled pork over rice - pretty decent. 

Nothing to really write home about, but nothing to hate on either. It's aite.

This is definitely a good second option for all of the east siders that can't make it to Chinatown for Vietnamese...

This is a true asian noodle shop...  much more focus on the food than the service.  Pho and spring rolls always tasty and come out quick, but definitely need to make eye contact with a server to get your check when you're finally done.

This place was terrible! They messed up our order and when I called to ask if they could correct it the man on the phone said "I don't give a fuck." And hung up on me. Terrible customer service. I'm a vegetarian and I believe there might have been meat in my food because I was violently sick. Probably food poisoning or meat was put into a vegetarian dish. Beware this place! Worst food I've had in vegas.

Good food & service. 

I was promptly seated, and given a glass of water. The food was hot & fresh, and did not skimp on the portion. My order came with soup and sauce for the eggrolls. Everything tasted great. 

Nice ambiance (with music), and spacious seating. Clean bathroom.
the 1 free drink coupon is only good for happy hr. did not explain well on the site, service is ok, food is ok too
I love the Pho here, always fresh and delicious. My favorite in Henderson. Friendly service too!!

It's definitely improved from several years ago! I stopped going to this place for a while, and after giving it a shot, I'm happy that they've improved... BIG TIME!

The food is good, prices are reasonable, service is good, bathrooms are clean, and the whole restaurant is fairly clean!!!

This is one of the go-to places for Vietnamese food for my family & I

I've been here many times, and each time I always think "Why do you keep coming back here??"  The service is *horrible* and the food is just okay.  They recently raised their prices, so I have less incentive than ever to come back.  The waiters always act like they are so annoyed to be serving you.  Last time I went, I ordered a pho with tripe, but there was no tripe in my bowl.  When I tried to tell my waiter, he just laughed.  I don't think he understood me, but instead of trying to, he just laughed and walked away.  Never going back.

Update: I usually order the white meat chicken pho, but the texture of the chicken isn't my favorite so I decided to try the dark meat chicken during my last visit. No surprise, I disliked it even more than the white chicken. Thinking they had good customer service, I asked the server if I could just have the white chicken instead brought to me on a side plate since I really didn't eat any of the dark chicken. The server's response was, "are you kidding me?" which threw me off a little. I've been going to Pho Saigon 8 on Spring Mountain for years and have never had this problem. If a customer doesn't like their food, you would think they would at least apologize or accommodate to their needs to make the rest of your visit better. I guess not here. Maybe I'll just get a different item from the menu. Sigh.

This new location is so clean and the service is quick. They're always filling your water and always grabbing dirty plates out of the way. Not only is the service quick, but the staff is also very friendly! They make sure everyone at the table is satisfied with their service. For their grand opening, they're giving their guests complimentary spring rolls which is very generous of them. I recommend bringing your family here as it is also very family friend! Lastly, the location is very convenient and near everything. Give them a visit and order their amazing appetizers.
In my top 5 places to eat Pho. Not number 1, but it is most definitely up there. The service is good and the seating is fast. I will come again.

Food was horrible to be realistic. It seems like they have never tried authentic Vietnamese food before. The broth for the pho was horribly bland and tasted packaged. Also, they served fish sauce with the eggrolls which is the equivalent of serving French fries with mustard instead of ketchup... Not normal at all. Save your money and time.

Ate here for dinner. Price is decent but serving is alright, I've ate somewhere where they have good amount of food serving for what they worth. Overall is pretty good. Pho is actually good except their Large is actually a Medium some other place. Will come by again for sure.

I guess it's little healthier soup base hence the blandness in flavor. rather go to Pho Thanh Huong on Tropicana or the other place down the street from this one. Little Saigon or the one over in china town even also called little siagon. more of the OC LS feel. I'm pretty glad I'm moving back on thursday, really miss good vietnamese food.
Good broth and excellent service. One of the best pho I have ever had. Spring rolls with pork was delicious.

This place isn't bad at all! It definitely has a lot of options in dishes and drinks. The pho broth is ok, but not as flavorful as another pho spot, but not terrible. This one at least had the tradition drinks of Avocado shake and Egg Yolk Soda.

I've been here in the past and it wasn't bad, but but last visit was the worst. Not only did I notice the attitude change, but those that were with me noticed that their attitude changed towards me when I came in my military uniform. Had some friends with me who were regulars too and noticed that they gave me less food compared to before when I did not wear my uniform. Not sure what the deal is, but they were either having a bad day or they are anti military. They weren't as friendly and avoided interactions with me.

Ordered beef pho to go. Was ready very quickly and very delicious when I got home :)
This is my favorite pho place they give you a lot of meet in the soup and it doesn't have a lot of fat, also thin slices. Overall 5 stars, the service was fast and easy, they were nice and the place looked clean

What's there to say they are great. Never had to wait that long from ordering to the end . love the pho best in town . will continue to enjoy there service and awesome food and dining. They are also very clean.

If you drink then this place is great for recovery food.  Have not found a better meal for the day after then this.  I went out 4 nights in a row and ate here 3 mornings in a row.  Had to drive a little ways but made me feel much better.
So we come here at least 2-3 times a week. My girlfriend and my son loves this place and we really enjoy the food consistently. Best Pho place in Las Vegas/ Henderson area.
Food is really great, pricing is perfect. Customer services needs a little more improvement and cash only is really annoying but I only care about the food really haha

The food is incredible. Best Vietnamese restaurant I have been to outside of San Francisco. Everything is fresh and the portions are generous. My favorite is the #12 and the vegetarian spring rolls. 

The service is fantastic. The manager came over and helped us decide what to order. 

Go here!!!!
Very good food. I will definitely be back here when I'm in the mood for soup and noodles. Great location.

There are so many Pho places in Spring Valley and I have tried about 8 of them.  Pho Saigon 8 is by far the best.  
To me the most important things about Pho is the quality of the broth, and I have to say I have ordered many different kids of Pho and the broth is always good, weather it be beef, chicken or mushroom broth, it is always yummy.  The spring rolls are huge, and also very fresh.
The prices are reasonable and the service is great!
I like the pho here a little better than Pho So 1. The tea tasted a little funny. I can make better french rice. So on an average I would say this place is good.

Couldn't give it a 4.5 so I gave it a 4. Of the Vietnamese food on this side of town their Phó was the heartiest ... most meat and veggies. Although,  you do pay a little more for that benefit. Pho done right is hard to mess up. They do it right.  Good attentive service.  I may be a little "westernized"/ "Europeanized" but I was a little disappointed that they didn't offer banh mi sandwiches.  But you can get just french bread. I also enjoyed the pork roles. 
 
Good little spot.

love this place!  Their pho finally convinced my husband of how delicious pho can be. This is the only pho place my husband trusts and its his favorite place to go for dinner on a cold day. The service is great, everyone is friendly and fast.  We have ordered for pick up and have done sit down service. Their raw beef, beef ball and chicken phos are our faves. Also enjoyed their spring rolls and egg rolls with lots of fresh veggies.  Great fish sauce btw.  Also their pho saved my life when i caught the flu. We did a lot of pick up of chicken pho that week!  Anytime i start feeling a cold coming on, this is my go to place and it helps me get rid of it.  Looking forward to my next visit!!
The ownership has made a major scale improvement to this place and the staff is always as friendly and lightning fast as ever. Quality of the food? Amazing!
The food was tasty, and the service great!!  Very attentive and friendly, and cheaper than pho Kim long.  Overall a great experience.

Very good pho! Clean place too. Only thing is they are quite short staff so it takes a long time for them to bring you extra plates or  forks that you might need. Opens early so we went there for breakfast.  So just keep that you have to wait a bit for stuff as they are short staff
Great broth! Very authentic with a ton of flavor! Great Thai tea as well. Service is fast and attentive. Usually busy but haven't yet had a problem being seated right away!
6/28/2017  Stopped in for lunch.  Great Place.  I recommend eating here.
The pho is ok. It's good but it's pho. The service brings this place down quite a bit. I'm not too picky but I don't like having to get up to find my server 3 times a meal.
Quick and friendly service! If you love spicy food, order #73 and add extra spicy paste they give you! Its really good! But I do wish that the bowls were bigger!
SUCH GOOD PHO! But the service and atmosphere sucks, so I only get take out. I get the #11 every time! So good.
Love this place! Their pho has that traditional home made Viet taste and very fast and good service. Highly recommended.

You are greeted when you walk in and sat at a table. 
They will then take your order. 
You will get your order within 5-10 minutes. 

Awesome!!!

BUT don't expect to see them again for the remainder of your meal. This is how most Vietnamese restaurants operate but this location does it much more apparently. 

There is a sign in front that says "please pay here." This saves the restaurant staff the closing step of service, which is to bring out your bill. 

I understand why they do this, however it makes paying the bill and leaving a tip a less personable experience. 

The restaurant is usually always busy which makes eating here somewhat of an experience but other than that...consider this a fast casual spot.

Best Pho I've found in Vegas.

The place is fairly nice for a Henderson strip mall. Decor is appropriate and tasteful, you'd have friends and family here; unlike most Pho joints that feel like a Vietnamese Robertos. Not that there's anything wrong with Robertos, it's just not a place you'd take a hot date. Saigon 8 is. Actually,  a "best I can get right now" date or "I'm feeling fat/unemployed" kinda date, but regardless, you won't be ashamed of this place.

The Pho is excellent. Standard pho gringo rules apply with Pho, stick with the Pho tai until you know what you're dealing with. Tripe is not for the unfamiliar stomach.  One amazing thing they do here that's apparently illegal in Vietnam: the veggie pho actually features veggie broth, and IT'S MARKED ON THE CONTAINER.

Also a fun game we play every time I call:
I say: "Hi can I have a Pho Tai and a Veggie Pho please? Extra meat and extra Jalapenos"
They say: "(Vocal Noises sounding mildly like english that may or may not be confirming my order.)"
"I didn't catch that, was that a Pho Tai and a Veggie Pho"
"(Garbles that may be English with incomprehensible accent)... 10 minutes".
"Okay thanks"

And my order has always been right over 10+ visits. Always extra Jalapenos, always extra meat, never any missing sides. This impresses me more than anything else.
Sorry. Just not my kind of Pho. The service was lousy, we waited almost 25 minutes for a bowl of soup. ?!?!

I think I'm writing about Vietnamese places too much, but I just love Pho.  I tried the beef stew here.  A bit more oily than to my liking.  However, it still had a good kick to it.  The Cha Gio (Egg Rolls) were a bit more crispy than Pho So 1's, but better than Pho Kim Long's.  I didn't get to try the pho here yet, but I did get the Bun Bi (Vermicelli Noodles with lemongrass beef and vegetables).  It's just as good as any other place.  The place is clean, the waiters are prompt in the beginning, but kind of forget about you later on.  Still, I didn't need much.  Too bad I can't give a 3.5 star rating, but I'll edge them out to a 4.
Really enjoy this place. This is my choice for best Pho spot in Vegas. Far better than the incredibly overrated Pho Kim Long on Spring Mt

Korean noodles served up cheap and fast across from LVAC and BodyHeat. What more could you ask for? The perfect amount of spice in the BBQ pork meatballs and noodles, and if there isn't, there's always sriracha or chili paste. 

This place has an enormous menu for the trying, but the first thing I wanted, they were out of. Credit card minimum of $10 so make sure to bring cash.

This is a nice, clean location with mixed service. The pho I ordered came out very fast, the other stuff we ordered was much later. My dad ordered a pork chop and we also ordered an appetizer, it was a good 10 minute difference between the pho and the rest. 

The food was good. My parents just returned from Vietnam and commented that the broth here was much more flavorful than what they ate over there. 

I feel the portions are decent for the money, my only request would be more tendon pieces with the pho. Everything was cooked well, my parents did not like the appetizer - it was a sausage wrapped in a spring roll. I thought it was okay. 

It wasn't too full on a Friday night, but the food was fresh.
Be aware,  the price just went up big , $1,50 to $4..more ! We walk out , not happy  ! Used to busy but 7pm dinner time  had 3 tables..! My salary not up 20% ..or more yet ! I think it s new owner  ?
I dont really know much about pho, but i thought whatever i ordered was really good. the service kinda sucked though.

I'd been wanting some Pho for some time and decided to stop one afternoon to kill my craving. The seating was a bit crowded, they were very busy and it was somewhat loud with the boisterous conversations but everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. Even though it was busy service was fast and efficient. I ordered the #44 Hu Tieu hay Mi Tom Cua (noodle soup with shrimp, crab and egg) and was not disappointed. I garnished it with the bean sprouts, basil and jalapeno along with some extra sauce to give it a bit more kick and paired it with some warm sake.
