I took my time enjoying the flavors as well as the atmosphere. I haven't tired many Vietnamese restaurants so I am by no means a  connoisseur but I will say I thoroughly enjoyed my lunch.

I love love love this place!  I practically eat here almost once a week.  Coming from a city where there was a lot of yummy Vietnamese food readily available, I was determined to find something similar in Henderson.  Pho Saigon 8 has come the closest to any I have tried...and trust me, I have tried many. 

My latest favorite crave here is the beef stew with wide flat noodles!  One thing I looooveeee about the soup is that you can taste the richness of the soup, meaning it took many hours to make it into its thick tendinous consistency, which is very hard to find in today's American money hungry culture!  (Less quality, more quantity).  ;-) 

But if you are a "Hendersonian" and is craving Vietnamese food, I'd suggest you to stop by Pho Saigon 8, right next to the LVAC on Eastern!

I have to agree with many of the reviews about this restaurant. Pho is great and love the spring rolls . Unfortunately everything other than the food is not impressive. I have been there several times (because I enjoy the food) and feel the same way about service not rude but very distant, ready for clean up and new customer to sit.
Food
Service 
Clean

First time here at the Rainbow location! Ordered Pho tai ( rare steak) and spring rolls. They also brought me a complimentary egg roll for coming in ! Everything was delicious!!! So excited to have good Pho on the southwest side of town. They serve beer and wine too! 
Great place. I'll definitely be back :)
All the dishes are pretty good. I especially liked bean thread noodles soup with chicken. Make sure you ask for the ginger sauce to eat with the chicken. It makes a big difference.

I think this is the best Pho place I have eaten at so far in Vegas.

I had the #1 egg rolls, and the lettuce and herbs were fresh cold and crunchy, while the egg roll was hot and crispy, wrapping the egg roll in lettuce and herbs and dipping in the sweet fish sauce provided a wide variety of delicious flavors and textures.

I also had the # 24 beef Pho that had a great beef broth, a generous serving of noodles, and was unusually hearty for a serving of Pho, though I did get the large.

My companion had the #76 which was a combo of many different things in the Pho, she has had more Pho from many more places and she said it was great.

The service was a little below average, come for the food, not for the service.  That's why I gave 4 instead of 5 stars.  I had to ask for a refill of my water multiple times.

Mostly Pho restaurants are all the same but what makes this restaurant deserving of a
5-star? Excellent service! It was Saturday afternoon and they were pretty busy but as soon as we were seated, we ordered food and in 5 mins food was ready. There were 5 of us and we ordered 3 Large Pho, 5 diff appetizers and 3 rice and bulgogi dish all ready in 5 mins.

Gave up with this place. My favorite dish here was beef stew. It was fine in the past until last two times I ordered from them. They got the cheapest and toughest beef that I've ever had. 1st time I let it go and thought maybe there was something wrong with their inventory. But this is the 2nd time I got this kind of beef means they decided to lower their meat quality. Will never come back.
Just as good as their sister restaurant in Henderson.  Great quality meat and broth for their pho.

Definitely my type of comfort food in Vegas after 3 full days of raging. I came here on a Monday afternoon, so it wasn't crowded at all. We quickly ordered our food and our orders came out in a timely manner.

Personally, the Pho here is decent for Las Vegas, but still nothing compared to home. They gave out a decent amount of noodles, but I wish they had given us more meat! Nonetheless, this definitely hit the spot for me because it had definitely brought me back to life!

What will it take to get this place to realize this is Vegas, you as a restaurant, survive on customer service!! Get it together, the waiter so so but Lordy the woman at the register was a Bitch. Never again will I give them my money

Pretty good pho in considerations of where it is geographically on the US map.
Been coming here for years every time I go to Vegas and the best spot for a hangover cure.

Service is quick all around from entering to exiting.

There are other pho places close by but I really like it here.
The service is quick and inexpensive.I t's very convenient when you want something quick and not terribly unhealthy after going to the gym.

I always order the combination pho.  I think they brought everything out in less than 5 minutes.  Maybe I've eaten a lot of pho my whole life and I cannot tell "good" from "great" anymore, but I come here every time because of proximity to the starbux, gym, and my appartment.  They have a nice selection of rice dishes too.  

Interestingly, they don't bring the check. You have to go to the cashier to pay, so remember your table.

Yes, I totally agree with Rachel D. in that it is a total challenge to find a decent pho place in Las Vegas.  It sucks that we from Hendertucky have to drive 20 mins over just to eat pho!! 

Anyway, the pho is good and oh-so much better than pho so 1 down the street. Less greasy and more flavorful!
I think it's probably one of the best pho in Vegas. Their broth is so good and rich. Ate here back to back after each night out.

Stopped here for takeout the other night and was very impressed! The lady who answered the phone was friendly and helpful (especially because I totally forgot one of the names of the dishes I wanted to order). The food was ready quickly and although we didn't dine in, the decor looked nice! 

We loved the spring rolls and definitely would go back for those alone! The beef pho broth was good, but I was really impressed by the vegetarian broth! It was so flavorful that I didn't even miss the meat!

A friend of mine and I went to the Spring Mountain Pho Saigon 8 this afternoon; we were very dissatisfied.   The service was very poor. The wait staff set us at a table with another couple and got our orders mixed up three times. I had beef pho and my friend had chicken pho. We were given only one side dish of bean sprouts and herbs. The serving size was smaller than other similar restaurants I have been to. The broth in both dishes was greasy and not very flavorful. Most disappointing was the fact that the broth while warm was not pipping hot like it usually is in pho. Won't go back. I am also going to call Las Vegas business license, the restaurant seemed like it had way too many tables, the back exit was blocked.
Best pho in vegas. Staff is friendly and attentive. Rare steajk pho is very delicious

When you're in Vegas and someone has a car, the obvious choice is to eat off-strip. Pho was the consensus. And so I suggested Pho Kim Long, the only pho place I knew in the area. That was quickly shot down. Dang should've known better than to suggest a pho place to Vietnamese people. LOL! 

Pho Saigon 8 was 3-4 miles from the strip; 15-20 minute ride with traffic. The restaurant was spacious; clean and bright with modern décor. The staff was hilarious and super accommodating! My friends asked for things I've never heard of for their pho and the servers immediately brought out the requests and in large quantities; some sort of herb, the fat from the broth and onions soaked in oil. 

My order of charbroiled chicken over rice vermicelli was so refreshing! Loads of noodles and chicken! Yum! Awesome lunch!
Pho is great here, best in Vegas !!! The Combo Stir fry pho is really good here, must try:)

Can't go wrong with the Bun Bo Hue with a lot of meat in it.  The dishes here are good but pricier than the Vietnamese restaurant in China town.  This restaurant locate in Henderson very convenient therefore you have to pay for the location but still fair.  They also serve fresh coconut juice for $4.95 per coconut.

What a bad experience. Never come back again. The server drop the lid of the chilly sauce. Oh my god,  she picked it up and put it back. So fu*$ ing idiot. It against health code. Come on, think about it...she can at least took it away and wash it. I had to complaint about it.. what a bad service... so terrible..

Terrible service and cheap. I ordered slice beefs and meatballs and paid additional to add tripe in my pho.When my ordered came, noticed only 1 slice in half meatball. Ask the waiter that there was only one meatball and he replied "there's 2 meatballs". So I showed him and said "there's one meatball cut in half, it's not two". He kept telling me that it is. I will not come back nor will my friends. They are so cheap in serving their food. Quality is bad and expensive for pho.

This is my go to pho restaurant in Vegas.  I've been coming here for quite awhile and they are always consistent with the flavor of their broth.  Most of the time I get the pho tai, which is sliced very thin.  The soup is flavorful and seasoned well.  

The chicken pho with white meat is also very good, along with their grilled chicken rice dish.  The egg rolls are also very tasty.  Whenever asked, I always recommend Saigon 8 as a great place for pho.

Their food is good and all especially their spring rolls but their service is horrid.

I may be the annoying customer that disliked where they seated me and asked to move but 1) it was right after they set waters down not like there was tons of food placed yet and 2) if their dining area wasn't so cramped and dark then the corner right next to the kitchen would have been okay.

And I may not have understood that Thai iced tea was not the same as their regular iced tea because the person who usually takes me there and orders for me was not there this time. And of course, I have to send the Thai iced tea back even though I had described to the male waiter that I wanted the "clear" iced tea.

But for the staff to so rudely express their exasperation with me was not just humiliating to me in front of the person I brought to THEIR restaurant but also very frustrating as a paying customer. The waiter who brought me the tea I ordered wrong literally argued with me that it was what I ordered and though I apologized and explained what I wanted, he stormed off to the front counter with it and threw his as about yelling the story to the other two waiters, one of whom always grunts and groans when you ask her for anything.

And yet I never did get the right tea until after my food came and I had to ask the youngest waiter there who is very nice and cordial. 

I don't care how good their food is, I don't pay them to get treated like an unworthy peasant while families of six or seven get star treatment from these despicable two servers. Will not be returning simply because they are so unpleasant to even order from and the girl is just there to text on her cellphone in between acting bothered by customers. Pathetic.

It's hard for me to find a different pho place besides this one. I love this place, not only because of their food and warm delicious bowls of grilled shrimp vermicelli, or soup with the greatest rare steaks, but also because this place is so clean. The dishes and the small little sauce bowls are clean, their chopsticks are probably the best disposable chopsticks I've ever seen at a pho place, and the spoons are also clean. Seriously, go here just simply because.

I live by little Saigon in southern California and we always come here when we're in Vegas. They have friendly staff and their food is great. I always order the bun bo hue. It's spicy and loaded with meat! The pho is great as well. They don't disappoint.

Had fresh roll. A little bland and dry. The Pho w beef brisket and ribeye was decent. Broth had decent flavor and portion size was well worth the $10. Service was very quick to deliver the food and slow to deliver the check. I think some people's complaints about rude service may be a misunderstanding of the culture and also due to a language barrier. But who knows. It's not overly friendly there but it's a strip mall restaurant and they're busy. I went in to eat and I got hot, decent food so I'm happy. If you're looking for a dinning experience that's going to change your life this isn't the place. If your looking for a decent and hot meal at a fair price then this is it. Definitely will be back. Only 4 stars because I've had better Pho but it's still good and well worth the price.
make sure u say the number correct they bitchx a me bc i said the wrong number and once i said i wanted something different they told me to eat  , good still good but the service sucks assss

Definitely one of the best spots in Vegas (Spring Mtn, near the strip) for pho. They have over 50 items on the menu. The beef stew with french bread is a good. The seafood pho is huge and tasty with tons of shrimp, squid, etc. Everything is about $6-8. I highly recommend this spot for some simple pho and Vietnamese dishes 1 mile off the strip.

Pho Saigon 8 has always been one of my favorite Vietnamese Restaurants. I am quite happy when they recently opened a branch closer to home at Rainbow and 215. I used to go to the Henderson branch at least once a week for lunch and when I do, I usually bring friends and/or co-workers since it's only a few minutes away from the office. We recently moved our office near the Spring Mountain Branch so I now take my friends and co-workers there. As a Fathers Day gift, my family wanted to take me out to dinner so I suggested that we go to a Vietnamese restaurant. Since Fathers Day was quite busy at home due to relatives visiting, we decided to go a day after. We decided to go to the one close to home, Rainbow and 215. I decided to order something different from the usual Pho Dac Biet this time. That's when the problem started. I decided I wanted to try some beef balls so I ordered #20 from the menu. The server brought me the wrong order, #22 which had no beef balls. When I told the manager (I think he was the manager because he was tending the register and was kind of rude), he stated that what I ordered didn't have beef balls. However, he'll just bring me some beef balls separately in a bowl instead of correcting the error. Since he was going to bring me a bowl of beef balls which is what I wanted, I said that would work, no problem. When we got the bill, this guy charged us for the extra beef balls. When I asked why, he stated that the beef balls were separate and I would have gotten a lesser amount if it came with my original order. It was very disappointing. I was trying to be nice and this guy had taken advantage. Our bill was $51.20 including the extra beef balls. My daughter works as a barista in one of the nice coffee shops in town and is a very generous tipper. She could have given them at least twice the amount of the beef balls in tips if not more had they taken them out of the bill. My son recommended to just pay the bill and not argue about the $4 or so beef balls. We paid and left without leaving gratuities. Not only that they lost a few dollars in tips, they also lost regular customers. Goodbye Pho Saigon 8. This was our last. There are plenty of Vietnamese Restaurants in town who are just as good if not better. Your beef balls were good though. LOL!

Wow! This has to be the best Vietnamese place I've eaten at! I had the grilled chicken and egg rolls with rice dish. The chicken was well prepared and had that nice grilled taste to it. The only thing I didn't like about the dish was the rice was a bit dry.

The thing that most impressed me was how fresh all the vegetables were. If you had pho, they gave you a dish of basil leaves with bean sprouts. Wow, I've never seen basil leaves so large and so green. Same goes for how fresh the bean sprouts were.

Definitely want to come here again when I'm in Vegas!

I ate here once about a year ago for PHO, it was acceptable. The service wasnt very good and they refused to do anything about a family allowing their baby to scream on and on. I wont be back, but its ok
This place always has great service along with making the food very quick. I usually get their #16 pho.

The people here are so nice and welcoming! My mother, sister, and I were seated right away. The broth was delicious and the cilantro and green onions added a amazing scent. Everything was cooked perfectly. I know I will be back!

Living in Orange County, I'm very spoiled when it comes to pho. We came here on a Sunday morning before making the long drive back home. It was over five months ago so I'm trying my best to recall the details of my visit.. Service was typical of a pho restaurant. We only saw the waitress when we ordered and when the food came. I remember the broth and meat being decent.

My issue with this place was the price and the waitress when I was placing my order. I believe it was $8-$9 for a large bowl (but their large was equivalent to a small/medium on OC!). I asked her if they had 'pho tuoi' which translates to fresh pho noodles (it's slightly thicker than the one they usually use). I had to explain to her that it's thicker noodles and she claimed that they do offer pho tuoi. When my bowl arrived, it was pretty obvious that they just gave me the thick white hu tieu noodles! Ugh, it already took forever to receive our food so I didn't even bother to send it back. I'm definitely never coming back here again. I should have known better than to expect good pho in Las Vegas.

Best broth in town. Family always gets the pho. I always get the wonton soup w/egg noodle and it's consistently the best we've ever tasted. Been to every pho place in Vegas and Houston. This place wins hands down. Always fast and friendly staff too. Fried spring rolls are a must have. I've been to their other locations on Spring Mountain  and the one on Rainbow. Again, flavor of the food, quality of the service are consistently excellent every time.

"I`m Pho-king hungry!" I make this joke anytime I know Pho is on the schedule for the day. Then I laugh. Then it's awkward. 

Anyway, I came here with my friend yesterday for some Pho. This is her normal spot and my first time here. I set one foot in the door the the lady had two menus in her hand already and asked "Two?". Yes, but when did you even see us?! Whatever. We were seated IMMEDIATELY is what I`m getting at here and that was just fine with me. We were brought water twice(as in TWO glasses of water EACH), which was a little odd, but I figured they just didn`t want to fuss with refilling our water? Who knows. I didn`t care much about that oddity. Within about 3 minutes they came to take our order and luckily, I always know what I want. Gimmie the Pho, number 11, the one with the rare cow that cooks in the broth. You know.  Also, a Sapporo, please and thanks. 

They brought my cold beer out pretty quickly but the glass wasn't cold(I know, I know. I like fancy touches, but still.) Sapporo as expected. Pho came out pretty soon after that with all the sides. I got a small and it was still pretty large. I love Pho and the bang for your buck that you get. Big bowl of broth, noodles(LOTS of noodles at this particular place), and some meat. I will say that there wasn't enough meat to satisfy my little carnivore heart, but it is what it is. The broth was AMAZING, which more than made up for the lack of meat. Add some lime to that bowl of broth = totally drinkable. So good! Some of the best Pho broth I have ever had. Noodles were..noodles. Overall, I would come back here. I found the service to be okay. They didn`t offer me another beer which was a little sad, but also helped me minimize my day drinking.

First time I went here last month, I thought this place was okay. They gave me too much noodles in the soup that I was overwhelmed. 

Second time, I LOVE IT. 

My boyfriend got the Pho Tai (rare steak pho) and the broth was perfect. My grandma was impressed with how clear the broth was (listen to the old asian lady, they know what they are talking about when it comes to pho!). I liked how it was not too salty but still flavorful.

I got the Bo Luc Lac Rice (shaken beef). The beef was tender and they did not drown it in sauce like some places do. The lady  recommended steamed rice but I opted for their red rice (i think it's tomatoes that makes it red...but I am not sure). Next time, I will do the steamed rice. 

Thai tea was amazing! Some places, the thai tea is too sweet. I can still taste the tea at this place. 

Service was nice. I liked that they refilled my water so much. Great selection of food. Will be back.

Foods pretty awesome.
Atmosphere is claustrophobic inducing though.
Combination Meat pho is lacking exotic meats though. Mostly just flank steak

Noodles cold and hot are great at this place!!! I tend to take anyone who loves noodles to this place. My kids love the noodles and we eat at this place atleast once a week. Fast service but the customer service could be more personable and friendly but other than that the food is awesome!!!

My boyfriend and I were hesitant on going here at first since they have branches all around town. We like local owned restaurants instead. We were nearby and needed something quick so we gave it a try. My boyfriend loved the broth. He usually doesn't care much for pho. It does taste different from all of the other pho places we've tried in town. Definitely coming back here, hopefully when it's not too crowded. (It can get really crowded)
If you are a Pho lover (like I am) this is a must try! The best Vietnamese sandwiches and Phö!!!!
My boyfriend and I look forward to eating here every time we crave Pho, it's definitely our go to. They're knowledgeable and speedy! Love it!

Really great Pho carry out! I was feeling sick and knew that some Pho no meat would do the trick. I called ahead and had my friend run in and grab it. It was all packaged separately and it was delicious. Looking forward to going back.

Food was pretty good. Portions were nice size as well. I only put 4 stars because I asked for no bean sprouts and they forgot I told them that. I just picked them out. 
Other than that they were nice and good service.

Always a very goid value for pho, got the vegetebale pho with rice noodles and a spring roll witb tofu. Very happy and excellent value. I am also happy, tgey do some cosmetic to the restaurant, this add some value . Will be back like i do since tge padt 5 years.

My coworker and I had more of the yummy #29 today for lunch. We also decided to share a #1, the Vietnamese fried egg rolls. They come served with lettuce to wrap them in, and a sweet chili dipping sauce. 

#29 was a hit once again, no surprise there. The egg rolls were delicious. Nice and crispy, pretty filling for the size.

I have had Pho just a few times.  Have to say, this place is pretty good.  I had the Pho Chicken Breast and Thigh.  Thick pieces of chicken, tasty, spicy, and price was decent.  Place is located in a pretty busy strip mall right off the 215.  Around lunch time, parking can get tough, but immediately after 2 pm it opens up.  The restaurant is a bit small and since it can get busy, you will feel a littled cramped. Still worth it since the food is good and staff is great.

The only good thing about this restaurant is the food. Other than that, I would never have a reason to come back. The service, timing of the food and attentiveness is terrible. The server never brought my drink. I received my appetizer and dinner 30 seconds apart. Dinner was cold by the time I got to it. I couldn't get napkins or a refill on water.

Its as good as it gets for Henderson.....lots of way better Pho places in Cali but I live in Vegas and this is as good as it gets for me until the next time my mama comes out and makes her Pho it at my house!

I always have the same thing...Hu tieu wonton, Pho Tai, Pho Ap Chao..
always good..nice clear broth, good flavor and they don't skimp on stuff like other places.
I did try the Bun Cha Hanoi once, big mistake...my mom makes the BEST bun cha hanoi so I thought I'd try theirs...well the skewered pork was tasty but the patties were awful!  There was no flavor to it what so ever!! Too bad, I was really hoping to enjoy that since my mom only comes out every few months to make her version of what my friends call "Lei Mama Patties". Oh well, c'est la vie...
I still love this place either way and am here at least once a month!

To all the people who say I should expect bad service because it is a Vietnamese restaurant, I'm sorry you feel that way. If I walk into a place to spend money, I shouldn't feel like a jerk for inconveniencing them. If you hate your job, quit. I work in a restaurant, too, and I know we all have bad days, but nobody should feel unwelcome when they want to spend their money and enjoy lunch. To put it shortly, the service was awful. We walked in and were sat, and before our menus were open the giant guy who sat us was already asking if we were ready. Not yet, guy. So he walks away, does a loop around the tiny restaurant, and 30 seconds later asks if we are ready. Repeat twice. Then, he got annoyed, sneezed into his hand, and never came back (thank goodness.) 

When we did finally order, I got Veggie spring rolls and bun with egg rolls. Spring rolls were yummy, no complaint there. My noodles though... soggy lettuce and warm noodles, eek.

My boyfriend ordered a pork stew over egg noodles, but what he got was gigantic chunks of pork fat. That's just gross. I took a picture of the scooped out fat... probably about 8 oz of fat and 3 oz of actual pork meat. I think most would agree that less quantity and more quality is preferable to more waste and less quality. When my food lovin' non-picky eater of a boyfriend barely touches a meal, there's an issue. Even he was grossed out by the bad quality.

I'll just keep going to Pho Kim Long in China Town. It's a longer drive, but at least I didn't get treated like I kicked someone's pet as soon as I walked in, and the food is fresh and yummy.

Second time here. My family tend to come here every year when we pass by Vegas on our way to California. I don't really remember the first time being here but I believe my experience was pleasant. However this time around the food and service was not the best. I ordered banh canh and there was barely any crab meat in it. It also took about ten minutes after ordering for them to the other half of our table our waters. Okay service. Decent banh canh but not the best. I'd come here next year again to try out other foods and see how they taste.
My girlfriend is extremely picky about where she gets her pho, this was our first time ordering from Pho Saigon 8 and we where very please with the pho & egg rolls.

Very good pho. Reasonable and fast. I comes to this location often but my last experienced was disappointing as they died not haver limes and there Broth did not seem as flavoursome as usual. I'm hoping this was a once off and will try again.

The wife and I have been coming here for over a year. When we first went the service was very good, friendly, and it felt like our business was appreciated. I don't know what happened but....

Out of the last three times we came the waiter (the same one each time) didn't take our drink orders, was very impatient while we were ordering, and my wife had to chase down a different waiter for water. FYI, all three times the waiter was that fat one that another reviewer found very rude/short. Speaking about the wait staff, did someone scare off all the female employees?

The strangest part is that food is exactly the same: fantastic. I wish Yelp would let us differentiate between the food, place, and staff as the food would easily get 5 stars while the staff (well, that staff that's left) would get 1.

It's very rare that I'd let the wait staff get to me as usually a return visit gets me a different waiter, but this place is so small that's not an option. Right now I'll just resign myself to finding a different Pho place.

Yum!

The service sucks.  There's one server who's super sweet and attentive, but anyone else will forget to bring you water, straws, napkins, totally ignore you after you get your food.. but who cares, it's sooo cheap and tasty!

I like the pho here, particularly the broth.... it, like most places, leaves you with that msg hangover (sleepy, overfull feeling lol).  I also like the bun, and bun bo hue (sp?), yummm.  I noticed that my last visit's pho had less noodles??  I normally can't finish a small, but I couldn't help but notice.  Maybe it's just me.  Egg rolls are alright, they have quite a few rice dishes in case you don't like noodles.  I love coming home from here wreaking of fish sauce!

xx

Was going here regularly until we discovered they weren't using veggie broth. Great soup honestly. Some of the best we've had in Vegas but we can't eat here anymore because we can't have animal broth.

I was so happy they opened up this place by my house on Rainbow. I used to have to drive to there other location in China town . Which I didn't mind because their food is very delicious. The service at the Rainbow location was fantastic everytime I go there. They are always on point! I love that they have wine there and saki. I normally order the beef spare ribs with rice and there egg rolls with lettuce. The egg rolls is so flavorful and always hot with a nice crunch. My family goes here minimum once a week! My son in law loves there Pho ! He says it's the best in town!! I will be a customer for life! Highly recommended!!

Best PHO in VEGAS.... hands down.

Don't go to the one off Eastern tho.  Broth was very bland.

It's ok but taste watery no flavor not really impressive. Service not all that .
Will not come back here .

Pho Saigon 8 is our favorite pho place.  We have been at all the popular pho locations but Pho Saigon 8 is our favorite.  We always get the pho tai and the broth is the best.  It is so savory compared to the rest.  The other places have a sweetness to it we don't like.  We also get the fried rolls which is awesome.  We use to go to the spring mountain location, but this Rainbow location is much closer and newer.  Best pho in town!

7 months ago, I left a 5 star review for this place. Me and my husband and family regularly eat here twice a week since the last 7 months. 

However in the last 4 times we came to eat here, I get a stomach ache at the bottom of my stomach immediately after and it last for up to 24 hours. This has been happening the last 4 times I've been there like I said. I am so sad and disappointed coz this was my favorite pho place. But now I have to say goodbye Pho Saigon 8. I can't keep coming back to a restaurant just to get stomach aches. 

My old review 7 months ago: highly recommend this place. Everything came out excellent. We ordered fresh spring rolls, pho with round eye and tendon and lastly pho with flank steak. I love how neat and clear their menu is and how they put a lot of pictures on their menu as well. Their bathroom was impressive too. Looked very clean compared to other asian/pho restaurants I've been too. Will definitely come back to this place next time I crave for pho.

The guys wanted pho and since I wasn't the driver, I had to deal with it. Yelp on an iPhone is about one of the best things invented. It directed us to a nice, clean restaurant that got high reviews. I didn't get pho, but everyone seemed to really like their soup. I tasted the broth and it was flavorful, not one of those tasteless, saltless crap, plus the meat they gave was a good amount, according to the person who ordered it. I got the bun (vermicelli) with beef. I immediately liked the fact that they gave me TWO little bowls of fish sauce. The beef was tasty and tender and they gave a lot of it. I'm definitely coming back here.

Fast Service if you order the Pho. Our food came in about 5 minutes after the server took our order.  The large Pho is about a small at other pho places, so order accordingly! 
Food was decent, nothing extraordinary, but the place is clean and close to the strip.

Came in for lunch BC I wasn't feeling well! I got here after noon so the place was very busy even for a weekday.  My order the small Pho with rare beef, brisket and added meat balls.

The sides of veggies and mints are really fresh here and my Pho hit the spot! I enjoy the Pho here BC it's always temperature hot and they give generous amount of ingredients. 

The service is spot on and they accept credit cards.

These guys are great for quick service! if you feel like take out or dine in, they will definitely get your order out quick and efficiently! Their tai tea is on point and is always a smart pick if you've got a sweet tooth like myself! I always order from there when I'm in need of something to fill me up and fast!

So let me start off by saying I'm Vietnamese. 

The good: they give you lots of meat in your Pho.

The bad: the broth was not very good. I'd give it a 3/10, it was cloudy, salty, and probably not fresh.

The really bad: the banh xeo here is quite literally the worst i've ever had in my -entire life-. Not only was the batter terrible, but it appears that they may have just pre-made the "shell" and baked it, microwaved some bean sprouts and shoved it in there.

My advice: go to Jenni Pho or Que Huong instead.

The only reason this review does not have a 1-star is because those are reserved for restaurants that give me food poisoning or are filthy.
My Favorite PHO place outside CHina Town, super cheap and tastes great even with take-out!

Busy...super crowded...not much service. I need water when I'm drinking pho---and no one ever came by to fill our cups, as they sat empty!

Not too pricey. Pho is decent. But just super crowded.

It's convenient, they have vegetarian pho and really good tofu spring rolls.   
The service range from efficient to retarded (just one guy who must be high cause or dropped as a kid)

Everyone is nice except the guy with the mustache who works there who had a death stare match with me.

(I won by the way)

Arrived in vegas to meet customers, and before hand just wanted to have something to eat at this place. Always has the best vietnamese dishes.

Very friendly, and their herbal tea served chilled are totally awsome.

Definitely recommended if you like vietnamese food.

Best pho place in town. I usually get the Pho Tai or the rice plate with the cubed beef. Their pho soup is really good. I'm not sure what makes their soup so much better then the other Vietnamese restaurants, but this place always hits the spot. Egg rolls and spring rolls taste very good here as well! I recommend going to this restaurant simply because the food is amazing. Customer service is above average as well. Unless they are full, they pretty much seat you right away.

I usually don't give out bad reviews but the service here was really BAD! My gf and I sat there for 15mins and nobody approached us NOT even for water. They took the orders of the group that came after us first and got them drinks before us. So we left. This was the second time that we experienced a horrible service here. WE WILL NEVER GO BACK HERE OR RECOMMENDED THIS PLACE TO ANYONE!

I pretend to be the Pho expert, because i've been around the Vietnamese noodle town once or twice...or a billion times. I would say this place was a great place considering it's location. I wasn't expecting much and i gotta say they impressed me. From the small detail of simply cleaning their vegetables beautifully to the soup that was not 85 percent fat, which is common among beef pho and it leaves an absolutely disgusting smell in your breath. I was expecting terrible and i received an okay experience. Not the best pho i've tasted and certainly not the cheapest (lord do they know how to rape your wallet)
If you're in vegas and want something other than alcohol, definitely go here.
Great Pho, loved it! Had a great time with a buddy who also thought it was great. will visit again soon I home!

I was there at 11:30pm  with my friends .. the food is excellent, customer service is wonderful,the waiter name Khiem always taking care our table and Lisa always come and say hello to us  make us feel welcome and relax... this is the place For me and my friends to hang out...Thank You for your service.

This place is my usual place for Pho if I don't want to go all the way down to the Chinatown area. Their Pho Tai is very tasty. However, last night as I ordered the Vietnamese Egg Rolls, I noticed a gnat on the lettuce. It grossed me out a little bit. I know that these things sometimes happen, but obviously the lettuce wasn't just washed. According to the bf the egg rolls are lacking in size (he's comparing them to the Pho So 1 egg rolls). I think its decent for what it is and the price is reasonable.

I dig. Pho Saigon 8 was one of my favorites driving to Chinatown. I was happy to learn that it opened on restaurant road (rainbow blvd) and close to the 215 exit. It looks like they even take online orders which it seems like lots of places are doing it. Welcome to the technology world! 

The pho tai itself was decent. I like my pho broth to be savory and not sweet so this broth met its criteria. The egg rolls on the other hand were too peppery. Overall I think the pho is decent and service was ok (it wasn't during any meal rushes). I like pho because generally it's fast enough so that with two kids in tow it's not a long wait. It's a win win and glad that we have other options for some pho especially with the temperature dropping. Parking might be tough but it is restaurant road.

Busy lunch, on a sunday afternoon or otherwise, pho saigon 8 never disappoints. Today im having chicken pho with bean thread noodles. They are super accomodating with requests!  Love that. 

Everybody's hustling through the busy lunch and noone skips a beat. My only beef with the hustle and bustle today is the lack of napkins. Wow. Dont get me wtong, Im a fan of using my pants , but not even one when my food came. 2 servers said they bting some asap... Still waiting... Doesnt ruin my pho experience, this place is still the best in town. Mental note, Bring napkins next time.

When I lived in Vegas, this was my go-to place for a good bowl of pho. I lived alone at the time, so I rarely ever cooked pho at home since a pot of it can feed a dozen people. Vietnamese food has come a long way since I moved there in 2006. Pho Saigon 8 is one of the best in town. The broth is clear and flavorful, made with just the right amount of each ingredient. Some places botch the soup by adding too much of a certain ingredient. Clarity is a good indication of the quality of a pho broth. If it's cloudy, it's probably no bueno. 

Besides the pho, the other dish I usually order here is the Hu Tieu My Tho with the soup on the side. I love Hu Tieu, probably even more than Pho, and this place has the best in town. Nothing compared to my hometown favorites (Nam Vang & Da Lat), but it's the best thing I can eat when I am not at home. For those who don't know, Hu Tieu is another variation of Pho. It comes with noodles and meat. I prefer to keep the broth separated and eat the noodles dry. I sip the broth with each bite and it's quite a delicious way to eat noodles.

This is my go to spot when im craving PHO', its just so good:]
They have a good range of pho soups and they have the other rice and vermicelli dishes/bowls.  Really tasty. Great egg rolls! Service is fast as long as its not completely packed and the servers are pretty nice. Just dont get the thai tea because it will be a disappointment!! I ordered it and it came in this tiny plastic cup instead of the tall cup in the picture! soo not worth the 3 and sumtin dollars.

i would have to agree about the msg with one of the yelpers though, some but NOT all of their soups have extremely high amounts of MSG, the egg noodle soups i think/soups other than the traditional pho soup, i had one and oh myyyy never ordered that again!

 But overall i would recommend this place, if your looking for authentic Pho go here instead of "pho kim long"!

I would've given 5 stars because their food is amazing but I hate calling in an order and everyone I speak to always act like they don't understand English. Especially if the request is simple... for example, no carrots.

This is my favorite pho place in Vegas! I'm from Hawaii where I'd eat pho maybe once a week..... okay, fine. I'd eat pho at least twice a week. It was my favorite food for a couple of years and I was fixated on it. During that time, I tried a lot of different places and acquired a taste for what I like.

Pho is beautiful like that. While I believe there are objectively bad places, there is certainly no "best". It just depends on what you like, how your taste buds prefer things before it goes down.

Pho Saigon 8 is that perfect balance for me here in Vegas and I'll tell you why:

The broth! Amazing- perfectly balanced to me. Not too much anise, not too much cinnamon, not too dark, not too light, not too greasy, but just greasy enough to be comforting. I always order my meat on the side because when it comes in the broth is always gets overcooked. First I squeeze some lemon/lime on it, then into the bowl it goes piece by piece as I'm ready to eat it, but remember to add the rest of it before it gets too cold to cook it at least a little.

Ngo gai! But wait.. we'll get around to that.

Pho is a labor of love. My boyfriend thinks I'm crazy because I spend about 5 minutes after the steaming bowl arrives just customizing it. You have to find your ideal balance of sour (citrus), salty (fish sauce), spicy (sate, sriracha, chili paste, fresh jalapenos) and sweet (hoisin). Each of the elements are provided on the side and you add your own condiments. 

There's the whole part with the beef, but then there's the sauce to dip the beef in. I mix a little hoisin with some sate which you have to ask for (it's refrigerated in back). Sate is chiles ground with shallots and shrimp in oil, slightly sweet but earthy and spicy. It is my favorite way to incorporate the spicy aspect into my bowl of pho. I add citrus as I go, to change the flavor a bit, starting with no citrus at all. I always request Ngo Gai (picture included) which is like a kicked up more floral cilantro. It's incredible, although not typically used in pho tai. Thai basil is a must with it's refreshingly licorice-y flavor, bean sprouts add crunch. There's even textural variation throughout your bowl that you can adjust!

I can't say I've ever had the self discipline to order anything other than the pho here.. I give into temptation every time. I'm a big fan of Vietnamese style beef stew and Bun Bo Hue, but I just can't not order the pho! One of these days.. I can, however, vouch for the spring rolls which are good and come with lots of mint. The bahn xeo is tasty and more than an entree size, even though it's on the appetizer list.

A unique offering at Pho Saigon 8 is the soda with egg yolk and condensed milk. I haven't seen this anywhere else in Vegas, and it's like a custard soda. Just the richness I want after a light bowl of pho. Absolutely delicious!

We've done almost all the Pho places in town. This is not our first choice.

We went in on a Sunday night. It wasn't croweded, based on the speed of service, you would have thought it was the busiest time of the night. Very, very, slow.

Spring Roll is actually quite good. A thick penut sauce was very nice. That's about it. My Korean wife was not pleased with her Pho. We saved the meat for our dogs. 

They were even slow in getting us a check, and taking care of payment. It's if they really didn't want our business.

BTW, my three dogs gave the meat two stars. That's why I gave it that rating.

This place has been opened for a year now and the food is fresh and delicious. The service is very friendly and efficient. They deliver customer service the right way especially in Las Vegas.
We ordered late at 11 pm both the Pho beef/flank/brisket and #42 dry Combo noodles with the broth on the side. Excellent broth and delicious noodle bowls. Thank you for a pleasant experience.

So we went to take my sister for Pho for her birthday, and yes this was a highly recommended. We arrived and were told it would be a 10 minute wait for our party of six. About 25-30 minutes we watch them seat a party of 5 that came in after us. We spoke up before they were seated and the staff did not make it right, so we walked out with a very loud voiced opinion. We will NEVER I mean NEVER return and the business owners that recommended this place will be told. I'd also give less than a star if possible.

When my parents first moved to Las Vegas, they asked the cashier at our pizza place (shout out to Eighth Avenue Pizza in Southern Highlands) where he goes for pho. He was Vietnamese and they assumed he would know where to go. He recommended this joint and that was 5 years ago. This has become one of our favorite places to eat out. Get past the language barrier. The menu (as I have photographed) has plenty of pictures with good descriptions of the food. We pretty much get the same thing everytime: 2 orders of spring rolls (they come 2/order); large pho #18, which has everything- rare eye of round, flank, brisket, tendon, & tripe; and #78, crispy egg noodles with stir-fried chicken, seafood. quail eggs, and vegetables. Sometimes, I order #61, grilled slice beef with rice vermicelli. The food comes out quick and is delicious. The wait staff is hit or miss, which is why I docked them a star. The prices are reasonable- pretty much everything is less than $10. The portions are large. We always end up bringing home our lunch and have it for dinner, too. For $1.85, you can order an extra portion of soup broth to add to the leftover pho. We always enjoy our lunch here. We go early, around 11, because they do get busy closer to noon.

This is my go to spot for Vietnamese food Every time I'm in Vegas for the last 10+ years.  I have tried several other restaurants and find Saigon 8 consistent with their quality of pho. I usually order the house special (pho dac biet) with a side of rare beef, green onions in oil, pickled red onions, and a Vietnamese coffee to boot. It's usually my first stop into town before I check in and my recovery food after a marathon of clubbing.  If I still have room left over I order the three color dessert. 
By the way, I'm Vietnamese and can get particular when it comes to my native food.  It's a good sign when you walk into a Vietnamese restaurant and see a good portion of the clientele Vietnamese.  When I want to eat Vietnamese food in Orange County I got to Bolsa/Westminster and nowhere else and when I'm in LV I go to Saigon 8 off of Spring Mountain.  Why settle!
Really great lemonade, make sure to stir it. Amazing egg rolls. Wonderful pho tai. Friendly service at the counter and table. Eye contact and smiles. Good prices. It was just really solid.

Worst pho on spring mountain rd!!!! No sprouts, only two piece of tai in large bowl. Dry old spring rolls. Horrible customer service.  Had to chase down server. Hen yum was basically an uncut onion, not even sliced!!  On the plus side, at least the water didn't taste like it came straight from the tap
Really good Pho! The Spring  Rolls were really good as a starter and you get plenty of food for the price. Nothing fancy but just good Pho.

Came here with my mom. I got the pho with veggies and tofu, my mom got pho with flank.  It was pretty good! I am personally not a big meat eater so I'm happy they had the veggie choice. It was delicious. We also got spring rolls which were pretty good. 
It was pretty empty when we went around 5 pm so service was pretty good.
I ordered the seafood pho for pick up! The gentleman was very nice and the food was delicious.

Pho Saigon 8 is my bf's favorite pho place. So by osmosis, I guess its mine, too. He says they have the best broth. I ... can't tell. It all tastes great to me. All pho is good. I don't know. 

Everything else is typical Viet joint. Tacky decor, unsanitary-looking bathrooms, curt but quick service, portions are huge (big bowls of pho for ~$8). The menu is concise, standard Viet. They actually have stuff, too. We've been to other joints and ordered menu items that are no longer available. They haven't been available. They will never be available. What, you can't change the menu or something? 

One time, on a whim, we just tried the pennyworth drink. Had no idea what it was. It tasted like grass. Mental note: just stick with the coconut. 

As much as I mediocre-like this place, pho is always a great solution to a hangover. Cheers. 

* off the strip, non-casino
Very relaxing area. Nice place to eat and service is fast. Music is also very relaxing which is they always have the station at 91.5 smooth jazz.

My favorite pho in Vegas. This establishment has been here for years and has been recently renovated. The spring rolls are the best here, fresh and plump. The price has went up but still Good portions for the price. Staff is and service are usually very prompt. Friendliness by the staff is a hit and miss here but I'm here mostly for the food. 10 mins off the strip, past the main Chinatown strip. Rarely is there a wait here even during peak hours when the restaurant is full. I highly recommend this Pho.

This is my usual go to pho place close to home. The restaurant is clean, they get you seated quickly and the portions are fair. Make sure you take note that the pho prices on their menu are for the "large" bowl but by default they give you the regular size if you don't ask. 

They have the best taste and value fresh spring rolls (they have pork and shrimp inside) I've had so far in Vegas. Seems so simple but yet other places can't seem to pull it off.

This place is pretty much a get in, eat, get out and get on with your life type of business. The service interaction is fairly minimal (which I actually like in some situations) so don't expect any small talk. They bring you some water, take your order, bring your food and you pay yourself at the counter when you're ready. If you need something else just flag them down and they'll help you. It helps if you know your table number which is labeled but they generally know which table is yours.

Your best bet is to do your homework on what dishes you may want to try, then go in and order by number.

If you're into really thick and strong coffee, give the Vietnamese ice coffee a try. I'll try to post a video of it brewing - it takes quite some time to funnel its way down into the glass so you can dump it in your ice but it's worth the wait.

My biggest beef with Pho Saigon 8 is that their Spring Mountain location is subpar and inconsistent in food taste/quality.  I will however visit this location any day of the week.

PS- if you like pork chops marinated in fish sauce and grilled.. It's absolutely wonderful here. Another popular item is any of the bún - rice noodle (no soup) dishes. Be sure to try it with the sweet chili sauce!

I'm from the bay area and have tried beef stew noodle soup all over the area and since moving to Vegas, I needed my pho phix!  Thanks yelpers, for helping me find this place!  They make one of the best that I have tasted.  The broth is delicious and the beef meat to tendon ratio is great.  I will be back to try other dishes as well.

Visiting Las Vegas and need a Pho Fix? 
Tired of paying through the nose for flashy Casino Faux Asian food without authentic, down-home goodness? 

If you have a rental, venture up the strip and turn west on Spring Mountain (Circus Circus and Sahara, near Fashion Show Mall). Go about 2 blocks, and between Wynn Road and Decatur, you will find the asian shopping and restaurant district of LV. Vietnamese, Japanese, Korean, Malaysian, Taiwanese, you name it.!

Pho Saigon 8 is in this area. A large place seating up to 100 (25 tables of four). It must be run by the second generation, because it is clean, has quality decorative modern furniture, high ceilings, clean floors, computer POS terminals, and tasteful 18x24 art pieces of young Vietnamese women. Popular love songs, but no big screen DVD variety shows!

Their name implies they only serve Pho, but they serve a large array of typical Vietnamese dishes. Yes, Pho Bo (beef) and Pho Ga (chicken) ranging from $4.50 to $7.00; but also Hu Tieu and Mi (Pork or Seafood Soups with Rice or Egg Noodles $7.50),  Com Dia (Rice Plates $6.95 to $9.00), Bun (Vermicelli noodles including the popular  Bun Bo Hue, from $6.35 to $9.50) and deserts (3 types of Che) and drinks (i.e. Vietnamese coffee, coconut juice, plum soda, etc.)

The Pho was good, albeit the sprouts and basil were a little wilted. This is a pleasant atmosphere with pretty good food and acceptable service. Not sure what the 8 represents in Vietnamese. It might imply that the restaurant is run by Chinese, since 8 in that culture is good luck, and also refers to longevity, as in the popular myths of the 8 immortals.

They do have other food here...
But I keep coming back for the Phò.
It has always been outstanding.

Made to order, fresh, hot and served by friendly staff.
Food is good...but the service is just not up to Par.  They need to be a little bit more organized.

This Pho restaurant is ok if you are not able to go to CHina Town.  They are often crowded and the tables are too close together.

The Pho is pretty good and so is the BBQ chicken rice plate.  That sauce to dip the chicken in GOOD!

We go there when we dont want to drive to far.

I love Pho! When I walked in the smell hit me and I knew pho sure this was where i wanted to eat. The spring rolls should be illegal they're SO pho-king good! I knew I wanted to order the spring rolls but what else? I asked the waiter to bring me the customer favorite... I'm not sure what kind of plant or animal life I ate, but it was tasty!
If I find myself in Vegas again, I'll go back pho sure!!

NEVER coming back to eat here!!!
Hope the $13.75 is worth my monthly business and a bad review. 

Told her I wanted Phô Xâo Dón Thâp Câm which I've had at different Vietnamese restaurant. She pointed at #79-Phô Áp Châo Thâp Cám. I asked specifically if noodles are flat and cut in squares. She mutters, "It's same..same thing". Okay I'll get it. 10minutes later guy comes and drops it off at table and leaves. I waved at guy to tell him it's not the same noodles that I wanted. He said, u ordered #79! Yes but only bc she said it was same thing....And it's not! He then tried to explain that every place makes it different. Okay I understand that so don't tell me it's same thing if it's NOT, right? Well immediately I said, "can I see the menu I want something else."!He continues trying to explain and wasn't taking it off my bill bc "I ordered it". I finally said fine do whatever charge me but I don't want it.  I ordered #70. It was okay(5.5/10), definitely had better at other places. 
Now that I've read few other 1star reviews on here, 200% I will NOT ever eat here!!! It was on dirty dining for demerits, Yelper witnessed employees not washing hands, Yelper had hair and bug found in their food! Plus you raised the prices on menu I noticed. 

Here's my $13.75 of advertising for u!!!

Close to the house, I frequent this restaurant when in need for something not super heavy to eat.  Overall it is one of the better Vietnamese restaurants around my neighborhood.  It actually gets pretty busy at times since it's in the LVAC parking lot.  A fair amount of seating, but we usually get take out.  Check your order though because we have on multiple occasions received the wrong order, and let's just say they were annoyed with us and claimed we got it wrong.

We always get their fresh spring rolls, and they provide a generous amount of peanut hoison dipping sauce in the to go order.  The rolls are also fairly sizable.  Not the best I have ever had, but consistent and hit the spot.

I get the vermicelli noodles with the grilled pork.  However I always get it to eat the next day because they always cook their noodles to long, and they firm up over night.  The pork is flavorful and tender, but the naoc mam (fish sauce) is fairly basic. I wish they used more herbs, garlic, shallots etc to add some extra punch to their noodle bowls.

My boyfriend appreciates that they have the Vietnamese rice porridge (chao) on request, but I prefer his mothers.  This one doesn't have that much of a flavor to me, and I get bored eating it quickly.  He also prefers their pho here above a lot of places in the valley.  They give a large amount of basil and and limes on the side unlike some places.  He always gets the combo.

They have some good jelly desserts that are tasty, a bit sweet, but less sweet than a lot of other restaurants.

They are a good spot when you don't feel like driving further into China town. Although I don't feel I have been to a Vietnamese spot in Las Vegas that has totally blown my mind yet, despite the many selections that have been popping up.

OMG... I was totally shocked by the flavorful broth! This place is great after a whole night of getting intoxicated which is exactly why we wanted Pho instead of all those americanized asian restaurants in Vegas.  

I called my friend Thuy (one foodie to another) and she introduced me to this place...so thanks THUY!

i love having relatives that live in vegas.... i get to enjoy the culinary treats that are off strip, delicious, and without the unnecessary fluff that comes with the territory of being on-strip.  

pho saigon is no fuss, no muss delicious vietnamese food.  i enjoyed the rolls and a vermicelli bowl with both pork and shrimp, although they were a little stingy with the shrimp portion of the dish.  i was able to also sample my cuzzo's veggie tofu pho which was delicious and chock-full of vegetables.  

it is rather expensive for vietnamese fare, but the portions are large (even when ordering a small).  they have a lot of staff, and things come out quickly and hot!  

a downside, my cuzzo ordered a thai iced tea with tapioca pearls, and the tapiocas were hard as rocks.  they were accommodating though and offered to cook up another batch, but she declined.

The best pho in town !  I used to go to their Springmountain location , so it's the same menu.   Same foods , but with better service.  Eric, the manager, used to work at the other location, is always friendly.   I usually get the #15 , meatballs and rare eye round steak.  The beef stew w/ french bread is delicious too.  My girl recently ordered combo fried rice and now it's her usual outside of ordering pho.  It's got a great flavor with bits of chinese sausage thrown in .
      Their competitor : Lemongrass- pho :  broth is bland ,  very little meat
Very Tasty. I am so glad, I stopped. The vegetarian pho was perfect. The service was prompt. Even the veggie spring rolls were excellent.

We were all all hung over after a night of drinking and needed something to hydrate us. Soup sounds good. We pulled over to this pho restaurant. I had pho before in Portland and it's always the best cure for hangover. 
The moment we stepped into the place, already we were soaked in the aroma of pho. Definitely smells like it's worth staying. 
Our pho arrived and it smells awesome. The first bite was good but not as great as I thought it would be by the smell. The service was typical. Overall, it was just a good pho place.

I'm so irritated by this place. I was told about it by family and thought I would give it a try. I was sat promptly for just myself. I totally understand at these places especially for a party of one if your at a large table other party's are sat with you. The family that was sat at the same table had a young child with the loudest Ipad ever on. After five minutes and no servers coming by I got up and decided to order to go.

I ordered a chicken pho, egg rolls, a roll of French bread and Thai iced tea. When he told me the total I almost said never mind but I'm really hungry and craving soup. Fine f*** it I'll pay the !!!!!$21 dollar!!!!! bill.
I've never paid so much for literally the same meal I get every time I go to a pho place. That's how much it usually costs for two meals! 

So I sit down to wait....and wait......and wait. It's been 30 minutes from the time I ordered to go. I'm about ready to say never mind I want my money back. Me and another guy get up and are looking at the dude in the front like ughhhhh hello! He goes into the back and brings out 5 to go orders! Are you freaking kidding me?!?! So my order was just sitting back there?! When I ask for my Thai iced tea he grabs it out of the fridge with a bunch of melted ice in it. So that was probably sitting there for 30 minutes also. I got it home and it was just warm not hot like it should be. Egg rolls were soggy. Not crispy crunchy. So disappointed 

Food was just ok. Not any better than any other place. Not terrible. Just whatever. 

Also it was totally silent in there. Like no music. It was awkward no ambiance or vibe. 

NEVER GOING HERE AGIAN. I should have just gone to a place I had been before.

NEVER EVER GO HERE!!!! WORST SERVICE I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!!!!!!! I hate that I'm even wasting time giving them this review. I would give this place negative 5 stars if I could. We walked in and they seated us right away, however the waiter did not give us no menus & no water, the tables stunk so bad life old dirty rags,  we sat there for 20 minutes, nobody even acknowledged we were even there, we walked out...

I love pho.  Nothing beats a warm bowl of soup and Pho Saigon 8 does it right.  I really enjoy it here.  Only Pho So 1 & Pho Kim Long do it better in Vegas.  I eat pho often and I need variety, so this place is my number 3.

Only pho place I enjoy eating at in Las Vegas- I'm picky with pho (Tip: if the word Pho isn't in the restaurant's name, don't get pho.)

My family and I have been eating here for as long as I can remember. The pho here is great the majority of the time. There are some days when the broth can be too salty, so a star off for its inconsistency. Good sized portions and price. Won't find better pho in the valley.
While most places offer jasmine tea, they give this vanilla tea which I really enjoy.

With it being a Vietnamese restaurant, don't expect exemplary customer service..

Delicious chicken breast pho, Scrumptious delicious appetizers, no crazy hovering from the servers and an efficient checkout process with the cashier. Who could ask for more?. Plus the broth is the bomb!

Been here several times now and out of all the times I've never had a bad experience. 

I usually order two things. Com Thit Nuong and Bum Bo Hue. The Com Thit Nuong's beef has a bit of charr to it which makes for the perfect crunch.This dish also comes with the pho soup. So if you're deciding if you want soup or rice you should just get this cause it comes with soup. So you get the best of both worlds. To make the perfect pho soup it cannot be salty. It's literally a large bowl of bone broth. It should be very clear and tasteful. If it makes you thirsty, then there's probably extra salt.

I am a big fan of spicy soup. Especially with pork blood. I know it sounds gross, but don't knock it till you try it. This restaurant by far has the best Bum Bo Hue. What makes them different is they don't have all the oil in it. Most pho places that make this soup adds too much chili oil. So when I drink it alone, I can taste a spoon full of oil. The broth here is spicy and tasteful. They don't add too much meat where it over powers your bowl. The noodles is the perfect amount. Note: they do not make this in a small. If you get the large, you won't regret it. 

Pricing: it is cheap!! 

Parking - the restaurant is located in the same center as the 7-11 and Mcdonalds. There's plenty of parking. At no charge :)
Everyone would agree that broth in a soup is key, and this place does just that. Service is better than others. Price is on par with competition. One big plus is  that this place is always clean.
Had the beef pho. I forget if it was the number 11 or 12. It was very good. Some places have a cilantro overkill, but this place did it just right.

I've been here several times now and I think it's a pretty decent place overall. 

I really like their egg rolls and spring rolls. Both are yummy and the portions are decent for the price. The sauce that comes with both is really good. 

I usually get the pho with chicken and that is my favorite option here. Today I had the pho with beef and I didn't like the beef as much as the chicken. The amount of meat in all of the pho options is generous. My husband was on the fence about giving pho a try, but changed his mind when he saw how much meat comes in the bowl. The small bowl is a lot of food and I can't imagine who would be able to eat the large. I like that they bring out items to help customize your dish like bean sprouts, basil, lime, chili paste, and jalapenos. I love adding jalapenos and chili paste for a spicy dish.

The restaurant seems clean. The service isn't anything notable, but it isn't bad either. The food comes out quickly and drinks get refilled before you need to ask. I like the check out process as well. When you are finished you just go to the counter, give them your table number (a sticker on the turntable at each table), and they give you your total.

This is a great little place after the gym or for lunch. It is healthy and good for your diet, but also quick and good for your budget. Plus, pho makes you feel good in general. If you have a short lunch break, this place is great. I think this is the best pho place in town.

The food here is really good and the restaurant is quite clean too. I used to go to the spring mountain location but I moved. So you can imagine I was pretty excited when they opened up this location that was much closer. I would recommend you giving them a try. Their rice vermicelli and rice dishes can't go wrong.

Great service and super fast. I ordered beef pho less than 3 minutes later I had my order it was hot and very delicious. I was amazed since it was a full house. I will totally recommend this restaurant to anyone who has a Pho craving. I been to many Pho restaurants but this restaurant was just to fast love it.

Food was good. Unfortunately the servers act like they don't want to be there. And when you ask for a to-go container, you get an eye roll. Not even a thank you or have a good day. Sad because I liked the food.
2nd best pho in Vegas next to Pho Kim Long Fast service and the soup is always on point!

If you want a really good bowl of pho, I recommend this place. I ordered rare and well cooked beef pho. The spring rolls are really good too. 

I ordered wine haha that was a plus !

I've been to Pho Saigon 8 multiple times; there are a few pros and cons for me.

Pros:
- Generous portions of Pho for low prices
- Delicious, hearty broth; one of the better broths out of the Pho restaurants I've been to
- Delicious Vietnamese fried egg rolls and rice paper spring rolls
- Fast service 

Cons:
- Brisket is the only meat I ever order in my Pho and the brisket here is way too fatty. Each slice of brisket is over 50% fat. There's different kinds of fatty too but this one is ridiculously chewy. I spend more time dissecting my brisket than enjoying my soup. 
- Sometimes the bean sprouts they bring out for your Pho looks and tastes old and withered

Anyway, the broth is amazing. If you order your pho and get meatballs, flank steak, rare beef, etc. I would definitely recommend coming here. If you like brisket though, try Pho Little Siagon across the street. Such tender beef brisket!

Ginormous hearty bowls of pho! 

I used to frequent the location on Eastern and came here for the first time the other day. I'm a huge fan for the taste and quality of the pho.

- Open restaurant - plenty of comfy booths and tables for seating 
- Averaging $9 for a regular bowl of pho, $10 for a large bowl of pho 
- Beansprouts are clean, fresh, and trimmed (some pho places they're just brown, stringy, and gross) 
- Broth is flavorful and delish just like the Eastern location 
- You can order LEAN brisket! It's not fatty and the meat is just as soft! 
- Pho is filled with generous portions of meat and vermicelli noodles 
- Service was average - nothing extravagant

This would probably be my #1 recommendation for pho if you're in the Southwest area. I didn't try any of their other dishes or teas - however - for a delicious bowl of pho it's definitely worth the visit!

With the winter approaching Pho Saigon is a go to place for my family. We used to go here all the time and loved it. We stopped going for a while because we don't eat beef or pork anymore. Luckily for us they said that any soup can substitute the broth for chicken! The seafood which is our usual is already made in a chicken broth. The spring rolls aren't fried they are just in clear wraps which is different for me I wasn't a fan of them. The employees are always friendly.

Best chain pho restaurant in Vegas. Taste is closest to Home. This Eastern location is smaller and has a limited menu compared to the Spring Mountain location. -1 star because they don't have fresh squeezed orange juice or soy milk, 2 items I always look forward to at Spring Mtn location.

Our go-to place for good, non-overpriced vietnamese food in vegas! I don't know why people go to pho saigon, because there's no line here and I think the food is better! It's just a little farther drive down spring mountain rd. 

I've had the pho, vermicelli, and the rice dishes here and everything is good! You can't fail with whatever you order, so don't worry! I always end up caving into ordering the fillet mignon (bo luc lac) with french rice because I just can't say no to garlic! They make it better than the restaurants in little saigon in california! If you're a garlic lover like myself, you'll love this dish because the beef is drenched in so much garlic, you'll have enough to eat it with the rice too!

The bf ordered flank steak and only had literally one piece of meat. The rest of the time while eating he had to pull out the cartilage and fatty pieces. I got the chicken pho, chicken was rubbery and felt like it was frozen for a while. Noodles were hard and clumped together, and the spearmint and jalapeños were turning black...bean sprouts were fresh tho and water was good and perfectly iced.

okay, I went to eat at this place several times, and every single time, the smell of fish sauce on the table bothers me much, the service is okay, not friendly, I ordered the vermicelli with grilled pork and shrimp, the noodle is so cold that I had to tell them to microwave it again,
they put a lot of MSG into the broth that after finishing eating, you will have to drink plenty plenty of water, too bad

I have been to this place about 3 times now.  Place is almost always packed.  Food is great and service can improve.  It is good place to go for 1.5hrs lunches.  :) 

Fresh rolls are awesome here and so is the beef stew!
Everytime I come here service is superb, food is great, location is near my home. When they get busy is when space is extremely limited.  Overall rating is 4 stars
This place is awesome, food and service are excellent.  Recommend this to anyone. The noodle soup I ordered was hot and delicious

There is an extensive selection of Vietnamese dishes here, including different types of pho for cheap prices.  I was able to stop in here for a fresh, tasty bowl of beef pho with tender rare steak and a Vietnamese ice coffee on my way to the airport.  

As opposed to the bay area, this place is much nicer than the average pho joint where I'm from.  The furniture here is a rich chocolate brown color including the walls where matchstick bamboo roll up shades hang over the windows.  The table tops on dark wooden legs are a sturdy granite with green and brown shades.  Even the chairs are  unique with routered silhouettes of bowls of pho with chopsticks on the wooden seat back of each chair.  There is a nice selection of dark green foliage inside giving the restaurant somewhat of an exotic feel.

The service here is also attentive, friendly and good.  They will clear your table as dishes become empty unlike the average pho spot which waits until you're completely finished.

Great place for pho and spring rolls. Place is always busy and service is quick. Easy atmosphere and a decent Thai Ice tea. I seem to hit this place up at least once a week. Its also easy on the pocket too.

We've been here a few times out of all the times we've come to Vegas. This one was the worst visit. We had a table of 10 people. 9 peoples orders came and one of those 9 even ordered an additional plate of food. We finished all of our food and within the time we were all eating, we asked if the last order was coming three times and they said it's coming. It never came and we were already almost done with the food. The server came and checked if we already got the order and ate it instead of checking if the kitchen fulfilled that order already. We were already done eating so she just ate our appetizers instead of an actual entree. 

The bo luc lac, which is shaken beef was cooked medium rare and it was extremely chewy. The onions were raw and the rice that came with it was overlooked and hard, almost as if it was a few days old. 

It's been two times where they fill the water on one half of the table and not the other half.

Service = 1star 
Food = 3star

I'm not sure why this place is so popular.  My friend's friend insisted on going here before heading home from Vegas.  I got the bun with pork and eggrolls (standard).  Eggrolls were no good - soggy and lacked flavor.  It came with only a little pork as well.  My friend got spring rolls - those weren't very good either.  Some got the pho, which I did think tasted flavorful and good.  The small size was too small for my firend, though, which is why she ordered the spring rolls.  Peanut sauce was not that great either.  And another got this red, spicy looking beef udon soup.  I didn't try it, but she loved it.  By the time we left, there was a line of people waiting.  Oh, they serve Vietnamese coffee in those little metal strainers, which then drips into a cup of a ton of Condensed Milk.  They gave us cups with ice.  OMG - the coffee was so good.  It wasn't the usual Cafe du Monde, which has a distinct chicory taste, but way better.  Both my friend and I raved about the coffee.  Service is pretty bad, too.

Bun Bo Hue was hella good. Come here twice a week. Gave them 4 stars for good food. They lost one star due to horrible services. Service was so unprofessional and rude that I almost ask them if they want my business or not. If I didn't crave for the Bun Bo Hue soo much, I could just tell the servers to fuck off.

I love this place!  I always get the #12 large size and it's always fresh and delicious.  Really good broth, and the meat is sliced super thin and they give you a lot!  The noodles are on point too.  My order is always to my table in like 5 mins, and my water glass is never empty, just make it visible on your table cuz they can get really busy.  If you want a nice hot filling meal, come here.  I live close, so it's my go-to pho spot.

First time here, it was a busy place and the staff here are ok, not all friendly and willing to help though.

We were a party of 6 so we had to wait a few minutes to be seated no big deal.  Once seated it took a bit for a server to come over and take our drink orders, he was working hard and doing a good job.  

Once the food came we were on our own.  The food was ok, nothing special that would make anyone in our party run back to this place especially since they have several locations.

Like I said after the food came you were on your own.  If you needed more drink or anything else you had to try hard to get someone's attention and if it's not the right person, hence a guy clearing tables, he has NO problem letting you know he does not do that and he will be gracious enough to NOT let anyone else know your table is in need of something.  So you are left to try and catch the attention of a friendly person who will either get you what you need or let your server know.  

It is a busy place, most are friendly and try to help, the food is ok but overall and I guess it's hard when you are as busy as they were, keeping the place clean is a challenge.

Came here for lunch with the family and ordere the fried tofu appetizer, seafood fried rice, grilled porky vermicelli, and of course pho. 

The food was good and the portions were a perfect size. We ended up taking food home!

I've always come here with my family of 8 people and had great and fast service. Today I was so disappointed with the service. The server sit us and left. He then sit another table with 3 ppl after us. He took their orders and brought out drinks for them. I looked at him and he said since we had a big group so he going to come to us after. Wth does that have to do with first come first served! Then he just walked back and forth like he had nothing to do. I got so irritated and got up and left! 


Tonight I brought my family back because we do love this place. Peter, the manager was very nice and professional. He recognized me and came to apologized for the incident. I wasn't expecting for anything but he comp us some drinks. We will be back. Thank you Peter for the pleasant experience tonight.

Best Pho in town!  Took a friend visiting  from out of town and she loved it. She hated the places that I room her to in Colorado.  The broth here is hands down awesome.  Service is hit or miss but that's not why you go! Rare steak is my fav here!

I love this place. They have great service and they are very efficient. The food is amazing and very well priced. I have tried multiple locations of pho Saigon this one is my favorite our of all of them!

I appreciate good pho, but I rarely stray from the "safe stuff".  This place is pretty go-to when I'm looking for some hot soup and some fresh spring rolls.  I haven't tried any of the non-pho stuff, to be honest.

This place seems like it is always busy, but there are always tables opening up.  The staff works pretty quickly to get things cleaned up and usher in new customers.

Good and fast.  Pho was hot and well spiced.  Lean meat, no fat.  Grilled beef was very good.  
Had kids with us.  Nice fast dinner.

Best Pho I've ever had!  I've eaten here weekly for a few years.  Large 22 cures any ailment!  Always great fresh sides for the soup.  Best iced tea in town.  It's got Jasmine and a ton of other flavors I love, but can't name.  Their fresh French bread is to die for along with their always crispy, piping hot egg rolls.

Found this authentic Vietnamese eatery in the Chinatown area of Las Vegas.  Great find and recommended. They have a big selection of pho at inexpensive prices.  I got a small pho for about $8.50 and it was a huge bowl full of beef, noodles and broth.  Very tasty! The meal came with a huge side of fresh, crunchy bean sprouts and basil and a homemade Vietnamese hot tea. This tea was the best tasting tea I've ever had... Wish they sold it but one of the staff told me it was home made and didn't come in dry form. Many Asians dining there so that's always a good sign.  Next time you're in Vegas check this place out which is a short distance away from the touristy Strip.

Recently moved here from Hawaii and needed to find a pho place. This place is great! They give big portions that are sure to fill you up with reasonable prices! Customer service is normally on point as I can only recall on time of mediocre service. Highly recommend this place!
