Love the Pho at this place.  I typically get the shrimp and crab in pork broth.  I love the location since it is right by my house, and the prices cannot be beat.

Fast review for a fast restaurant!

 REALLY FAST FOOD! But good quality.

Veggie Pho has really good cooked veggies including Bok Choy. They are always friendly and have good service. Price is great and I know when I in a hurry I can still eat well. Please check them out!

Pho Saigon 8 was one of those random huge restaurants at the side of the road on Spring Mountain. In Chinatown, there are many Pho choices but...Pho Saigon 8 has the biggest signage. Hah. So, me and my sis got here on suggestion via Yelp. 

When I walked in, at first I thought it was like a cafeteria style. We sat, ordered, ate, waited for the check....like natural noobs. We seriously conversed and observed for a good 30 minutes to see if others were given checks. We then realized people were walking up to cashier and saying their table number. Needless to say, we felt stupid...cashier laughed it up also.

On to the food, we ordered spring rolls, meatball pho, and veggie pho. The spring rolls were excellent, fresh veggies served alongside these little deep fried packets of awesome. Always wrap them in lettuce dipped in sarachi, epic. The pho was extremely flavorful!!! The broth was savory and just a little hint of mint at the end of the taste which is exactly how I like it.

Service was extremely fast, streamlined by the ordering process which is a plus and a minus. A plus for speed but a minus for personalized service: seriously, my only gripe, otherwise Pho Saigon 8 is a lock!!! Try it!!!

Pretty good spot to get your pho fix.

Environment: similar to most Vietnamese restaurant, most people come here for a quick lunch or dinner. 

Service: most of the workers are Vietnamese. I wouldn't say they are super friendly, but they get the job done. We sat down quickly, they got our orders fast and brought our food out quickly. You then pay at the front cashier before you leave.

Food: the food here is pretty good. I got the spring rolls which taste good especially with their peanut sauce. I get the pho special with the tendons tripe and flank beef. Because I was really craving pho, i really enjoyed it. The broth was delicious and the meat was good as well. They also give you the standard sprouts, mint leaves, lime, and jalapeños. 

Overall, good spot to get your pho fix. It is in a convenient location, and you can eat quickly and get back to your business after.

Pho was okay, Spring rolls were okay, Service.. what service? We had to get our own refills on water, our check and did I mention they forgot our food? We sat there for twenty minutes waiting for one bowl of pho and spring rolls. Finally we went up to ask and there was our waitress busy eating and on the phone. I understand you need to eat but you're still working so either you find someone else to help us or do your job & put our order in, refill our water, and bring us our check.
The service as quick but waiters were all over the place. When you need something better ask quick and fast because these waiters are on the move! Other than that the food is great.

Really REALLY good.
Ordered the Pork flavored pho and it was delish. The broth was one of the best broths i've had. Service was super quick and to top of the great meal the soundtrack they had playing was some super old school pop and it was awesome. Can't wait to go back!

Best Pho!   Love this place noodles are delicious-broth is flavorful!  my favorite #11!   The basil, bean sprouts, jalapeño and lime wedges along with the oysters sauce and Sriracha sauce makes the meal to my unique taste spicy and yummy!   We have introduced Pho Saigon 8 to family and friends and will keep on coming back.  Restaurant is clean and staff is prompt.

Pho! Pho! Pho! 

This place is AMAZEBALLS. I absolutely adore the soup. The noodles are just right, and the location is close to a bunch of shops that are interesting to check out before of after you stop on. Relatively cheap Eats without the cheap after effects. I love how clean the restaurant is and how efficient the waiters are. Never had a complaint or had to turn back food. I frequent this place whenever I'm on this side of town.
Poor service in this resto. Wait staff looks like they don't want your business and cashier is texting. Food is decent just needs better service

Pho was good (broth was lighter per previous reviewer's comments).  Prices were reasonable.  Restaurant was very clean and service was a-ok.  I have nothing bad to say about it.  

Also, @Matthew C: though I've been known to have a similar opinion about LV residents' tastes, I thinks it's super positive to see restaurants opening that are not KFCs / Taco Bells.  I like to support any independent business trying to make it.

I've tried about 95% of all the Vietnamese restaurants in town so just wanted to note some distinguishing factors.

The egg-rolls are not as good as pho so 1.  They are smaller, less flavorful and not as fresh.

The pho broth and noodles taste as if they use less MSG than most other places which is a good thing.  The meat portion in their dac biet is about average.

They do offer the same wide variety as many other vietnamese places, one thing i do advise people not to order is there bun cahn sai gon #42.  Horrible dish, gelly like soup, and during the time i ordered it, the noodles were hard and not prepared properly at all.

San Francisco Bay Area transplant and it's some of the best I've ever had. 

Best Pho
We are here every week because we absolutely love this place. Affordable price, big serving, good tasting food.

Always a great place for some pho.  Service is fast and polite and the food is not greasy.  The eggs rolls and spring rolls are fresh and the rice dishes are always so delicious! The price is reasonable and definitely worth it. I've been to a lot of pho places and this makes it to the top!
I'm not really a Pho kinda guy.  But a friend loves the place so we went.  I had the pork chops, which aside from them being really thin were actually pretty tasty.

A great pho place that may leave you with Chinese Fast Food Syndrome, full when you're done, but hungry 30 minutes later.

I came during a very busy time for lunch, and saw a lot of Asian families here. This is a good sign. Like most Asian restaurant, there is very little to no service. Sit, order, eat, pay, out. 

The pho is good here. The broth is good, but the noodle is lacking like all the other places in town. In terms of portion, this place doesn't serve as big of a portion than Pho 87. Pho Saigon 8 is a little more expensive than other places if you do a comparison of price to portions. However, it is tasty for what you get.

The other issue with this place was I felt full after eating the bowl of Pho, but 5 minutes later I was hungry. I do have a big appetite, but I just got the case of Chinese Fast Food Syndrome, which all points to MSG. For me personally, I could care less about MSG. I could even eat MSG ice cream wrapped in bacon. But, for those concern about MSG, I'm fairly certain this place uses MSG.

This is a decent pho place. Very tasty stuff. Is it the best pho place in Vegas? Nope. But it should be satisfactory for most people.

Maybe it's because it just opened but my chicken was like super over cooked to the point that some part I couldn't even eat. I got the red rice with the whole hen. And I couldn't eat the flap part or some of the outside part of the whole chicken cause it's overcooked to the point that it's hard. And then my rice .. I usually love the red rice but it was so stale & just not easy to eat.
The pho soup on the other hand is pretty descent. Overall, I would like to come back maybe when they're not training anymore or something cause I couldn't even finish my food :(

We have dined at this location several times when it was originally occupied by Bon Jour Bistro and most recently by the American Grill.  We shared orders of Pho ga tang (chicken noodle soup served with cilantro, basil, bean sprouts, jalapeno and hoisin sauce) and cha gio (crisp spring rolls that you wrap in a piece of lettuce and dip in nuoc cham (Vietnamese dipping sauce)).  The basil was not fresh so I requested more and got what I asked for, more un-fresh basil.  The flavor of the pho was mild and the chicken was limited to a few shreds.

Good food, but awful service and the prices are higher than similar places. We were ignored by the staff consistently and even after literally waiving at several people who made eye contact still no acknowledgment. 
The staff members, while inattentive, were also dressed in clothes that looked unwashed.

Services is pissed poor. My friend already got his order, but I never got mine. Couldn't get anyone to take my order, every server kept passed by the table, just no one would stop to take my order. Will never go back to such pissed poor services restaurant.

Passing by this place to give it another try.. Not holding my hope up.. 

First thing walking into the restaurant, what's up with flickering lights? Are we in October hollowing hunted house already?
Don't like hunted restaurant!!

Services still poor, there are NO soup spoons on the table we were sitting at! I asked for it, of course, non came. I had to seek spoons from adjacent table! 

Then as we wait for waiter to get our orders, he expressed they had RUN out of basil for pho noodle soup!!! It is unheard of! Sounds like breakfast restaurant telling me they run of eggs and bacons at 06:00 AM as I just sit down in their restaurant.

Then we were out of cold water, I asked for more water. It only took 10 minutes for the water made it to our table after 8 other tables got their fresh water refilled!?!? WTF!?!?

Hunted restaurant!? No soup spoons, no waters, no basil for pho noodle soup!! Sorry, Pho Sai Gon 8 at Henderson, you fail again as customer services!

Food: very good
Service: very good, fast
Parking: lots
Inside : very spacious, 10 booths, 8 four tops, clean bright, 4 big screen TV playing sport. I have my fav booth that has a plug for my phone **smiles**
I have been here about 6 times now. Always half to to full odds customers. Price is reasonable.

Loved the soup! Good atmosphere and friendly compassionate staff.  Easy parking.  I ordered soup, spring rolls and desert.  Everything I ever ordered from this place was yummy.  I will keep coming back to this place for the foreseeable future. Possibly every pay day.

I'm so happy they put a pho place in this plaza!! It's so close to my house & a very convenient location for having lunch after the gym or after grocery shopping! 

I've only ordered takeout but both times were really good. I've tried different things on the menu like the vermicelli, bun bo hue, beef ball soup, & some rice dishes. All were very good. 

The only reason this place lost a star is because once when I went, there was a bunch of homeless people hanging out on the side corner. Didn't look too good. But it was the 1st time I went & since then there hasn't been anymore. 
:-)

Saigon 8 is by far the best pho place ever!!  My boyfriend and  I have been regulars there for about 3 years now.   I always take my friends or family that visit to saigon 8 and everyone always loves it.  They have the best pho Ive ever had and it is consistently excellent.   I usually get the fried spring rolls, fresh or tofu spring rolls and the white meat chicken soup.  Sometimes i branch out and order the beef pho, wonton pho with egg noodles or beef stew noodle soup.  I also occasionally order the korean bbq rice plate or another variation of rice platter.  I also like to end the meal with an iced vietnamese coffee with condensed milk. yum!  I must say Saigon 8 is one of our favorite restaurants in Vegas.  Its inexpensive and consistently delicious.

My go to pho spot. Broth is flavorful and consistent. My favorites are the pho with well done lean meat and the bbq pork rice dish.  I used to dine here pretty often but lately I've been getting takeout. The soup is packaged very nicely and just as tasty as when we dine in.

I've been coming here for the past 2 years. It is a great little spot for a great bowl of pho. The food is really good and the staff is great as well. In addition, when I order to-go, the food is ready at a good rate, without flavor or quality compromise. Awesome food and awesome staff!

Introduction:
I tried to come here at least once a week. The food is outstanding and so is the service.

Quality: 5/5
I usually have the #22 large bowl Pho. I seemed to never finish it, but it's so good that the small is not enough.

Customer Service: 5/5
Definitely awesome, the waiter and Waitresses are cordial and on point.  Usually, you don't get these type of services at a Pho restaurant.

Quantity: 5/5
My gosh, they are super generous with their meat portions. No matter what you order, it's guaranteed that you will have enough food to fulfill your belly.

Cleanliness: 5/5
Squeaky clean.  Again, another unusual experience you will have at a Pho restaurant. In a good way of course.

Atmosphere: 5/5
No matter how busy they are, everyone appeared to be organized and not running like a chicken with it's head cut off.

Tips: 
If you are like me, not a fan of the Ketchup fried rice, you can actually order regular fried rice. Which is super delicious.

we came here after a night of drinking. LOTS of drinking. in fact I think we were still drunk when we stumbled into the restaurant. I love pho, especially post-drunken debauchery. So I said forget the buffet, lets get some pho! Thank you yelp for sending us to this spot.

The night before we tried taking a cab to get pho, the place ended up being closed and we had to pay $20 for a freakin cab ride... ugh! so we were REALLY looking forward to this. and it did not let us down. The place was packed with asians, from what I could tell they were mostly vietnamese or filipino. 

I ordered the pho tai bo vien. The bowl came steaming hot with so much greenery on top it looked like a garden, lol jk. but that's good cus you know it'll be flavorful! The soup was really good and it came with lots of meat. My friend ordered pho tai with no noodles and the order came out right for once! 

we all enjoyed the pho. it was so good we wanted to order some to go for after the nights festivities! lol!  next time we'll try the rice dishes too! If youre tired/too broke for buffets and theres no deals for steak & eggs nearby, go get some pho at pho saigon 8!! :]

The Pho Tai was ok. The beef was chewy and the broth was ok. Maybe it was at the end of the evening and they've diluted the broth to make it stretch. The service was kind of slow but the server was nice and polite. The table was sticky and the utensils were dirty so we had to ask for new ones that didn't have dry old food stuck on the chopsticks and soup spoon. I will not be returning.

I feel like there must be an alternative pho universe here when I hear people talking about how this restaurant is so awesome and gives too much beef. I guess they've shrunk them down so much that we are made to believe we are getting more even though it's actually less. We usually go to Pho 8 or Pho So #1. All the Pho start at a large for $8.55. You can ask for smaller but it defaults at large. Business tactic I presume. Any other place you are given a small at a lower price and not the other way around. I always order #13, beef and flank. The noodles came out bunched up, as if they took it out from the bin and stuck it into the broth soup without giving it a light cooking. The last 2 times I came, I thought the broth was too cold because it couldn't fully cook my meat. This time it was hot. It's getting a bit inconsistent. I got a little turned off by some cream in my bean sprouts and spearmint leaves. They were polite and grumbled it must've come from the jalapeño. Really? I quickly ran to the restroom to check my forehead. Afraid my better half wrote stupid on it that morning when I woke up late. But they brought me another. It's just not normal to have cream in a Pho restaurant. But at least they gave me a new one. Whipped cream isn't a big deal but I was afraid it might be silicone or something. Asian restaurants aren't the cleanest in the world I hate to say.

As for the beef, you get the same if you order small or large. They just give you more noodles pretty much. I thought it could use a few more pieces given the large bowl of noodles. Normally I get beef on the side but it's pointless if the broth is not boiling hot so I stopped asking for it on the side.

There's really no favorite Pho place for me anymore. #1 has gone down ever since I heard they opened a second location and moved the cooks there. Now the soup tastes more fatty and oily. The broth here is not fatty or oily.

The Pho is excellent here. Being a Vietnamese and a fan of Pho, I am very critical about this dish. Pho here absolutely meets an exceeds my expectation. My sons is 9, and he also loves the dish and finished a whole bowl by himself.
The restaurant is very clean. The service is very quick and friendly. 

I am sure every time we go to Las Vegas, this is the place we will be coming for Vietnamese foods.

My boyfriend and I mistakenly ordered Pho from this location through a food delivery service and we noticed the difference in quality. We did not enjoy our dinner and the whole time he commented on how the broth didn't taste good and I had to agree. I tried to find positives but there went any. 

I'll stick to my local Pho restaurant that we frequent because we didn't like the food from this place.

I have been here few weeks and it's hit or miss.  Today, I was there for lunch and I ordered same pho each time I go there.  I can order small pho with extra noodles without extra charge which I learn it from one of the waitress who works there.  Unfortunately she wasn't working there today.  The waiter who took my order today saying he can't put extra noodles.  You have to order on the side for extra $2.00.  He didn't say it with smile either.  The food taste okay, but the service is not so good.

Great Vietnamese food. I've been to pretty much every pho restaurant in the neighborhood and these guys are the best bar none. The pho broth is deep and flavorful, and every other item I've had has been top notch. Do yourself a favor and stop in.
Dependable and consistent. I love pho and eat it in every season so I'm glad I have a place that I can count on.

On a hot las vegas day. I was craving bbq chicken and spring roll vermicelli with a tall glass of Thai Iced tea! I wanted to try another Vietnamese place. so I yelped it. And this was one of the popular one. I was in heaven!!!! OMG!! So refreshing. The bean sprouts, carrots, and peanuts  added crunch. The mint was soo refreshing!! I was sooo content. I must stop by if yr in Vegas!
Best Pho I've had in the valley. Every location is fantastic and the food is always consistent. Friendly service as well, will be back again and again.

In the last 2+  years, I never missed coming here every time I came to Vegas, sometimes more than once during a trip.  And let me tell you, I call Vegas my home away from home.  But the last time I was here, it was a big disappointment.  

We got here 15 minutes before closing.  Surprisingly we were not the last customers.  There were several people came in after us as late as 1 minute before closing.  However at the strike of 10:00pm, they promptly turn off the neon 'OPEN' sign.  

I don't know if the timing had anything to do with my experience, but the broth of the PHO was so spicy and off that neither I nor my fiance was able to finish 1/2 of it.  I was just grossed out by it that I couldn't eat another bowl of PHO for a good 2 months anywhere!!!!  

I blame Pho Saigon 8 for ruining my love for PHO because unlike before when I'd crave PHO every week, I hardly eat PHO anymore.  Giving it 3 stars is being kind.  I felt like my BFF had really let me down!
We love this place for both dine in and to go it is a little small but both my kids love their broth. You can truly tell a great pho house by the smell as you walk in.

I really like the quality of the food here. For starters, the egg rolls are delicious here. I remember my first time they would give s free egg roll, I guess they don't do that anymore, nonetheless still delicious. I haven't tried the spring rolls at THIS location but I have at the other location so I know I won't be disappointed. 

The pho, the broth, the noodles are all just a perfect blend when you need to fill yourself with something delicious with that homemade feel. I usually get the meat on the side, so I can watch the steamy broth cook the thin slices of beef. I LOVE this soup! Seriously, I absolutely love the feeling of warm, spoonfuls of noodles, meat and broth. 

Another one to try, the beef stew. It is served with a warm baguette. That is definitely a nice filler upper! 

If you're not a soup or noodle guy, they also serve rice plates. The thit muons is by far one of the best Vietnamese plates  in the city. 

The only downside is the wait can get hectic. I docked some stars because on the 3 occasions I have been, I've had a weird welcome (no greeting, no one to guide me to a table, so I sat myself only to be reseated?!) and a few inattentive servers. Other than that, the food is good, close to home & very well presented.

One of our friends was debating on what to get and the waiter was super pushy.  Our water glasses sat empty for more than 20 minutes and were never refilled despite the fact this 'female-dog' passed by our table several times.  She only came back to tell us that we needed to pay up at the register.  5 minutes later she comes by to give us our check. We weren't even done eating.
To make matters worse, I ordered the chicken pho thinking that it would be perfect for a hangover.  As I stirred the noodles around, a dead spider came floating to the top.  How authentic!  I nearly threw up.  Being that I wasn't gonna get any more fluids than from this bowl of spider pho, I fished the little guy out and took a few sips.  I would later pay for this mistake 1 hour later by spewing chunks not from my mouth, but from the other end. 

Moral of the story: If you want terrible service, complimentary bugs to go with your meal, diarrhea and worsening of your hangover, come here.

im giving it a 4 because the bun bo hue is fucking great. thats the only reason why i go there. i bring my own bottled water cuz I know im not getting refilled. uhm. customer serive throw that shit out the door. and I'm not vietnamese but for all the yuppies out there thinking your gonna get great service from a vietnamese restaurant, you might want to think again. the pho. not very good at all. but what ever. i give it a 4 because i get what i want and its inexpensive.

I have been here twice and had the same grumpy old Asian man server both times. 
I knew I was in the right place when I was the only white guy in there. It is always busy so that says something.

The food is really delicious and such big portions. You are definitely full when you leave.

I decided to take the wife and kids to broaden their horizons. It was an experience watching them look at all the condiments like the basil, lime, jalapenos and sprouts and wondering how they were going to use them.

I had the chicken and seafood pho, it was just as delicious as the first time I had it, with perfectly cooked shrimp and quail eggs floating around for a great rich touch. The broth is so flavorful.

The kids all had the chicken pho. They weren't sure how to eat it. I told them slurping was OK, just in here though..lol

My wife unfortunately didn't eat anything because the old man either didn't understand her when she said vegetarian and asked if they had rice noodles. He kept showing her items on the menu with chicken and just didn't get it.  So that sucked

It was a great experience for the children and I stopped someplace after for the wife.

Service is basic is all I can say. He takes the order, and drops the check off when you are done.

Next time, I want to find a place that clearly says what vegetarian options they have so my wife can enjoy with us...
Service took awhile on a slow day and because of the repetitive "having to wait for different items I asked for", by the end of my meal I forgot to take the food I intended on bringing home lol.

#18 Pho
- Rare steak on the side is only available in size Large.
- Broth was rather salty
- Decent portions
- slightly expensive at ~$7.80 for a Large.

Prompt service, typical of Vietnamese restaurants. 

Cash only!

...odd wire-transfer et al. booth at the front of the restaurant...

Large #20 (Beef, tendon, flank, and more...) $7.50

Maybe it was because I was hungry, but this is bowl of Pho was one of the best bowls I've ever had. I especially loved the green onions in the soup and the steak like piece of beef tendon. I've never had tendon so thick and delicious before!

The perfect stop in LV to recover from the buffets on the strip. We always get one large bowl each, one with raw meat, briskest and meat balls that you can dip in hoisin sauce and one bowl with everything including the tendons. My husband is a white guy but in terms of Pho (minus the tendons) he's becoming a native and this is a compulsory stop in Vegas. The service is really fast, so that you can quickly dig in. On the plus side, look around you, plenty of Vietnamese people and this is always a good sign.

It's a nice little spot that I've taken a few friends to. 
Cant go wrong with a clean environment and fresh food ;)

Four stars because of the service....its a good thing i don't care about that..but only because it's expected from an Asian establishment...Other than that it's good Pho.  I alternate between three different soups depending on my mood..always good..Ive never not enjoyed my meal. The broth is good..not the best Ive had, but its good for when my personal favorite Lemongrass across the street is closed for remodeling. Booo. You won't be disappointed here. Its a good choice.
Will not be back. Absolutely horrible, rude service. I would've given 0 stars if it was an option. It's dumb they won't let you order a small portion for carry out too.

Service:. Fast and efficient.  

Food: decent.  Broth was good.  Way way too many noodles for my liking, but perhaps some like alot of noodles.  Next time, I'll request for not too much noodles, as it is suppose to be a soup, right?
Iced coffee is strong and on point.  :)

I wish they had chili flakes.  I like spicy food but I'm not into the siracha or chili paste as it is just way too much sodium but dry chili powder would compliment pho perfectly.  Hard to find spots with it. Maybe I should travel with my own stash. :p

Will try again.

Tried the vermicelli (bun) here and it was terrible. The rice noodles were overcooked and mushy which pretty much ruined the whole dish, but the beef was also burnt and tasted like nothing but charcoal.

The herbs were fresh and the fish sauce was good, but those are pretty hard things to screw up.

Spring rolls were ok, not bad but not great either.

I don't think I'll be coming back here any time soon.

Guys, i just left the place. I ready don't want to say it but I have to warn people that this place are by far the worst place of all the Pho in United State. I feel so bad for not giving tips. But #@## , I spent $ 48.00 and the food was nasty. Well, except the water lol.

I was directed to Saigon 8 years ago by a friend of mine and have been going here every since! I recently discovered they are opening a location on 215 and south Rainbow next week so I am happy to say I will be a loyal customer at that spot as well! Best pho in town!!

By far the best place to get pho in Las Vegas. I have a 4 year old that at least once a week insist we go to eat here. I must say no matter if it is take out or eat in my wife and I have no problem with the request. We are very pleased there is now a location on are side of town as well.

PS8 for the past one year has the most consistent and best tasting Pho in Las Vegas. When I first moved the Vegas 8 years ago, I picked Pho So 1 as the best place to eat pho, but that place really went down hill about two years ago when they changed cooks. PS8 wasn't on the top of my list back then because they were very inconsistent with their food.

About a year ago, I noticed the food at PS8 got better and stayed consistently good. If you read my reviews before, you know that I always seek out and try new Viet restaurants as soon as they opened, but nothing came close or beat PS8 so far.

Beside Pho, I highly recommend the pork chop rice dish and the grilled pork vermicelli noodle. Their soda lemonade (viet style) is the best in town. They also accept all types of credit cards.

One more thing that I'm very impressed is the fact they haven't been on dirty diners list since I moved to Vegas and that is quite an accomplishment for an Asian restaurant. (LOL)

The waiter/tress were very helpful! They knew when to come and the food was delicious!!!!!

P.S. The food looked so yummy we just dove in! No picture!

Love the food. It's always great. Service is lack luster as soon as they have more than 5 customers but the food is so tasty that really it's not that bad. 

Pho is pretty basic but they have awesome rice plates!

The cadet hats that all the servers wear explains a lot about this place.  Maybe it's grandma working behind a built up wooden window inside the restaurant cleaning the basil for the pho'.  Better yet, it was the old retired Vietnamese solider working behind the cash register making our iced coffee.  The Pho' and iced coffee helped significant to cure the hang over after a night of clubbing in Vegas.  However the attire and attitudes of the servers are the highlight of the restaurant.  The broth was very flavorful and we thoroughly enjoyed it after being buffetted out.  Will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas and need a cure for my hangover from the night before.

Ordered spring rolls and a #16. My friend took me here to eat and it was my first time ever having pho.

I couldn't decide between a small and a large so I went with the large. It was a huge portion so next time I'm going with the small. 

Just a 3 star because the restaurant had a weird scent to it and it could be cleaner. Service was fair but the environment felt dirty, so not sure if I'll be coming back.

We came here 2 weeks after they opened.  Hoping this would be our pho spot on this side of town.  I was debating on their egg rolls for our appetizer, but didn't end up ordering it.  Since they're still launching their grand opening month, they offered us complimentary egg rolls.  I wasn't impress with them.  It wasn't so crispy and tasty.  It was more soft and overcooked.  We all ordered pho.  The pho broth here was more on the bland side or I would call it Americanize.  We definitely not craving it or anything.   

I prefer their location off Lindell and Spring Mountain better, even though the service isn't as good as this one.  I haven't been to the one off Eastern yet, from the reviews, it might be the one to try if I'm over in that area.

Same recipe...but different cooks makes the difference.

I'm Vietnamese from Vietnam and I must say the food here is decent, but the customer service is terrible. I've been to this place so many times since my family likes Vietnamese food and they have many other dishes besides pho, so it's not a bad option for a large party. If you order food to go over the phone then don't expect them to make it for you beforehand unless you come in and pay first, or at least that's always the case for me. The last time I was there to pick up some food they didn't have it ready for me so I ended up waiting, and when they're done they didn't even bother to bring it to me while I was sitting in the front wondering why it was taking so long. The crispy noodles were not that crispy and I was very disappointed considering it used to be very good. I have had many bad experiences with the customer service I don't think I will return any time soon. Some of the waiters are rather rude. But overall the food is alright, I've had better.

UNBELIEVABLY RUDE SERVICE. If you want to be ignored completely for simple things such as water please eat here. If you want to call to ask a question and the person that answers yells at you please call here. Enough said. Can take my love of pho else where.
The best pho in town!! My girlfriend introduced me here and now we're regulars. Great restaurant, food comes quick and pretty chill. I love this place!

So far this is the best pho I have had in Henderson.
Was seated fast and the service was really efficient, no room for idle chit chatting but I am okay with that.
Pricing is pretty standard for the many pho places in town.
Broth was very good and the meat was tender.
No oxtail option which makes me sad, but maybe i just needed to look harder.
I didnt really need the spring rolls, but it gave me something else to compare with others.
Had a nice flavor as well.
Decor is nothing spectacular, but the place was clean.
Still have a couple others to hit before I can decide which is my favorite pho.

I come here during the summer when it's 118° just for their pho. Pho Saigon 8 has the best pho in Vegas.

I could sit and drink the broth all day long. The noodles are an added bonus. And a little siracha, a little sweet sauce, toss in some bean sprouts, basil and a few jalapeños and you're set. 

Very friendly wait staff, usually pretty quick with seating, getting drinks and taking your order. 

I don't know what I'm going to do when I move to LA!

This pho place is close to my house. I'm so glad I have a good pho place near by. Their spring rolls are delicious! I'm not a vegetarian and their veggie spring rolls are a must try! I was surprised how good they actually were. Their broth is pretty consistent in a good way. I usually get the combination pho and the fried egg rolls as well. I haven't been disappointed in any of those dishes and will continue to come here. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the older Asian lady is kind of rude other than that everything else has been great.

I'm Asian...totally grew up with pho as a staple in the house...so....I know my pho! 

ALL Asians on Yelp say that...but BELIEVE US! It's completely relevant and comparable to having an expert in PHO-logy giving you an expert opinion!!! 

With that being said...
I was pretty excited this morning when all of the family agreed to have pho today...but so disappointed that I wish we had just gone with the latter and went to a buffet instead...

So here is how this Pho-day went:

11:36am Arrive at Pho Saigon 8
Homeless looking man sitting just inside the restaurant door opens the door for us...weird...but ok. 

We are seated immediately...good.
*Restaurant decor...meh.
*Restaurant size...kinda small.
*Restaurant seating...elbow to elbow.
*Restaurant ambience...bland...just like the soup. 
We scanned the menu and hubs notices a taped piece of paper in the menu that says "Consuming raw meat may cause illness" or something along those lines...I see their reasoning for putting that I the menu...but that is hella hella discouraging and bothersome! 

This female server (probably in her mid-late 20s) was the rudest B!7H ever...idk if she knew how to speak English or she was just having a bad F¥King day...but REALLY?! If you don't like your job go work in some other industry! This is customer service slap your smile on and sell the damn restaurant!!! 

She took our order for food...she seemed to speak decent English so I'm not gonna blame anything on that...but when my daughter, her friend and I have to say "The number 3" a dozen effing times and you still don't effing understand that it is NOT a #30 and THEN get a funky@$$ attitude about it after I held my fingers up so YOUUUU can understand. You better be glad my ghetto@$$ didn't come out for real! On top of that she NEVER asked if we wanted to order any drinks...my husband had to yell at her from across the restaurant as she scurried away to do idk what! 

All of that threw me off so bad I kept saying under my breath, "I don't want to be here I want to leave...I don't trust the food that is going to come out after all that." But hubs wanted to just eat and run because football was on. So we stayed...ugh.

Our food came out at a decent time...no need to wait. My daughter's friend ordered just the vegetarian spring rolls for herself she was still hungry after finishing that and asked to order the "Vegetarian Pho"

CLEARLY labeled..."VEGETARIAN" on the menu but the second server that waited on us (who was much more pleasant) stated that they use chicken for their vegetarian pho broth... CHICKEN BROTH.,.in their VEGETARIAN pho!!! That completely defeats the purpose of vegetarian dummies!...keep away non meat-eaters keep away!

Finally...my own food...so so so disappointed that even my PHOto was sad....the large bowl here is more like a small bowl at any other pho restaurant in town...maybe even smaller! Their satay is red chili paste...not true Satay at all. They use purple onions in their pho....kinda gross to me because it gives the broth a flowery sweeter kind of flavor...i like red onions but I feel pho has absolutely no place for them. I had no fish sauce, or salt in the immediate area to fix the broth...and trying to fix something that should be so simple to make in the kitchen bothers me bad!

I'm going to stick to my own home cooked pho or if I'm lazy go to Pho Kinh Do for now.... This place was such a huge disappointment! 

I just read in one of the tips on yelp that they have a C grade?! Wtf?!? I wish I wish I wish I would have seen it for myself otherwise this review would have never happened! 

1 STAR for making the 1st server go away and letting the second server tend to us....(She and the fact that Yelp doesn't allow me to give negative Stars are the reason why you got 1 star from me.)

Btw...we ran into that same homeless man again an hour later only this time he was standing in the entryway of SF Supermarket just down the street and later being pursued by an angry cell phone wielding Asian man....makes me wonder what he was doing at the restaurant if he wasn't a patron.


I miss Pho Ca Dao in San Diego!

I ALWAYS stop by here before leaving Vegas. Nothing like a hot bowl of pho to end a weekend of indulgence. Honestly one of the best restaurant pho's I've ever had! We used to go to Kim Long but now I think their menu values quantity over quality... Pho Saigon 8 is the place to go for pho! Food- great! Parking- easy! Service- good! And there's never a wait.

I thought i was going to pho 8 for their crab udon soup but accidentally came here instead.  The crab udon soup was really good, thick broth and well seasoned.  Unfortunately their pho was only okay.  Broth was a little bit under seasoned and their rare beef was overcooked when it got to our table

This is the best Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas.  I love the "banh canh Saigon" and "bun cha Hanoi".  The food tasted so fresh and the staff was so attentive. The owner even gave us a free sample of milk tea...so delicious!

I went here on a Friday evening and I had the pho Tai  (with rare eye round steak)...broth was good. The filling in the crispy egg rolls was amazing and the sauce that came with it was light not too heavy which was good. The service was friendly and fast. Great experience over all!

Consistently efficient service, often getting our food within 5 minutes of ordering.  Our family really appreciates as well the consistently yumminess of the pho.

Personally, I get the vermicelli dish with grilled marinated pork and egg rolls.  I usually use just a bit of sriracha and this meal leaves me perfectly full as well as not walking away from dinner with a sluggish, food-coma type feeling.

Best pho place in Henderson and such a convenience being able to enjoy quality pho without having to drive all the way to Spring Mountain.

Food is good but no service at all ! 
Do not dine-in if you do not  like 
your dinner ruined by snotty and rude service. 
Every one seems miserable. I reapeat everyone.  
They forgot to bring my food out and when I asked I was 
did you order at all ? hey my companion is half way through
his I did not come to just sit and watch others eat their meals. 

I had to ask for everything twice as the first no one seems to care or 
pretended they do not understand ENGLISH.  
When finally done I asked for my check
and the waiter pointed  me to pay in the counter  
using our table number.  I told the register why no one could 
bring the check over and she rudely told me she could have brought it over if I asked her but hey why would I walk over all the 
to the front just to ask register to bring my check.  
After I paid she did not even gave me a receipt I had to ask for it. 

WILL NEVER GO BACK - I WOULD LIKE TO BE TREATED LIKE A HUMAN WHEN I PAY FOR MY DINNER !

The Pho here is pretty solid.  The service is fast and they are always nice.  I usually get the #14 small, which is the rare steak and tendon. YUM. This is a usual lunch spot for me and one of my dear friends.  She always orders a dish that is not Pho, surprisingly.  It's grilled lemongrass chicken with eggrolls served over noodles. It always looks amazing!

Their eggrolls and spring rolls are both delicious!  This is also close to my house so that's a huge plus.

This is a cool place to enjoy great noodles.

1.  Spring Rolls - Had the Vietnamese Spring rolls here and it was very tasty! The dipping sauce and taste was very nice.

2.  Pho - we had the chicken Pho and also a meat pho with brisket, flank,tendons. I thought the tendon was undercooked, yet it wasn't and it was delicious.

3.  Broth - I liked it very much. It was clear, and had a nice taste of beef with green onion. Very subtle to me.  After I got the tasted down, I did throw some chili sauce into it, so, that altered it afterwards.

4.  Ambiance and others - Very small and nice, always crowded, and it a place where parking can be a challenge due to the large LVAC in the same log.

5.  Service -The staff are all young and very service oriented. You pay at the cashier and I have no idea how they remember what everyone ordered to give you the bill, yet they do!

I do love to have soda and they serve soda here in a can which is not as tasty to me as fountain and this means you will have to pay for refills......

Check this place out!

The food were cold from the broken rice (egg quail is super cold, probably they take out from the refrigerator ) . The beef broth from Bun Bò Hue ( spicy beef noodles) was cold as well and there is no taste as spicy as their description. There is a short hair inside my Pho (beef noodles) .  The fresh lemonade is just taste as raw water with probably 2 steps of lemon squeeze in. I got stomachache after having my dinner here. The food is really really baddddd !!!
Yum yum yum. This hits the spot when I need a pho fix. They make a great variety of things and they are all tasty

This is one of my favorite restaurants in town. The Pho is amazing and they serve several other dishes as well. My wife always gets a meat dish that tastes fresh off of a bbq and shares that with my daughter; a very tasty dish as well. Service is good and i havent had any complaints so far.

Food is not bad. I've been here quite a few times but today when I was eating their veggie spring roll I found a couple of hair strains in my food. YUCK! I almost threw up everything else I ate. It's probably an honest mistake but that's disgusting. I won't be returning. I like my food hair free thank you very much.

Review: Beef stew with egg noodles

Instead of staying at the casinos and middle of the strip area to eat, we decided to look up a high rated pho joint. We picked the right spot and the drive from the Venetian wasn't far compared to driving from SF to Vegas. 

Soup was very flavorful and thick which was awesome. Had beef chunks...a good amount of them in the bowl- not chewy or dry at all. The noodles were a little thinner than what I'm used to, but this is at a different area so I shouldn't fault that- chewy noodles and fresh. Also had a couple carrots in the bowl which was nice..it wasn't cook all the way through to where it was soggy and I thought it was just right. 

I always ordered the beef strew with egg noodles in S.F at the usual spot I go to and thought it was pretty good, up until last weekend. Pho Saigon 8's beef stew was so good...I can't subject myself to anything lower. 

Oh yeah....I went there a second time and ordered the same thing right before hitting the road and driving home. Again...it was awesome.

If you're not near chinatown, this place is a good replacement if:
You don't mind sitting on your neighbor's lap
Dirty tables in abundance
Service is slow, unfriendly, and sometimes wrong

But, it serves the purpose. Next to yogurtland so you can get a delightful treat afterwards.
A must for anyone looking for delicious Vietnamese Cuisine. Very affordable prices and they offer great variety in their menu. Great location, and service. My favorite: #21..Large! :-)

How does one ever choose which Vietnamese restaurant to go to when they are everywhere and their names are only differentiated by a number?  Because someone else must bring you there first, and that brings me to Pho Saigon 8.

A packed place on Saturday afternoon, a bit of a wait for our party of 7.  It gets a bit crowded by the front because people are waiting to be seated while other people wait to pay.  (Note: You pay at the register after your meal, so don't wait around at your table for the check 'cuz you won't get it.  Just remember your table number when you get to the register, otherwise you'll be one of those dorks who has to walk back to the table just to find out what your table number was.)

I had a typical bowl of pho with everything but the kitchen sink in it.  Accompanied with it came the standard fresh bean sprouts, Vietnamese basil, lemon, and jalapenos.  This place also provided some other leafy green to throw in, which is always a plus.  I don't mind the lemon, but sometimes I do like the lime in my soup though.  

Like all typical pho places, all the tableware is on the table for you to help yourself with.  However, this place only provides a limited amount of napkins, not the whole napkin dispenser like some of my other favorite pho places.  I can be messy, and my nose is constantly dripping from all the sriracha sauce I use, so I like to have an endless supply of napkins available for my disposal.  

Overall, a decent place.  Their menu is quite extensive, so you're bound to find something for everyone in here.  They even offer durian milkshakes, which is something you can't find or smell anywhere.  It gets crowded though, and to me, that's a good sign in a Vietnamese pho restaurant.

Update: 04/23/07 - Went back and tried their Com Ga Nuong hay Thit Nuong Cha Gio ($7.15), which is grilled chicken (or sliced pork) and egg rolls with steamed rice.  I replaced it with their French rice for a bit of variety.  I've been missing the five spice chicken rice plate from PPQ in San Francisco, so that's why I decided to try their version of chicken rice plate.  It was definitely disappointing!  No skin or much taste at all.  Service was blah, I had to ask for tea twice and it didn't show up until after my meal came.  By then, I didn't want my tea anymore.  I know not to try their chicken rice plate again.

Update! 10/10/07 - Brought some out of town guests for some pho and this was our safest bet for them.  I ordered 18. Pho Tai Nam Gau Gan Sach hay Pho Dac Biet (Small $6.35).  One friend really enjoyed the soup here.  He said it had a lot more flavor than some of the other pho joints he's been to, mostly in the South Bay.  We also ordered the 7. Banh Xeo ($7.50), also known as a Vietnamese pancake.  The crepe was lighter and crispier than the one I had at Pho Hung Restaurant, but it wasn't loaded as much.  It came with a mountain of greenery to eat with your crepe too.  You can't complain that they are being skimpy on the fresh veggie stuff, that's for sure!  The BF ordered 37. Banh Mi Bo Kho ($7.00), which is beef stew served with a small baguette of French bread.  He likes to get this a lot at Vietnamese restaurants.  Another friend was really impressed that they offered red rice too since she rarely sees that on the menu.

I'll up their rating from a 3 to a 3.5.

(I added pics of our eating in the business profile this time!)

Better than the other place. 
Just kidding.  
It's good pho for what's around this side of town. 
Most definitely will come back when I'm craving pho. 
Ordered a number 21. Broth was awesome!

The ONLY place I will eat PHO in LAS VEGAS because it's the BEST. I've checked out many other places in Vegas but Pho Saigon 8 is by far the best. I go there so often the servers simply ask me if I'd like #11. yep... And the jasmine tea is delicious.  They use the freshest vegetables and everything is very clean.  The service is super fast and to the point- but don't expect them to hover over your table the entire time. Ask for everything you need up front when you order. And don't forget to tip well- they work hard.

This is my to-go place for pho, and this place never disappoints! 

I appreciate how much parking this place has, and how inside can accommodate parties large or small. Service is average, they come, take your order, give you your food, and leave you to feast. Never have they checked up on us or asked us if we needed refills or anything. 

However, their pho is excellent! Especially during slow hours, their soup base is perfect! Not too salty, and they are really generous with the amount of noodles they give. I suggest getting a large for just 50 cents more. And ask for the meat on the side if you prefer your meat to be more tender and soft. The thin slices of meat cook really fast in the hot soup and gets really hard and overcooked eventually.

I had to bring my review to 5 stars for the sheer fact that I return here so often. It gets my weekly dosage of Vietnamese out of the way and I actually enjoy coming back.

I have tried many items and I plan to try them all.

Good service, decent pho. If you're around the area, try it out. They have a nice selection of offerings.

I stopped in Pho Saigon 8 for a quick bite during lunch.  They're located right off Rainbow and 215 and have plenty of parking.  

I know some of the reviews mentioned issues with service quality and speed, but my experience was pretty good all the way through.

I was greeted and seated right away.  The server immediately said that he would bring water over and to take a look if I wanted any other beverages.

I always go for the house special when I get pho.  I like the "everything combo".  They didn't explicitly list out such and item on the menu.  I asked my server if they had a house special and he said "I got you" without hesitation.  It was really nice to just be taken care of and let the kitchen make something up for me.

My combo pho came out delicious.  The "large size" serving was appropriate and they definitely do fill it up.  My only complaint is that I wished they had more variety of meats in my special combo.  The best part of this experience was that I was charged the regular 9.99 rate for my special order.  That was really nice of them.
Pretty standard menu and good prices. Broth was good but nothing memorable. The decor and service is ok. More of a eat and leave place. Like most pho spots. Overall good food.

This used to be our fav Pho place, even if its out of the way for us in Henderson, clean and new shop. Sadly the service is just bad. There is a "bigger" gal that works behind the counter, and has the "shoot me now, I hate my job" attitude. There is one lady who does get customer service and does a good job taking care of customers, but she is not always there. The Pho broth is clean, not greasy, and the noodle + protein amount is generous.  Prices seem a tad higher than most places in the Valley, but I dont think we will be going much anymore.

Had the chicken pho, fresh spring rolls and Thai tea. Broth was very good. Not too cinnamony like most places. Minus one star for not having any sandwhiches. I was really craving for binh ma... Also they didn't have the garlic chili sauce. Not sure if its usual to not have it but back home in Hawaii, we had it everywhere.

I come here all the time and I even tip the waiters really well. However, my friend ordered the number 58, which was disgustingly sweet,  and the chief cook  has so much pride that when we complained he would not exchange the food or give refund. Do not eat here. They don't know anything about customer service.

Was in dire need to get some hangover soup  "pho". Stopped by, ordered to go... Food was out within 5 minutes! Quick service is always a plus. The food is good. I prefer my spot in riversides flavors but this place was still good and hit the spot. The portions are large and they give you a ton of sprouts, basil, sauces when you order to go. I'd go back when I'm in the area again.

didn't think the pho tai was anything special.
it was really oily.
better than pho so 1.
I used go to this place a lot but not anymore. The prices went up high for a small amount of food. Soups are always mid warm to put any of cold sprouts.

Came here at a suggestion of BF buddy who said it was a good spot. It was nice and busy, but we got a table right away. 

My thing about trying places is a grabbing a pho and a rice plate. Solid actually. I liked my eggrolls in my rice plate particularly. Took a while to pick, their menu is pretty extensive and I appreciate that. More to explore each time..... Gotten bun also since the first time and it was also yum! I want to explore the non pho soups they offer. 

I prefer the pho broth at Pho So 1, but not the ambiance (see review- smokey). I think this is my preferred spot so far. Solid pho, plates, and bun. Atmosphere is basic but clean (is it just me or I smelled moth balls coming in?)  and the service is pretty friendly, attentive enough but don't expect a lot of checking up on you- wave em down and they'll come. Oh and pay at the counter. 

Coming back to t This is a spot I can take some of my friends who are slightly squeamish about hole in the walls...you know the type. Hahaha.
The pho here is really really good, lot's of meat in my yummy pho!  super love the peanut sauce of the spring roll. Always expect a crowded lunch and dinner.

Ok-for those who have never tried Pho Noodle soup, you need to!  Pho soup eats like a meal.  They serve fresh coconuts to go with their soup, and all ingredients are fresh.  Prices are very fair, and highly recommend!

I have been going to this same Pho restaurant for over 10 years, and the best thing about it, the flavor has never changed. Even with the second location on Eastern and 215, it has not lost its magic. The same owner, and great server and customer service. I always order #20 large with rare on the side, vietnamese rolls with their satay sauce. Mmmmmm.... Nothing but good. Soup base always rich flavored, meat freshly cut, and veggies also fresh. 
Ive tried many other Vietnamese restaurants, and if your looking for consistant flavor,  it is worth the extra drive if your going to Pho Kim Long, or Saigon 1.

Great customer service and delicious pho located in this side of town. My boyfriend and I have come in a few times (dining in and ordering take out) and they have always been consistent with their service and delicious Vietnamese dishes. We ordered take out tonight which was extremely fast. It only took about 15-20 minutes. We both ordered pho and egg rolls as an appetizer. Everything was made fresh to order. We especially loved how everything was hot even when bringing it home. Best part was that they also included all the veggies (like bean sprouts, basil, cilantro, etc) and different sauces (like hoisin, chili, and sriracha) to put in our pho. It definitely hit the spot since it's been really cold out. We will be back for sure.

I'm surprised this place has 3 and a half stars obviously they're doing something right , and I'll tell u what that is . The Pho . Me and my boyfriend had been here before and my first experience was pretty good. Service is never really good at Asian places lets just face it , we all know that . I think that once u have have had a good experience at a resteraunt you're always expecting the same . Thats definitely not the case here. First experience the service was actually good  & the Pho was really good probably one of my favorites I've tried and I've been to quite a few vietnamese pho   restaurants . The pho was ok last night not even that good barely any meat or noodles .  I tried flagging the waitress several times even as she was passing by me she blatantly ignored me as i was trying to  order some spring rolls which came at the end as I was almost done with my bowl of pho because she took it to so long for me to place the order for them . Had to ask for water which is one of my pet peeves when eating out . I'm giving two stars because I love the pho here probably wont be coming back though .

Another favorite Pho place. The food is delicious like all vietnamese places i normally order the fresh egg rolls , fried egg rolls and the pork and their latte.. love the food here its pretty good prcies is pretty cheap as well the only downside to the place is the staff is not as friendly as the other vietnamese places.. I would still recommend this place if you are near this place just dont expect good service..

The pho was GREAT!!!! The beef noodle soup my husband got was GREAT!!!! The service was decent. The food came out fast. The waiter was very dull, didn't smile but he tended to us quickly. In the corner in the front is where they kept the black tub to put dirty dishes. I didn't see any dishes in there (didn't really go close enough to see) but that didn't look very appealing. Nevertheless, I will continue coming here.

Hello to location number 3! Can you say convenient? Thank you for coming to the southwest! This restaurant is located right off of the freeway on 215 and Rainbow across from the Walmart shopping center in the 7-Eleven plaza. Inside is spacious and clean with plenty of parking out front. Service was good. Everyone was very attentive and our waters were never less than half full. Unlike the other pho restaurants the soup spoons and chopsticks are not left at the table. So if you accidentally drop one be ready to wave down a server for another one lol

Banh Canh Saigon - BEST in Vegas!! This is what I come here for always. I love the flavor and thickness of the broth with the long tapioca noodles. Bowl is loaded with straw mushrooms, shrimp, pork, and pork blood. My favorite! Will not disappoint. 

Pho Dac Biet - Good! Their broth is nice and flavorful. Definitely one of the better pho broths in Vegas.

Cha Gio - Perfectly seasoned inside. Served hot and crispy with fresh veggies and pickled carrots/radishes for you to lettuce wrap it with. Comes with nuoc mam for you to dip it in. TIP: If you want your eggrolls / appetizers to come out first make sure you tell your server that. If not the entrees will come out first.

Goi Cuon - Good

If you're looking for good pho in the southwest this is the place to be. Spacious, clean, and quick service. They have comfortable booths with like 6 big screen TVs hanging up all over the restaurant for you to watch while you eat. Will definitely be back soon for my Banh Canh Saigon fix.
Amazing food, service and atmosphere! Very clean and am so glad I got to stop by! Thank you so much for the amazing and fresh pho, coffee and spring rolls!!!!

Officially my new favorite Pho restaurant. Pho Kim long is definitely on my favorites as well, these two restaurants are head to head. So if you near by and like pho this is a spot you wanna check out!

I have been there 2 times in one week. That's how yummy this place is. 
The reason I like this place so much is because it is much more tasty than other Vietnamese restaurants I've tried out. They have a large menu so you have much to choose from. I only had take out, so I'm not sure how the service is other than take out. Try this place out if you like Asian cuisine. Man, I'm hungry now just thinking about it.

I come to this place often and I'm always satisfied. I'm a creature of habit so I stick with the chicken breast soup, it just doesn't get any better than that. I also typically get the combination fried rice which is absolutely phenomenal! The service is always good and your food is on your table in a short amount of time. What also drives me to this place is the affordability of it all. I like the fact that I can grab a good meal and not break the bank for it. And being that it's down the street from my house, this has definitely become my "go-to" spot.

I always find myself coming here whenever I'm hungry and want something that doesn't break the bank. I always say I'm going to try something new whenever I come, but I always end up getting the #31... chicken breast w/ rice noodles; You really can't go wrong with it. Lately they've been a little slow when it comes to taking my order but they never fail when it comes to bringing out the food quickly. I also highly recommend their fried rice... Just trust me, you'll looove it!! I've never gone to any other phô place and I'm honestly okay with that because this place just works for me! Lol. What I like about this location is that it's right across the street from the yoga studio I go to so its really convenient and the perfect place to come and grab a bite to eat after some hot yoga!

I've been here a few times before (years ago), and it was always good food and good service. 

Most recently, I had dinner here a few nights ago. We got here around 6 or 7pm on a Monday, there was no wait, it was fairly busy, got seated immediately. But a few minutes after that, the dinner crowd started to roll in. We got there in good timing. 

Interior still looks the same since I was last here. Nice, clean, asian decor. 

I am currently on a Slow Carb Diet (protein, veggies, legumes...at least 20 grams of protein at each meal) to sugar detox and reclaim my health. That day I felt sick, so this was the perfect place to go to that night. My usual yelp habit is to look through the tips and then the reviews. I'm so glad I scanned the reviews because I read Mel C.'s review mentioning Pho with Chicken Breast! Thanks Mel! I scanned the menu at the table as well, and that was the best option for me. I've been to a couple of other Pho restaurants and that's the first time I saw Pho with Chicken Breast on the menu! I was excited. 

There's a choice of a small or large bowl, I got the small. The small was a pretty good size, filled with more than enough noodles, broth and thick slices of chicken breast. There must have been 8-10 slices of chicken breast, which was more than I expected. Score! I can't imagine what the large would be. 

I usually enjoy the noodles, but this time around because I was sick and have been cutting carbs my stomach didn't do well with the noodles. I ate a few, but they were too much for me. The noodles were pretty thick as well.

Next time, I'll have to ask for no noodles and replace them with veggies. 

Oh by the way, you can also ask for egg noodles if you prefer. They had no problem switching to egg noodles with my friend's bowl. 

Service was quick! Our food was brought to us in about 5 minutes. 

Great service, no complaints and I will be back again!

Every time I go to Las Vegas, I always come here at least once with my family. This is the best pho restaurant in Vegas that I've ever been to. The service was good and the quality of the food was great. I really liked the bánh canh cua (crab udon) and they weren't cheap about putting in more shrimp or crab. I always plan on returning whenever I take a trip to Vegas.

I came here on Monday with my husband and his uncle. This was our first time coming as well as our last time. My husband ordered the banh canh tom cua gio heo (udon with shrimp, crab, and pork feet.) In the photo it looked so amazing! However when it came out, my husband swirled around the soup. No shrimp. No crab. And no pork feet. There was a thin slice of pork. My husband asked the server if he was given the right dish. The server responded that it was what he ordered. Hubby asked why there was no shrimp or crab or pork feet. The server said that the crab was broken up in the soup so it was not easy to see and the thin slice of pork was the pork feet slice because they don't give out the bones. As for the shrimp, there truly wasn't any shrimp so the server came with a seperate bowl with shrimp for him. It really didn't taste good. We are a bit picky with Vietnamese food, so we decided to never return.

I'm so happy this location opened just less than 5 minutes away from my house! The pho always exceed my expectation and as a promo for this new location, they're offering a free egg roll per entree purchase. Staff was very friendly and service was good. I love the fact that this location has TVs also!

One of my favorite pho places, and most reasonable too!  It only costs about $7-8 for a very large bowl of whatever you are craving.

The soup/broth is so delicious, far from flavorless and salty, this one hits the spot every time.

I have also had Many of the rice dishes too.  All visits are very satisfying.

If you have never been to an "authentic" Asian restaurant, I'll let you know that you need to send a friendly wave when you need something.  It isn't impolite, and is actually customary.  Keep this in mind when you need a refill on drinks.

As far as the food goes the pho is good. The broth is amazing. I've been all over this city and keep coming back here . I probably won't anymore because the customer service is lacking. Especially on the female side, the men are OK. The women seriously need to lose the attitudes. I don't know if it's a cultural thing but Wtf. Any who it's cheap. I guess I have to start searching for another spot. Food wise it's a four, but since service sucks it's an overall two . *** There is one nice waitress, she the youngest***

Synopsis : Customer service sucks/extremely rude/inattentive

My friend Matt brought me here for my first experience with Vietnamese food and it was delicious.  The service was great.  I was apprehensive at first going somewhere that was out of my element, but a couple minutes later I was happy to be there.  Food tasted fresh, hot and so yummy.  I loved it so much I took my mom.  She polished off her bowl before I did!
I can't wait to go back again.  Now who should I take, hmm?

Felt like another run of the mill Pho spots that's on any other corner. I ordered the #11 because I just like it simple sometimes with just the beef in my pho. The table we got sat to had a strong scent of mildew. Maybe it's from the rags they keep using.. but that's just a guess so it could be something else. 

The Pho tasted okay so I will give it 4 stars.. but didn't really make me scream wow. The noodle was cooked well. 

The place is a little cramped so make sure you don't bump into anybody on the way in and out.

I come here way too much and I love it way too much. 

This place has great Pho, Bun Bo hue, and Beef Stew with French bread. This place is constantly the best place for those items and maybe other stuff too but these are the things I go there for. 

I have been here at least 10+ times now and love it. It is my go to place because they are consistantly good. 

service: it's an asian restuarant, service is never good, it is always about how fresh and good the food is.

Wow they are getting a bad rep, the pho is actually good here. This stuff does not deserve thier 2.5 rating. 

I will agree not the best I have had but still good and definately worth going back. 

Tried a few things and the Bun Bo hue was hit and miss, first time soup was bland second time it was great. 

Service is usually bad but with most asian places its the norm, asian people go for the food not the service. 

One thing that was really good is the Nem (forgot the second word), ifs the pink meatballs that are not cooked (I think) with the raw garlic and chili in it. They serve it over vermacilli in one of thier bun dishes... that was good but only if you know vietnamese food. Bun bo Hue and raw Nem is not for the first timers. 

I would return again.

I was never a fan of Vietnamese food.  The first time I ever ate it was over ten years ago and thought to myself how I'd never eat it again.  I met my ex from Seattle and moved there for about almost 4 years and everywhere I went was a Pho restaurant.  After a while I came to fall in love with their food and only in Seattle.  I swore that there would never be another Vietnamese restaurant that can compare.

Today, mom decided she wanted to eat Vietnamese and thought what the heck.  I drove on Eastern, passed the I-215, and right by the Las Vegas Athletic Club was the restaurant.  

When I walked in, mom had already been seated and luckily there was no line.  Last time we were here there was a twenty minute wait.  It's a somewhat small intimate restaurant with so many tables and chairs so close to one another.  So many people talking loudly, and plates clattering, sipping their soup loudly made me wonder if this is actually what it's like in a restaurant in Vietnam.  Looking forward to the day I find out through hands on experience.

No time was wasted and I gave my order of a #70.  I forgot the name but there was white noodles, some vegetables, herbs, barbecue shrimp, barbecue thinly sliced pork, and spring rolls.  The sauce on the side tasted like a sweet fish sauce with carrots and other ingredients to hide the gross smell of fish sauce.  I poured that in my bowl and mixed all the food around.  I haven't talked about fireworks in my mouth because it's been a while since I've felt that.  But, we're gonna talk about that in this review.

FIREWORKS!!!  When I put the food in my mouth, I literally felt like I was in the sky with fireworks around me.  I can still remember it like it was just a minute ago.  Normally, I don't like to eat past being full, but this dish was just too good to not finish.  The combination of the pork, noodles, vegetables, and sauce blended well together.  Food Network judges talks about texture a lot and this dish is not just mushy noodles and meat, but had the crunch of the vegetables and spring rolls.  The different texture was definitely there and worked very well with this dish.

Mom ordered something with seafood pho.  It was also very well made with crunchy garlic sprinkled on top.  Mom added vegetables and herbs to it which gave it a playful texture.  Her pho was also great.  All the food was awesome which is why I gave it a 4 stars.  

It's just too bad that the servers were far too busy to give any smile to the customers.  They're all so serious and don't look very friendly.  I'm sure they're very nice outside of work but while serving my mother and I, we didn't get that welcome feeling like they wanted us there.  Sure, they gave us water, took our order, brought out our food and finally our check.  That's all routine.  There was no *umph* to their service.  It was just eh and blah.

3 stars to the servers and 4 stars to the cooks.  I'm sure they were in a good mood to be cooking AWWWWWESOOMMMMMME!

Very good pho, bun, fresh rolls, spring rolls, good cold beer, very reasonable prices, decent service not much different than HCMC or Hanoi. Only difference is that chopsticks and spoons here are clean. Food is wonderful, great lunch and dinner, packed with Vietnamese clientele :-)
This place is the bomb, we love their pho and fresh spring rolls.  If my kids eat their food, it must be good.

Bad luck this past month on restaurants.  Pho Saigon 8 was possibly the WORST Vietnamese in Las Vegas:

Banh mi Bo Kho:  Vietnamese Beef Stew.  Thick, tasteless and bland broth.  Beef cubes were chewy and not seasoned at all.  What's worse is the side of French bread that it came with was a day old and STALE.   I told the server right away and he took it to the back without telling me a word of what he planned to do.

Pho Ga:  Ugh, could someone please tell me why yelpers are saying the broth is flavorful and yummy?  Far from yummy, the diluted soup tastes like boiled water with a splash of chicken broth and a little salt.  Could not eat half of this bowl.  

The only thing they had right:  Vietnamese coffee.  By the way, after we finished eating, 15 minutes later, the server came out with the replacement bread.   

Really?

I have been obsessed with Pho Lately, and my best friend and his wife live just around the corner, so I thought we should try it. I like it. The vibe is nice( decorations were great), the food is yummy ( they even have small and large sizes for the pho!) and not pricey. It was about $10 each with a thai iced tea. I liked the fact that they had chopsticks and spoons in a little fancy dispenser on each table, along with the sauces. The waiter didn't really check on us, and we waited a few minutes to get the bill and a takeaway box, even with the usual "turning around to find someone to help us" look. So that's what keeps it from getting 5 stars, that's all. Enjoy!

Overall decent pho place, very flavorful broth with the lean steak/meatball pho. Quality of the meat was good and fresh accompaniments. One of the better pho options for the Henderson area. Service was decent, no complaints. Was just slightly disappointed when they got my to go order wrong when we were finished. 4/5

Lucky for me , it was a raining nite and I found a parking space in the small lot mentioned... Unaware of another Pho ,place across the street, I decided to pop into this one for dinner with my cousin??? I see this place along the freeway, when I am driving back and forth up hwy 215, it was crowded, but we got seated right away, the food was reasonably priced, the food tasty and the service was not bad.. They had a few item on the menu that we don't see at most of the Pho  places back home in the bay area.. I was not disappointed, but maybe I will go across the street , next time I am in town to try Lemongrass Cafe..

The food is good for the price but the service this time was not so good. We waited over 5 minutes just to get menus and I had to raise my voice for some one to notice me and another patron who was already eating handed me a menu before the restaurant handed us menus. I hope the next time I go back the service is better.

I have been going to Pho Saigon since last year. It's pretty close to where I live and only a walk away from LVAC.

I usually order the same thing -- a small bowl of their number 18 pho. Service is generally okay. I usually get my food about 10 minutes or less after putting in my order. I have tried their fresh spring rolls, they're not bad, though their sauce could use some improvement. They also do to-go orders, but I'm not sure about phone orders.

Ambiance is like your usual asian restaurant, although no matter how many times I have been there, I just can't recall whether they had music or not. It's also good for family, they can push tables together to accommodate a large party, and I think they have a different section for larger parties too.

I wish they had some kind of promo or discount for frequent customers. I'll be back again when my tummy craves for pho.

My friends and I visited this place twice for our Vegas trip  and both times the Pho was great. Not sure if it is for a limited time but, when you come in and order, they give you free egg rolls...plus!!!

I feel weird giving this place such a low review considering how many good reviews this place has received. Maybe I'm just a bit pickier than most, or it could be that there was only one item on the menu I could eat and it turned out to be a greasy mess. Unfortunately it wasn't pho either since all of their pho is beef or chicken based.

It was probably my mistake for expecting to find vegetarian pho, which I've had in all the pho restaurants I've been in from Texas to California. I guess Nevada is the exception, despite the wide variety of vegetarian cuisine in Vietnam thanks to a large Buddhist population.

My review is probably only useful for those who are vegan/vegetarian. For all others you can probably safely ignore anything I have to say about the food here.

Completely tasteless broth... maybe it was water.

Go to Lemongrass down the street.

Very dissapointing.

This place is sooooo good, wooohooohooo from today forward this will be my neighborhood PHOvorite place to have my soup. It should be PHO you too. This PHOlace can be pack so plan your trip here, it can be very busy during lunch and dinner time but not bad you can be seated pretty fast. :)

This place is my go to when I'm trying to get soup or spring rolls real quick. I live pretty close by so that could be a factor, but the food I order is always good! If I'm craving pho, I know I'll always leave having satisfied the craving.

Note I said the food that I order because I don't really order anything else. I always get pho, spring rolls, or some type of vermicelli bowl. My usual options never disappoint so I keep sticking to them. If I'm getting pho, I always get #16 which has rare round eye, flank, and brisket. It is so yummy and satisfying!

I love the deep fried spring rolls. They might be called egg rolls, but I'm not actually sure. It comes with lettuce, mint, and pickled carrots and radish. I usually wrap one with lettuce and make a little burrito with the extra stuff and pour some of the sauce on top. You have got to try it! Sometimes that's all I'll order and I won't even share it.

It's a good restaurant, it's clean, and it's pretty cheap, especially for knowing your food will turn out right. Not everyone on the waiting staff speaks English very well. That never bothers me but I'm mentioning it in case some people need to prepare themselves for that. Be patient and understanding, and you shall have a delicious meal!

I got delivery for three items - cha gio, bun thit nuong cha gio, and a Thai tea. The time was a bit later than what they confirmed it for but not too long so that was ok. Fairly disappointed with the vermicelli noodles though. There was very little veggies and meat to accompany the mass of noodles. Not to mention not all of the noodles was throughly cooked. Some was still clumped together.

Two lovely ladies highly recommended we try pho from this place. We decided to have it for a late breakfast Sunday while in Las Vegas. Place was half full with mostly regulars and large families. Customer service is short and polite. 
We were directed to a table (they are numbered). Utensils and sauces are on table. It is clean and so are the bathrooms. 
Rice noodle soup with roasted pork and chicken with lime, mint, mung beans, and fresh chiles on the side. Pork was so tender and delicious. Broth was flavorful. Hubby had the large and he shared a small portion with me.
Ribs with steamed rice, and a few pickled veggies. Tender and juicy meat on the ribs. They were sprinkled with sesame. I enjoyed them very much. I was also served a small portion of broth. It was wonderful  (lots of ginger). 
Overall, I'd love to return and try a cold noodle dish with veggies and a fresh roll. There are about 50 choices and I would love to also try the coffee.
