I really wish I could give them no stars.  People beware when eating here.  Always check your food for hair and always check your bill when you leave.  We ordered fried rice and found a hair in it.

My main disappointment with this place was how they overcharged me.  My total was $45 and some change.  I paid with a $100 bill and got back $44.  Tell me does that equal a Benjamin?  Yeah, tell me that y'all deserve an $11 tip is total BS.  Man I was ready to slap a bitch.  

So, I go back to the register and tell the older gentleman, I guess the owner, that the young guy that rung me up gave me the wrong change and showed him the change I received.  The older man was apologetic and corrected the error and said that they didn't mean to do it cause it was busy. But, when I went to pay it had already died down.  The young guy that rung me up didn't even apologize that he did wrong and fkd up even as the owner tried getting his attention.  

If y'all are wondering if I left them a tip, the answer is HELL to the NO, would any of you after that stunt?  I simply just smiled and walked out.  

Since y'all hungry for tip here's one: teach your employees to calculate your customers' bills correctly.   Basic arithmetic isn't really that hard, you can learn from YouTube and I ain't got time for y'all's . To say the least I will no longer be requiring your services.  Bye Felicia.

Living in LA, I have yet to find anything that can compare to their vermicelli with shrimp paste!!!!! It's the best!!!! Every time I am here in LV, this is the first restaurant I will be!!! Thanks to whoever is responsible for the shrimp paste vermicelli!!!! YUMMMY...in my tummy!

The first time I came in we were seated immediately and got our waters within minutes of sitting. However, it did take a long time for someone to come and take our orders. There were two other parties that were sat after us and their order was taken and delivered before us. That part annoyed me because whenever we would call someone they would say "I'll be right with you to take your order" but we proceed to watch them taking orders from parties who came after us.  

Anyways, the food is really good! I ordered the #70 Vermicelli bowl with pork, shrimp, and spring rolls. Their sauce for the vermicelli was delicious! I have never tasted a good vermicelli before from other restaurants so for that it'll be my go-to place. Their green onion portioning are really small so it isn't as big/ regular sized as it is at other places. They took a while to refill my water during my last couple of visits so be aware that you will have to flag down your severer a couple of times. You would have to ask for the chili garlic sauce because they don't put it out on the table with the siriacha and hoisin. My fiancè's plate and mine came out to $23 with tax, not including tip. I like their vermicelli Bowl but their service are slow when they're busy.

I came here for the first time during dinner time and they weren't busy at all. There were probably 5 tables including us so we got greeted and seated right away. As we sat down our server was so quick to bring us our forks/ napkins, and waters. I'm amazed. The environment is beautiful and spacious. Within literally 4 minutes our server took our order, to me that's pretty quick and efficient. I ordered a large beef pho with brisket only. They don't have the brisket only option on the menu but my server was more than willing to accommodate me in what I wanted. My fiancè ordered the Sliced Grilled Pork with Egg Roll & steamed rice. 

We waited less than 10 minutes for our food and at the food window it looked like there was a manager overseeing the food being taken out so when my pho came out he asked the cook why is there so little meat and my server intervened to explain to him that I only wanted brisket. I really appreciated that a lot, the manager ensured my order was going out accurately. Then when it came to my fiancè's bowl it was semi-correct, instead of the steamed rice like he wanted they gave him rice noodles. We didn't say anything just because I'm that type of customer to accept what is given if it's a tedious mistake such as rice noodles instead of steamed rice. No biggie, the vermicelli was good anyway! Our total check was $22 with tax but without tip so it isn't bad for two people. This is a good late night pho place that remains open until 11pm so if you don't want to travel all the way to China town you have this place on Rainbow.
I like Pho here. Maybe MSG not add in, but delicious here and clean here. I love the food.

Everytime I go to vegas before leaving with a big hangover I stop by to have pho here it's way better then most pho spots in vegas I live in oc n this the only place that would be up to par for the rich flavors of the soup n served really hot not like warm like some pho restaurants

Sometimes, you just really want to have a nice, hot bowl of Pho.

Sometimes, the place you REALLY want to go to is closed, with no reason posted...so in those times, you go to your old standby.

Pho Saigon 8 is my standby. 

I've always had good food here, although the service sometimes leaves a little to be desired, as was the case yesterday.

I went with my boyfriend, best friend, and girl friend, and we were seated right away. 
When our server came by to take our order, my best friend said "Can we please have someone wipe down the table?  Its VERY sticky."
Server said "oh ok." took our orders and walked away...and did not come back.

A runner came out with the veg for our pho, and my friend said to this one: "Before you set those down, we had asked to have the table wiped down, as its very sticky."

She apologized, and asked our server for a rag...and was ignored.  So she went over and got one herself and took care of the table.  

After that, we had no problems 

The food quality was standard.  Not as good as the other place I wanted to go, but it definitely satisfied the weeks of cravings I had been having!  

I'll gladly come back to Pho Saigon 8.  Its not my first choice anymore, but it will certainly do in an emergency.

I'v been here many time, just now decided to write a review. This is one of my favorite places to go to when stuck with no where to go. I've always ordered the same thing...bun bo hue...can never go wrong. Just that the hot weather can make you sweat quiet a bit. Once in awhile, the pho special is my other goes to dish.

The service is very fast, not always pleasant...however, the foods always fast and the quality is great. Check in and out is very fast, this would qualified for fast foods with restaurant atmosphere.

I would definitely recommend this place if you are ever in Las Vegas and looking for a good meal and not burn thru your pocket.

Over all, the foods are good and in large portions. Prices are reasonable. The place is almost full most of the time, but we always get seated right away. Services are not exceptional, but just enough to get good experience.
Authentic food, clean, services are good. Price is reasonable. I'm pretty picky when it comes to food. Will come back.

I typically eat Pho when I'm wanting to eat "light". I get the grilled chicken small bowl and I like to think it's sort of healthy. 

The last time I dined here with my coworker we both felt awful all day. I couldn't eat dinner, I had trouble concentrating at work, nauseous, etc, etc. The verdict? Insane amounts of MSG. In fairness I am relatively sensitive to MSG but this is the worst MSG reaction I've ever had. 

The quest for pho with less MSG continues!
I travel from city to city and eat Pho all of the country. This was pretty good of the 40 to 50 restaurants I've eaten in this is a top five.

Service sucks! The noodle taste sourly today. A staff sitting on the table in the corner saw me raise my hand twice when I look at him he just look away. I had to step to the cashier to place additional order. I approached the lady using POS system, she point at another person I was like WHAT? She goes " go talk to her" wow really?! This place is never my first choice it's only I'm in the area. Will not come back here, ever again.
I would definitely say this is one of the better pho places I've frequented in Vegas.  For some reason, pho doesn't come as cheap in Vegas as it should.

This is by far my favorite pho spot in Vegas! I love the fact that they have vegetable broth which is my favorite I've had! Not many pho restaurants have vegetable broth either. I typically get the vegetable and tofu pho which is always delicious and hits the spot. I have this place like 2x a week. The staff is always friendly for the most part. This is my go to and love that it's conveniently close to my house! 10/10 reccomend!!

This place is great for a quick lunch or dinner. The food here is always delicious and always hits the spot.

What doesn't is their service. Usually the waitresses are rushing you, rolling their eyes, and just have an attitude. It's like they don't want to be there. Sometimes I question if it's the language barrier or not, but I don't think that's the case here.

Wanna talk about asian soul food? Try the beef stew at Pho Saigon 8. OMG its soo thick, rich, and hearty. It comes served with either french bread, rice, and noodles but my bf and i will always order all three LOL. its way too good to even waste a single drop. 

Okay enough with the obsessiveness. I have been to many pho shops in las vegas, little saigon, pho kim long, pho so 1 and it seems like the beef stew always comes out as beef soup. Its flavorless, oily, and watery. At pho saigon 8, you can tell the broth gets its richness from the cubes of beef and tendon and the sweetness from the onions and the carrots boiling for many hours. Since this location has opened, either one of us always orders this dish. But as usual the pho-, bun-, and the plate dishes are exceptional. The only reason why I give this place 4 and not 5 stars is because of the customer service, the waitress sat us at a dirty and sticky table and the server next came to refill our water. If you look at a typical asian family,  it seems like we care mainly about the taste/ quality of food only and less the customer service aspect. We have this 'dont bother me, dont check on me unless if i ask' kinda thing. But wiping down tables, and refilling water should be a must!
Great motha phoken pho yo ! Eat here for some great pho and sexy paintings of Asian women. I wish I can take out me some pho too!

Service 3/5
Food 2/5

Tl;dr meh, go somewhere else. 

Service was normal but I had the issue of huge a delay between my family's orders. We had 7 orders, 5 pho orders and 2 rice dish orders. There was a 10-15 min delay for us to receive the rice dishes. Our waitress was a bit rude, and like other reviewers reported they did try to rush us out even though there were no parties waiting.

Food:
pho with beef: broth was disappointing, it lacked any flavor. Meat was passable
Fried chicken and rice: chicken was dry and the French rice was very wet
French styled beef and rice: Beef was not tender and it was absurdly sweet.
Chicken and egg roll with rice: egg rolls were okay, the chicken was dry, but the rice was fine.

Side note: the parking lot is normally full so be prepared to park on the street or in another lot.
So sad to say but unfortunately, I will no longer eat here...they were featured on dirty dining and had a bunch of demerits. That must explain the stomachache I had the last time I ate there??

Servers sucks there I had  to ask for napkins, forks and spoons. I paid for a large bowl and 2 small bowls, the large bowl had the same amount of noodles as the small bowl. Disappointing. Going back to Annie Pho. Sorry not sorry!
I've been here several times. The staff is always friendly and your food is delivered in minutes. Great go to spot for a quick meal that hits the spot.

I ordered a chicken rice noodle dish and there was barely any chicken.  It was all
Noodles and the chicken was dry with no flavor.  They used to be a lot better.  I still think I like the pho but that's about it.

Comfortable spot for some quick pho.

Environment: The inside of the restaurant isn't anything special, but it is cozy. Seating is done quickly, which is most important when grabbing a quick lunch. The only thing I would say is that when we went there, there had been no music or anything playing which did make the environment a little change. It wasn't awkwardly quiet because the sound of all the customers talking to one another at their respective tables filled the air, however some type of music playing could have been welcomed.

Food: To start we got spring rolls, which were nice and fresh just how I like them. Dipping sauce was good as well. As for the pho, they had a nice sized menu with numerous options. I like the ones with a couple different varieties of meat in it so I could get one which combined flank, rare beef, and tendon. The bowl was huge and the flavor was good. Probably was not the best pho I have ever had but it can compare to other pho spots in Vegas.

Service: Service was quick and efficient which is what I would expect. Never felt like I was waiting for anything or that it was hard to get anyone's attention so I would say that I was satisfied.

Overall I would come here again if I were in the mood for noodles and in the area (especially since Monta closed, and Henderson has a lack of noodle spots in general), however I doubt I wouldn't put it up there with my real favorite pho restaurants which I would be willing to drive farther for.

This is my go to Pho spot in Vegas. I have yet to order anything else on the menu but I've had a variety of their Pho's. I usually just get the rare flank. Sometimes I'll feel adventurous and get the meat balls. Relaxing restaurant and a good staff

Definitely not the best pho I've had. Bowls were small compared to other places and priced higher. The Brother was not that flavorful and it wasn't as hot as it should be. The egg roll was thin and lacked flavor. The staff was ok. Not that helpful and the owner just stood at the register without a smile. 

I do have to say that their chicken and egg fried rice was good but would I come back? Most likely not.

I don't know if this was good because I was hungover af when I came in, but this was thee best pho I have ever had.

The broth though. How can I describe the flavor...it wasn't salty nor was it too sweet, but it packed a hell of a flavor. And the beef...omfg. Shit was tender and juicy. Not overcooked and dry like some pho restaurants.

Yeah...I def killed my small bowl #22. They messed up my order and gave me the wrong bowl at first (which led me to be the last to get food out of all my friends) but I'll let that slide because this pho was just so damn good.

(-) A "large" bowl of pho looks like a regular bowl of pho to me
(-) Pricey for the amount you get
(-) It was an almost-satisfying amount of pho in the large bowl. I'm going to be looking for food in an hour or two
(-) The Che 3 Mau dessert I got had green jelly that was still slightly frozen -___-

This place is meh. Nothing too spectacular.

On a Sunday evening, we ordered the LG Beef steak and lean meat pho and egg rolls for 16. 

- Nice place. Entrance is a bit weird but tables are clean. 
- Wooden chopsticks with pho. come'on now...
- Expensive. Man, you can honestly get a $3 large bowl of pho in Westminster.
- Large bowls are small. Go to Pho Saigon also on spring mountain. 
- Taste great. How pho should be. good broth + meat
- Egg rolls are smaller. Also go to Pho Saigon for bigger sizes. 
- Fast service. Pho came out first in less than 5min and egg rolls came out minutes later.
- Need to give more vegetables. lame..

We came on a Sunday evening and ordered
1. #12 Pho tai chin, 8.05 Large 
2. #60 Com ga roti, 8.05 
for $20

- Conveniently located right off the 215. 
- Legit Viet restaurant! Cramped seating. Waiter speaks Viet to take our order. Grandma serves us our meal. Pay at the cashier after you finish eating. The only thing missing is a sign that says cash only! haha! Love it! 
- Pho tai chin: noodle soup with rare eye round steak and well done lean meat
Steaming hot when served. Broth was good, but average. I liked how the well done meat didn't have a lot of fat on it. Need more bean sprouts and cilantro. 
- Com ga roti: roasted Cornish hen, served with French rice or steamed rice, 8.05
Delicious French rice. They made it crispy and dry enough where you can still taste the tomato paste and not soggy. The chicken was a bit burnt and quite small. They did give plenty of vegetable sides and broth side soup was a good compliment. Seems like the side soup is what they would use for their wanton soup. 
- Viets eat here so you know its good.
- It takes hours to make the broth of pho bc you have to cook the bone. Just because its fast, doesn't mean its old. It's marinated. 
- Prices are cheaper than others in Henderson. I think this place gets mixed reviews since it's Henderson and expect American style service. 
- Similar to Spring Mountain

Cheap filling eats on the strip if you like Vietnamese food. 

Their chicken Pho was decent, broth was good, but they didn't use just chicken breast ... so my Fiance and I had yucky looking pieces of chicken that just looked completely unappetizing. For a $13 bowl of Pho ... I would think they would only use chicken breast .... 

They brought out a lot of lime as requested .. some Vietnamese restaurants are pretty stingy with lime most of the time. 

They also have us a lot of Thai basil to put in our soup too. This was a plus.
My absolute favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas.  Always visit on my trips from Fort Lauderdale.  Friendly service, generous portions, a lot of menu items for all tastes.  Highly recommend.

I enjoy spring rolls and a bowl of pho every now and then. When I have the appetite for Vietnamese food, I just have to have it. The boyfriend phoned in a to-go order for me. We were told the food will be ready in 15 minutes. When we got there, we still had to wait.

Pho Tai: 
Nothing exciting to write home about. It was ordinary and slighly saltier than normal. 2/5

Spring Rolls:
Teeny tiny rolls and they skimp on meat/shrimp. The peanut sauce is quite salty. 1/5

Thai Iced Tea: 
Not the best place to get this from. It has a weird flavor and texture. 2/5

There are other Vietnamese restaurants along Eastern Avenue. I'd recommend going somewhere else.

Not the cleanest environment, generally speaking. Service is fair. Pricing is low. 

Personally my pho restaurant of choice, regardless of the facts stated prior. I regular the small pho tai, spring rolls with char broiled pork, and ice coffee with condensed milk. 

Unfortunately it seems the service and the quality of the food is not consistent. In my most recent visit (4/23/2016), they forgot my pho. After reordering, it was served at room temperature. Very undesired as the raw beef did not cook thoroughly due to the soup being of lower than should be temperature.

There's no pho in summerlin so i google maps this place and although not the closest location this is a MUST TRY. so bomb. So lit. I loved everything about my vermicelli bowl. I got egg roll/pork/shrimp. My boyfriend got seafood pho and loved it. The Thai tea tastes authentic so that's another plus. Definitely would recommend & come back.

Fast service, always fresh food. Great value. I have a preference for the #15 Pho Tai Bo Vien. Noodle soup with rare eye round steak and beef meatballs. Not a salty broth like some Phos sometimes come.

I love this place, I have tried many, so far this will be my regular place for my pho fix 

The above was over 6 months ago. Today I found a roll of plastic wrap about an inch wide of some sort in my pho. I tried to ask the waitress what that was, she said sometimes that gets in there and quickly took it from the table and ran off. Because of that, I will not be going there again. Because I didn't like her answer. And I take off 2 stars. I will stop at my 9th check in, bye Felicia 

Haven't been to this place since I found the plastic in my pho, thought I'd see if it's worth going back, lol still the same, that old lady waitress still don't smile, bad service, so I will stay away a few years and maybe I'll try again or not. I will take another 2 stars off

random viet restaurant in a strip mall - didnt even know it existed as you really can't see it from the street. they have a wide range of vietnamese food, including diff sizes for pho. one of the few places that have the tomato based crab and pork meat noodles - which came with 3 huuge blocks of blood cubes. not a fan of those but luckily was able to pick those out. 

overall, decent place for cravings.

Definitely one of my favorite Vietnamese places in Vegas. My regular order is #73, Bun Bo Hue. It is a thicker version of rice noodle in spicy soup. It comes with pork blood, tendon, pig feet and tripes; which is more texture than just the sliced meat or meatballs alone. Nice service and menu selections, great for casual dining.

I used to go to their Eastern location a lot with my family when I still lived on that side of town. And now that it's opened on the Southwest, I wouldn't have to travel to Chinatown or the Southeast for pho anymore!

The place is super clean when we were there. Utensils aren't at the tables like they normally are for a pho place. The server brings you the utensils after you order.

I either like to order pho tai, which is pho with rare steak, or a pho tai bo vien, which is pho with rare steak and meatballs. You are able to either get a large bowl or small bowl and they're usually $1 difference. When I went with my husband one night, I was so hungry that I ordered a large bowl of pho while he ordered a small bowl. When they came with our food, they gave me his small bowl thinking it was mine. Hahahaha. 

I love pho because most places have piping hot soup and if they don't, they're horrible. And the best thing about Pho Saigon 8 is that their broth is actually very decent! It's always consistent whenever I go to the Eastern location and I imagine the Rainbow location would be the same. The broth isn't watered down or overly salty. It's not sweet either! Yes, there are pho places where their broth is sweet.  

Also, if the broth sucks, I typically pour a gallon of sriracha into it but here I don't! 

The prices are a bit higher than most other pho places but not by a lot. If you're hungry, always get the large one! 

Also, their egg rolls are pretty good too :) If pho doesn't fill you up, get an order of their egg rolls!
My favorite place for pho in Vegas!  Excellent broth, fast service, ample portions, and plenty of options.

I'm so sorry, Pho Saigon 8, but I'm no longer one of your fans.  My family and I have been regular patrons here whenever we need our "pho phix," but it just doesn't seem the same anymore.  Sadly, the quality of your food has gone away.  I don't know if you are cutting costs with a sub-par ingredients list now, but your food doesn't quite taste the same anymore.  Add to that that some of your menu items have gone up in price which seems more difficult to swallow.

Twice in the past 2 weeks we've dined here, and twice we've gone home feeling some kind of indigestion - both of us, and both our kids.  It's weird to explain this, but we have to attribute it to what we had eaten there.  It is all too coincidental.

Any pho you select here is delicious, but something just isn't right anymore.  It has got to be the freshness or quality of the ingredients.  I had even tried their Bun Rieu, vermicelli noodle and crab soup, for the first time and left here feeling less than satisfied.  The crab meat just didn't taste fresh.

Lastly, according to the server, they've changed the way that they make their Da Chanh and Soda Chanh, fresh lemon drink and fresh lemon soda.  It tasted different this time around; even my son thought so, and you know kids' palates...you change a simple ingredient and they can taste the difference immediately.  They either put some weird syrup in it now or they use different lemons or limes...hard to say, but it had a strange, almost close to a lychee-flavored taste, to it.  Unfortunately, they forgot the key ingredient - "freshness."  They should have stuck to their original way of making it.  It was very thirst-quenching then.

Bittersweet Adieu...

There was about a year and a half where my best friend and I came here every Monday for post-workout pho, sometimes, even without having actually worked out. As far as Vietnamese entrees go, I'm sure I'm just scratching the surface, but I've had vermicelli (cold noodles with veggies, meat and fish sauce), rice plates, pho (noodles with assorted meat, usually in beef broth) and the French-Vietnamese sammiches. This place wins at the first three. I actually haven't even checked the menu to see if they have sandwiches because the other stuff is pretty darn good.

Both the fresh spring rolls (pork and shrimp), and the deep fried spring rolls (wrap them in lettuce with pickled veggies and dunk in fish sauce) are good ways to jump off the meal. For drinks, I like their hot tea and the Thai tea was surprisingly good as well.

In terms of actual belly filling picks, I prefer either pho or vermicelli to the rice plates, and depending on the season, will heavily lean towards one or the other and consistently order that every time. Obviously, when cold, I'll get pho, and when it's hot, I'll order vermicelli (try the grilled pork with fried spring rolls!).

I've tried Pho Kim Long (har har har), and felt it just didn't stack up to Pho Saigon 8. This is definitely my favorite Pho place in Vegas.

My go to for Pho ! Great quality food + nice & fresh ! Best broth in my opinion.
No AC last time I was there & it was unbearably hot inside. Table next to took food to go. That may have been a temporary thing I hope...

Good for a night out partying. It's pretty good here, but like I've said in prior reviews, pho basically always tastes decent to me. I did feel like there was a lot of meat, and I really liked that. There were a couple of complaints though: The eggrolls that we ordered was a little bit too greasy though, but the meat packed inside was decent. Also, compared to other Vietnamese restaurants in LA/SoCal, I kinda feel it was a bit pricey. Furthermore, the service with us was extremely lacking. A group of Vietnamese guys came in about 15 minutes after us, sat next to us, and ordered after us, and were finished with their meals before we even got our soups. Made us feel like if we were Vietnamese, we definitely would have received better service.

Before I was introduced to pho-milan.  I would always go here especially since it was right next to LVAC and I would usually come here for a quick bite to eat after the gym or craving for some vietnamese food.  

The food was just okay nothing amazing.  
Spring Rolls: It is usually a hit & miss thing. Sometimes its tasteful and sometimes is very bland.  When its bland I would have to use a lot of the dipping sauce to have some taste to the spring rolls.

Pho: I normally dont order pho, but when I finally did, I hated it.  I forgot what I ordered but it was not great at all.  It was cold and I asked them to reheat it, but one of the servers didnt understand what I was asking.  They had to ask another server to figure out what I wanted.  But after they reheated it, it wasnt something I would order again. 

Pork&Rice: I usually order this and in order for me to enjoy it. I would always use the pho's broth that they bring on the side and I would add it to the meat and rice to have more flavor to it.  

Service:  They normally dont smile when you enter their restaurant and only one or two of them is friendly.  I would have to flag them down to re-fill my glass of water and ask for the check.

So this was the first time I've bought here, there's one in Texas that we love  so far the food we got was pretty good I must say but the only thing we didn't quite like were the spring rolls, they should use Roman lettuce for them or a better lettuce vs the iceberg lettuce. We will go back to them and try other dishes!!

My place to go when I'm craving for an authentic bowl of pho or for a rice dish. Honestly, this is the best pho restaurant in Vegas! Other pho places in town are full of msg. I always get the spring rolls, pho tai and the shaken beef dish. Quality of food is always good here and I'm never disappointed.

I may not be the biggest Vietnamese food fan.  The food was just ok.  
Ambiance, eh, service and overall, just ok.
Very poor service, food is not as good as it is rated. Waiter expect us to grab our own food and make us grab our own need. Overall very bad experience.

Food here is really good dont get me wrong my family and i come here often . But this one time we order to go the lady at the regester is so dam rude on the phone . When i got there she was still rude i wanted to tell her off so bad i will be going to pho king up the road from now on this is what that scum look like !!

Cheap & quick service. Solid place for Pho Dac biet & Bun Bo Hue, they are not skimpy on their serving of beef. This is one of their better locations, especially better than the one on spring mountain. I do recommend getting a side of their egg rolls. This is our place to go on a Sunday. Not too crowded either.

Noodle soup, served piping hot with fresh condiments, like cilantro, basil, and bean sprouts.  Good for cold winter night, or when I crave a good pho.  It's the big bowl with plenty of broth, vegetable, meat and noddle, which is a bit fat, almost like spaghetti noodle, but is good.  

Here the service is quick, attentive despite how busy this place is.
Great pho very authentic, tasty. Win.

Feeling hung over so stopped in at new pho place for a to go order.  Place was very clean neat and new.  Was welcomed by a nice lady, who took my to go order and even offered me cold water while I waited.  About 5 minutes later, she brought my to go order, very neatly packaged!  Raw beef slices were even bagged seperate!  Still steaming hot when I got home, flavor is excellent, good traditional broth, healthy portions of meat in both the chicken and beef pho.  Meat is tender and everything was perfect.  This is my new go to pho place close to home!

This used to be our go to spot for pho, especially when the whole family is in town, but we took about a yearlong hiatus after we had a couple of bad experiences with service and decided to head down the street for our Vietnamese. We came back recently and the food was good and the service was better because we went during a non peak time. It will usually be busy when you go in, and because of this, service can be inattentive. Generally, your server will also be curt with you, that's the way they always have been and I don't see that changing anytime soon.

The pho here is consistently good. Everyone in my family, except for a select few, always order pho. I usually get #16 (I am not going to remotely attempt to spell any of the dishes) which is rare eye round, flank, and brisket. They'll bring you as much of the accouterments needed for your soup also. Even though it doesn't take them long to bring out your bowl once you order, you can tell the broth has been cooking for hours. The deep beef flavor is easily detectable along with the aroma of spices like star anise and clove. A big squeeze of sriracha for heat is the only other thing that I usually add to my soup.

I have had a few of their rice plates and they are satisfactory. The kids will always want an order of shredded pork spring rolls to start and they usually don't last too long. Pricing is affordable, usually right around $$ per person depending how many large bowls and sodas are ordered. Heads up also, check your bill before you pay because they'll tack on 15% gratuity for your party (it may be posted on a small sign in the front) and not say a word when they give you the check or after you've signed off on an extra 20% tip. Ultimately it's our fault for not looking over the check, but you're welcome Pho Saigon 8.

The pho is good enough to keep us coming back occasionally, but not good enough to overcome the service to make us regular visitors.

I ordered some wanton soup with egg noodles instead of traditional pho this time.  I would have to say my soup lacked in flavor, but the wantons themselves were tasty. I haven't had a fantastic spring roll in a long time, if anyone finds the absolute best please let me know. That being said Pho Saigon 8's spring roll were ok.  I would come back only for the pho.

This is the worst place i have been to.. service sucks and bad customer service!! We had to ask for water more than 5 times before getting some water.  Order took along time to come out and food wasnt that great

This was recommended by a Vietnamese co-worker that said (put popular billboard pho restaurant here) was "trash" and said to go here instead.  I was immediately pleased when the restaurant was spacious, clean, and filled with Vietnamese people and not tourists like me.  

I order my usual:  Small combination with no tripe and an order of the fresh spring rolls.  Great broth compared to other pho places because I couldn't taste the sink water taste I often taste in other pho places.  They have a good amount of meat and I am very satisfied with the amount of food.

Service was friendly and most of the time they don't write down your order and I wonder how they get it right most of the time.  

They do accept major credit cards so it's NOT CASH ONLY.  Another reason why I like going there because they do accept credit/debit.

Impeccable service.  Delicious pho and spring rolls.  Quick, clean spot for lunch.  It was super busy when we walked in but they had a table waiting for us. By the time we were done the lunch rush was over. Thai tea was great.

Already ate here at least 10 times.  Its the best Pho place i have tried in Vegas,
It actually reminded me more of food in Garden Grove CA.
The quality has been pretty consistent.
The place is clean, and the service is good.

Usually I LOVE this place. Me and my boyfriend go here all the time for the yummy pho but my most recent trip here was sO ANNOYING. First we called ahead to take our food to go and they told us it would be ready in 10 minutes. Okay so to kill time we went to yogurt land (which is next door) and made our way to the restaurant and our food still wasn't ready. We we're told to sit and wait at the tables by the bathroom, so we did. Ten minutes later some customers come in and THEY KICK US OUT of the booth! There were other tables to seat them why they gotta kick us out and our food still wasn't done. We wait another ten minutes and I decide to tell them wassup like why am I waiting 30 minutes for them to give me some broth and noodles in some styrofoam? We didn't order anything fancy just the regular noodles and broth smh.

People rave about this place. After having tried a Ramen place the night before in China Town, I thought this place was just OK, at best.

Service was very slow, they squashed us in a side table even though there were plenty of other seats, and didn't really explain WTF we were supposed to be doing.  For instance, I guess you are supposed to be wrapping the egg rolls in the large pieces of lettuce they give you??? They give you a BUNCH of stuff to doctor up your soup with, which I guess should've been my first indication that it wasn't going to be all that good.

DON'T GET THE MEATBALLS. They were nasty. Apparently, there's some confusion on meatballs and sausage in a casing?  You literally had to bite and tear into these packets of meat to get a chunk off of them. It definitely reminded me of eating an overcooked piece of sausage and way too big to be eating in one bite.

The Thai Tea was amazing but I felt for it's size, extremely over priced. In fact, the whole thing was a bit overpriced, it was almost $40 for 3 of us for lunch without tip.
Trying to get the check was a production too, then paying the check up at the front, then tipping was all very strange.

I think we all agreed we don't have to go back.

As a regular pho eater, I can say that pho is good here. (I am half Vietnamese and my mom is terrible at making pho so I often go out to eat it.)

The noodles are a hit or miss and since I'm a big noodle eater, this matters to me. Sometimes they are soggy but sometimes they are perfect. Though the broth is consistent and is one of the best in Vegas, making this place one of the few solid pho places around Vegas. 

It is still not up to par with LA pho places, but as I have said in other reviews I have yet to eat at a pho place in Vegas that measures up.

The only thing that is below average, even for an asian restaurant (which says a lot), is the service. 

I am used the okay service of asian restaurants where the waitresses are often overwhelmed with too many customers and often forget things and don't have enough time to give you a lot of time, so that doesn't bother me. What does bother me is when a worker is walking around like he has nothing and they purposely ignores you. I ordered a pho from one guy working there and never ended up getting my order. He even avoided me and purposely ignored me when I tried to catch his attention . Finally another server saw me and promptly got my order, at least she was very nice. I wish I could say that this only happened to me once (and I would be willing to overlook it since I come here often) but it was not the only time and he was not the only guy that did that.

HORRIBLE service. The only reason I gave two stars was because the food was pretty darn great. I had dinner here with my mom and the whole time the waitress and waiter (we were served by both) had an attitude and were rushing us. The waiter asked for our order as soon as they handed us the menu and we asked for a few minutes. He came back two minutes later and asked for our order and again we asked for a few more minutes because there's like a thousand items on the menu and it was my first time there. We finally ordered and the waitress came out and brought our food since our waiter was on his break having his meal at the table in front us us. We had the pho ga, shrimp spring rolls, and shrimp fried rice. Everything was absolutely delicious! When we asked the waitress for another order of shrimp spring rolls, she brought them back to us in a to-go box. I guess she wanted us to leave so we left since we were done with their crap. This place really needs to work on their customer service. The entire time both waiters had an attitude and a mad look on their face. I am a very polite customer and great tipper everywhere I go but I didn't leave a damn thing here. I'm never going back there again.

I think this place has the best pho in Las Vegas.  Been here about a dozen times and it's consistently good - tasty broth, flavorful meats, and well-cooked noodles.  Service can be sometimes friendly and sometimes brusque, but it's always fast.  Highly recommended.
The number #78 is super bomb. The 215 and rainbow location is very nice and seems nicer than the others. The crispy eggroll is a must!

Haven't had Pho in months.  The Pho restaurant by our home in Arkansas just vanished one day.  No Pho restaurants within 100 miles.

Saigon 8 is near a townhouse I'm renting.  It was excellent.  The sliced Brisket was very tender and the sirloin was sliced to perfection and very flavorful.  Lots of bean sprouts, basil, onion, etc to dress it up.

Service was very fast and the people behind the counter were very nice as well.  Wish I lived closer

Fast and yummy...granted I usually just get the Pho, but I love it.  I can add as much or as little veggies and sauce as I want.  
I go there ALOT (coffee is sooooooo good).
I just love it!

Very clean and VERY quick & friendly service.  For some reason I just don't feel like it hit the spot!  I live SW and I think if still drive to Spring Mountain for PHO.  I'm going to give it a chance and try some other things on the menu first though!!!

Gosh... today I'm sick as hell and we came here for pho, tea and egg rolls. We come here all the time. I ask for Thai tea and it comes back half full. Then I send it back and she brings it back with no ice, half full. Why can't you full the fuxking cup up the right way if you want me to pay full price?! We come here allllll the time!!!!!! Irritating and poor service today

Compared to other pho places, this place isn't that bad and I can see myself returning here. Although the place is fairly new, it's nice to see that it's clean inside and it's pretty spacious. I ordered #20 and it was actually loaded with meat which I was thankful for. The soup broth was a bit too oily for me but the noodles were cooked just right. It was not too hard but it also did not get too soft even after sitting in the soup for a bit.

Incredibly flavorful, tasty broth, with generous portions of meat (got the #21). I also got the vermicelli bowl (combo with fried egg roll, pork) and it was awesome. Generous portions that it serves as two meals for me. I've had the vermicelli bowl at Mai Lang (another Viet place in Henderson) and pho Saigon 8 is much better. 

Service: Its fast but don't expect too much from it, it's really bare bones (take your order, refill your water, that's about it). They're not rude by any means though, just business.

It was really just okay to me. Their pho broth was a bit bland compared to other places I've tried. I gave 3 stars for their thai ice tea. It was delicious. Their egg rolls were also pretty good but I mainly went for their soup and was a bit disappointed.

Okay, this place is a little hated on, but I think it's a pretty good option if you are on this side of town.  The Bun Bo Hue is not the best I've had, but definitely is one that has the most meat/pork cake/pork hock, etc inside.  It could be a little spicier, but I don't think the broth is half bad.  The grilled chicken/egg roll vermicelli bowl is pretty tasty as well, the chicken is very tender and flavorful.  There are negatives to this place, it's kind of dirty and the service is pretty bad.  Also, I've only been there a few times but definitely some inconsistencies in the dish.  One time the vermicelli bowl came without any greens....and one time I just got the regular bean sprouts when usually it's a different dish for the bun bo hue.  So not the best, but not bad for being in this area.

This is our go to pho place since it's a convenient location for us.  The place appears clean and is extremely kid friendly.  The portion size is generous and the soup broth is flavorful.   The meat and the bean sprouts always seem fresh. I do leave a little thirsty....so I'm guessing there's some MSG in the broth.  The egg rolls are always hot and crispy, but sometimes a little inconsistent with the amount of pepper used.  I like that they always give us a bowl and scissors to help cut up food for our toddler.  The service is always fast, we can usually be in an out in less than 45 minutes.  This is the typical Asian establishment, if you need something, it's best to be proactive and ask.

We were on our way back from the Grand Canyon when we decided to stop by the Walmart at this exit in order to grab a few items for our stay. Low and behold we noticed this Pho restaurant and decided to stop. 

We are regular eaters of Pho, have been all over Vietnam and this restaurant did not disappoint. Service was quick and the food was outstanding. Unfortunately we only kept a rental car for our first 3 days in Las Vegas, otherwise we would have returned several more times as the food was that great. 

On another note, do not confuse this with another restaurant called Pho Saigon that is in the same strip mall as In & Out Burger. We thought it was the same owners, but apparently not, as the other one was "dead" and this one was packed!

Food is fine. Bun bo is spicy but great.Clean and fast service. I found this place it is very convenient and affordable to have lunch or dinner in Vegas. I tried some chicken but it was not as good as I expected since it was a little dry. Bun cha is ok. Nothing special.

I got takeout here so I can't comment on the service,which probably is ok. 
It is located in a small strip mall and appears clean and have some typical Asian decorations. Obligatory buddha some water structure. 
The food however was a huge disappointment. I didnt have the pho so maybe I'm unfairly judging but the spring rolls had lettuce that you buy at the grocery store, rice noodles, and some tofu. That's it! Where's the cilantro? Wheres the sliced carrots? The noodle with dish with chicken was very tasteless and frankly just bad. If someone ate here believing they were eating vietnamese food they might say they hate an entire country's food without a proper reference point. 

Maybe the pho is better but based on the quality of the other stuff I dont expect it.

Food is always good here! I noticed they did a lot of changes. New menus and appetizer are much bigger now than before. Service is always ehh. It's ALWAYS a hit a miss. You would have to raise your hand or make eye contact with the servers/bussers to get what you need. I only come here because it's closer to me. But, if I were to choose where to eat I would say Pho Mailan is so much better! It's better making the trip to go further down on eastern for amazing food and service!

YUM. 

Huge fan of this place. My friends and I come here all the time when we're in Vegas. It's perfect for a lunch on Saturday because it's hearty and delicious. I always get the Pho -- the broth is flavorful, the noodles are fresh and it's just wonderful. Sure, it's not as good as some Pho places in LA, but for Vegas it's not bad at all. I'm also a fan of the Spring Rolls with peanut sauce. YUM.

QUICK, GOOD AUTHENTIC FOOD, AND CHEAP!!! what more do you want from a vietnamese restaurant??? they have just a handful of items on the menu, which mean they're good at what they cook, so you can go no wrong with that they're offer. If you fancy dishes, there are plenty other restaurants nearby. You come here for Pho, Bun, and broken rice with pork chop, they're the stable of Vietnamese comfort food.
friendly and attentive wait staff. food was pretty good and authentic, good location, i don't have to drive all the way to China town to eat, so it's a plus for me!

I hate being a party pooper, but this place's menu really intimidates me.  There are a million items, and the descriptions are vague at best.  
The things we usually get (pho with rare beef, charbroiled chicken vermicelli, and spring rolls) are great, but I want to try new things.  Some of the servers speak very little English, so asking for suggestions doesn't really work.  
The last time we came in I ordered some kind of a tomato beef stew.  It was tasty, but the beef was soooo suuuuper fatty.  
If I could get more out of the menu, I would give this place 4, or 5 stars.  Unfortunately, since it can be kind of a hit or miss experience for me, I can only give them 3.

This place really hits the spot! My family was in town last weekend and we really were craving these noodles being that we havent had it in  a loooooooooooong time. I loved it. I got the Pho #18 plus some meatballs. the 4 meatballs arent worth the extra few bucks you have to pay for them, but it was still wonderful to eat overall. It was as close to how my mother used to fix it as i have come across here in vegas.

The serving were huge and great for the price we paid. 

 i would definitely would go back again and im sure when my family comes back into town we will be hitting this place up again. 

I guess as far customer service goes, it wasnt bad. I think it would be great if they opened one up in north las vegas being that we dont have one on this side of town at all.

We've been looking for a yummy Pho for a while and Yelp helped us find Pho Saigon 8!!  

I ordered a Tofu vegetable Pho while the boyfriend ordered Chicken Pho and Spring Rolls. (bill came out to $20 and change)  DE-LICIOUS!  Eric said his chicken was moist (not the usual overcooked and dry) broth was a perfect, steaming hot- but NOT burn your mouth hot.  

...Talk about FAST food, the spring rolls came out minutes after we ordered it and our Pho came out as Eric was finishing up his appetizer (and he eats fast!)

it's a smaller restaurant and was packed at 5pm (it's a good sign that the food was going to be good!).  The decor is nice, table tops are some kind of stone/granite (no booths) and it was clean.  I'm agreeing with another reviewer, it's a tight fit and the tables are a little close together and I don't recall any type of music playing.  The service was friendly, nice and quick- although there was not much rapport between us.  They were great about busing the tables and keeping it clutter-free (my pet peeve).  Must agree with another reviewer, the parking lot is a little small...   Despite the semi-negative description of the restaurant itself, don't let that stop you from eating the YUMMY food!!

I overheard customer at another table complementing the server for the GREAT food he just had.  He introduced himself to the server and told him he would be a frequent customer.. :o) = so I know I wasn't the only one Raving about how good the food was!!!

5 stars for delicious food at a great price, nice sized servings (was a bonus) and quick and friendly service.  This will be a restaurant that we re-visit a few times a month- I know it!
Very clean restaurant, very tasty Pho. Warm Saki was barely warm but was good nonetheless. We will be back again!
i got it to go and it wasn't even hot. the chicken was barely edible. i basically threw my entire pho away after a few bites.

It's good to catch this place at 12:00pm because all the early birds got the left over broth from yesterday and by noon the new batch gets cooked. OMG I am just kidding!!!! 

I like the Pho here a lot. The broth is clear, flavorful, and oh so yummy after a long night of ??. 

I was so hungry, I ordered spring rolls, egg rolls --these two are not that great. I had Pho in a small bowl with meatball was about $7. I love it. 

This place is very busy for locals and out of towners. It just feels like home.

We always came here whenever we visit Las Vegas. We tried other Pho places in Vegas however, this is still the best for us. We are from So Cal so we know what would be a good bowl of Pho. No need to wait at Pho Kim Long, just drive down a couple block then you find Pho Saigon 8. Highly recommended!

I like this place bc they are fast and less crowded and broth is not bad. I only gave them 3 stars bc the pho ga (chicken pho) is good not great and ginger sauce is okay, and eggroll filling is mushy not firm.

I am little disappointed today.  I've been to Pho Saigon 8 probably more than 20+ times and never had one single complaint in the past...
The size, I mean the portion of noodle got REALLY smaller (I've been ordering  the small bowl of Pho & always has been enough to fill me up), the taste of soup was a bit salty, the vegetables were dried out, and their soup wasn't hot enough.  I can't believe that their food portion size went down & their quality of food went way down stream.  I am not sure if I wanna come back and have another Pho here any time soon......

Maybe, the chef went on vacation or something??!?!?

I am not too sure if  Pho Saigon 8 is worth recommended to you as I had both pleasant and not-so-pleasant experiences.  I am confused 
-.-;;;
However, I still like their Vietnamese iced coffee a lot!
Unfortunately, I have to give this place only 3stars.

YUM! This is by far our favorite Vietnamese / Pho restaurant in town! The service can be spotty but the food is always consistent and great! Plus, you cannot beat the prices. Both of us eat usually for under $20 even with an appetizer!

Our favorites

Crunchy Egg Rolls $5.95
Meatball / Beef Pho small $6.75
Sliced pork and grilled shrimp with virmecelli $6.75
Thai Iced Tea $2.25

This is a new location so it is pretty nice inside. It does, however, get pretty busy around meal times so plan ahead and come a little early to get a good table. 

You won't be disappointed - that's Pho sure!

boy is it cold out in vegas tonight.. stopped in here with the parentals to get warm and toasty..
i rarely eat anything else than seafood pho.. so tonight i got the small #44 which only consists or shrimp and crab! the other place i usually eat pho at in the bay area has more seafood items in the meal but since those are my top 2 favorite things.. it sounded like the perfect bowl!
my choice of beverage tonight was their fresh squeezed lemonade! 
food came out in a timely manner.. and everything looked delish..
i loved how i ordered a small but they gave me noodles as it was a large! i was totally expecting imitation crab.. and to my surprise there was real crab meat.. couldn't get better than that! shrimp was kinda bland but nothing that sriracha sauce can't fix!
taste, size, temperature of the whole thing was wonderful.. just what i needed for a cold night!
my lemonade was bomb! i usually don't care for tart sour drinks but i must say this was some good as lemonada! so refreshing to the mouth after a hot meal!
i shall come here many more times in the future! 

oh the bad.. 
not so many parking spaces for the little shoppping area its in.. seating arrangements kinda suck.. service was ok.. but they could try to come around a little more often.. and when the bill came back swiped and all.. they didn't have a customer copy receipt.. only store copy.. i personally don't care for that extra piece of paper but many do!

oh did i mention there's a yogurtland next door.. :)

All i can say was DELICIOUS! i came in for lunch today with my parents 'cuz we were hungry for some viet food and it was perfect for a chilly noon time. I ordered the beef stew with french bread, crepe and egg roll for appetizer. They prolly have the best crepe and beef stew in town! And ooooohh goodnesssss the french bread was perfect!!!! It was hot, crunchy, and fluffy! From the first bite, it made me say "daammn" hahaha.. yes it is that delicious!! Also the crepe was perfectly cooked and very decent filling! I was really glad that it was not OILY! unlike the one at pho kim long it was soaking in oil (totally disgusting) but anyways the service was nice too! Fast and on point! 

So if you're looking for an authentic viet food in henderson this is a must go to place! And they also have another location at spring mtn. 

MUST TRY: beef stew with french bread/rice/noodles, crepe, and their viet hot coffee was delicious!

The hearty beef broth here is the best! The only reason I gave it 4 stars is for the service which I'll touch on below. 

Service... there is no such thing as service in this place. Every time I've been here there is one person behind the counter that seats you and then takes your order and you never see him/her again. I always see 1 or 2 other staff members in there but they never help out. They just sit at a corner table and eat. Maybe I'm just going during their lunch breaks?! 

That said, don't come in here thirsty because you'll never get a refill on water. And to top off the water issues it's always room temperature. You'd think ice cubes are a rare commodity at this joint!

But yes, still 4 stars because the pho (broth mostly) makes me happy in my pants!!!

Hands down my favorite pho place in Vegas! I had a couple go-to places for pho before but after Pho Saigon 8 opened, this is my only place to go in Southwest area.

Food is great! I always had meatball pho because it will come out safe everywhere I guess.. but their meatball itself is already different, it's more chewy and just a better grade quality I could taste. So I decided to try Bun Bo Hue as well, and I was impressed! 

The main reason I will return her is because if the quality of food they serve, cleanness, and presentation. The environment is always clean, and my vegetable plate for my noodles are always fresh, clean, crisp, and well organized on the plate. Service was welcoming and friendly. Although they are not 'great service' like fancy restaurant, but among Vietnamese restaurant I think they are fast, hardworking, and knowledgeable.

Although for pho restaurant it's a about $1-$2 more expensive than some places, but I think it's totally worth it if they continue to provide this quality of food, environment, and service.

Pho is a challenge in this city. I have not found a really good place yet, but Pho Saigon 8 can make the cut of being decent.

The taste of the broth is a lot better than all the other pho restaurants in the city, as it wasn't as oily. The only bad part is that there was MSG in there, and a lot of it! I got really thirsty afterwards, and I got a headache! Ehh....I would have given it 5, but the taste just got to me afterwards...In addition, the service was just awful after our food came. Our drinks and food came right away, but when it was refill time....not a soul came by to visit! We even asked for refills when we did find someone, but we waited too long and decided to leave... BOO!

If I were to choose a place for pho, this would be it (as I have no other choice...)

I am not too picky with pho, HOWEVER, this place soup base tasted really really salty! MSG??? and BIGGEST let down was their MEATBALL tasted like RUBBER! never ever did I encounter that in ANY of pho restaurants I've been to. Their price is higher than other pho restaurants, and the servers took very long to take order, and didn't seem to know what they were doing. Like if you see an empty water cup pushed to side of the table...of course....you want more water! spring roll was bland and very bad! will not go back!

Love Pho! Have only had it a few times. Small bowl was plenty and the taste was amazing! Shrimp spring roll was cold and dipping sauce delicious. Right off freeway so will be an easy stop again. Most customers were Vietnamese, so you know all the food is good. Waiter recommended the type of Pho we had. Delicious!!!

I haven't even eaten the food yet, but I'm with my 83 year old dad while pushing my sick mom in a wheelchair.  One of the older female waitresses was walking in at the same time as us and got to the door before we did.  She looked right at me, then at my mom in her wheelchair, opened the door and let the door close in my face.  What a BITCH!  Nice job at making my experience horrible before even eating the food.

I've eaten here like 3 times already since i've moved from California. Living in cities like SD, LA, and the SF Bay Area where I would constantly find myself eating at Pho spots over a million times, I was a bit scared to see what Vegas would provide for my Pho cravings.

So far I've stumbled upon this place and the Pho is ok. The broth has the usual flavor, but I think I've had more flavorful broths eating in spots like Pho Ca Dao in San Diego and Jasmin Garden in San Francisco. But I will say the large bowl of Pho can hit the spot when you have the craving.

I have also had their wonton egg noodle soup. Pretty basic. Noodles have a soft texture and the wontons break a part easily--making it a pleasant experience eating together. I'm sad they didn't have the spicy chili oil sauce they have in some Vietnamese/Chinese spots.

Their fresh spring rolls are good as well.

In a way, I think their food is a tad bit over priced compared to some mom and pop Vietnamese restaurants I love going to in California, but ehh i'll get over it. 

Another thing is that they have a limit of $10 when using credit cards. Since sometimes I usual eat by myself for dinner, it's kind of annoying.

So overall, the place is just OK in my book.

This place is addictive. Never seen it empty and the most iv had to wait is a couple minutes. Service is really fast and out of the dozen times iv been here they've always gotten my order correct. 
  As far as the food I usually get the #16 pho and maybe some spring rolls or egg rolls. Both are amazing! Best pho around by far. And also the house hot tea is a mixed blend and awesome. 
   I definitely recommend this place. You will be hooked

Pho Saigon 8 is the best pho spot off Spring Mountain Road.  I know this because each time I'm in Vegas, we always leave the strip and have Pho for breakfast.  Sorta helps us recover from the activities the night before.  We've tried almost every Pho restaurant in Chinatown / Spring Mountain Road.

The first time I went, I tried their beef stew with french bread.  The beef stew was very good.  The beef was very tender and was just right in flavor.  The soup wasn't thick and it wasn't watery so the consistancy was perfect.  The french bread was warm and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  The best beef stew with french bread I've ever had.

The next few times we went there, I tried their special combo Pho.  The broth was tasty and you could taste it was simmered.  They use red onions instead of white onions and I think it drew out the flavor quite nice.

The iced coffee was very strong - the way I like it!  I defininitely think Pho Saigon 8 is the best Pho restaurant in Vegas.

I give this place a 5 star for its food!! Its service is a 3.5 on average lol

We first came to this spot since it was so close to home. It really kick started our pho love. We have tried other places and have now decided this is our spot!!! The broth is amazingly flavored. They give generous portions so if your not a big eater the small would fill you up. 

Our meals consist of #13 beef broth with raw rib eye and flank, with a side of broccoli... Get it raw the broth is so hot that it will cook thw rib eye to perfection. #18 raw rib eye, flank, tendon, and tripe. We also start with #1 crispy egg rolls that come with generous lettuce and mint. Overall this place has the best Pho in Henderson!! No joke! 

The service is spotty. However, we are willing to deal with it for the quality and freshness of the food. It is best to order everything you need before your server leaves to enter your order. Also, if you need a refill on your drink move your cup in eyes view they are ninjas when it comes to refills. We have never had a server be rude they are just usually pretty busy and they are there to get things done. It is very clean and it is not a place to lounge. 

If you live in henderson and you are in need of some dank Pho this is a must try!!!

This is by far the best Pho in town. They have another location I go to but took about 30 min to get there. Glad they opened one on my side of town. I always get the combination pho #18. Their food is pretty consistent with their other locations.
Good pho tai bo vien & bun bo hue here, worth the money. Customer services are good.  Nothing can be compare to the foods back in oc, california. However,  this place will do.
Service is kinda impersonal. BUt the food is great. That is the reason why this place is usually packed for lunchtime. Reasonable prices.

I would not recommend coming to this place solely based on the service. The soup itself was great when they don't mess up your order that is. What I called to speak them about my to-go order being messed up the person I spoke to stated he would take care of it no problem. Then when I showed up he wants me to pay for another one with a promise that they will get it right. That makes no sense then argued that I read the menu wrong. I repeated my orders several times which you confirm by repeating back to me so I don't know how I can miss read the menu when it was a special order. To argue like that and not care about customer service just turns you off to a location. I should have been concern during my initial order when he cared more about being on his phone then dealing with the customer. I would not recommend coming to this place. 

 Funny how the person responding to my review wasn't even there. This has nothing to do with getting anything for free. This is the point I was trying to make they would rather argue with their customers than listen to them.  Terrible terrible terrible. If they would have stopped arguing and actually listen they would understand or hear the point that I was trying to make.
Very disappointed in portion size , left still hungry . Service ok. Taste ok not great.

second time coming to this location! always order a #27 with spring rolls. the pho is served fast. very delicious! 

customer service could be a little better. had to ask for extra lemons twice. 

would I come back? yeah because it's affordable.

I've been eating at Vietnamese Pho restaurants my whole life. Coming from LA, I tend to be a Pho snob but this place is soooo good. I got the one with everything rare. The soup is clean but full of flavor and the large bowl is PACKED with ingredients. Exactly what I'm looking for before a long ride back to LA and decently priced!

If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese cuisine, this restaurant is perfect and it's delicious and cheap. Growing up in Westminster Ca, I never knew how spoiled I was with so many authentic Vietnamese restaurants within walking distance. After moving to the East coast, I realized not all Vietnamese restaurants are the same. I have to say this place is on par with all the pho spots back home in Ca and is one of the best pho restaurants you can find in Vegas. I typically get the pho, but also recommend trying vermicelli, the rice dishes, and egg rolls. The decor isn't wonderful but this place is really just about the food. I usually get my order to go which will consist of a container of broth, and separate container with noodles, meat, and veggies. Just heat the broth and pour it in a bow with the noodles and meat. Presentation isn't the same as eating at the restaurant but the taste is the same. Overall, this is one of my favorite pho spots in Vegas and it's definitely worth a try.

Lousy Customer service.Very slow. Gave us menus and did not come back for awhile. Not even waters for 10 minutes.Tables stink like an old dirty rag. I got the Chicken breast Pho and the broth was bland and tastless. Had to add a lot of Salt , pepper , and chil oil to give it flavor. The BBQ Pork roll was like a cold hot dog wrapped in a roll with a few veggies. They serve it with peanut sauce. Needs it to give it some taste. This was my second and last time here.

I went here for the first time yesterday with my family, and let me tell you Pho Saigon 8 has theeeeee BEST pho I've ever had in Las Vegas! Their pho broth is so tasty and it doesn't taste like water.. Unlike the other pho places I've been to. My brother isn't the biggest pho fan in the world, so he had their Korean BBQ plate & my daughter had their grilled chicken plate. Both came with a generous amount of rice, vegetables, & their nuoc cham sauce. I tried both and they were both sooo delicious! If I could order Pho, Korean BBQ, and Grilled Chicken.. I so would do it! 

Anyway, the place is nice & clean. It didn't take very long for us to get seated by the servers. The only reason why I didn't give this place five stars is because their service isn't all that great. I really appreciate servers who smile and are attentive, but you won't find that here :( I guess you can't pair up great food with great service.

Despite the whole crappy service thing, their food is on point so you'll definitely find me coming back here for more in the future :)

So I had pho once in my life, it was seafood, I didn't like it and that was back in California. I, in my never ending quest to "try new things" went out for Vietnamese with my sister after coming up empty at Whole Foods. 

I've passed by this place a million times and have wanted to try it. Again, even if I don't like something the first time, I try to try it in a different preparation again at another time. We walked inside, it was nice, clean, and we were seated promptly. My sister decided she wasn't hungry and didn't want to try anything so she ordered a side of rice. I ordered a #73 (I have no idea what the real name was.) The description said it was spicy. The waitress told me it had pig's blood in it. Was I a little hesitant, yeah, but I ordered it anyway.

My sister's rice was delivered to our table in about 2 seconds, along with the mint and lettuce for my pho. About 5 minutes later, the soup came out. I was completely unfamiliar with the two gray black cubes of ??? and the white pate like half circle floating on the side. Apparently, according to the waitress, it was pig's blood sausage and another type of sausage. I had to skip the blood sausage. I couldn't bring myself to try it. The pork in it, well, I couldn't identify what part of the animal it was from. The fat was very rare. 

Was the soup spicy? No. I had to add a ton of siracha to my soup, along with the jalapenos. Would I go there again? Maybe, but I would for sure try something else. What I ordered was not something that had a lot of depth of flavor.

I only go here with my g/f when she is craving a beef noodle bowl. The service here is poor. Staff members never check up on us or refill our beverages after we've been served. Last time we were here, some of the staff were horseplaying right in front of the customers. The restaurant is very dirty too. I once sat down and shuffled my chair forward and my hand was covered in something slimy. Its disgusting smell forced me to head to the restroom and wash my hands repeatedly. I will take the advice of other reviewers and try out Lemongrass nearby.

This is a traditional Vietnamese restaurant where you'll need to seat yourself and pay at the register, so don't write a crappy review about waiting for your check or sitting at a dirty table. The food here is always fresh and consistently delicious. I suggest you try the crispy egg noodle plate along with a sweet iced coffee.

We were recommend to eat at this place by a local. The food rocked and was very good. Had the #1 and # 12, Eggrolls with the lettuce and herbs you dip in a great sauce and Pho soup that came in a  rich, full flavored, very tasty broth that made me think I was back in Vietnam.  Service was not the best as we were there in the end of a lunch rush but the food more then made up for that. They also let us order a 1/2 order of eggrolls when we were still hungry.

Flavor (Broth) was not the best. Cost was fine, but for a family of 5, they included an 18% tip onto the check. They also only accept cash, which didn't really matter to me, but service was so so. Been to much better.

one of the best pho places ever!  

we were in vegas last summer and really wanted some pho. so we went here and even though the place was really hot and crowded, the pho was delicious! so when we went back in december, i was afraid i was going to be let down (simply because I thought i over-hyped it to myself from the first time I went here).  BUT! i wasnt let down.  the pho was even better when its not blazing hot outside.  yum yum yum

the meat, rice plates, meatballs, noodles, etc. etc. are all great! the portion size is good for the price you pay and the place is very clean.  the service is quick and efficient.  

GO HERE IF YOURE IN VEGAS AND WANT PHO!
Service is excellent, every time i come and eat with my fambam Lucy knows my order like usual !! Great people and very friendly !!

I came in around 2 for lunch on a Thursday and luckily it wasn't too busy so I was seated right away. I ordered the nem nuong spring rolls but they gave me the regular ones with shrimp instead. I was on a time limit so just ate it anyways. For my main entree I ordered the Saigon  banh canh  and it was just OK. I've had better and it was a lot of soup and not much meat. Also, no one followed up with me to see how everything was so customer service was lacking a bit.

Best Vietnamese food in Las Vegas.  Don't have to go to California anymore.  
The Pho is phonomenal and the spring rolls are dynomite.  Ice French-pressed coffee with condensed milk will keep you high thoughout the day.  Nice Bun too.

when we saw that the noodle bar that the mandalay bay was charging upwards of $15 for a simple bowl of soup, we jumped in the car and drove a mere 10 minutes to spring valley's chinatown. 

good broth, served piping hot. good, springy noodles and fresh accompanying vegetables. and this place served cuts of beef of commendable quality in the soup. 

ca fe sua da was more potent than sweet (not necessarily a bad thing).

It's probably the best pho in Las Vegas but of course it can't compared to pho in Little Saigon. The broth is flavorful but they don't give you alot of meat. I ordered pho dac biet (special pho)for  almost $9 but there is only few pieces of meat.
My daughter lv sugarcane shrimp. Bu bo hue was nicely done.  Not too sauty. Spice d just right. The bu thit nueng rice place was a nice complement.  Will return.

The pho is delicious, the place is causal and low key. ...The service, not so much. I waited at a table for a few mins, and one server kept avoiding eye contact. After I got my order, no one checked to see if I needed anything. And my dirty plates were not bussed and remained on the table until I left. Service 2.5 stars. Food 4 stars.

I go here all the time because:

1. It's always busy, that means food is good.

2. The bean sprouts and basil in the side are always fresh. The ingredients are fresh. Order something beside pho and taste the fresh ingredients. They don't have to put too much seasoning. "FRESH!"

3. They have the pickled jalapeño jar. I'm Thai, we Thais need something other than siracha. I only wish they had fresh ground chili. 

4. Service is simple, they just take order and you get up and pay at counter, I like that. So the food is not expensive and one does not need to leave a huge tip. 

I love this place. I seriously do. I just wish they had sandwiches too. Then my life would be complete.

BEST PHO IN TOWN PERIOD! 

I love this place for 10 years now! Rare and tendon! 
If in Chinatown this is the spot!

The food is inexpensive and very tasty.  The service can be up or down depending on whatever I have had good service when it was busy and bad service when it was quiet(example we were escorted to a table when the restaurant was quiet, my wife asked to be seated at a different table, the host said it was dirty and left our water and menus at the table which we did not want to be seated and left.  We then waited for the table to be cleaned and then transferred our own water and menu.   I put up with the service because this is still my go to place for pho.   Except for one time when they placed our order to a different table by mistake our orders are usually served without a long wait.  If not for the spotty service I would give 4 stars.  Usually however they keep your water glass full(except once)

NOT RECOMMENDED. 
The pho was cold and they charged 15% for service without even notifying the customers!!! We didn't even know until the check came out. The ONLY thing the servers did was bring out water and our pho. NOTHING ELSE and they charged 15% for service. NEVER COMING BACK EVER!

Woke up on a Friday morning and urgently needed a pho fix.

The special combo beef pho was a no-go.
The soup was really oily along with a herbal taste.
 However, they have fresh coconut juice and perfect Vietnamese coffee !!

Um, won't be back.

My husband is a Pho addict so about once a month I put on my sweet wife hat and we get pho. We used to live in Henderson and loved Pho Saigon 8, but now that we live on the other side of town we decided to try their Spring Mountain location. 

The decor is identical to the Henderson location, but the food is not nearly as good. The dining area is huge and the wait staff were friendly and even played peek-a-boo with our little one. We ordered the egg rolls and we both decided on grilled pork vermicelli. The egg rolls were OK, but the vinegar sauce on the side was lacking in flavor. The vermicelli was a biggest disappointment of the night. The pork didn't have the usual rich grilled flavor and the vegetables looked wilted and old. I didn't touch the lettuce and scooted the limp carrots to the side of my bowl. The noodles seemed old and were cold and lifeless. The flavors were muddled, not the bright and vibrant dish I was hoping to receive. We also shared a thai tea which tasted off too. I took a couple of sips and decided I was done.  

We definitely won't be back to this location.

One of the better pho restaurants in Las Vegas.  Pho is tasty with excellent broth.  I had the BBQ pork chops and fried egg combo and really liked the flavor of the pork, however, the chop was so thinly sliced I was disappointed with the portion.  The fried fish balls and egg rolls were excellent.  Can't wait to go back and try more dishes.

Always great pho soup and usually pretty good service from the staff. Love coming here for lunch with Co workers and friends. Ordering take out for lunch is a breeze too as they package everything up neatly for you in alittle pho kit.
Tried Pho for the first time from here. Delish! So good my boyfriend stole my left overs. Really big portions which is awesome.

I have come here a few times. More so on my lunch break. 
They prepare  everything fresh, it was always hot when I came to pick it up.

 I have tried the spring rolls. Very good. Fresh shrimp, good peanut sauce.
Also I have tired the egg rolls,they are the small ones minimally filled but have an great inside! I like how with the order you get a big bag of lettuce and things. The sauce for the rolls is also very good.

I should have tried more and gone more often, maybe I will. 
But from what I did have , it was always good!

Overall: Pho Saigon 8 disappoints in making its namesake dish, but the Hu Tieu was pretty dang good. It might be my regular for that dish, but I'll have to continue looking for a pho restaurant.

Food: 3

Pho Chin (Cooked Brisket): The broth lacked the intense umaminess from beef bones, but it was clear and not too sweet. However, the brisket was completely dry and tasteless.

Hu Tieu My Tho Kho: Surprisingly, this dish was good. The sauce was well balanced and flavorful. There was plenty of sautéed ground pork and offals, and the shrimps were a good size. They aren't too consistent on the offals as one bowl had almost all heart while the other had a mix of heart and liver. Make sure to ask for the hu tieu giay!

Service: 3

We didn't have too many interactions with the waiters outside of ordering and asking for a few extra things.

As a California native from Little Saigon, I'm used to ordering in Vietnamese in Vietnamese restaurants. However, I'm not sure if all the waiters here speak Vietnamese fluently because our waiter seemed to have a hard time understanding my order.

Ambiance: 4

Pho Saigon 8 is a small restaurant, so the tables are kind of close together. But it's decently clean and cool.

Came here for lunch the other day since I was on this side of town. I came with a bunch of friends and we got seated immediately. 

I ordered a small pho with brisket & beef balls. My friends got a large pho (#18) & egg rolls. We got our rolls first and without really looking at the menu we assumed that spring rolls were the fried rolls, since a lot of Vietnamese places call spring rolls egg rolls & the uncooked rolls summer rolls. But I guess every Vietnamese place differs? (Kinda confusing tho :( ) we told them that we wanted the fried ones so they had to go back & make our order. At first they told us to just take it & eat them since we ordered it but why take something we won't eat right? The pho on the other hand was good.
